ā

ā

prefix. intensifier; back; here ✓

Grammar prefix
Meaning intensifier; back; here
Sanskrit ā

Examples

pa, parā, ni, nī, u, du, saṃ, vi, ava, anu, pari, adhi, abhi, pati, su, ā, ati, api, apa, upa, pahāro, parābhavo, nihāro, nīhāro, uhāro, duhāro, saṃhāro, vihāro, avahāro, anuhāro, parihāro, adhihāro, abhihāro, patihāro, suhāro, āhāro, atihāro, apihāro, apahāro, upahāro, evaṃ vīsati upasaggehi ca.

kaccāyana nāmakappa 221

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāy'ānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ

DN 22.18 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
ākaṅkhati

pr. (+acc) wishes (for); wants; desires; aspires (for) [ā + √kaṅkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning wishes (for); wants; desires; aspires (for)
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction ā + kaṅkha + ti
Synonym icchati, jigiṃsati, jigīsati, patthayati, pattheti
Sanskrit ākāṅkṣati
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)

Examples

ākaṅkheyya ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca assaṃ manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā'ti, sīlesv'ev'assa paripūrakārī ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno vipassanāya samannāgato brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ.

MN 6 ākaṅkheyyasuttaṃ

bhikkhu siyā jhāyī vimuttacitto,
ākaṅkhe ce hadayass'ānupattiṃ,
lokassa ñatvā udayabbayañ'ca,
sucetaso anissito tadānisaṃso'ti.

SN 2.2 dutiyakassapasuttaṃ
ākaṅkhana

nt. longing, wish, desire [ā + √kaṅkh] ✗
ākaṅkhanta

prp. (+acc) wishing (for); desiring; seeking; aspiring (for) [ā + √kaṅkh + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ākaṅkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning wishing (for); desiring; seeking; aspiring (for)
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction ā + kaṅkha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym abhikaṅkhamāna, ākaṅkhamāna, icchanta, icchamāna, patthayanta, patthayamāna, patthayāna
Variant ākaṅkhī
Commentary (DHPa) tasmā'ti yasmā tasiṇāya purakkhatā paliveṭhitā sattā, tasmā attano virāgaṃ rāg'ādivigamaṃ nibbānaṃ patthento ākaṅkamāno bhikkhu arahattamaggen'etaṃ tasiṇaṃ vinodaye panuditvā nīharitvā chaḍḍeyyā'ti attho.
Sanskrit ākāṅkṣat
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)

Examples

sace, bhante, aññatitthiyapubbā imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhantā pabbajjaṃ, ākaṅkhantā upasampadaṃ cattāro māse parivasanti, catunnaṃ māsānaṃ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājenti

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

tasiṇāya purakkhatā pajā,
parisappanti saso'va bandhito.
tasmā tasiṇaṃ vinodaye,
bhikkhu ākaṅkha'virāgam'attano.

DHP 343 taṇhāvaggo
ākaṅkhamāna

prp. (+acc) wishing (for); desiring (for); seeking (for) [ā + √kaṅkh + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of ākaṅkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning wishing (for); desiring (for); seeking (for)
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction ā + kaṅkha + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym abhikaṅkhamāna, ākaṅkhanta, icchanta, icchamāna
Commentary (VIN 1.4.3.9) ākaṅkhamāno'ti icchamāno.
Sanskrit ākāṅkṣamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)

Examples

bahū devā manussā ca,
maṅgalāni acintayuṃ,
ākaṅkhamānā sotthānaṃ,
brūhi maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

KHP 5 maṅgalasuttaṃ

maccherā ca pamādā ca,
evaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati,
puññaṃ ākaṅkhamānena,
deyyaṃ hoti vijānatā'ti.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ
ākaṅkhavagga

masc. Chapter 8 of Dasakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.71-80 ✗
ākaṅkhasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.71 (AN10.71) ✗
ākaṅkhā

fem. longing, wish, desire [ā + √kaṅkh] ✗
ākaṅkhi

aor. wished for, desired [ā + √kaṅkh] ✗
ākaṅkhita

pp. wished for; desired [ā + √kaṅkh] ✗
ākaṅkhiya

ptp. desirable; sought-after; lit. to be wished for [ā + √kaṅkh + iya] ~

Grammar ptp of ākaṅkhati
Meaning desirable; sought-after; lit. to be wished for
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Construction ā + √kaṅkh + iya
Derivative kicca (iya)
Sanskrit ākāṅkṣya
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)
ākaṅkhī

adj. (+acc) wanting; wishing (for); hoping (for) [ā + √kaṅkh + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from ākaṅkhati (+acc)
Meaning wanting; wishing (for); hoping (for)
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Construction ā + √kaṅkh + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Sanskrit ākāṅkṣin
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)

Example

tasmā sampadam'ākaṅkhī,
sampann'atthū'dha puggalo,
sampannapaññe sevetha,
evaṃ ijjhanti sampadā.

AN 8.34 khettasuttaṃ
ākaṅkheyya

ptp. desirable; should be sought after; lit. to be wished for [ā + √kaṅkh + a + eyya] ~

Grammar ptp of ākaṅkhati
Meaning desirable; should be sought after; lit. to be wished for
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction ā + kaṅkha + eyya
Derivative kicca (eyya)
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)
ākaṅkheyyasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 6 (MN6) [ākaṅkheyya + sutta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Majjhima Nikāya 6 (MN6)
Construction ākaṅkheyya + sutta
ākaḍḍhati 1

pr. (+acc) drags out; pulls away [ā + √kaḍḍh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning drags out; pulls away
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Base √kaḍḍh + a > kaḍḍha
Construction ā + kaḍḍha + ti
Sanskrit ākarṣati
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Example

tāsaṃ ce, āvuso, naḷakalāpīnaṃ ekaṃ ākaḍḍheyya, ekā papateyya, aparaṃ ce ākaḍḍheyya, aparā papateyya. evam'eva kho, āvuso, nāmarūpanirodhā viññāṇanirodho, viññāṇanirodhā nāmarūpanirodho

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
ākaḍḍhati 2

pr. (+acc) drags; pulls towards [ā + √kaḍḍh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning drags; pulls towards
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Base √kaḍḍh + a > kaḍḍha
Construction ā + kaḍḍha + ti
Commentary (MNa) ākaḍḍheyyā'ti attano abhimukhaṃ kaḍḍheyya.
Sanskrit ākarṣati
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma balavā puriso dīghalomikaṃ eḷakaṃ lomesu gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya samparikaḍḍheyya, evam'ev'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ vādena vādaṃ ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
ākaḍḍhana

nt. pulling out, dragging [ā + √kaḍḍh] ✗
ākaḍḍhanta

prp. (+acc) dragging; pulling [ā + √kaḍḍh + a + nta] ~

Grammar prp of ākaḍḍhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning dragging; pulling
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Base √kaḍḍh + a > kaḍḍha
Construction ā + kaḍḍha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym kaḍḍhanta
Sanskrit ākarṣat
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
ākaḍḍhamāna

prp. dragging; pulling [√kaḍḍh] ✗
ākaḍḍhita

pp. pulled, dragged [ā + √kaḍḍh] ✗
ākaḍḍhituṃ

inf. (+acc) to drag; to pull [ā + √kaḍḍh + ituṃ] ~

Grammar inf of ākaḍḍhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to drag; to pull
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Construction ā + √kaḍḍh + ituṃ
Sanskrit ākarśitum
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
ākaḍḍhitvā 1

abs. (+acc) having dragged (to); having pulled (to); having escorted (to) [ā + √kaḍḍh + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ākaḍḍhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having dragged (to); having pulled (to); having escorted (to)
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Construction ā + √kaḍḍh + itvā
Synonym kaḍḍhitvā
Sanskrit ākṛṣṭvā
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Example

so bhikkhu saṅghamajjham'pi ākaḍḍhitvā vattabbo, m'āyasmā evaṃ avaca, mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya

VIN 2.5.7.8 ariṭṭhasikkhāpadaṃ
ākaḍḍhitvā 2

abs. (+acc) (of a sword) having drawn; having pulled out [ā + √kaḍḍh + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ākaḍḍhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of a sword) having drawn; having pulled out
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Construction ā + √kaḍḍh + itvā
Sanskrit ākṛṣṭvā
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Example

brāhmaṇassa asiṃ ākaḍḍhitvā upasiṅghantassa maricacuṇṇāni nāsaṃ pavisitvā khipitu'kāmataṃ uppādesuṃ. tassa khipantassa nāsikā asidhārāya paṭihatā dvidhā chijji.

JAa 126 asilakkhaṇajātakavaṇṇanā

ākaḍḍheti

pr. (+acc) slurps, lit. causes to drag [ā + √kaḍḍh] ✗
ākaḍḍhenta

prp. (+acc) slurping; lit. causing to drag [a + ā + √kaḍḍh + *e + nta] ~

Grammar prp of ākaḍḍheti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning slurping; lit. causing to drag
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 *e (drag, plough)
Base √kaḍḍh + e > kaḍḍhe (caus)
Construction a + kaḍḍhe + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit ākarṣayat
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
ākappa

masc. deportment; conduct; behaviour [ā + √kapp + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning deportment; conduct; behaviour
Root Family ā √kapp
Root √kapp･1 a (be fit, be suitable)
Construction ā + √kapp + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym ācāra, samācāra
Sanskrit ākalpa
Sanskrit Root √kḷp 1 (be adapted)

Example

añño me ākappo karaṇīyo'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ

AN 10.48 dasadhammasuttaṃ
ākappasampadā

fem. good manners; good deportment; lit. accomplishment in behaviour [ākappa + sampadā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning good manners; good deportment; lit. accomplishment in behaviour
Construction ākappa + sampadā
Commentary (ANa) ākappasampadā'ti cīvaraggahaṇ'ādino ākappassa sampatti.
ākappasampanna

adj. who carries oneself properly; with good deportment; with suitable behaviour; (comm) with monk-like behaviour [ākappa + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who carries oneself properly; with good deportment; with suitable behaviour; (comm) with monk-like behaviour
Construction ākappa + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ākappena + sampanna)
Commentary (ANa) ākappasampanno'ti samaṇ'ākappena sampanno.
Sanskrit ākalpa + sampanna

Example

dullabho, bhikkhave, vuḍḍhapabbajito nipuṇo, dullabho ākappasampanno, dullabho bahussuto, dullabho dhammakathiko, dullabho vinayadharo.

AN 5.59 paṭhamavuḍḍhapabbajitasuttaṃ
ākampita

pp. shaken, trembling [ā + √kamp] ✗
ākara 1

masc. mine, place of production ✗
ākara 2

masc. store ✗
ākaroti

pr. does in a certain way; makes; prepares [ā + √kar] ✗
ākassati

pr. drags, pulls [ā + √kass] ✗
ākassi

aor. dragged, pulled [ā + √kass] ✗
ākāra 1.1

masc. way; manner; method; lit. way of making [ā + √kar + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākaroti
Meaning way; manner; method; lit. way of making
Root Family ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ā + √kar > kār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym upāya, naya, pakāra
Commentary (VINa) ucc'āvacehi ākārehī'ti mahant'āmahantehi upāyehi.
Sanskrit ākāra
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Examples

tesaṃ no, bhante, āyasmatā mahākaccānena imehi ākārehi imehi padehi imehi byañjanehi attho vibhatto'ti

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu samantapāsādiko ca hoti sabb'ākāraparipūro cā'ti.

AN 10.8 jhānasuttaṃ
ākāra 1.2

masc. aspect; facet; detail; property; quality; attribute [ā + √kar + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākaroti
Meaning aspect; facet; detail; property; quality; attribute
Root Family ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ā + √kar > kār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym pariyāya, vedas
Sanskrit ākāra
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Examples

yehi, ānanda, ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi yehi uddesehi nāmakāyassa paññatti hoti, tesu ākāresu tesu liṅgesu tesu nimittesu tesu uddesesu asati api nu kho rūpakāye adhivacanasamphasso paññāyethā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

DN 15.1 mahānidānasuttaṃ, paṭiccasamuppādo

soḷas'ākārasampannā,
aṭṭh'aṅgasusamāgatā,
t'ādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
upapajjati devalokaṃ manāpan'ti.

ākāra 1.3

masc. disposition; tendency [ā + √kar + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from ākaroti
Meaning disposition; tendency
Root Family ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ā + √kar > kār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym āsaya
Sanskrit ākāra
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)
ākāra 1.4

masc. reason; evidence; clue [ā + √kar + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākaroti
Meaning reason; evidence; clue
Root Family ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ā + √kar > kār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) ākārā'ti kāraṇāni.
Sanskrit ākāra
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Example

tañ'ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ pare evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, ke pan'āyasmato ākārā, ke anvayā, yen'āyasmā evaṃ vadesi, abhay'ūparato ayam'āyasmā, n'āyam'āyasmā bhay'ūparato, vītarāgattā kāme na sevati khayā rāgassā'ti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
ākāra 1.5

masc. form, mode, condition, state, appearance [ā + √kar] ✗
ākāra 2.1

masc. (gram) the prefix ā- ✗
ākāra 2.2

masc. (gram) derivative verbal noun ending in -ana ✗
ākārattha

masc. meaning "manner" ✗
ākāranidassanāvadhāraṇa

nt. ?? in a certain way, specific example and limitation ✗
ākāranta

adj. (gram) ending with the letter ā [ākāra + anta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (gram) ending with the letter ā
Construction ākāra + anta
Compound kammadhāraya (ākāra + anta)
Sanskrit ākāra + anta

Example

kāraggahaṇaṃ kim'atthaṃ? ākār'anta ikār'antā ca honti, paccakkhā dhammā yassa so'yan'ti paccakkhadhammā, surabhino gandho surabhigandhi, sundaro gandho sugandhi, pūtino gandho pūtigandhi, kucchito gandho kugandhi, duṭṭhu gandho yassa so'yan'ti dugandhi, pūti eva gandho pūtigandhi.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 337
ākārapaññatti

fem. designation of quality ✗
ākāraparivitakka

masc. method of thinking; mode of reasoning; way of examination [ākāra + parivitakka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning method of thinking; mode of reasoning; way of examination
Construction ākāra + parivitakka
Compound kammadhāraya (ākāra + parivitakka)
Commentary (ANa) mā ākāraparivitakkenā'ti sundaram'idaṃ kāraṇan'ti evaṃ kāraṇaparivitakkena'pi mā gaṇhittha.
Sanskrit ākāra + parivitarka

Example

etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
ākārarūpa

nt. form as mode (e.g., mark of the female, etc.) ✗
ākārava

adj. having a form; having a cause; grounded ✗
ākāravant 1

adj. having good reasons; supported by evidence; grounded [ā + √kar + *a + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from ākāra
Meaning having good reasons; supported by evidence; grounded
Root Family ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ā + √kar > kār + *a + vant
ākāra + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) ākāravatī'ti kāraṇaṃ pariyesitvā gahitattā sakāraṇā (MNa) ākāravatī'ti kāraṇavatī sahetukā.
Sanskrit ākāravat
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Examples

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, imehi ākārehi imehi padehi imehi byañjanehi tathāgate saddhā niviṭṭhā hoti mūlajātā patiṭṭhitā, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ākāravatī saddhā dassanamūlikā

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ

n'atthi kho no, bhante, koci manāpo satthā yasmiṃ no ākāravatī saddhā paṭiladdhā'ti. manāpaṃ vo, gahapatayo, satthāraṃ alabhantehi ayaṃ apaṇṇako dhammo samādāya vattitabbo.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
ākāravant 2

adj. having a form; having a cause [ā + √kar] ✗
ākāravikāra

masc. mode-alteration (e.g., aniccatā, viññatti) ✗
ākāsa 1

masc. open space; vacuity [ā + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākāsati
Meaning open space; vacuity
Root Family ā √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ā + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ākāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṭṭhañ'ca paṭicca valliñ'ca paṭicca tiṇañ'ca paṭicca mattikañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito agāraṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati, evam'eva kho, āvuso, aṭṭhiñ'ca paṭicca nhāruñ'ca paṭicca maṃsañ'ca paṭicca cammañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito rūpaṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ ākāsaṃ ākāsagataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, kaṇṇacchiddaṃ nāsacchiddaṃ mukhadvāraṃ, yena ca asitapītakhāyitasāyitaṃ ajjhoharati … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
ākāsa 2

masc. sky; air [ā + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākāsati
Meaning sky; air
Root Family ā √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ā + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym antalikkha, viha, veha
Sanskrit ākāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

Examples

ahi āviñcheyya, vammikaṃ pavekkhāmī'ti, susumāro āviñcheyya, udakaṃ pavekkhāmī'ti, pakkhī āviñcheyya, ākāsaṃ ḍessāmī'ti

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

sā pattaṃ gahetvā ākāse khipi. patto ākāse aṭṭhāsi

DNa 16.4 mahāparinibbānasuttavaṇṇanā
ākāsa 3

masc. open air [ā + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākāsati
Meaning open air
Root Family ā √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ā + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ākāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

Example

ākāsaṃ ce nissāya tiṭṭheyya, ye ākāsanissitā pāṇā te naṃ khādeyyuṃ

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ
ākāsa 4

masc. space [ā + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākāsati
Meaning space
Root Family ā √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ā + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ākāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

Examples

idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā, ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

anusāsa brahme karuṇāyamāno,
vivekadhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
yath'āhaṃ ākāso'va abyāpajjamāno,
idh'eva santo asito careyyaṃ.

SNP 60 dhotaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 5
ākāsa 5

masc. environment; atmosphere; (comm) craving [ā + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākāsati
Meaning environment; atmosphere; (comm) craving
Root Family ā √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ā + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (SNPa) ākāsaṃ na sito siyā'ti taṇhānissito na bhaveyya. taṇhā hi rūp'ādīnaṃ ākāsanato, ākāso'ti vuccati.
Notes see sk ākarṣana
Sanskrit ākāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

Example

purāṇaṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
nave khantiṃ na kubbaye,
hiyyamāne na soceyya,
ākāsaṃ na sito siyā.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
ākāsakasiṇa

nt. space kasina; total space [ākāsa + kasiṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning space kasina; total space
Construction ākāsa + kasiṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (ākāsa + kasiṇa)
Sanskrit ākāśa + kṛtsna

Example

odātakasiṇam'eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ. ākāsakasiṇam'eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
ākāsakasiṇasamāpattiparama

adj. regarding the attainment of space kasina as the ultimate [ākāsakasiṇa + samāpatti + parama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning regarding the attainment of space kasina as the ultimate
Construction ākāsakasiṇa + samāpatti + parama
Compound kammadhāraya (ākāsakasiṇasamāpatti + parama)
Sanskrit ākāśa + kṛtsna + samāpatti + parama

Example

ākāsakasiṇasamāpattiparamā kho, bhagini… viññāṇakasiṇasamāpattiparamā kho, bhagini, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā attho'ti abhinibbattesuṃ. yāvatā kho, bhagini, viññāṇakasiṇasamāpattiparamatā, tadabhiññāsi bhagavā.

AN 10.26 kāḷīsuttaṃ
ākāsagaṅgā

fem. celestial river ✗
ākāsagata 1

adj. empty; hollow; vacuous; spacious; lit. space state [ākāsa + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning empty; hollow; vacuous; spacious; lit. space state
Construction ākāsa + gata
Compound kammadhāraya (ākāsa + gata)
Synonym aghagata, tuccha, tucchaka, ritta, rittaka, vivaragata
Commentary (MNa) ākāsagatan'ti ākāsabhāvaṃ gataṃ.
Sanskrit ākāśa + gata

Example

yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ ākāsaṃ ākāsagataṃ, aghaṃ aghagataṃ, vivaraṃ vivaragataṃ, asamphuṭṭhaṃ maṃsalohitehi upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

Meaning atmospheric; relating to sky
Construction ākāsa + gata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ākāse + gata)
Sanskrit ākāśagati

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye viddhe vigatavalāhake deve ādicco nabhaṃ abbhussakkamāno sabbaṃ ākāsagataṃ tamagataṃ abhivihacca bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

Meaning travelling by air

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
ākāsatala

nt. flat roof of a building ✗
ākāsati

pr. shines; is visible [ā + √kās] ✗
ākāsadhātu

Examples

cha'y'imā, āvuso, dhātuyo tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena samma'd'akkhātā. katamā cha? pathavīdhātu, āpodhātu, tejodhātu, vāyodhātu, ākāsadhātu, viññāṇadhātu

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

Meaning like open space; like empty space
Construction ākāsa + sama

Sanskrit ākāśa + sama

Example

ākāsasamaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. ākāsasamañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato uppannā manāp'āmanāpā phassā cittaṃ na pariyādāya ṭhassanti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
ākāsasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.155 (SN45.155) ✗
ākāsānañcāyatana

nt. dimension of infinite space; base of infinity of space [ākāsa + na + anta + āyatana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning dimension of infinite space; base of infinity of space
Construction ākāsa + na + anta + āyatana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākāsānañcassa + āyatana)
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana

Examples

nissaṭṭhena āvuso, pañcahi indriyehi parisuddhena manoviññāṇena ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ neyyaṃ, anantaṃ viññāṇan'ti viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ neyyaṃ, n'atthi kiñcī'ti ākiñcaññ'āyatanaṃ neyyan'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā, ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
ākāsānañcāyatanadhātu

fem. state of the dimension of infinite space; element of the base of infinity of space [ākāsānañcāyatana + dhātu] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of the dimension of infinite space; element of the base of infinity of space
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + dhātu
Commentary (SNa) ākās'ānañc'āyatanam'eva ākāsānañcāyatanadhātu.
ākāsānañcāyatananissita

adj. dependent on to the dimension of infinite space; based on the dimension of infinite space [ākāsānañcāyatana + nissita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on to the dimension of infinite space; based on the dimension of infinite space
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + nissita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ + nissita)
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana + niśrita

Example

atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhā ākāsānañc'āyatananissitā, atthi viññāṇañc'āyatananissitā, atthi ākiñcaññ'āyatananissitā, atthi n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatananissitā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
ākāsānañcāyatanapañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 40.5 (SN40.5) ✗
ākāsānañcāyatanaparama

adj. having the dimension of infinite space as peak; with the base of infinity of space as apex [ākāsānañcāyatana + parama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having the dimension of infinite space as peak; with the base of infinity of space as apex
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + parama
Commentary (SNa) karuṇāvihārissa uṇhābhighātādirūpanimittaṃ sattadukkhaṃ samanupassantassa karuṇāya pavattisambhavato rūpe ādīnavo parividito hoti, ath'assa parividitarūp'ādīnavattā pathavīkasiṇ'ādīsu aññataraṃ ugghāṭetvā rūpanissaraṇe ākāse cittaṃ upasaṃharato appakasiren'eva tattha cittaṃ pakkhandati. iti karuṇā ākās'ānañc'āyatanassa upanissayo hoti, na tato paraṃ, tasmā ākās'ānañc'āyatanaparamā'ti vuttā.
ākāsānañcāyatanasaññā

fem. (+loc) recognition of dimension of infinite space (in); perception of dimension of infinite space (in) [ākāsānañcāyatana + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp (+loc)
Meaning recognition of dimension of infinite space (in); perception of dimension of infinite space (in)
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākāsānañcāyatanassa + saññā)
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana + saṃjñā

Example

idha, sandha, bhadrassa puris'ājānīyassa ... ākāsānañc'āyatane ākāsānañc'āyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti, viññāṇañc'āyatane viññāṇañc'āyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
ākāsānañcāyatanasaññī

adj. (+loc) aware of dimension of infinite space (in); percipient of dimension of infinite space (in) [ākāsānañcāyatana + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning aware of dimension of infinite space (in); percipient of dimension of infinite space (in)
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākāsānañcāyatanassa + saññī)
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana + saṃjñin

Example

siyā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno tathārūpo samādhipaṭilābho yathā ... na ākāsānañc'āyatane ākāsānañc'āyatanasaññī assa, na viññāṇañc'āyatane viññāṇañc'āyatanasaññī assa

AN 10.6 samādhisuttaṃ
ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpatti

fem. attainment of the dimension of infinite space [ākāsānañcāyatana + samāpatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning attainment of the dimension of infinite space
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + samāpatti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākāsānañcāyatanassa + samāpatti)
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana + samāpatti

Examples

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi ākāsānañc'āyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū ākāsānañc'āyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino'ti. so tāya ākāsānañc'āyatanasamāpattiyā attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ayam'pi kho ākāsānañc'āyatanasamāpatti abhisaṅkhatā abhisañcetayitā. yaṃ kho pana kiñci abhisaṅkhataṃ abhisañcetayitaṃ tadaniccaṃ nirodhadhamman'ti pajānāti.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ
ākāsānañcāyatanasahagata

adj. associated with the dimension of infinite space; connected with the base of infinity of space [ākāsānañcāyatana + sahagata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning associated with the dimension of infinite space; connected with the base of infinity of space
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + sahagata

ākāsānañcāyatanasukhumasaccasaññā

Grammar fem, abstr, comp

Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + sukhuma + sacca + saññā

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a refined and true perception of the dimension of infinite space
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + sukhuma + sacca + saññī
ākāsānañcāyatanasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 28.5 (SN28.5) ✗
ākāsānañcāyatanūpaga

adj. gone to the dimension of infinite space; epithet of a class of devas [ākāsānañcāyatana + upaga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning gone to the dimension of infinite space; epithet of a class of devas
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + upaga
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ + upaga)
Commentary (DNa) ākāsānañcāyatan'ūpago'tiādīsu pana ākāsānañcāyatanabhavaṃ upagato'ti, evam'attho veditabbo.
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana + upaga

Example

ākaṅkheyya ce, gahapatayo, dhammacārī samacārī, aho vat'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ākāsānañcāyatan'ūpagānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan'ti, ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ vijjati, yaṃ so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ākāsānañcāyatan'ūpagānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
ākiñca

nt. nothingness; emptiness [na + kiñci + *ya] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from na kiñci, neg
Meaning nothingness; emptiness
Construction na > a > ā + kiñci + *ya
akiñci + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym ākiñcañña
Sanskrit akiñcana +
ākiñcañña 1

adj. with nothingness; empty; void [na + kiñci + ana + *ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from na kiñcana, neg
Meaning with nothingness; empty; void
Construction na > a > ā + kiñci + ana + *ya
akiñcana + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
a > ā
Synonym aghagata, tuccha, tucchaka, suññata
Commentary (MNa) ākiñcaññā'ti ārammaṇ'akiñcanassa abhāvato ākiñcaññā.
Sanskrit akiñcana +

Examples

yā c'āyaṃ, āvuso, appamāṇā cetovimutti, yā ca ākiñcaññā cetovimutti, yā ca suññatā cetovimutti, yā ca animittā cetovimutti, ime dhammā nān'ātthā c'eva nānābyañjanā ca udāhu ek'atthā byañjanam'eva nānan'ti?

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

katamā c'āvuso, ākiñcaññā cetovimutti? idh'āvuso, bhikkhu sabbaso viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ samatikkamma n'atthi kiñcī'ti ākiñcaññ'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati. ayaṃ vuccat'āvuso, ākiñcaññā cetovimutti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
ākiñcañña 2

nt. nothingness; emptiness [na + kiñci + ana + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na kiñcana, neg
Meaning nothingness; emptiness
Construction na > a > ā + kiñci + ana + *ya
akiñcana + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
a > ā
Synonym ākiñca
Sanskrit akiñcana +

Examples

idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ samatikkamma, n'atthi kiñcī'ti ākiñcañña-āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattam'ah'ābhipassa.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
ākiñcaññābhinivesa

adj. insisting on emptiness; adhering to nothingness [ākiñcañña + abhinivesa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning insisting on emptiness; adhering to nothingness
Construction ākiñcañña + abhinivesa
Variant akiñcanābhinivesa
Commentary (ANa) akiñcanabhāve niggahaṇabhāve cittaṃ etesaṃ abhinivisatī'ti ākiñcaññ'ābhinivesā.
ākiñcaññāyatana

nt. dimension of nothingness; sphere of emptiness; base of nothingness [ākiñcañña + āyatana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning dimension of nothingness; sphere of emptiness; base of nothingness
Construction ākiñcañña + āyatana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākiñcaññassa + āyatana)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana

Examples

idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ samatikkamma, n'atthi kiñcī'ti ākiñcaññ'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, vijjati yaṃ idh'ekacco purisapuggalo ākiñcaññ'āyatana-adhimutto assa.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
ākiñcaññāyatanadhātu

fem. state of the dimension of nothingness; element of the sphere of emptiness [ākiñcaññāyatana + dhātu] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of the dimension of nothingness; element of the sphere of emptiness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + dhātu
ākiñcaññāyatananissita

adj. dependent on the dimension of nothingness; based on the sphere of emptiness [ākiñcaññāyatana + nissita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on the dimension of nothingness; based on the sphere of emptiness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + nissita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ + nissita)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + niśrita

Example

atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhā ākāsānañc'āyatananissitā, atthi viññāṇañc'āyatananissitā, atthi ākiñcaññ'āyatananissitā, atthi n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatananissitā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
ākiñcaññāyatanapañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 40.7 (SN40.7) ✗
ākiñcaññāyatanapaṭisaṃyutta

adj. connected with the dimension of nothingness; concerned with the base of nothingness [ākiñcaññāyatana + paṭisaṃyutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected with the dimension of nothingness; concerned with the base of nothingness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + paṭisaṃyutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanena + paṭisaṃyutta)
ākiñcaññāyatanaparama

adj. having the dimension of nothingness as peak; with the sphere of emptiness as apex [ākiñcaññāyatana + parama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having the dimension of nothingness as peak; with the sphere of emptiness as apex
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + parama
Commentary (VISM) upekkhāvihārissa pana, sattā sukhitā vā hontu dukkhato vā vimuccantu, sampattasukhato vā mā vimuccantū'ti ābhogābhāvato sukhadukkh'ādiparamatthagāhavimukhabhāvato avijjamānaggahaṇadukkhaṃ cittaṃ hoti. ath'assa paramatthagāhato vimukhabhāvaparicitacittassa paramatthato avijjamānaggahaṇadukkhacittassa ca anukkamādhigataṃ viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ samatikkamma sabhāvato avijjamāne paramatthabhūtassa viññāṇassa abhāve cittaṃ upasaṃharato appakasiren'eva tattha cittaṃ pakkhandati. iti upekkhā ākiñcaññ'āyatanassa upanissayo hoti, na tato paraṃ, tasmā ākiñcaññāyatanaparamā'ti vuttāti.
ākiñcaññāyatanasaññā

fem. (+loc) recognition of dimension of nothingness (in); perception of dimension of nothingness (in) [ākiñcaññāyatana + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp (+loc)
Meaning recognition of dimension of nothingness (in); perception of dimension of nothingness (in)
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanassa + saññā)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + saṃjñā

Example

idha, sandha, bhadrassa puris'ājānīyassa ... ākiñcaññ'āyatane ākiñcaññ'āyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti, n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatane n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
ākiñcaññāyatanasaññī

adj. (+loc) aware of dimension of nothingness (in); percipient of dimension of nothingness (in) [ākiñcaññāyatana + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning aware of dimension of nothingness (in); percipient of dimension of nothingness (in)
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanassa + saññī)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + saṃjñin

Example

siyā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno tathārūpo samādhipaṭilābho yathā ... na ākiñcaññ'āyatane ākiñcaññ'āyatanasaññī assa, na n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatane n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaññī assa

AN 10.6 samādhisuttaṃ
ākiñcaññāyatanasappāya

adj. beneficial for the dimension of nothingness; supportive for the base of nothingness [ākiñcaññāyatana + sappāya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning beneficial for the dimension of nothingness; supportive for the base of nothingness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + sappāya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanassa + sappāya)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + sāṃpreya (bsk)

Example

ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati yaṃ taṃsaṃvattanikaṃ viññāṇaṃ assa ākiñcaññ'āyatan'ūpagaṃ. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamā ākiñcaññ'āyatanasappāyā paṭipadā akkhāyati.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ
ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpatti

fem. attainment of the dimension of nothingness; attainment of the sphere of emptiness [ākiñcaññāyatana + samāpatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning attainment of the dimension of nothingness; attainment of the sphere of emptiness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + samāpatti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanassa + samāpatti)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + samāpatti

Examples

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi ākiñcaññ'āyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū ākiñcaññ'āyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino'ti. so tāya ākiñcaññ'āyatanasamāpattiyā attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ayam'pi kho ākiñcaññ'āyatanasamāpatti abhisaṅkhatā abhisañcetayitā. yaṃ kho pana kiñci abhisaṅkhataṃ abhisañcetayitaṃ tadaniccaṃ nirodhadhamman'ti pajānāti.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ

Meaning connection with the dimension of nothingness; concern with the base of nothingness

ākiñcaññāyatanasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 28.7 (SN28.7) ✗
ākiñcaññāyatanādhimutta

adj. intent on the dimension of nothingness; fixed on the base of nothingness [ākiñcaññāyatana + adhimutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning intent on the dimension of nothingness; fixed on the base of nothingness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + adhimutta
ākiñcaññāyatanūpaga

adj. gone to the dimension of nothingness; epithet of a class of devas [ākiñcaññāyatana + upaga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning gone to the dimension of nothingness; epithet of a class of devas
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + upaga
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ + upaga)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + upaga

Example

ākaṅkheyya ce, gahapatayo, dhammacārī samacārī, aho vat'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ākiñcaññāyatan'ūpagānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan'ti, ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ vijjati, yaṃ so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ākiñcaññāyatan'ūpagānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
ākiñcaññāyatanūpapatti

fem. rebirth into dimension of nothingness; reappearance in the sphere of emptiness [ākiñcaññāyatana + upapatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning rebirth into dimension of nothingness; reappearance in the sphere of emptiness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + upapatti
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatane + upapatti)
Commentary (MNa) yāva'd'eva ākiñcaññ'āyatan'ūpapattiyā'ti yāva saṭṭhikappasahass'āyuparimāṇe ākiñcaññ'āyatanabhave upapatti, tāva'd'eva saṃvattati, na tato uddhaṃ.
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + upapatti

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, n'āyaṃ dhammo nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṃvattati, yāvadeva ākiñcaññ'āyatan'ūpapattiyā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ākiñcanasambhava

masc. origin of the state of nothingness ✗
ākiṇṇa

pp. (+instr) crowded (with); hemmed in (with); surrounded (by); lit. strewn [ā + √kir + na] ✓

Grammar pp of ākirati (+instr)
Meaning crowded (with); hemmed in (with); surrounded (by); lit. strewn
Root Family ā √kir
Root √kir･1 a (scatter, sprinkle)
Construction ā + √kir + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change rn > ṇṇ
Sanskrit ākīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṝ √kṛ 6 (scatter)

Example

yaṃnūna mayaṃ yena gosiṅgasālavanadāyo ten'upasaṅkameyyāma. tattha mayaṃ appasaddā app'ākiṇṇā phāsuṃ vihareyyāmā'ti.

AN 10.72 kaṇṭakasuttaṃ
ākiṇṇakammanta

adj. rough in action; acting impurely ✗
ākiṇṇamanussa

adj. full of people; crowded with people; packed with people; (comm) endless people; lit. strewn with men [ākiṇṇa + manussa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of people; crowded with people; packed with people; (comm) endless people; lit. strewn with men
Construction ākiṇṇa + manussa
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ākiṇṇa + manussehi)
Commentary (MNa) ākiṇṇamanussā'ti janasamākulā. (SNa) ākiṇṇamanussan'ti nirantaramanussaṃ.
Sanskrit ākīrṇa + manuṣya

Examples

ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, idaṃ, bhante, kapilavatthu iddhañ'c'eva phītañ'ca bāhujaññaṃ ākiṇṇamanussaṃ sambādhabyūhaṃ.

SN 55.21 paṭhamamahānāmasuttaṃ

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, ayaṃ nāḷandā iddhā c'eva phītā ca bahujanā ākiṇṇamanussā'ti? evaṃ, bhante, ayaṃ nāḷandā iddhā c'eva phītā ca bahujanā ākiṇṇamanussā'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
ākiṇṇayakkha

adj. full of supernatural beings [ākiṇṇa + yakkha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of supernatural beings
Construction ākiṇṇa + yakkha
Sanskrit ākīrṇa + yakṣa
ākiṇṇaludda

adj. rough and fierce; very fierce ✗
ākiṇṇaloma

nt. matted, thick hair ✗
ākiṇṇavihāra

masc. living in crowds ✗
ākirati 1

pr. (+acc) stirs up; heaps up; kicks up [ā + √kir + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning stirs up; heaps up; kicks up
Root Family ā √kir
Root √kir･1 a (scatter, sprinkle)
Base √kir + a > kira
Construction ā + kira + ti
Sanskrit ākirāsi
Sanskrit Root √kṝ √kṛ 6 (scatter)

Example

kayirā ce kayirāth'enaṃ,
daḷham'enaṃ parakkame,
sithilo hi paribbājo,
bhiyyo ākirate rajaṃ.

DHP 313 nirayavaggo
ākirati 2

pr. (+acc) sprinkles; scatters; pours; spreads [ā + √kir] ✗
ākiranta

prp. (+acc) filling up; heaping; piling up; lit. sprinkling [ā + √kir + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ākirati, trans (+acc)
Meaning filling up; heaping; piling up; lit. sprinkling
Root Family ā √kir
Root √kir･1 a (scatter, sprinkle)
Base √kir + a > kira
Construction ā + kira + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Commentary (VINa) ākirante'pī'ti piṇḍapātaṃ dente'pi.
Sanskrit ākirat
Sanskrit Root √kṝ √kṛ 6 (scatter)

Examples

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tahaṃ tahaṃ olokentā piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhanti, ākirante'pi atikkante'pi na jānanti

VIN 2.7.3 khambhakatavaggo

anāpatti asañcicca, assatiyā, ajānantassa, gilānassa, aññesaṃ dento omasati, aññassa bhājane ākiranto omasati, uttaribhaṅge, āpadāsu, ummattakassa, ādikammikassāti.

VIN 2.7.4 sakkaccavaggo
ākiri

aor. strewed over, scattered [ā + √kir] ✗
ākiritvā

abs. (+acc) having sprinkled; having scattered [ā + √kir + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ākirati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having sprinkled; having scattered
Root Family ā √kir
Root √kir･1 a (scatter, sprinkle)
Construction ā + √kir + itvā
Synonym okirāpetvā
Sanskrit ākṝ
Sanskrit Root √kṝ √kṛ 6 (scatter)

Examples

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave dakkho nhāpako vā nhāpak'antevāsī vā kaṃsathāle nhānīyacuṇṇāni ākiritvā udakena paripphosakaṃ paripphosakaṃ sanneyya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

santi, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa oḷārikā upakkilesā paṃsuvālukā sakkharakaṭhalā. tam'enaṃ paṃsudhovako vā paṃsudhovak'antevāsī vā doṇiyaṃ ākiritvā dhovati sandhovati niddhovati.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
ākula 1

adj. entangled; knotted; fouled; snarled [ā + √kul + a] ~

Grammar adj
Meaning entangled; knotted; fouled; snarled
Root Family ā √kul
Root √kul･1 a (be close)
Construction ā + √kul + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym anākula
Synonym ākulaka
Sanskrit ākula
Sanskrit Root √kul 1 (accumulate)
ākula 2

adj. confused; disturbed; agitated; disordered [ā + √kul + a] ~

Grammar adj
Meaning confused; disturbed; agitated; disordered
Root Family ā √kul
Root √kul･1 a (be close)
Construction ā + √kul + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym anākula
Synonym āvila, byākula
Sanskrit ākula
Sanskrit Root √kul 1 (accumulate)
ākula 3

adj. (+instr) infested (with); swarming (with) [ā + √kul + a] ~

Grammar adj (+instr)
Meaning infested (with); swarming (with)
Root Family ā √kul
Root √kul･1 a (be close)
Construction ā + √kul + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym anākula
Sanskrit ākula
Sanskrit Root √kul 1 (accumulate)
ākulaka

adj. entangled; knotted; fouled; snarled [ā + √kul + a + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from ākula
Meaning entangled; knotted; fouled; snarled
Root Family ā √kul
Root √kul･1 a (be close)
Construction ā + √kul + a + ka
ākula + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym ākula
Sanskrit ākula +
Sanskrit Root √kul 1 (accumulate)

Example

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
ākulajāta

adj. become tangled; become snarled [ākula + jāta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning become tangled; become snarled
Construction ākula + jāta
Commentary (DNt) tantam'eva vā ākulaṃ tantākulaṃ, tantākulaṃ viya jātā bhūtā'ti tan'tākulajātā.
Sanskrit ākula + jāta
ākulabyākula

adj. tangled and confused [ākula + byākula] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning tangled and confused
Construction ākula + byākula
ākulayati

pr. mixes up [ā + √kul] ✗
ākulī

fem. kind of flower [ā + √kul] ✗
ākulībhūta

adj. entangled, confused ✗
ākoṭaka

masc. name of a deity; lit. beater; pounder [ā + √kuṭ + *aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from ākoṭeti
Meaning name of a deity; lit. beater; pounder
Root Family ā √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･8 *e (knock, beat)
Construction ā + √kuṭ > koṭ + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit ā + kuṭṭaka
Sanskrit Root √kuṭṭ 10 (divide, crush)

Examples

atha kho sambahulā nānātitthiyasāvakā devaputtā asamo ca sahali ca nīko ca ākoṭako ca vegabbhari ca māṇavagāmiyo ca abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ veḷuvanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

atha kho ākoṭako devaputto nānātitthiye ārabbha bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
ākoṭana 1

nt. beating; pummelling; pounding [ā + √kuṭ + *e + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from ākoṭeti
Meaning beating; pummelling; pounding
Root Family ā √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･8 *e (knock, beat)
Base √kuṭ + *e > koṭe
Construction ā + koṭe + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit ā + kuṭṭana
Sanskrit Root √kuṭṭ 10 (divide, crush)

Example

evaṃ vutte, bhante, rattapāṇi rajakaputto taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, ayaṃ kho te, makkaṭacchāpako raṅgakkhamo hi kho, no ākoṭanakkhamo, no vimajjanakkhamo'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
ākoṭana 2

nt. urging [ā + √kuṭ] ✗
ākoṭanakkhama

adj. able to take a beating; can be pounded [ākoṭana + khama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning able to take a beating; can be pounded
Construction ākoṭana + khama
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākoṭanassa + khama)
Commentary (MNa) ākoṭṭanakkhamo'ti saviññāṇakassa tāva ākoṭṭanaphalake ṭhapetvā kucchiyaṃ ākoṭitassa kucchi bhijjati, karīsaṃ nikkhamati. sesī ākoṭitassa sīsaṃ bhijjati, mattaluṅgaṃ nikkhamati. aviññāṇako khaṇḍakhaṇḍitaṃ gacchati. tasmā evam'āha.
Sanskrit ā + kuṭṭana + kṣama

Example

evaṃ vutte, bhante, rattapāṇi rajakaputto taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, ayaṃ kho te, makkaṭacchāpako raṅgakkhamo hi kho, no ākoṭanakkhamo, no vimajjanakkhamo'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
ākoṭayati

pr. beats, strikes; knocks (at); pounds; hammers (in) [ā + √kuṭ] ✗
ākoṭāpeti

pr. (+acc) makes beat; causes to pound; makes pummel [ā + √kuṭ + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ākoṭeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes beat; causes to pound; makes pummel
Root Family ā √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･8 *āpe (knock, beat)
Base √kuṭ + *āpe > koṭāpe (caus)
Construction ā + koṭāpe + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit ā + kuṭṭ
Sanskrit Root √kuṭṭ 10 (divide, crush)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpeyya vā rajāpeyya vā ākoṭāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 4 purāṇacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ
ākoṭita 1

pp. beaten; pounded; pummelled [ā + √kuṭ + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of ākoṭeti
Meaning beaten; pounded; pummelled
Root Family ā √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･8 *e (knock, beat)
Base √kuṭ + *e > koṭe
Construction ā + koṭe + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym paccākoṭita
Sanskrit ā + kuṭṭita
Sanskrit Root √kuṭṭ 10 (divide, crush)

Examples

atha kho āyasmā nando bhagavato mātucchāputto ākoṭitapaccākoṭitāni cīvarāni pārupitvā akkhīni añjetvā acchaṃ pattaṃ gahetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami

SN 21.8 nandasuttaṃ

sappaṭibhayaṃ nāma ārāme ārām'ūpacāre corehi manussā hatā dissanti, viluttā dissanti, ākoṭitā dissanti.

VIN 1.4.3.9 sāsaṅkasikkhāpadaṃ
ākoṭita 2

pp. compressed, screened [ā + √kuṭ] ✗
ākoṭitapaccākoṭita

adj. pounded back and front; beaten this way and that [ākoṭita + paccākoṭita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pounded back and front; beaten this way and that
Construction ākoṭita + paccākoṭita
Compound dvanda (ākoṭita ca paccākoṭita ca)
Commentary (MNa) ākoṭitapaccākoṭitan'ti ākoṭitañ'c'eva parivattetvā punappunaṃ ākoṭitañ'ca.
Sanskrit ākoṭana + prati + ākoṭana

Examples

atha kho āyasmā nando bhagavato mātucchāputto ākoṭitapaccākoṭitāni cīvarāni pārupitvā akkhīni añjetvā acchaṃ pattaṃ gahetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami

SN 21.8 nandasuttaṃ

upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇiṃ rajakaputtaṃ evaṃ vadehi, icchām'ahaṃ, samma rattapāṇi, imaṃ makkaṭacchāpakaṃ pīt'āvalepanaṃ nāma raṅgajātaṃ rajitaṃ ākoṭitapaccākoṭitaṃ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
ākoṭeti 1

pr. (+acc) knocks; taps; beats [ā + √kuṭ + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning knocks; taps; beats
Root Family ā √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･8 *e (knock, beat)
Base √kuṭ + *e > koṭe
Construction ā + koṭe + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (MNa) ākoṭeyyā'ti ujukaṃ piṭṭhiyaṃ pahareyya.
Sanskrit ā + kuṭṭayati, ākoṭayati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √kuṭṭ 10 (divide, crush)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vassānaṃ pacchime māse saradasamaye kiṭṭhasambādhe gopālako gāvo rakkheyya. so tā gāvo tato tato daṇḍena ākoṭeyya paṭikoṭeyya sannirundheyya sannivāreyya.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
ākoṭeti 2

pr. (+acc) compresses [ā + √kuṭ] ✗

Meaning having beaten; having pounded; having pummelled
Root Family ā √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･8 *e (knock, beat)
Base √kuṭ + *e > koṭe
Construction ā + koṭe + tvā

Sanskrit ākuṭṭayitvā

ākoṭesi

Grammar aor of ākoṭeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning knocked; tapped; rapped
Root Family ā √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･8 *e (knock, beat)

Construction ā + koṭe + si
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (MNa) aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesī'ti agganakhena kavāṭe saññaṃ adāsi.
Sanskrit kuṭṭ
Sanskrit Root √kuṭṭ 10 (divide, crush)

Examples

atha kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo yena so vihāro saṃvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṃ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi. vivari bhagavā dvāraṃ.

DN 3.3 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā kathāpariyosānaṃ viditvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
ākoṭṭana

nt. beating; pounding [ā + √kuṭṭ] ✗
ākhīṇa

adj. scattered, unrestrained; rough; impure [ā + √kir] ✗
ākhīṇavyappatha

adj. of rough speech ✗
ākhu

masc. rat, mouse ✗

fem. name; appellation; label [ā + √khyā + ā] ~

Construction ā + √khyā + ā

ākhyāta

nt. (gram) verb; lit. declared; announced [ā + √khyā + ta] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning (gram) verb; lit. declared; announced
Root Family ā √khyā
Root √khyā･1 a (announce)
Construction ā + √khyā + ta

Synonym kiriyāpada, kriyapada
Notes (Apte) Inflected or conjugated
Sanskrit ākhyāta
Sanskrit Root √khyā 2 (see)

Examples

tesaṃgahaṇena samāsataddhit'ākhyātakitakānaṃ vibhattipaccayapad'akkhar'āgamā ca lopā honti. vāsiṭṭho, venateyyo

kaccāyana samāsakappa 317

idha ākhyāte aniddiṭṭhesu sādhanesu kvaci dhātu vibhatti paccayānaṃ dīgha viparīt'ādesa lop'āgama'icc'etāni kāriyāni jinavacan'ānurūpāni kātabbāni.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 517
ākhyātakappa

masc. (gram) chapter on verbs [ākhyāta + kappa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (gram) chapter on verbs
Construction ākhyāta + kappa
Compound kammadhāraya (ākhyāta + kappa)
Sanskrit ākhyāta + kalpa

Examples

iti ākhyātakappe paṭhamo kaṇḍo.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 431

iti ākhyātakappe catuttho kaṇḍo. ākhyātakappo niṭṭhito.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa
ākhyātapada

nt. (gram) verb; verbal part of speech; lit. verb word [ākhyāta + pada] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (gram) verb; verbal part of speech; lit. verb word
Construction ākhyāta + pada
Compound kammadhāraya (ākhyāta + pada)
Sanskrit ākhyāta + pada

Example

yaṃ pan'etaṃ, evaṃ me sutan'tiādikaṃ nidānaṃ, tattha evan'ti nipātapadaṃ. me'tiādīni nāmapadāni. sāvatthiyaṃ viharatī'ti ettha vī'ti upasaggapadaṃ, haratī'ti ākhyātapadan'ti iminā tāva nayena padavibhāgo veditabbo.

SNa 1.1 oghataraṇasuttavaṇṇanā

ākhyāyikā

fem. story [ā + √khyā] ✗
āga

masc. mountain, tree ✗
āgacchati 1

pr. (+acc) comes (to); arrives (at) [ā + √gam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning comes (to); arrives (at)
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction ā + gaccha + ti
Antonym gacchati
Synonym anupāpuṇāti
Sanskrit āgacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

santi, bhante, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kesamuttaṃ āgacchanti. te sakaṃ'y'eva vādaṃ dīpenti jotenti, parappavādaṃ pana khuṃsenti vambhenti paribhavanti omakkhiṃ karonti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ

yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū paccattaññ'eva satiṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti, kin'ti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṃ āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsuṃ vihareyyun'ti

AN 7.23 paṭhamasattakasuttaṃ
āgacchati 2

pr. (+acc) comes along; approaches [ā + √gam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning comes along; approaches
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction ā + gaccha + ti
Antonym gacchati
Sanskrit āgacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitu'kāmo amaritu'kāmo sukhakāmo dukkhappaṭikūlo

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ
āgacchati 3

pr. (+acc) comes back (to); returns (to) [ā + √gam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning comes back (to); returns (to)
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction ā + gaccha + ti
Antonym gacchati
Synonym upanivattati, paccāgacchati, pacceti, paṭikkamati, punupeti
Sanskrit āgacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

pañcakāmaguṇike rāge pariññāte n'atthi taṃ saṃyojanaṃ yena saṃyojanena saṃyutto ariyasāvako puna imaṃ lokaṃ āgaccheyya

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ

sā ce tato cutā itthattaṃ āgacchati, sā yattha yattha paccājāyati dubbaṇṇā ca hoti durūpā supāpikā dassanāya, daliddā ca hoti appassakā appabhogā appesakkhā ca.

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ
āgacchati 4

pr. (+acc) comes out; flows out [ā + √gam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning comes out; flows out
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction ā + gaccha + ti
Sanskrit āgacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, same bhūmibhāge pokkharaṇī caturaṃsā ālibaddhā pūrā udakassa samatittikā kākapeyyā. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āliṃ muñceyya, āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

satt'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sapattakantā sapattakaraṇā kodhanaṃ āgacchanti itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā. katame satta?

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

kathaṃ byākaramānā ... dhammassa c'ānudhammaṃ byākareyyāma, na ca koci sahadhammiko vād'ānupāto gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgaccheyyā'ti?

SN 12.25 bhūmijasuttaṃ
āgacchana

āgacchanta

Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7

so araññato āgacchante mālākāre disvā thokaṃ thokaṃ phāṇitakhaṇḍaṃ datvā uḷuṅkena pānīyaṃ adāsi, te c'assa ek'ekaṃ pupphamuṭṭhiṃ adaṃsu.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ

DHP 219 piyavaggo

idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gilāno hoti. so ce bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya, ahañ'hi gilāno, āgacchantu bhikkhū, icchāmi bhikkhūnaṃ āgatan'ti.

VIN 4.3.110 pañcannaṃ appahitepi anujānanā

dūrato sotthim'āgataṃ,

DHP 219 piyavaggo

eta'r'ahi vā paccuppannam'addhānaṃ ajjhattaṃ kathaṃkathī hoti, ahaṃ nu kho'smi? no nu kho'smi? kiṃ nu kho'smi? kathaṃ nu kho'smi? ayaṃ nu kho satto kuto āgato? so kuhiṃ gāmī bhavissatī'ti?

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

Examples

muṇḍo virūpo abhisāpam'āgato,
kapālahattho'va kulesu bhikkhasu,

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

taṃ buddhaṃ asitaṃ tādiṃ,
akuhaṃ gaṇim'āgataṃ,
bahūnam'idha baddhānaṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16

Derivative kita (ta)

Sanskrit āgata

Examples

VIN PAT PC 73 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ

āgatāni kho, tāta uttara, amhākaṃ mantesu dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dve'y'eva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
āgata 6

pp. present; at hand; current; lit. come [ā + √gam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of āgacchati
Meaning present; at hand; current; lit. come
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)

Phonetic Change mt > t
Antonym anāgata
Synonym paccuppanna
Sanskrit āgata
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

dve'me, bhikkhave, bālā. katame dve? yo ca anāgataṃ bhāraṃ vahati, yo ca āgataṃ bhāraṃ na vahati. ime kho, bhikkhave, dve bālā'ti.

AN 2.99 bālavaggo
āgatakicca

nt. arriving at work; reaching what is to be done [āgata + kicca] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning arriving at work; reaching what is to be done
Construction āgata + kicca
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (āgata + kiccaṃ)
Variant āhatakicca
Commentary (SNt) āgatakiccan'ti āhatakiccaṃ, ayam'eva vā pāṭho.
Sanskrit āgata + kṛtya

Example

vipassanā hi tīṇi lakkhaṇāni upanijjhāyatī'ti lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhānaṃ. maggo vipassanāya āgatakiccaṃ sādhetī'ti lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhānaṃ. phalaṃ tathalakkhaṇaṃ nirodhasaccaṃ upanijjhāyatī'ti lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhānaṃ.

SNa 1.36 saddhāsuttavaṇṇanā
āgatatta

nt. (gram) (of text) fact of having been handed down [ā + √gam + ta + tta] ~

Meaning (gram) (of text) fact of having been handed down

Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + ta + tta
āgata + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Sanskrit āgatatva (origin)
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)
āgatapāka

masc. name of a layman; lit. cooking (for whoever) comes [āgata + pāka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a layman; lit. cooking (for whoever) comes
Construction āgata + pāka
Sanskrit āgata + pāka
āgatapubba

adj. visited before ✗
āgatapubbatā

fem. fact of having visited before ✗
āgataphala

adj. who has reached the fruit; epithet of a stream enterer [āgata + phala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has reached the fruit; epithet of a stream enterer
Construction āgata + phala
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (āgata + phalaṃ)
Commentary (VINa) tattha āgataṃ phalaṃ assā'ti āgataphalā paṭiladdhasot'āpattiphalā'ti attho. (ANa) ariyaphalaṃ assa āgatan'ti āgataphalo.
Sanskrit āgata + phala

Examples

saddheyyavacasā nāma āgataphalā abhisametāvinī viññātasāsanā.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ

yo so, bhante, ariyasāvako āgataphalo viññātasāsano, so katamena vihārena bahulaṃ viharatī'ti?

āgatabala

Meaning received power

Example

gahapatiko rathā otaritvā kesesu gahetvā nāmetvā kapparapahārehi koṭṭetvā gale gahetvā āgatamagga-abhimukhaṃ khipitvā pakkāmi

JAa 78 illisajātakavaṇṇanā
āgatamha

sandhi. we have come; we have arrived; lit. we are come [āgata + amha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pp + pr
Meaning we have come; we have arrived; lit. we are come
Construction āgata + amha
Commentary (SNa) āgat'amha imaṃ dhammasamayan'ti evaṃ samāgate devakāye disvā mayam'pi imaṃ dhammasamūhaṃ āgatā.
Sanskrit āgata + smaḥ

Example

mahāsamayo pavanasmiṃ,
devakāyā samāgatā,
āgat'amha imaṃ dhammasamayaṃ,
dakkhitāye aparājitasaṅghan'ti.

SN 1.37 samayasuttaṃ

Example

āgatā samaṇā imaṃ saṅgh'ārāmaṃ so'yaṃ āgatasamaṇo, saṅgh'ārāmo.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 328
āgatāgata

Meaning come whenever; whatever arrives
Construction āgata + āgata
āgatāgama

adj. who is an heir to the scriptures; who has received the texts; lit. come down scriptures [āgata + āgama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is an heir to the scriptures; who has received the texts; lit. come down scriptures
Construction āgata + āgama
Compound kammadhāraya (āgata + āgama)
Sanskrit āgata + āgama

Example

idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse sambahulā therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutā āgat'āgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā. tesaṃ me therānaṃ sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ

AN 4.180 mahāpadesasuttaṃ
āgati

fem. coming; arrival [ā + √gam + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from āgacchati
Meaning coming; arrival
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Antonym gati
Synonym āgata
Sanskrit āgati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

tatr'āp'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, n'eva āgatiṃ vadāmi, na gatiṃ, na ṭhitiṃ, na cutiṃ, na upapattiṃ. appatiṭṭhaṃ, appavattaṃ, anārammaṇam'ev'etaṃ. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

UD 71 paṭhamanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā jarādhammā jaraṃ anatītā'ti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
āgatigati

fem. coming and going; arriving and departing [āgati + gati] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning coming and going; arriving and departing
Construction āgati + gati
Compound dvanda (āgati ca gati ca)
Commentary (Sna) āgatigati na hotī'ti paṭisandhivasena āgati nāma, cutivasena gamanaṃ nāma na hoti.
Sanskrit āgati + gati

Example

nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

UD 74 catutthanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ
āgatosi

sandhi. you have come [āgato + asi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pp + pr
Meaning you have come
Construction āgato + asi
Sanskrit āgata + asi

Example

dūrato āgato'si sabhiya,
pañhe pucchituṃ abhikaṅkhamāno,
tes'antakaro bhavāmi pañhe te puṭṭho,
anupubbaṃ anudhammaṃ byākaromi te.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
āgantabba

ptp. to come [ā + √gam] ✗
āgantar 1

masc. arriver; comer; guest; visitor; lit. who arrives [ā + √gam + tar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from āgacchati
Meaning arriver; comer; guest; visitor; lit. who arrives
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Phonetic Change m > n
Antonym anāgantar
Synonym āgata, upasaṅkamitar, pāhuna, pāhunaka
Sanskrit āgantu
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

ye ca rūp'ūpagā sattā,
ye ca arūpaṭṭhāyino,
nirodhaṃ appajānantā,
āgantāro punabbhavaṃ.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
āgantar 2

masc. (+acc) returner (to); who comes back (to) [ā + √gam + tar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from āgacchati (+acc)
Meaning returner (to); who comes back (to)
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Phonetic Change m > n
Antonym anāgantar
Commentary (ANa) āgantāro itthattan'ti itthabhāvaṃ kām'āvacarapañcakkhandhabhāvam'eva āgantāro, n'eva tatr'ūpapattikā na uparūpapattikā honti.
Sanskrit āgantu
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena m'idh'ekacce sattā tamhā kāyā cutā āgāmino honti āgantāro itthattaṃ?

AN 4.171 cetanāsuttaṃ
āgantuka 1

Examples

AN 5.36 kāladānasuttaṃ

āvuso, āgantuka kuṭumbikassa te gehe bhattaṃ bhuñjanato varataraṃ mīḷhaṃ khādituṃ... kuṭumbikena dinnasāṭakanivāsanato varataraṃ naggena vicarituṃ

DHPa 1.5.11 jambukatthera vatthu

Root √gam･1 a (go)

āgantu + ka

Sanskrit āgantuka
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmetī'ti āgantukakathaṃ otārento purimakathaṃ bahiddhā apanāmeti. tatr'idaṃ vatthu, bhikkhū kira sannipatitvā ekaṃ daharaṃ, āvuso, tvaṃ imañ'c'imañ'ca āpattiṃ āpanno'ti āhaṃsu. so āha, bhante, nāgadīpaṃ gato'mhī'ti.

āgantukasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.159 (SN45.159) ✗

Meaning wanting to come; wishing to return

DHPa 2.18.10 meṇḍakaseṭṭhi vatthu

āgantvā

abs. (+acc) having arrived; having come to; having returned [ā + √gam + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of āgacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having arrived; having come to; having returned
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + tvā
Phonetic Change m > n
Antonym anāgantvā
Synonym āgantvāna, upagantvā
Sanskrit āgantvā
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

puratthimāya disāya āgantvā sīghaṃ dūtayugaṃ taṃ dovārikaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, kahaṃ, bho purisa, imassa nagarassa nagarassāmī'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, eso, bhante, majjhe siṅghāṭake nisinno'ti.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ

bhikkhussa ṭhit'okāsaṃ vā nisinn'okāsaṃ vā nipann'okāsaṃ vā āgantvā mantentaṃ ukkāsitabbaṃ, vijānāpetabbaṃ, no ce ukkāseyya vā vijānāpeyya vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.8 upassutisikkhāpadaṃ
āgantvāna

abs. (+acc) having arrived; having come to; having returned [ā + √gam + tvāna] ✓

Grammar abs of āgacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having arrived; having come to; having returned
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + tvāna
Phonetic Change m > n
Antonym anāgantvā
Synonym āgantvā, upagantvā
Commentary (KPa) āgantvāna sakaṃ gharan'ti ettha sakaṃ gharaṃ nāma pubbañātigharam'pi attanā sāmikabhāvena ajjhāvutthapubbagharam'pi. tadubhayam'pi yasmā te sakagharasaññāya āgacchan'ti, tasmā āgantvāna sakaṃ gharan'ti āha.
Sanskrit āgantvā
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

tirokuṭṭesu tiṭṭhanti,
sandhisiṅghāṭakesu ca,
dvārabāhāsu tiṭṭhanti,
āgantvāna sakaṃ gharaṃ.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa, paṭhamakaṇḍa
āgama 4

masc. coming, approach [ā + √gam] ✗
āgamana 1

nt. coming; approach; arrival [ā + √gam + ana] ✓

Meaning coming; approach; arrival

Root √gam･1 a (go)

Sanskrit āgamana
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

etu kho, bhante, bhagavā. svāgataṃ, bhante, bhagavato. cirassaṃ kho, bhante, bhagavā imaṃ pariyāyam'akāsi, yadidaṃ idh'āgamanāya

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ

ehi kho, mārisa, svāgataṃ, mārisa! cirassaṃ kho, mārisa, imaṃ pariyāyam'akāsi yadidaṃ idh'āgamanāya.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

Sanskrit āgamana
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

yassa darathajā na santi keci,
oraṃ āgamanāya paccayāse,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

āgamanadiṭṭhika

adj. with a belief in future consequences ✗

masc. road by which one arrives; path by which it comes [āgamana + patha] ~

masc. way of coming in [āgamana + magga] ~

ptp. according to the way of arrival (at the path) [ā + √gam] ✗
āgamayati

pr. waits, waits for; expects [√āgam] ✗
āgamayamāna 1

prp. (+acc) waiting (for) [√āgam + *aya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of āgamayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning waiting (for)
Root Family √āgam
Root √āgam･8 *aya (wait)
Base √āgam + aya > āgamaya
Construction āgamaya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Commentary (MNa) āgamayamāno'ti olokayamāno. ahaṃ buddho'ti sahasā appavisitvā yāva sā kathā niṭṭhāti, tāva aṭṭhāsī'ti attho.

Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū rammakassa brāhmaṇassa assame dhammiyā kathāya sannisinnā honti. atha kho bhagavā bahidvārakoṭṭhake aṭṭhāsi kathāpariyosānaṃ āgamayamāno.

MNa 106 āneñjasappāyasuttavaṇṇanā
āgamasandhimatta

nt. (gram) merely insertion of a letter for the sake of euphony [āgama + sandhi + matta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (gram) merely insertion of a letter for the sake of euphony
Construction āgama + sandhi + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (āgamasandhi + matta)
Sanskrit āgama + saṃdhi + matta

Example

t'eva ariyasāvakassā'ti te ariyasāvakassa. vakāro āgamasandhimattaṃ hoti.

MNa 106 āneñjasappāyasuttavaṇṇanā
āgamaṃ

aor. (+acc) I myself have come [ā + √gam + aṃ] ✓

Grammar aor, reflx 1st sg of āgami, trans (+acc)
Meaning I myself have come
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + aṃ
Sanskrit āgamam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

evaṃ abhikkantadassāviṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kathaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ,
maccurājā na passati.

SNP 70 mogharāja māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 15

anejaṃ mūladassāviṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3
āgamā 1

imperf. (+acc) came (to); arrived (at) [ā + √gam + ā] ✓

Grammar imperf of āgacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning came (to); arrived (at)
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + ā
Synonym āgā
Sanskrit āgam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

idh'āgamā vijjupabhāsavaṇṇā,
kokanadā pajjunnassa dhītā,
buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca namassamānā,
gāthā'c'imā atthavatī abhāsi.

SN 1.40 dutiyapajjunnadhītusuttaṃ

sabbe sattā sabbe pāṇā,
sabbe bhūtā ca kevalā,
sabbe bhadrāni passantu,
mā kañci pāpam'āgamā.

AN 4.67 ahirājasuttaṃ
āgamā 2

aor. (+acc) you yourself have come [ā + √gam + ā] ✓

Grammar aor, reflx 2nd sg of āgami, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning you yourself have come
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + ā
Sanskrit āgamaḥ
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

atha tvaṃ pavitakkam'āgamā,
manasā diṭṭhigatāni cintayanto,
dhonena yugaṃ samāgamā,
na hi tvaṃ sakkhasi sampayātave'ti.

āgami 2

aor. (+acc) came to, approached [ā + √gam] ✗
āgamissati 1

fut. (+acc) will happen (to) [ā + √gam + issa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of āgacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning will happen (to)
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + issa + ti
Sanskrit āgamiṣyati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

na man'taṃ āgamissati,
udabindunipātena,
udakumbho'pi pūrati,

thokaṃ thokam'pi ācinaṃ.

DHP 121 pāpavaggo
āgamissati 2

fut. (+acc) will come (to); will arrive (at) [ā + √gam + issa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of āgacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning will come (to); will arrive (at)
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + issa + ti
Sanskrit āgamiṣyati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

atha puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito ekāyanena maggena tam'eva aṅgārakāsuṃ paṇidhāya. tam'enaṃ cakkhumā puriso disvā evaṃ vadeyya, tath'āyaṃ bhavaṃ puriso paṭipanno tathā ca iriyati tañ'ca maggaṃ samārūḷho, yathā imaṃ'y'eva aṅgārakāsuṃ āgamissatī'ti.

āgāḷha

pp. vicious; harsh; rough [ā + √gāh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ā √gāh
Meaning vicious; harsh; rough
Root Family ā √gāh
Root √gāh･1 a (dive, plunge)
√ In Comps gāh or ggāh
Construction ā + √gāh + ta > gāḍha > gāḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change t > ḍ > ḷ

Example

AN 3.133 lekhasuttaṃ
āgilāyati

pr. is tired; is aching; is sore [ā + √gilā + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans
Meaning is tired; is aching; is sore
Root Family ā √gilā
Root √gilā･3 ya (be sick, tired)
Base √gilā + ya > gilāya (pass)
Construction ā + gilāya + ti
Commentary (MNa) piṭṭhi me āgilāyatī'ti kasmā āgilāyati? bhagavato hi chabbassāni padhānaṃ padahantassa mahantaṃ kāyadukkhaṃ ahosi, athassa aparabhāge mahallakakāle piṭṭhivāto uppajji.
Sanskrit āglāyati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √glai √glā 1, 2, 4 (be weary)

Example

paṭibhātu taṃ, ānanda, kāpilavatthavānaṃ sakyānaṃ sekho pāṭipado. piṭṭhi me āgilāyati, tam'ahaṃ āyamissāmī'ti.

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ
āgilāyana

nt. being sore; being sick [ā + √gilā] ✗
āgilāyi

aor. was wearied, ached [ā + √gilā] ✗
āgu

nt. crime; offence; wrong-doing ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning crime; offence; wrong-doing
Synonym ela, kibbisa
Commentary (ANa) āgun'ti pāpakaṃ lāmakaṃ akusaladhammaṃ.
Sanskrit āgas

Examples

āguṃ na karoti kiñci loke,
sabbasaṃyoge visajja bandhanāni,
sabbattha na sajjatī vimutto,
nāgo tādi pavuccate tathattā'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, coraṃ āgucāriṃ gahetvā rañño dasseyyuṃ, ayaṃ te, deva, coro āgucārī, imassa yaṃ icchasi taṃ daṇḍaṃ paṇehī'ti

Example

āguṃ karoti

idiom. commits a crime; commits an offence; does a misdeed [āguṃ + karoti] ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr, intrans
Meaning commits a crime; commits an offence; does a misdeed
Construction āguṃ + karoti
Commentary (THa) na hi āguṃ karoti so'ti āha. yasmā āguṃ, pāpaṃ, sabbena sabbaṃ na karoti
Sanskrit āgaḥ + karoti

Examples

nāgaṃ vo kittayissāmi,
na hi āguṃ karoti so,
soraccaṃ avihiṃsā ca,
pādā nāgassa te duve.

āguṃ na karoti kiñci loke,
sabbasaṃyoge visajja bandhanāni,
sabbattha na sajjatī vimutto,
nāgo tādi pavuccate tathattā'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
āghāta 1

masc. annoyance; irritation; repugnance; loathing [ā + √ghaṭ + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āghāteti
Meaning annoyance; irritation; repugnance; loathing
Root Family ā √ghaṭ
Root √ghaṭ･8 *e (strike, kill)
Construction ā + √ghaṭ > ghāṭ + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
ṭ > t
Antonym anāghāta
Synonym vighāta
Sanskrit āghāta
Sanskrit Root √han √ghaṭ 1, 2, 8 (smite)

Examples

tass'eva kho pana pubbe aviddasuno āghāto hoti byāpādo sampadoso. sv'āssa pahīno hoti ucchinnamūlo tāl'āvatthukato anabhāvaṃkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

nava'y'ime, bhikkhave, āghātapaṭivinayā. katame nava? anatthaṃ me acari, taṃ kut'ettha labbhā'ti āghātaṃ paṭivineti.

Examples

ācama

masc. sipping; rinsing ✗
ācamakumbhī

fem. rinsing vessel (holding water) ✗
ācamati

pr. sips (water, for purification); rinses (one's mouth or one's body) [ā + √cam] ✗
ācamana

nt. washing; rinsing [ā + √cam + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from ācamati
Meaning washing; rinsing
Root Family ā √cam
Root √cam･1 a (wash, rinse)
Construction ā + √cam + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym dhovana, vikkhālana
Commentary (SNa) udak'ācamanāni cā'ti udakena mukhaparimajjanāni.
Notes (MW) sipping water from the palm of the hand (before religious ceremonies, before meals, andc.) for purification
Sanskrit ācamana
Sanskrit Root √cam 1, 5 (sip)
ācamanakumbhī

fem. water-pitcher used for rinsing ✗
ācamanapādukā

fem. fixed shoes for the feet when washing ✗
ācamanasarāvaka

masc. dish for holding water (for sipping or washing) ✗
ācamayati

pr. sips (water, for purification); rinses (one's mouth or one's body) [ā + √cam] ✗
ācamayitvā

abs. having washed one's hands and rinsed one's mouth; having performed preparatory ablutions [ā + √cam + *aya + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of ācamayati, caus, intrans
Meaning having washed one's hands and rinsed one's mouth; having performed preparatory ablutions
Root Family ā √cam
Root √cam･1 *aya (wash, rinse)
Base √cam + *aya > cāmaya > camaya (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + camaya + itvā
Synonym ācamayitvāna
Sanskrit ācamayitvā
Sanskrit Root √cam 1, 5 (sip)
ācamayitvāna

abs. having washed one's hands and rinsed one's mouth; having performed preparatory ablutions [ā + √cam + *aya + itvāna] ~

Grammar abs of ācamayati, caus, intrans
Meaning having washed one's hands and rinsed one's mouth; having performed preparatory ablutions
Root Family ā √cam
Root √cam･1 *aya (wash, rinse)
Base √cam + *aya > cāmaya > camaya (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + camaya + itvāna
Synonym ācamayitvā
Commentary (ANa) sayaṃ ācamayitvānā'ti attanā'va hatthapāde dhovitvā mukhaṃ vikkhāletvā.
Sanskrit ācamayitvā
Sanskrit Root √cam 1, 5 (sip)
ācamitvā

abs. having rinsed; having washed [ā + √cam] ✗
ācameti

pr. rinses, washes [ā + √cam] ✗
ācamesi

aor. rinsed, washed [ā + √cam] ✗
ācaya 1

masc. increase; accumulation [ā + √ci + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ācināti
Meaning increase; accumulation
Root Family ā √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Construction ā + √ci > cay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym apacaya
Sanskrit ācaya
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

Examples

ācayāya saṃvattanti no apacayāya.

AN 8.53 saṃkhittasuttaṃ

dissati, bhikkhave, imassa cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa ācayo'pi apacayo'pi ādānam'pi nikkhepanam'pi.

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ
ācaya 2

masc. setting up (one of the kinds of upādā-rūpa) [ā + √ci] ✗
ācayagāmisutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.142 (AN10.142) ✗

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.186 (AN10.186) ✗
ācayagāmī

adj. leading to accumulation; leading to growth ✗
ācayāpacaya

masc. (+gen) increase and decrease (of); accumulation and diminution (of); enlargement and reduction [ācaya + apacaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+gen)
Meaning increase and decrease (of); accumulation and diminution (of); enlargement and reduction
Construction ācaya + apacaya
Compound dvanda (ācaya ca apacaya ca)
Commentary (MNa) ācay'āpacayo hotī'ti vaḍḍhi ca avaḍḍhi ca hoti, iti imassa kāyassa kālena vaḍḍhi, kālena parihānī'ti vaḍḍhiparihānimattam'eva paññāyati
Sanskrit ācaya + apacaya

Example

yaṃ kho te, aggivessana, purimaṃ pahāya pacchā upacinanti, evaṃ imassa kāyassa ācay'āpacayo hoti

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ācarati

pr. (+acc) acts; behaves; performs; does [ā + √car + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning acts; behaves; performs; does
Root Family ā √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Base √car + a > cara
Construction ā + cara + ti
Antonym nācarati
Synonym abhisaṅkharoti, iriyati, karoti, carati, pakubbati, samācarati, samudācarati
Sanskrit ācarati
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Examples

muṭṭhīhi'pi yujjhanti, raṅgamajjhe'pi saṅghāṭiṃ pattharitvā naccakiṃ evaṃ vadanti, idha, bhagini, naccassū'ti, nalāṭikam'pi denti, vividham'pi anācāraṃ ācaranti.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsaka sikkhāpadaṃ

kim'idaṃ kusalaṃ kim'ācarema,
icc'eke hi samecca mantayanti,
te mayaṃ puna'r'eva laddha mānusattaṃ,
paṭipannā viharemu sīlavanto.

VV 53 chattamāṇavaka vimānavatthu

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo

Example

uyyojeyyā'ti mātugāmena saddhiṃ hasitu'kāmo kīḷitu'kāmo raho nisīditu'kāmo anācāraṃ ācaritu'kāmo evaṃ vadeti, gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti

DN 25 udumbarikasuttaṃ

ime kho, bhikkhave, dve sukkā dhammā lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti vā.

VIN 4.1.18 ācariyavatta kathā

upasampādessāmī'ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariyaṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa. ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ. dvīhi kammavācāhi dukkaṭā.

VIN 2.5.7.5 ūnavīsativassasikkhāpadaṃ

Synonym yoggācariya
Sanskrit ācārya
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

ehi tvaṃ, samma medakathālike, caṇḍālavaṃsaṃ abhiruhitvā mama uparikhandhe tiṭṭhāhī'ti. evaṃ, ācariyā'ti kho, bhikkhave, medakathālikā antevāsī caṇḍālavaṃsikassa paṭissutvā caṇḍālavaṃsaṃ abhiruhitvā ācariyassa uparikhandhe aṭṭhāsi.

DN 4.5 soṇadaṇḍasuttaṃ

na tāv'āhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti … sakaṃ ācariyakaṃ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti

DN 16.20 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

Meaning lineage of teachers; lit. teacher's house
Construction ācariya + kula
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ācariyānaṃ + kula)
Sanskrit ācārya + kula

Example

sace me, bhante, assadammo saṇhena vinayaṃ na upeti, pharusena vinayaṃ na upeti, saṇhapharusena vinayaṃ na upeti, hanāmi naṃ, bhante. taṃ kissa hetu? mā me ācariyakulassa avaṇṇo ahosī'ti.

Grammar nt, comp

Sanskrit ācārya + sthāna

Example

iti kho, aggivessana, udako rāmaputto sabrahmacārī me samāno ācariyaṭṭhāne ca maṃ ṭhapesi, uḷārāya ca maṃ pūjāya pūjesi.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ācariyadhana

nt. payment for a teacher; teacher's fee; lit. teacher's wealth [ācariya + dhana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning payment for a teacher; teacher's fee; lit. teacher's wealth
Construction ācariya + dhana
Compound catutthī tappurisa (ācariyassa + dhana)
Commentary (MNa) ācariyadhanaṃ pariyesissantī'ti aññatitthiyā hi yassa santike sippaṃ uggaṇhanti, tassa sipp'uggahaṇato pure vā pacchā vā antar'antare vā gehato nīharitvā dhanaṃ denti. yesaṃ gehe n'atthi, te ñātisabhāgato pariyesanti, tathā alabhamānā bhikkham'pi caritvā denti'y'eva. taṃ sandhāy'etaṃ vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit ācārya + dhana

Example

imehi nāma, bhante, aññatitthiyā ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṃ pariyesissanti, kim'aṅgaṃ pan'āhaṃ āyasmato ānandassa pūjaṃ na karissāmī'ti!

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ
ācariyantevāsī

masc. teacher and student; master and apprentice [ācariya + antevāsī] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning teacher and student; master and apprentice
Construction ācariya + antevāsī
Compound dvanda (ācariya ca antevāsī ca)
Commentary (DNa) it'iha te ubho ācariy'antevāsī'ti evaṃ te dve ācariy'antevāsikā.
Sanskrit ācārya + antevāsin

Example

itiha te ubho ācariy'antevāsī aññam'aññassa ujuvipaccanīkavādā bhagavantaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhā honti bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca.

DN 1.1 paribbājakakathā
ācariyaparamparā

fem. succession of teachers ✗
ācariyapācariya

masc. teacher and teacher's teachers; current and former teachers [ācariya + pācariya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning teacher and teacher's teachers; current and former teachers
Construction ācariya + pācariya
Compound dvanda (ācariya ca pācariya ca)
Commentary (MNa) ācariyapācariyānan'ti ācariyānañ'c'eva ācariy'ācariyānañ'ca.
Sanskrit ācārya + prācārya

Example

mayā'pi kho etaṃ, bho gotama, sutaṃ pubbakānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ācariyapācariyānaṃ bhāsamānānaṃ, ārogyaparamā lābhā, nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhan'ti. ta'y'idaṃ, bho gotama, sametī'ti.

fem. teacher's secret knowledge; lit. teacher's fist [ācariya + muṭṭhi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning teacher's secret knowledge; lit. teacher's fist
Construction ācariya + muṭṭhi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ācariyassa + muṭṭhi)
Commentary (SNa) ācariyamuṭṭhī'ti yathā bāhirakānaṃ ācariyamuṭṭhi nāma hoti, daharakāle kassaci akathetvā pacchimakāle maraṇamañ'ce nipannā piyamanāpassa antevāsikassa kathenti, evaṃ tathāgatassa idaṃ mahallakakāle pacchimaṭhāne kathessāmī'ti muṭṭhiṃ katvā pariharitvā ṭhapitaṃ kiñci n'atthī'ti dasseti.
Sanskrit ācāryamuṣṭi
ācariyalesa

masc. teacher as a pretext [ācariya + lesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning teacher as a pretext
Construction ācariya + lesa
Compound kammadhāraya (ācariya + lesa)
Commentary (VINa) ācariyaleso nāma itthan'nāmassa antevāsiko diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto. aññaṃ itthan'nāmassa antevāsikaṃ passitvā codeti, itthan'nāmassa antevāsiko mayā diṭṭho.
Sanskrit ācārya + leśa

Example

kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāyā'ti leso nāma dasa lesā, jātileso, nāmaleso, gottaleso, liṅgaleso, āpattileso, pattaleso, cīvaraleso, upajjhāyaleso, ācariyaleso, sen'āsanaleso.

VIN 1.2.9 dutiyaduṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ
ācariyavāda

masc. traditional teaching ✗
ācariyavevacana

nt. synonym for a teacher [ācariya + vevacana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning synonym for a teacher
Construction ācariya + vevacana
Commentary (VINa) buddhavevacanāni vā'ti buddhassa vā pariyāyanāmāni ... asakyaputtiyassa vā. tattha vaṇṇapaṭṭhāne āgataṃ nāmasahassaṃ upāligāthāsu (ma ni 2.76) nāmasataṃ aññāni ca guṇato labbhamānāni nāmāni buddhavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. sabbāni'pi dhammassa nāmāni dhammavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. esa nayo sabbattha.
ācariyasādisa

adj. like the teacher; equal to one's teacher [ācariya + sadisa + *a] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like the teacher; equal to one's teacher
Construction ācariya + sadisa > sādisa + *a
ācariyasadisa + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) tattha jappe ācariyasādisā'ti kathanaṭṭhāne mayaṃ ācariyasadisā'y'eva.
ācariyānī

fem. woman teacher, wife of a teacher ✗

ācariyāmahayuga + ā

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning teacher and preceptor
