Commentary (VINt) ācariy'upajjhāyānan'ti iminā pabbajjā upasampadā ca yojetabbā.
ācariyūpaddava

masc. risk for the teacher; danger for the teacher [ācariya + upaddava] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning risk for the teacher; danger for the teacher
Construction ācariya + upaddava
Commentary (MNa) ācariy'ūpaddavenā'ti abbhantare uppannena kiles'ūpaddavena ācariyass'upaddavo.
ācāma

masc. rice water; pot scum [ā + √cam + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ācamati
Meaning rice water; pot scum
Root Family ā √cam
Root √cam･1 a (wash, rinse)
Construction ā + √cam > cām + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) ācāmo'ti bhattaukkhalikāya laggo jhāmaodano, taṃ chaḍḍitaṭṭhāne gahetvā khādati. odanakañjiyan'ti'pi vadanti.
Sanskrit ācāma
Sanskrit Root √cam 1, 5 (sip)

Example

so sākabhakkho'pi hoti sāmākabhakkho'pi hoti nīvārabhakkho'pi hoti daddulabhakkho'pi hoti haṭabhakkho'pi hoti kaṇabhakkho'pi hoti ācāmabhakkho'pi hoti piññākabhakkho'pi hoti tiṇabhakkho'pi hoti gomayabhakkho'pi hoti, vanamūlaphal'āhāro'pi yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
ācāmadāyikāvimānavatthu

nt. Vimānavatthu 20 (VV 20) ✗
ācāmabhakkha

adj. feeding on rice water; eating pot scum [ācāma + bhakkha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning feeding on rice water; eating pot scum
Construction ācāma + bhakkha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ācāmaṃ + bhakkha)
Commentary (MNa) ācāmo'ti bhattaukkhalikāya laggo jhāmaodano, taṃ chaḍḍitaṭṭhāne gahetvā khādati. odanakañjiyan'ti'pi vadanti.
Sanskrit ācāma + bhakṣa

Examples

so sākabhakkho'pi hoti sāmākabhakkho'pi hoti nīvārabhakkho'pi hoti daddulabhakkho'pi hoti haṭabhakkho'pi hoti kaṇabhakkho'pi hoti ācāmabhakkho'pi hoti piññākabhakkho'pi hoti tiṇabhakkho'pi hoti gomayabhakkho'pi hoti, vanamūlaphal'āhāro'pi yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

te tattha sākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, sāmākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, nīvārabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, daddulabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, haṭabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, kaṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, ācāmabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, piññākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, tiṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, gomayabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, vanamūlaphal'āhārā yāpesuṃ pavattaphalabhojī.

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
ācāmeti

pr. helps sip; helps wash [ā + √cam] ✗
ācāra 1

masc. behaviour; conduct; action [ā + √car + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ācarati
Meaning behaviour; conduct; action
Root Family ā √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction ā + √car > cār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anācāra
Synonym ākappa, paṭipatti, samācāra
Sanskrit ācāra
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Examples

ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'ti

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

mitte bhajassu kalyāṇe,
suddhājīve atandite,
paṭisanthāravuty'assa,
ācārakusalo siyā,
tato pāmojjabahulo,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissati.

DHP 376 bhikkhuvaggo
ācāra 2

masc. custom; norm; social convention; polite behaviour [ā + √car + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ācarati
Meaning custom; norm; social convention; polite behaviour
Root Family ā √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction ā + √car > cār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit ācāra
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

seyyath'idaṃ, nando vaccho, kiso saṃkicco, makkhali gosālo, etehi, bho gotama, acelakā mutt'ācārā hatth'āpalekhanā naehibhaddantikā natiṭṭhabhaddantikā na abhihaṭaṃ na uddissakataṃ na nimantanaṃ sādiyanti

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ācāra 3

masc. (+gen) practice (of) [ā + √car + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from ācarati (+gen)
Meaning practice (of)
Root Family ā √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction ā + √car > cār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit ācāra
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)
ācārakulaputta

masc. good man by behaviour [ācāra + kulaputta] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning good man by behaviour
Construction ācāra + kulaputta
Commentary (SNa) tattha yo yato kutoci kulā pabbajitvā sīl'ādayo pañca dhammakkhandhe pūreti, ayaṃ ācārakulaputto nāma.
ācārakusala

adj. well mannered; well behaved; lit. skilled in behaviour [ācāra + kusala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning well mannered; well behaved; lit. skilled in behaviour
Construction ācāra + kusala
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ācāre + kusala)
Commentary (DHPa) ācārakusalo'ti sīlam'pi ācāro, vattapaṭivattam'pi ācāro. tattha kusalo siyā, cheko bhaveyyā'ti attho.
Sanskrit ācāra + kuśala

Example

mitte bhajassu kalyāṇe,
suddhājīve atandite,
paṭisanthāravuty'assa,
ācārakusalo siyā,
tato pāmojjabahulo,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissati.

DHP 376 bhikkhuvaggo
ācāragocara

masc. conduct and a suitable environment; lit. behaviour and pasture [ācāra + gocara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning conduct and a suitable environment; lit. behaviour and pasture
Construction ācāra + gocara
Compound dvanda (ācāra ca gocara ca)
Commentary (DNa) ācāragocarasampanno'ti ācārena c'eva gocarena ca sampanno.
Sanskrit ācāra + gocara

Example

etha tumhe, āvuso, sīlavā hotha, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvutā viharatha ācāragocarasampannā aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvino, samādāya sikkhatha sikkhāpadesū'ti

AN 5.114 andhakavindasuttaṃ
ācāragocarasampanna

adj. who knows how to behave and keep to suitable places; well behaved and restrained; lit. successful in behaviour and pasture [ācāragocara + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who knows how to behave and keep to suitable places; well behaved and restrained; lit. successful in behaviour and pasture
Construction ācāragocara + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ācāregocarena + sampanna)
Commentary (SNa) ācāragocarasampanno'ti ācārena ca gocarena ca sampanno.
Sanskrit ācāra + gocara + sampanna

Examples

etha tumhe, āvuso, sīlavā hotha, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvutā viharatha ācāragocarasampannā aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvino, samādāya sikkhatha sikkhāpadesū'ti

AN 5.114 andhakavindasuttaṃ

sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
ācārattha

masc. meaning "behaviour" [ācāra + attha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning meaning "behaviour"
Construction ācāra + attha

Meaning teaching the prescribed rules of conduct

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning failure in moral conduct

Commentary (VSa) tattha garukānaṃ dvinnaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ vasena sīlavipatticodanā veditabbā, avasesānaṃ vasena ācāravipatticodanā, micchādiṭṭhi-antaggāhikadiṭṭhivasena diṭṭhivipatticodanā, ājīvahetu paññattānaṃ channaṃ sikkhāpadānaṃ vasena ājīvavipatticodanā veditabbā.

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning virtuous; ethical; lit. accomplished in behaviour
Construction ācāra + sampanna
Synonym kalyāṇasīla, sīlavatī, sīlavant
ācikkhaka

masc. who tells; informer [ā + √cikkh] ✗
ācikkhaṇā

fem. telling; informing; relating; explaining [ā + √cikkh + aṇā] ~

Grammar fem, act, from ācikkhati
Meaning telling; informing; relating; explaining
Root Family ā √cikkh
Root √cikkh･1 a (show, tell)
Construction ā + √cikkh + aṇā
Derivative kita (aṇā)
Sanskrit ākhyāna
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)
ācikkhati 1

pr. (+acc or +dat) informs; tells (to); talks about [ā + √cikkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc or +dat)
Meaning informs; tells (to); talks about
Root Family ā √cikkh
Root √cikkh･1 a (show, tell)
Base √cikkh + a > cikkha
Construction ā + cikkha + ti
Synonym akkhāti, āmantayati, ārocayati, āroceti, kathayati, katheti, pabrūti, pāvadati, pilapati, bravīti, brūti, bhaṇati, lapayati, vadati
Commentary (SNa) ācikkhatī'ti katheti.
Sanskrit ākhyāti
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)

Examples

amutra mayā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahitā, mā kho tattha paṭiggaṇhī'ti. sace passitvā na ācikkhati, āpatti dukkaṭassa. sace ācikkhite paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.5.4.4 kāṇamātusikkhāpadaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, loke lokadhammo, taṃ tathāgato abhisambujjhati abhisameti, abhisambujjhitvā abhisametvā taṃ ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti.

SN 22.94 pupphasuttaṃ
ācikkhati 2

pr. (+acc or +dat) describes; points out; shows (to) [ā + √cikkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc or +dat)
Meaning describes; points out; shows (to)
Root Family ā √cikkh
Root √cikkh･1 a (show, tell)
Base √cikkh + a > cikkha
Construction ā + cikkha + ti
Synonym avekkhati, upadisati, dasseti
Commentary (SNa) maggaṃ ācikkheyyā'ti hatthe gahetvā, esa maggo'ti vadeyya.
Sanskrit ākhyāti
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)

Examples

pāpā nivāreti kalyāṇe niveseti assutaṃ sāveti saggassa maggaṃ ācikkhati

DN 31.13 siṅgālasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhintī'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
ācikkhana

nt. telling; informing; announcing [ā + √cikkh + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from ācikkhati
Meaning telling; informing; announcing
Root Family ā √cikkh
Root √cikkh･1 a (show, tell)
Construction ā + √cikkh + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym akkhāna, ākkhāna, ākhyāna, pavedana, byākaraṇa
Sanskrit ākhyāna
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)

Examples

utu'kkhānaṃ: hem'ant'ādīnaṃ tiṇṇaṃ utūnaṃ, ettakaṃ atikkantaṃ, ettakaṃ avasiṭṭhan'ti. evaṃ utu-ācikkhanaṃ kataṃ kiṃ?

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi

evaṃ utu-ācikkhanaṃ. utūn'īdha pana sāsane hem'antagimhavassānānaṃ vasena tīṇi honti.

PAT PK dhammayuttikapubbakicca
ācikkhanta

prp. (+acc or +dat) telling; informing; relating; explaining (to) [ā + √cikkh + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ācikkhati, trans (+acc or +dat)
Meaning telling; informing; relating; explaining (to)
Root Family ā √cikkh
Root √cikkh･1 a (show, tell)
Base √cikkh + a > cikkha
Construction ā + cikkha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym kathayamāna, kathenta
Commentary (SNa) diṭṭhaṃ sutañ'ca ācikkhan'ti diṭṭhaṃ, diṭṭhaṃ me'ti sutaṃ, sutaṃ me'ti ācikkhanto, na niguhanto.
Sanskrit ācakṣat, ākhyāt
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)

Example

jegucchī nipako bhikkhu,
cātuyāmasusaṃvuto,
diṭṭhaṃ sutañ'ca ācikkhaṃ,
na hi nūna kibbisī siyā'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
ācikkhāpetvā

abs. (+acc) having made show; having made tell [ā + √cikkh + *āpe + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ācikkhati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having made show; having made tell
Root Family ā √cikkh
Root √cikkh･1 *āpe (show, tell)
Base √cikkh + āpe > cikkhāpe (caus)
Construction ā + cikkhāpe + tvā
Sanskrit ākhyā
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)

Example

satthā mūlasiriṃ āmantetvā, jānāsi etan'ti pucchitvā, na jānāmī'ti vutte, pitā te ānandaseṭṭhī'ti vatvā asaddahantaṃ, ānandaseṭṭhi puttassa te pañca mahānidhiyo ācikkhāhī'ti ācikkhāpetvā saddahāpesi

DHPa 1.5.3 ānandaseṭṭhi vatthu
ācikkhi

aor. (+acc or +dat) told; informed; taught (to) [ā + √cikkh + i] ✓

Grammar aor of ācikkhati, trans (+acc or +dat)
Meaning told; informed; taught (to)

Root √cikkh･1 a (show, tell)
Construction ā + √cikkh + i

Sanskrit ākhyat

Example

idha chinditamārite,
hatajānīsu kassapo,
na pāpaṃ samanupassati,
puññaṃ vā pana attano,
sa ve vissāsam'ācikkhi,
satthā arahati mānanan'ti.

VIN 2.5.4.4 kāṇamātusikkhāpadaṃ

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ
ācikkhitabba

ptp. should be told; should be informed; lit. to be told [ā + √cikkh + a + itabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of ācikkhati
Meaning should be told; should be informed; lit. to be told
Root Family ā √cikkh
Root √cikkh･1 a (show, tell)
Base √cikkh + a > cikkha
Construction ā + cikkha + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Sanskrit ākhyātavya
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)

Examples

dvattipattapūre paṭiggahetvā tato nikkhamantena bhikkhuṃ passitvā ācikkhitabbaṃ, amutra mayā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahitā, mā kho tattha paṭiggaṇhī'ti.

VIN 2.5.4.4 kāṇamātusikkhāpadaṃ

rūpena vā nimittena vā saññāṇaṃ katvā nikkhipitvā ācikkhitabbaṃ, yassa bhaṇḍaṃ naṭṭhaṃ so āgacchatū'ti.

VIN 2.5.9.2 ratanasikkhāpadaṃ
ācikkhitar

masc. who tells; informer [ā + √cikkh] ✗
ācikkhituṃ

Grammar inf of ācikkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to explain; to describe; to point out; to demonstrate
Root Family ā √cikkh
Root √cikkh･1 a (show, tell)

Commentary (SNa) ācikkhitun'ti kathetuṃ.
Sanskrit ākhyātum
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)

Examples

sakkā evam'evaṃ viññāṇam'p'idaṃ ācikkhituṃ desetuṃ paññāpetuṃ paṭṭhapetuṃ vivarituṃ vibhajituṃ uttānīkātuṃ iti'p'idaṃ viññāṇaṃ anattā'ti.

SN 35.234 udāyīsuttaṃ

ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ
ācikkhitvā

Grammar abs of ācikkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having told; having related; having described

nārado sabbaṃ taṃ pavattiṃ ācikkhitvā iminā kāraṇena ahaṃ iminā abhisapito, ath'āhaṃ, mayhaṃ doso n'atthi, yassa doso atthi, tass'eva upari abhisapo patatū'ti vatvā abhisapiṃ

DHPa 1.1.3 tissatthera vatthu
ācikkhiyati

pr. (+instr) is informed; is told [ā + √cikkh] ✗
ācikkhiyamāna

Grammar prp of ācikkhiyati, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being informed (by); being told (by); being spoken to (by)
Root Family ā √cikkh

Base √cikkh + iya > cikkhiya (pass)
Construction ā + cikkhiya + māna

Synonym vuccamāna
Sanskrit ākhīyamāna
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)

Example

yo, bhikkhave, tathāgatena evaṃ ācikkhiyamāne desiyamāne paññapiyamāne paṭṭhapiyamāne vivariyamāne vibhajiyamāne uttānīkariyamāne na jānāti na passati tam'ahaṃ, bhikkhave, bālaṃ puthujjanaṃ andhaṃ acakkhukaṃ ajānantaṃ apassantaṃ kin'ti karomi!

SN 22.94 pupphasuttaṃ
āciṇṇa 1

nt. (+gen) custom (of); practice (of); habit (of); lit. practiced [ā + √car + na] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of ācarati (+gen)
Meaning custom (of); practice (of); habit (of); lit. practiced
Root Family ā √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction ā + √car > cir + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change a > i
rn > ṇṇ
Synonym vatta
Sanskrit ācīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

na kho, āvuso gotama, āciṇṇaṃ nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa kammaṃ, kamman'ti paññapetuṃ. daṇḍaṃ, daṇḍan'ti kho, āvuso gotama, āciṇṇaṃ nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa paññapetun'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
āciṇṇa 2

pp. practised; performed; observed [ā + √car] ✗
āciṇṇakappa

masc. customary practice ✗
āciṇṇakamma

nt. habitual kamma ✗
ācita 1

pp. accumulated; heaped up [ā + √ci + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ācināti
Meaning accumulated; heaped up
Root Family ā √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Construction ā + √ci + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Sanskrit ācita
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

Example

ahaṃ kho gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā piṇḍāya caranto alatthaṃ lūkhassa vā paṇītassa vā bhojanassa yāva'd'atthaṃ pāripūriṃ. tassa me kāyo garuko akammañño mās'ācitaṃ maññe. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti.

AN 8.80 kusītārambhavatthusuttaṃ
ācita 2

pp. (+instr) covered (with); spread (with); full (of); lit. accumulated [ā + √ci + ta] ~

Meaning covered (with); spread (with); full (of); lit. accumulated

Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)

Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym atthata, upalitta, santhata
Sanskrit ācita
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)
ācinanta

prp. (+acc) accumulating; gathering; collecting; heaping up [ā + √ci + nā + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ācināti, trans (+acc)
Meaning accumulating; gathering; collecting; heaping up
Root Family ā √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Base √ci + nā > cinā
Construction ā + cinā + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit ācinvat
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

Examples

m'āvamaññetha pāpassa,
na man'taṃ āgamissati,
udabindunipātena,
udakumbho'pi pūrati,
bālo pūrati pāpassa,
thokaṃ thokam'pi ācinaṃ.

DHP 121 pāpavaggo

tassa vaḍḍhanti vedanā,
anekā rūpasambhavā,
abhijjhā ca vihesā ca,
cittam'ass'ūpahaññati,
evaṃ ācinato dukkhaṃ,
ārā nibbānam'uccati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ
ācināti

pr. (+acc) accumulates; gathers; collects; amasses [ā + √ci + nā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning accumulates; gathers; collects; amasses
Root Family ā √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Base √ci + nā > cinā
Construction ā + cinā + ti
Antonym apacināti
Synonym vicināti
Sanskrit ācinoti
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

Example

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako apacināti no ācināti, pajahati no upādiyati, visineti no ussineti, vidhūpeti no sandhūpeti

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ
ācini

aor. accumulated [ā + √ci] ✗
āciyi

aor. was heaped up; was accumulated [ā + √ci] ✗
ācīyati

pr. is heaped up; is accumulated [ā + √ci] ✗
ācīra

nt. strip; row; fence; hedgerow; enclosure [ā + cīra] ✓

Grammar nt, from cīra
Meaning strip; row; fence; hedgerow; enclosure
Construction ā + cīra
Commentary (DNa) sv'eva ca tinduk'ācīrasaṅkhātāya timbarūrukkhapantiyā parikkhittattā tinduk'ācīro.
Sanskrit prācīra

Example

tena kho pana samayena poṭṭhapādo paribbājako samayappavādake tinduk'ācīre ekasālake mallikāya ārāme paṭivasati mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṃ tiṃsamattehi paribbājakasatehi.

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu
ācera

masc. teacher ✗
āceraka

nt. teachings; profession ✗
ājañña

adj. thoroughbred; well bred [ā + √jan + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ājāyati
Meaning thoroughbred; well bred
Root Family ā √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction ā + √jan + ya
Derivative kita (ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Variant ājāneyya, ājāniya, ājānīya
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, subhūmiyaṃ catumahāpathe ājaññaratho yutto assa ṭhito odhastapatodo.

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

dullabho purisa-ājañño, na so sabbattha jāyati,
yattha so jāyati dhīro, taṃ kulaṃ sukham'edhati.

DHP 193 buddhavaggo
ājaññajātaka

nt. Jātaka 24 (JA 24) ✗

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning harnessed with thoroughbred horses
Construction ājañña + saṃyutta

nivesane nivese ca,
vibhatte bhāgaso mite.

SNP 19 brāhmaṇadhammikasuttaṃ
ājava

nt. swift current; rapids; torrent [ā + √ju + *a] ✓

Meaning swift current; rapids; torrent

Root √ju･1 a (be fast)

Phonetic Change u > av
Sanskrit ā + java

Example

Root √ñā･5 nā (know)

Phonetic Change ñ > j
Synonym vijāna
Sanskrit ājñāna
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Example

passa dhammaṃ durājānaṃ,
sampamūḷh'etth'aviddasu,
nivutānaṃ tamo hoti,
andhakāro apassataṃ.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

Construction ājānana + attha + aṃ

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

acchariyaṃ, āvuso, abbhutaṃ, āvuso! yathā taṃ sutavatā sāvakena samma'd'eva satthusāsanaṃ ājānantena, evam'eva āyasmatā puṇṇena mantāṇiputtena gambhīrā gambhīrapañhā anumassa anumassa byākatā.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

prp. (+acc) knowing; understanding [ā + √ñā + nā + māna] ✓

Meaning knowing; understanding

Root √ñā･5 nā (know)

Construction ā + jānā + māna

kathaṃkathiṃ dhotaka kañci loke,
dhammañ'ca seṭṭhaṃ ājānamāno,
evaṃ tuvaṃ ogham'imaṃ taresi.

pr. acknowledges [ā + √ñā] ✗

VIN 1.2.3 duṭṭhullavācāsikkhāpadaṃ

Sanskrit ājñītvā
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)
ājāniya

adj. thoroughbred; well bred [ā + √jan + *iya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ājāyati
Meaning thoroughbred; well bred
Root Family ā √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction ā + √jan > jān + *iya
Derivative kita (*iya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym khaḷuṅka
Variant ājāneyya, ājānīya, ājañña
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

kiṃ pattinam'āhu vedaguṃ,
anuviditaṃ kena kathañ'ca vīriyavā'ti,
ājāniyo kin'ti nāma hoti,
puṭṭho me bhagavā byākarohi.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

yass'assu lunāni bandhanāni,
ajjhattaṃ bahiddhā ca saṅgamūlaṃ,
sabbasaṅgamūlabandhanā pamutto,
ājāniyo tādi pavuccate tathattā'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
ājānīya

adj. thoroughbred; well bred; of good breed; of high pedigree [ā + √jan + *īya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ājāyati
Meaning thoroughbred; well bred; of good breed; of high pedigree
Root Family ā √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction ā + √jan > jān + *īya
Derivative kita (*īya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym khaḷuṅka, anājānīya
Variant ājāneyya, ājāniya, ājañña
Commentary (SNa) ājānīyo'ti hatthī vā hotu ass'ādīsu aññataro vā, yo kāraṇaṃ jānāti, ayaṃ ājānīyo'va catuppadānaṃ seṭṭho'ti attho.
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

varam'assatarā dantā,
ājānīyā ca sindhavā,
kuñjarā ca mahānāgā,
attadanto tato varaṃ.

DHP 322 nāgavaggo

sambuddho dvipadaṃ seṭṭho,
ājānīyo catuppadaṃ,
sussūsā seṭṭhā bhariyānaṃ,
yo ca puttānam'assavo'ti.

ājānīyajjāyita

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
ājānīyaṭṭhāna 1

nt. position of a thoroughbred [ājānīya + ṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning position of a thoroughbred
Construction ājānīya + ṭhāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ājānīyassa + ṭhāna)
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya + sthāna

Example

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅkassa kiñ'cā'pi evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata maṃ manussā ājānīyaṭṭhāne ṭhapeyyuṃ, ājānīyabhojanañ'ca bhojeyyuṃ, ājānīyaparimajjanañ'ca parimajjeyyun'ti

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning high position; exalted state; lit. place of a thoroughbred

Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya + sthāna

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning place fit for thoroughbreds; position suitable for those of high pedigree

Antonym anājānīyaṭhāna
Sanskrit ājāneyya + sthāna

Example

mayañ'hi, bhante, pubbe aññatitthiye paribbājake anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyā'ti amaññimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyabhojanaṃ bhojimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyaṭhāne ṭhapimha.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
ājānīyaparimajjana

nt. grooming fit for a thoroughbred [ājānīya + parimajjana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning grooming fit for a thoroughbred
Construction ājānīya + parimajjana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ājānīyassa + parimajjana)
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya + parimārjana

Example

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅkassa kiñ'cā'pi evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata maṃ manussā ājānīyaṭṭhāne ṭhapeyyuṃ, ājānīyabhojanañ'ca bhojeyyuṃ, ājānīyaparimajjanañ'ca parimajjeyyun'ti atha kho naṃ manussā na c'eva ājānīyaṭṭhāne ṭhapenti na ca ājānīyabhojanaṃ bhojenti na ca ājānīyaparimajjanaṃ parimajjanti.

AN 10.87 nappiyasuttaṃ
ājānīyabhojana

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning food fit for thoroughbreds; meals suitable for noble ones
Construction ājānīya + bhojana
Compound catutthī tappurisa (ājānīyassa + bhojana)
Antonym anājānīyabhojana
Commentary (MNa) ājānīyabhojanan'ti kāraṇaṃ jānantehi bhuñjitabbaṃ bhojanaṃ.
Sanskrit ājāneyya + bhojana

Examples

mayañ'hi, bhante, pubbe aññatitthiye paribbājake anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyā'ti amaññimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyabhojanaṃ bhojimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyaṭhāne ṭhapimha.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅkassa kiñ'cā'pi evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata maṃ manussā ājānīyaṭṭhāne ṭhapeyyuṃ, ājānīyabhojanañ'ca bhojeyyuṃ, ājānīyaparimajjanañ'ca parimajjeyyun'ti atha kho naṃ manussā na c'eva ājānīyaṭṭhāne ṭhapenti na ca ājānīyabhojanaṃ bhojenti na ca ājānīyaparimajjanaṃ parimajjanti. taṃ kissa hetu?

AN 10.87 nappiyasuttaṃ
ājānīyavant

masc. who has thoroughbred-like qualities; who has noble character; lit. having thoroughbred quality [ā + √jan + *īya + vant] ✓

Grammar masc, from ājānīya
Meaning who has thoroughbred-like qualities; who has noble character; lit. having thoroughbred quality
Root Family ā √jan
Root √jan･3 (be born, produce)
Construction ā + √jan > jān + *īya + vant
ājānīya + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit ājāneya + vat
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

ājānīyo vata, bho, samaṇo gotamo, ājānīyavatā ca samuppannā sārīrikā vedanā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā asātā amanāpā sato sampajāno adhivāseti avihaññamāno'ti.

ājāneyya

adj. thoroughbred; well bred [ā + √jan + *eyya] ~

Meaning thoroughbred; well bred

ājāyati

pr. (+loc) is born (in) [ā + √jan + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans (+loc)
Meaning is born (in)
Root Family ā √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Base √jan + ya > janya > jāya (pass, irreg)
Construction ā + jāya + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym vijāyati
Sanskrit ājāyate
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

sace enti manussattaṃ,
aḍḍhe ājāyare kule,
coḷaṃ piṇḍo ratī khiḍḍā,
yatthākicchena labbhati.

SN 1.49 maccharisuttaṃ
ājīva

masc. livelihood; mode of living; way of life; way of earning a living [ā + √jīv + a] ✓

Meaning livelihood; mode of living; way of life; way of earning a living

Derivative kita (a)
Synonym vihāra, sājīva
Sanskrit ājīva
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Examples

parisuddho no ājīvo bhavissati uttāno vivaṭo na ca chiddavā saṃvuto ca

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

siyā kho pana te, nigrodha, evam'assa, ājīvā no cāvetu'kāmo samaṇo gotamo evam'āhā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, nigrodha, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. yo eva vo ājīvo, so eva vo ājīvo hotu.

DN 25 udumbarikasuttaṃ
ājīvaka

masc. Ājīvaka; ascetic; member of a renunciant sect; (comm) naked ascetic; lit. (following a specific code of) livelihood [ā + √jīv + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from ājīva
Meaning Ājīvaka; ascetic; member of a renunciant sect; (comm) naked ascetic; lit. (following a specific code of) livelihood
Root Family ā √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction ā + √jīv + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Synonym ājīvika
Commentary (MNa) ājīvako'ti naggasamaṇako.
Sanskrit ājīvaka
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Examples

evaṃ vutte, bhikkhave, upako ājīvako hupeyya'p'āvuso'ti

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ

tatr'idaṃ, bhante, pūraṇena kassapena sukk'ābhijāti paññattā, ājīvakā ājīvakiniyo.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ

Sanskrit ājīvaka + śataṃ

Example

ek'ūnapaññāsa ājīvakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa paribbājakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa nāg'āvāsasate, vīse indriyasate, tiṃse nirayasate, chattiṃsa rajodhātuyo

AN 10.49 sarīraṭṭhadhammasuttaṃ

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of livelihood; to make a living
Construction ājīva + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ājīvassa + hetu)

Example

n'āhaṃ alakkhyā ahirikkatāya vā,
na cittahetū na ca dūrakantanā,
ājīvahetū ca ahaṃ na nikkhamiṃ,
kato ca te citta paṭissavo mayā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
ājīvika

masc. ascetic; member of a renunciant sect; (comm) naked ascetic; lit. (following a specific code of) livelihood [ā + √jīv + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from ājīva
Meaning ascetic; member of a renunciant sect; (comm) naked ascetic; lit. (following a specific code of) livelihood
Root Family ā √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction ā + √jīv + ika
Derivative kita (ika)
Synonym ājīvaka
Sanskrit ājīvaka
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Example

addasā kho maṃ, bhikkhave, upako ājīviko antarā ca gayaṃ antarā ca bodhiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannaṃ. disvāna maṃ etadavoca, vippasannāni kho te, āvuso, indriyāni, parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto!

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
ājīvikapakata

adj. induced by (the necessity of) obtaining a living ✗
ājīvikabhaya

adj. danger to one's livelihood; fear concerning livelihood ✗
ājīvikāpakata

adj. problems with livelihood; difficulty earning a living [ājīvikā + pakata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning problems with livelihood; difficulty earning a living
Construction ājīvikā + pakata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ājīvikāya + pakata)
Commentary (MNa) dubbhikkh'ādīsu jīvituṃ asakkonto pabbajito ājīvikāpakato nāma, ājīvikāya pakato abhibhūto'ti attho. (SNa) ājīvikāpakatā'ti ājīvikāya upaddutā abhibhūtā, puttadāraṃ posetuṃ asakkontā'ti attho.
Sanskrit ājīvika (bsk) + prakṛta

Example

tañ'ca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, kulaputtā upenti atthavasikā, atthavasaṃ paṭicca, n'eva rāj'ābhinītā, na cor'ābhinītā, na iṇ'aṭṭā, na bhay'aṭṭā, na ājīvikāpakatā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
āṇatta 1

pp. ordered; commanded [ā + √ñā + *āpe + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of āṇāpeti, caus
Meaning ordered; commanded
Root Family ā √ñā
Root √ñā･5 *āpe (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + āpe > ñāpe > ṇāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + ṇāpe + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ñ > ṇ
p > t
Sanskrit ājñapta, ājñāpita
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Examples

acchindāpeyyā'ti aññaṃ āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. sakiṃ āṇatto bahukam'pi acchindati, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.

VIN 1.4.3.5 cīvarācchindanasikkhāpadaṃ

nikkaḍḍhāpeyyā'ti aññaṃ āṇāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa. sakiṃ āṇatto bahuke'pi dvāre atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

pp. ordered [ā + √ñā] ✗

Root Family ā √ñā
Root √ñā･5 *āpe (know)
√ In Comps ññā

Construction ā + ṇāpe + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change ñ > ṇ
āpe + ti > atti (contraction)

Examples

so, bhariyaṃ me nissāya bhayena uppannena bhavitabban'ti cintetvā rañño āṇaṃ paṭibāhituṃ asakkonto gantvā rājānaṃ vanditvā aṭṭhāsi

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu

seyyathā'pi saha bhaṇḍena gahitacoraṃ, vadhetha nan'ti rañño āṇāya rājapurisā bandhitvā catukke catukke pahārasatāni dentā āghātanaṃ nenti.

āṇāpaka

masc. who gives an order; who passes on an order ✗

VIN 1.4.2.7 eḷakalomadhovāpanasikkhāpadaṃ

sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.

VIN 4.8.207 pajjotarāja vatthu
āṇāpetuṃ

inf. to command; to order; to direct [ā + √ñā] ✗

abs. (+acc) having commanded; having ordered; having informed; lit. having caused to know [ā + √ñā + *āpe + tvā] ✓

Meaning having commanded; having ordered; having informed; lit. having caused to know

√ In Comps ññā

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, dasārahānaṃ ānako nāma mudiṅgo ahosi. tassa dasārahā ānake ghaṭite aññaṃ āṇiṃ odahiṃsu.

āṇi 2

Meaning lynchpin; axle pin

samānattatā ca dhammesu,
tattha tattha yath'ārahaṃ,
ete kho saṅgahā loke,
rathass'āṇī'va yāyato.

vīriyaṃ parakkammadaḷhaṃ kareyya.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu app'ābādho hoti app'ātaṅko, samavepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgato n'ātisītāya n'āccuṇhāya majjhimāya padhānakkhamāya. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo samayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ
ātaṅkaphassa

masc. contact with disease; touch, sensation of sickness ✗

nt. drum covered with leather on all sides ✗

Sanskrit ātapa
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Examples

phuṭṭhassa me aññatarena byādhinā,
rogena bāḷhaṃ dukhitassa ruppato,
parisussati khippam'idaṃ kaḷevaraṃ,
pupphaṃ yathā paṃsuni ātape kataṃ.

JA 293 kāyanibbinda jātakaṃ

paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cīvaraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya uṇhassa paṭighātāya ḍaṃsamakasavāta-atapasiriṃsapasamphassānaṃ paṭighātāya yāva'd'eva hirikopīnapaṭicchādan'atthaṃ

MN 2.4 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
ātapa 2

masc. mortification [ā + √tap] ✗
ātapati

pr. shines [ā + √tap] ✗
ātapatta

nt. sunshade, umbrella [ā + √tap] ✗
ātapi

aor. shone [ā + √tap] ✗
ātappa

nt. effort; exertion; lit. to be burned [ā + √tap + ya] ✓

Grammar nt, ptp of ātapati
Meaning effort; exertion; lit. to be burned
Root Family ā √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Construction ā + √tap + ya
Derivative kicca (ya)
Phonetic Change y > p
Synonym uṭṭhāna
Commentary (MNa) ātappāyā'ti kilesasantāpakavīriyakaraṇ'atthāya. (MNa) ajj'eva kiccam'ātappan'ti kilesānaṃ ātāpanaparitāpanena ātappan'ti laddhanāmaṃ vīriyaṃ ajj'eva kātabbaṃ.
Sanskrit ātapya, ātapta
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Examples

tumhehi kiccam'ātappaṃ,
akkhātāro tathāgatā,
paṭipannā pamokkhanti,
jhāyino mārabandhanā.

DHP 276 maggavaggo

tenah'ātappaṃ karohi,
idh'eva nipako sato,
ito sutvāna nigghosaṃ,
sikkhe nibbānam'attano.

SNP 60 dhotaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 5
ātappakaraṇīyasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.50 (AN3.50) ✗
ātappamakari

aor. made an effort; exerted oneself [ātappaṃ + akari] ~

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning made an effort; exerted oneself
Construction ātappaṃ + akari
ātappamanvāya

ind. due to effort; through exertion ✗
ātappaṃ karoti

idiom. (+dat) makes an effort (to) ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr (+dat)
Meaning makes an effort (to)

Example

bhūtena kho pana vuccamāno avajānāti, no paṭijānāti. abhūtena vuccamāno na ātappaṃ karoti, tassa nibbeṭhanāya iti'p'etaṃ atacchaṃ iti'p'etaṃ abhūtanti.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ
ātāpa

masc. glow, heat, ardour [ā + √tap] ✗
ātāpana

nt. causing pain; torturing; mortifying; lit. causing heat [ā + √tap + *e + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from ātāpeti, caus
Meaning causing pain; torturing; mortifying; lit. causing heat
Root Family ā √tap
Root √tap･1 *e (burn, radiate heat)
Base √tap + *e > tāpe (caus)
Construction ā + tāpe + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym paritāpana
Sanskrit ātāpana
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Example

iti evarūpaṃ anekavihitaṃ kāyassa ātāpanaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attan'tapo hoti attaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
ātāpanaparitāpanānuyoga

masc. practice of self-mortification and torture ✗
ātāpanaparitāpanānuyogamanuyutta

adj. devoted to the practice of torturing and mortifying oneself [ātāpana + paritāpana + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to the practice of torturing and mortifying oneself
Construction ātāpana + paritāpana + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (ātāpanaparitāpanānuyogaṃ + anuyutta)
Sanskrit ātāpana + paritāpana + anuyoga + anuyukta

Example

iti evarūpaṃ anekavihitaṃ kāyassa ātāpanaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attan'tapo hoti attaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
ātāpita

pp. heated [ā + √tap] ✗
ātāpiya

adj. energetic; zealous; exerting oneself [ā + √tap] ✗
ātāpī

adj. avid; ardent; zealous; with continuous effort; lit. burning [ā + √tap + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from ātapati
Meaning avid; ardent; zealous; with continuous effort; lit. burning
Root Family ā √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Construction ā + √tap > tāp + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit ātāpin
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Examples

asso yathā bhadro kasāniviṭṭho,
ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha,
saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca,
samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca,
sampannavijjācaraṇā patissatā,
jahissatha dukkham'idaṃ anappakaṃ.

DHP 144 daṇḍavaggo

niddaṃ na bahulīkareyya,
jāgariyaṃ bhajeyya ātāpī,
tandiṃ māyaṃ hassaṃ khiḍḍaṃ,
methunaṃ vippajahe savibhūsaṃ.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
ātāpīsutta

nt. Itivuttaka 34 (ITI 34) ✗
ātāpeti 1

pr. (+acc) torments; tortures; causes suffering; lit. causes heat [ā + √tap + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ātapati, trans (+acc)
Meaning torments; tortures; causes suffering; lit. causes heat
Root Family ā √tap
Root √tap･1 *e (burn, radiate heat)
Base √tap + *e > tāpe (caus)
Construction ā + tāpe + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym abhisantāpeti, samparitāpeti
Sanskrit ātapayati
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Example

yv'āyaṃ, bhante, puggalo attantapo attaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto so attānaṃ sukhakāmaṃ dukkhapaṭikkūlaṃ ātāpeti paritāpeti, iminā me ayaṃ puggalo cittaṃ n'ārādheti.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
ātāpeti 2

pr. (+acc) heats [ā + √tap] ✗
ātāpesi

aor. (+acc) scorched, tormented [ā + √tap] ✗
ātitheyya

nt. hospitality; gift to a guest [atithi + *eyya] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from atithi
Meaning hospitality; gift to a guest
Construction atithi > ātithi + *eyya
Derivative taddhita (*eyya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (ANa) ātitheyyānī'ti āgantukadānāni. atitheyyānī'ti'pi pāṭho.
Sanskrit ātitheyī, ātithya
ātu

masc. father ~

Grammar masc, in comps
Meaning father
Synonym petti, pitā, pitar, pitaraṃ, piti
Commentary (MNa) ettha ātū'ti pitā, mātū'ti mātā.
Notes CPD suggests a masculine correspondent of mātu. Or possibly a contraction of ātumaṃ 'one's own'.
ātuma

masc. self; oneself; personality; individual ✓

Grammar masc, atta group, from sk ātman
Meaning self; oneself; personality; individual
Variant atta
Sanskrit ātman

Examples

idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo abhāvitakāyo hoti abhāvitasīlo abhāvitacitto abhāvitapañño paritto app'ātumo appadukkhavihārī.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ

yo attano sīlavatāni jantu,
anānupuṭṭho'va paresa pāva,
anariyadhammaṃ kusalā tam'āhu,
yo ātumānaṃ sayam'eva pāva.

SNP 22 uṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 10
āturakāya

Meaning sick in body; physically unhealthy
Construction ātura + kāya

Examples

aham'asmi, bhante, jiṇṇo vuḍḍho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto āturakāyo abhikkhaṇ'ātaṅko.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ

tasmā't'iha te, gahapati, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, āturakāyassa me sato cittaṃ anāturaṃ bhavissatī'ti. evañ'hi te, gahapati, sikkhitabban'ti.

āturacitta

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sick in mind; mentally unhealthy
Construction ātura + citta
Compound kammadhāraya (ātura + citta)
Sanskrit ātura + citta

Example

na hi pana taṃ, gahapati, paṭibhāsi bhagavantaṃ uttariṃ paṭipucchituṃ, kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, āturakāyo c'eva hoti āturacitto ca, kittāvatā ca pana āturakāyo hi kho hoti no ca āturacitto'ti?

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
āturatā

fem. fact of being sick; fact of being diseased [ā + √tur + a + tā] ~

Meaning fact of being sick; fact of being diseased

Root √tur･1 a (hurt, be sick)
Construction ā + √tur + a + tā
ātura + tā

Sanskrit ātura +
Sanskrit Root √tur √tṛ 3 (pass)
āturati

pr. hurts; is sick [ā + √tur + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning hurts; is sick
Root Family ā √tur
Root √tur･1 a (hurt, be sick)
Base √tur + a > tura
Construction ā + tura + ti
Sanskrit ā + tur
Sanskrit Root √tur √tṛ 3 (pass)

Example

parittānam'pi, mahārāja, pavattīyamānānaṃ saddo suyyati, jivhā sukkhati, hadayaṃ byāvaṭṭati, kaṇṭho āturati. tena tesaṃ pavattena sabbe byādhayo vūpasaman'ti, sabbā ītiyo apagacchantī'ti.

MIL 4.2.4 maccupāsamuttipañho
āturanna

nt. food for the sick ✗

Meaning becomes sick; becomes hoarse
Root Family ā √tur
Root √tur･1 īya (hurt, be sick)

Construction ā + turīya + ti

Sanskrit Root √tur √tṛ 3 (pass)

Example

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
ādāti

pr. takes, grasps [√ādā] ✗
ādātuṃ

inf. to grasp, to take; to seize [√ādā] ✗
ādāna 1

nt. taking; taking up; grasping; holding [√ādā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from ādiyati
Meaning taking; taking up; grasping; holding
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)

Derivative kita (ana)
Antonym dāna, anādāna, nikkhepana
Synonym atta
Sanskrit ādāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

yesaṃ sambodhi'y'aṅgesu,
sammā cittaṃ subhāvitaṃ,
ādānapaṭinissagge,

te loke parinibbutā.

ādānataṇhaṃ vinayetha sabbaṃ,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'cā'pi majjhe,
yaṃ yañ'hi lokasmim'upādiyanti,
ten'eva māro anveti jantuṃ.

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning craving to have; craving to get
Construction ādāna + taṇhā

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 12
ādānanikkhepa

masc. picking up and putting down [ādāna + nikkhepa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning picking up and putting down
Construction ādāna + nikkhepa
ādānanikkhepana

nt. picking up and putting down; taking and releasing [ādāna + nikkhepana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning picking up and putting down; taking and releasing
Construction ādāna + nikkhepana
Compound dvanda (ādāna ca nikkhepana ca)
Commentary (VISMa) ādānanikkhepanato'ti bhavassa gahaṇavissajjanato, jātito, maraṇato cā'ti attho.
Sanskrit ādāna + nikṣepaṇa

Example

hatthesu, bhikkhave, sati ādānanikkhepanaṃ paññāyati. pādesu sati abhikkamapaṭikkamo paññāyati. pabbesu sati samiñjanapasāraṇaṃ paññāyati. kucchismiṃ sati jighacchāpipāsā paññāyati.

SN 35.236 paṭhamahatthapādopamasuttaṃ
ādānapaṭinissagga

masc. abandoning attachment; relinquishing (all what is) grasping ✗
ādānappaṭinissagga

masc. giving up taking up; relinquishing of holding; abandoning of grasping [ādāna + paṭinissagga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning giving up taking up; relinquishing of holding; abandoning of grasping
Construction ādāna + paṭinissagga
ādānasatta

adj. stuck to grasping; entangled in grasping [ādāna + satta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning stuck to grasping; entangled in grasping
Construction ādāna + satta
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ādāne + satta)
Commentary (SNPa) ādānasatte iti pekkhamāno, pajaṃ imaṃ maccudheyye visattan'ti ādātabb'aṭṭhena ādānesu rūp'ādīsu satte sabbaloke imaṃ pajaṃ maccudheyye laggaṃ pekkhamāno. ādānasatte vā ādān'ābhiniviṭṭhe puggale ādānasaṅgahetuñ'ca imaṃ pajaṃ maccudheyye laggaṃ tato vītikkamituṃ asamatthaṃ iti pekkhamāno kiñcanaṃ sabbaloke na uppādiyethā'ti.
Sanskrit ādāna + sajjita

Example

tasmā pajānaṃ na upādiyetha,
bhikkhu sato kiñcanaṃ sabbaloke,
ādānasatte iti pekkhamāno,
pajaṃ imaṃ maccudheyye visattan'ti.

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 12
ādānādhippāya 1

adj. longing to take; yearning to steal [ādāna + adhippāya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning longing to take; yearning to steal
Construction ādāna + adhippāya
Commentary (ANa) ādān'ādhippāyo'ti idāni gahetuṃ sakkhissāmi, idāni sakkhissāmī'ti evaṃ gahaṇ'ādhippāyo.
ādānādhippāya 2

adj. aimed at a stealing; with robbing as goal [ādāna + adhippāya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning aimed at a stealing; with robbing as goal
Construction ādāna + adhippāya
Commentary (ANa) parabhaṇḍassa ādāne adhippāyo etesan'ti ādān'ādhippāyā.
ādāya 1

ger. (+acc) taking [√ādā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning taking
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction √ādā + ya
Antonym anādā
Sanskrit ādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, bhikkhu paṃsukūliko rathiyāya nantakaṃ disvā vāmena pādena niggaṇhitvā dakkhiṇena pādena pattharitvā, yo tattha sāro taṃ paripātetvā ādāya pakkameyya.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

na monena munī hoti,
mūḷharūpo aviddasu,
yo ca tulaṃva paggayha,
varam'ādāya paṇḍito.

DHP 268 dhammaṭṭhavaggo
ādāya gacchati

idiom. carries away; lit. taking goes ✓

Grammar idiom, ger + pr
Meaning carries away; lit. taking goes
Sanskrit ādāya + gacchati

Examples

taṃ puttapasusammattaṃ,
byāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ,
suttaṃ gāmaṃ mah'ogho'va,
maccu ādāya gacchati.

DHP 287 maggavaggo

antaken'ādhipannassa,
jahato mānusaṃ bhavaṃ,
kiñ'hi tassa sakaṃ hoti,
kiñ'ca ādāya gacchati,
kiñ'c'assa anugaṃ hoti,
chāyā'va anapāyinī.

SN 3.4 piyasuttaṃ

paṇḍito uppāditadhanañ'ca, ābhatadhanañ'ca sabbaṃ tassā mātāpitūnaṃ datvā samassāsetvā sasure āpucchitvā taṃ ādāya nagar'ābhimukho agamāsi.

seyyathā'pi, aggivessana, allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ udake nikkhittaṃ. atha puriso āgaccheyya uttar'āraṇiṃ ādāya, aggiṃ abhinibbattessāmi, tejo pātukarissāmī'ti.

VIN PAT SA 11 bhedānuvattakasikkhāpadaṃ
ādāyagamanīya

adj. to be gone with; to be taken; going with ✗
ādāyinī

adj. who takes; who grasps [√ādā + ī + inī] ✓

Grammar adj, fem nom sg of ādāyī
Meaning who takes; who grasps
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)

Sanskrit ādāyin
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Example

pañcahi, bhikkhave, vaḍḍhīhi vaḍḍhamānā ariyasāvikā ariyāya vaḍḍhiyā vaḍḍhati sār'ādāyinī ca hoti var'ādāyinī ca kāyassa. katamehi pañcahi?

SN 37.34 vaḍḍhīsuttaṃ
ādāyī

adj. taking; receiving; accepting [√ādā + ī] ✓

Meaning taking; receiving; accepting

Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)

Synonym āda
Sanskrit ādāyin
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

pañcahi, bhikkhave, vaḍḍhīhi vaḍḍhamānā ariyasāvikā ariyāya vaḍḍhiyā vaḍḍhati sār'ādāyinī ca hoti var'ādāyinī ca kāyassa. katamehi pañcahi?

SN 37.34 vaḍḍhīsuttaṃ
ādāsa

masc. mirror [ā + √dis + a + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning mirror
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa > dassa (irreg)
Construction ā + dassa > dāsa + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ass > ās
Sanskrit ādarśa
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim'atthiyo ādāso'ti? paccavekkhaṇattho, bhante'ti.

Meaning sun

parittapaññassa me bhūripañña,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.

Root Family ā √dīp
Root √dīp･3 ya (shine, explain)
Construction ā + √dīp + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ī > i
p > t
Synonym ādittaka, pajjalita, pajjālita, sampajjalita

Examples

ādittasmiṃ agārasmiṃ,

no ca yaṃ tattha ḍayhati.

SN 1.41 ādittasuttaṃ
ādittaka

adj. blazing; burning; on fire [ā + √dīp + ta + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from āditta
Meaning blazing; burning; on fire

Root √dīp･3 ya (shine, explain)
Construction ā + √dīp + ta + ka
āditta + ka

Phonetic Change ī > i
p > t

Sanskrit ādīpta + ka
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)

Example

evaṃ ādittako loko,
jarāya maraṇena ca,
nīhareth'eva dānena,
dinnaṃ hoti sunīhataṃ.

AN 8.74 dutiyamaraṇassatisuttaṃ
ādittajātaka

nt. Jātaka 424 (JA 424) ✗
ādittato

Meaning as blazing; as burning; as on fire
Root Family ā √dīp
Root √dīp･3 ya (shine, explain)

āditta + to

p > t
Sanskrit ādīptāt
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)

Example

kadā nu rūpe amite ca sadde,
gandhe rase phusitabbe ca dhamme,
ādittato'haṃ samathehi yutto,
paññāya dacchaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.

AN 8.74 dutiya maraṇassatisuttaṃ
ādittasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.41 (SN1.41) ✗
ādittasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.61 (SN22.61) ✗
ādittasutta 3

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.28 (SN35.28) ✗
ādinna 1.1

pp. burst; split open [ā + √dar] ✓

Grammar pp of ādāti
Meaning burst; split open
Root Family ā √dar
Root √dar･1 a (break, split apart)
Construction ā + √dar > dir > na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change a > i
r > n
Sanskrit ā + dārita
Sanskrit Root √dṝ √dṛ 2, 9 (pierce, split)

Example

kīdiso, bho purisa, kiṃsuko'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, ocīrakajāto kho, ambho purisa, kiṃsuko ādinnasipāṭiko, seyyathā'pi sirīso'ti. tena kho pana, bhikkhu, samayena t'ādiso'v'assa kiṃsuko, yathā'pi tassa purisassa dassanaṃ.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ
ādinna 2.1

pp. taken; grasped; seized; held [√ādā + na] ~

Grammar pp of ādāti
Meaning taken; grasped; seized; held
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction √ādā > ādī + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ā > ī (Kacc 502, 493)
īn > inn
Synonym atta, gahita, gahīta, gāhita
Sanskrit ādatta
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
ādinnagahitaparāmaṭṭhacitta

adj. with a mind that is taken, grasped and tightly clung to [ādinna + gahita + parāmaṭṭha + citta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a mind that is taken, grasped and tightly clung to
Construction ādinna + gahita + parāmaṭṭha + citta
Sanskrit ādatta + gṛbhita + parāmṛṣṭa + citta
ādinnadaṇḍa

adj. who has taken a stick in hand; who administers justice; who has embraced violence ✗
ādinnasaññī

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as applied [ādinna + saññī] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as applied
Construction ādinna + saññī
ādinnasipāṭika

adj. with burst seed pods [ādinna + sipāṭika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with burst seed pods
Construction ādinna + sipāṭika
Compound kammadhāraya (ādinna + sipāṭika)
Commentary (SNa) sv'āssa phalitakāle diṭṭhattā attano dassan'ānurūpena ocirakajāto ādinnasipāṭiko'ti āha. phalitakālasmiñ'hi kiṃsuko olambamānacīrako viya adhomukhaṃ katvā gahitaasikoso viya ca sirīsarukkho viya ca lambamānaphalo hoti.
Sanskrit ādatta + sṛpāṭikā (beak)

Example

kīdiso, bho purisa, kiṃsuko'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, ocīrakajāto kho, ambho purisa, kiṃsuko ādinnasipāṭiko, seyyathā'pi sirīso'ti. tena kho pana, bhikkhu, samayena t'ādiso'v'assa kiṃsuko, yathā'pi tassa purisassa dassanaṃ.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ
ādippati

pr. blazing, burning; red-hot [ā + √dīp] ✗
ādibrahmacariya

nt. primary ethics; fundamental morality; higher holy life ✗
ādibrahmacariyaka

adj. fundamental to the holy life; essential to the spiritual path [ādi + brahma + cariya + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from brahmacariya
Meaning fundamental to the holy life; essential to the spiritual path
Construction ādi + brahma + cariya + ka
ādi + brahmacariya + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Compound kammadhāraya (ādi + brahmacariyaka)
Antonym nādibrahmacariyaka
Variant ādibrahmacariyika
Commentary (ANa) ādibrahmacariyakānī'ti maggabrahmacariyassa ādibhūtāni cattāri mahāsīlasikkhāpadāni.
Sanskrit ādi + brahmacarya + ka

Examples

taṃ kissa hetu? esā, bhikkhave, kathā atthasaṃhitā, esā ādibrahmacariyakā, esā nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.

SN 56.9 viggāhikakathāsuttaṃ

yāni ca kho tāni sikkhāpadāni ādibrahmacariyakāni brahmacariyasāruppāni tattha dhuvasīlo ca hoti ṭhitasīlo ca, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.

AN 3.89 tatiyasikkhāsuttaṃ
ādibrahmacariyaṃ

ind. as regards a pure and holy life ✗
ādibrahmacariyika

adj. fundamental to the holy life; essential to the spiritual path [ādi + brahma + cariya + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from ādibrahmacariya
Meaning fundamental to the holy life; essential to the spiritual path
Construction ādi + brahma + cariya + ika
ādibrahmacariya + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Compound kammadhāraya (ādi + brahmacariyika)
Variant ādibrahmacariyaka
Commentary (SNa) ādibrahmacariyikā'ti maggabrahmacariyassa ādibhūtā pubbapadhānabhūtā.
Sanskrit ādi + brahmacarya + ka

Examples

aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, hetū aṭṭha paccayā ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāya appaṭiladdhāya paṭilābhāya, paṭiladdhāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā saṃvattanti. katame aṭṭha?

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ

uggaṇhātha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. pariyāpuṇātha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. dhāretha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. atthasaṃhitā, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā ādibrahmacariyikā'ti.

SN 2.8 tāyanasuttaṃ
ādibhūta

adj. (gram) initial; occurring at the beginning; lit. beginning state [ādi + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (gram) initial; occurring at the beginning; lit. beginning state
Construction ādi + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (ādi + bhūta)
Sanskrit ādi + bhūta

Example

ādibhūtānaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ ekassarānaṃ kvaci dvebhāvo hoti. titikkhati, jigucchati, tikicchati, vīmaṃsati, bubhukkhati, pivāsati, daddallati, dadāti, jahāti, caṅkamati. kvacī'ti kim'atthaṃ? kampati, calati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 458
ādima

adj. first, original, foremost ✗
ādimajjhapariyosāna

nt. beginning, middle and end [ādi + majjha + pariyosāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning beginning, middle and end
Construction ādi + majjha + pariyosāna
ādimaya

adj. made of etc. ✗
ādimeva

sandhi. (+loc) very beginning; (of) the very starting point (of) [ādiṃ + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, nt + ind (+loc)
Meaning very beginning; (of) the very starting point (of)
Construction ādiṃ + eva
Sanskrit ādi + eva

Examples

tasmā't'iha tvaṃ, bhikkhu, ādim'eva visodhehi kusalesu dhammesu. ko c'ādi kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ? idha tvaṃ, bhikkhu, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesu.

SN 47.46 pātimokkhasaṃvarasuttaṃ

yā imā, bhante, anekavihitā diṭṭhiyo loke uppajjanti, attavādapaṭisaṃyuttā vā lokavādapaṭisaṃyuttā vā, ādim'eva nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno manasikaroto evam'etāsaṃ diṭṭhīnaṃ pahānaṃ hoti, evam'etāsaṃ diṭṭhīnaṃ paṭinissaggo hotī'ti?

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
ādiya 1.1

ger. (+acc) taking up [√ādā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning taking up
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction √ādā > ādi + ya
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym anādiya
Sanskrit ādā
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Example

tam'enaṃ hatthidamako uttari kāraṇaṃ kāreti, ādiya, bho, nikkhipa, bho'ti.

MN 125 dantabhūmisuttaṃ
ādiya 2.1

adj. blameworthy; reproachable; lit. to be pointed out [ā + √dis + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of ādisati
Meaning blameworthy; reproachable; lit. to be pointed out
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ā + √dis + ya
Derivative kicca (ya)
Phonetic Change y > s
Antonym anādiya
Synonym avajja
Variant ādissa
Commentary (MNa) tumhe'pi tena ādiyā bhaveyyāthā'ti tumhe'pi tena āmisadāy'ādabhāvena no dhammadāy'ādabhāvena ādiyā bhaveyyātha. apadisitabbā visuṃ kātabbā vavatthapetabbā, viññūhi gārayhā bhaveyyāthā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit ādṛśya
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Example

tumhe ca me bhikkhave āmisadāy'ādā bhaveyyātha no dhammadāy'ādā, tumhe'pi tena ādiyā bhaveyyātha, āmisadāy'ādā satthusāvakā viharanti, no dhammadāy'ādā'ti

MN 3 dhammadāyādasuttaṃ
ādiyati 1

pr. (+acc) takes; grasps; embraces [√ādā + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning takes; grasps; embraces
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction ādiya + ti
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Synonym ādīyatī, ādeti
Variant ādīyati
Sanskrit ādatte
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

saddhāya sīlena ca yā'dha vaḍḍhati,
paññāya cāgena sutena c'ūbhayaṃ,
sā t'ādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
ādīyati sāram'idh'eva attano'ti.

SN 37.34 vaḍḍhīsuttaṃ

diṭṭhīnivesā na hi svātivattā,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ,
tasmā naro tesu nivesanesu,
nirassatī ādiyatī ca dhammaṃ.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3
ādiyati 2

pr. (+acc) steals; takes [√ādā + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning steals; takes
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction ādiya + ti
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym nādiyati
Synonym harati
Commentary (VIN 1.1.2) ādiyeyyā'ti ādiyeyya hareyya avahareyya iriyāpathaṃ vikopeyya ṭhānā cāveyya saṅketaṃ vītināmeyya.
Sanskrit ādatte
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

yo pāṇam'atipāteti,
musāvādañ'ca bhāsati,
loke adinnam'ādiyati,
paradārañ'ca gacchati.

DHP 246 malavaggo

sace musā na bhaṇasi,
sace pāṇaṃ na hiṃsasi,
sace adinnaṃ n'ādiyasi,
saddahāno amaccharī,
kiṃ kāhasi gayaṃ gantvā,
udapāno'pi te gayā'ti.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
ādiyati 3

pr. (+acc) obeys; follows; accepts; lit. takes [√ādā + ya + ti] ~

Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction ādiya + ti
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
ādiyanapaccayā

ind. because of the taking ✗
ādiyanta 1

prp. (+acc) stealing; taking [√ādā + ya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning stealing; taking
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction ādiya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Synonym ādiyamāna, haramāna
Sanskrit ādāt
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Example

santi, gahapatayo, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino ... pāṇam'atipātayato, adinnaṃ ādiyato, sandhiṃ chindato, nillopaṃ harato, ekāgārikaṃ karoto, paripanthe tiṭṭhato, paradāraṃ gacchato, musā bhaṇato, karoto na karīyati pāpaṃ.

ādiyapeti

pr. makes take; makes accept [√ādā] ✗
ādiyamāna

prp. (+acc) taking; grabbing; stealing [√ādā + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning taking; grabbing; stealing
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction ādiya + māna

Synonym ādiyanta, haramāna

Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

tathārūpaṃ bhikkhu adinnaṃ ādiyamāno ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

VIN PAT PA 2 adinnādānasikkhāpadaṃ

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave orabbhiko vā urabbhaghātako vā app'ekaccaṃ urabbhaṃ adinnaṃ ādiyamānaṃ pahoti hantuṃ vā bandhituṃ vā jāpetuṃ vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kātuṃ

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
ādiyamukha

adj. credulous; quickly convinced ✗

ādiyasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.41 (AN5.41) ✗
ādiyāna

prp. (+acc) taking up; grasping [√ādā + ya + āna] ~

Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)

Antonym anādiyāna

ādiyāpeti

pr. (+acc) causes to take; makes steal [√ādā + ya + *āpe + ti] ~

Grammar pr, caus of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning causes to take; makes steal
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya + *āpe (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya + āpe > ādāyāpe > ādiyāpe (caus, irreg)

Synonym hārayati
Sanskrit ādāyati
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
ādiyi 1

aor. (+acc) took; grabbed; grasped [√ādā + ya + i] ~

Grammar aor of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning took; grabbed; grasped
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction ādiya + i
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Sanskrit ādā
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
ādiyi 2

aor. (+acc) stole [√ādā + ya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning stole
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction ādiya + i
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Sanskrit ādā
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Example

adhanānaṃ dhane ananuppadiyamāne dāliddiyaṃ vepullam'agamāsi. dāliddiye vepullaṃ gate aññataro puriso paresaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyi. tam'enaṃ aggahesuṃ.

DN 26.6 cakkavattisuttaṃ
ādiyi 3

aor. (+acc) accepted; approved; lit. took [√ādā] ✗
ādiyituṃ

inf. to grasp, to take; to seize [√ādā] ✗
ādiyitvā

abs. (+acc) having taken; having grasped [√ādā + ya + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having taken; having grasped
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction ādiya + itvā
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym anādiyitvā
Sanskrit ādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

kadā nu paññāmayam'uggatejaṃ,
satthaṃ isīnaṃ sahas'ādiyitvā,
māraṃ sasenaṃ sahasā bhañjissaṃ,
sīh'āsane taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

pārājiko hotī'ti seyyathā'pi nāma paṇḍupalāso bandhanā pavutto abhabbo haritatthāya, evam'eva bhikkhu pādaṃ vā pād'ārahaṃ vā atirekapādaṃ vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
ādiye

opt. (+acc) should take; should steal [√ādā + ya + e] ✓

Grammar opt of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning should take; should steal
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction ādiya + e
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Sanskrit ādadīta
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Example

pāṇaṃ na haññe na c'adinnam'ādiye,
musā na bhāse na ca majjapo siyā,
abrahmacariyā virameyya methunā,
rattiṃ na bhuñjeyya vikālabhojanaṃ.

AN 3.71 uposathasuttaṃ
ādilopa

masc. (gram) elision of the beginning [ādi + lopa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (gram) elision of the beginning
Construction ādi + lopa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ādissa + lopa)
Sanskrit ādi + lopa

Example

506, 496. sabbatth'āsass'ādilopo ca.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 506
ādivaṇṇa

masc. (gram) first vowel; first syllable; initial phoneme [ādi + vaṇṇa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 458
ādivasena

ind. by means of etc.; as etc.; concerning etc. ✗
ādisa

adj. of character; of quality; of kind; referring to [ā + √dis + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from ādisati
Meaning of character; of quality; of kind; referring to
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Construction ā + √dis + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym rūpa
Sanskrit ādṛśa
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

Examples

yena yena hi maññanti,
tato taṃ hoti aññathā,
et'ādiso vinābhāvo,
passa lokassa pariyāyaṃ.

SNP 34 sallasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 8

tassa na tādiso vaṇṇo hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na t'ādiso saro hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na t'ādisaṃ padaṃ hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ.

AN 3.83 gadrabhasuttaṃ
ādisati 1

pr. (+acc) points out; explains; reveals [ā + √dis + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning points out; explains; reveals
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa
Construction ā + disa + ti
Synonym akkhāti, ārocayati, āroceti, āvikaroti, uttānīkaroti, upadisati, jānāpeti, jotayati, joteti, dīpeti, deseti, pakāseti, pilapati, sandasseti
Sanskrit ādṛś
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

Example

yo atītaṃ ādisati,
anejo chinnasaṃsayo,
pāraguṃ sabbadhammānaṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ.

SNP 69 posāla māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 14
ādisati 2

pr. (+acc) (of a gift) offers; presents; dedicates; gives [ā + √dis + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of a gift) offers; presents; dedicates; gives
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa
Construction ā + disa + ti
Synonym abhiharati, dajjeti, dadāti, deti, patiṭṭhāpeti, pavecchati
Sanskrit ādṛś
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

Example

vandanaṃ dāni vajjāsi,
lokanāthaṃ anuttaraṃ,
padakkhiṇañ'ca katvāna,
ādiseyyāsi dakkhiṇaṃ.

THI 68 ekudāniyattheragāthā
ādisanā

fem. prophesy, guessing, pointing out [ā + √dis] ✗
ādisi

aor. pointed out, told, announced [ā + √dis] ✗
ādisitvā

abs. (+acc) having pointed out; having indicated [ā + √dis + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of ādisati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having pointed out; having indicated
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Construction ā + √dis + itvā
Sanskrit ādrśitvā
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)
ādiso

ind. from the beginning; at first; at the beginning; as a beginning ✗
ādissa 1.1

ger. (+acc) offering; presenting; dedicating; giving [ā + √dis + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of ādisati, trans (+acc)
Meaning offering; presenting; dedicating; giving
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Construction ā + √dis + ya
Phonetic Change y > s
Variant uddisitvā
Commentary (VINa) kāle'pi ādissa dinnan'ti saṅghassa vā idaṃ akālacīvaran'ti uddisitvā dinnaṃ, ekapuggalassa vā, idaṃ tuyhaṃ dammī'ti dinnaṃ.
Sanskrit ādṛśya
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

Example

akālacīvaraṃ nāma anatthate kathine ekādasamāse uppannaṃ, atthate kathine sattamāse uppannaṃ, kāle'pi ādissa dinnaṃ, etaṃ akālacīvaraṃ nāma.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
ādissa 1.2

ger. (+acc) with reference to; regarding; about [ā + √dis + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of ādisati, trans (+acc)
Meaning with reference to; regarding; about
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Construction ā + √dis + ya
Phonetic Change y > s
Sanskrit ādṛśya
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

Example

kalyāṇamittatā muninā,
lokaṃ ādissa vaṇṇitā,
kalyāṇamitte bhajamāno,
api bālo paṇḍito assa.

THI 63 kisāgotamītherīgāthā
ādissa 2.1

ptp. (+acc) blameworthy; reproachable; lit. to be pointed out [ā + √dis + ya] ✓

Grammar ptp of ādisati (+acc)
Meaning blameworthy; reproachable; lit. to be pointed out
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ā + √dis + ya
Derivative kicca (ya)
Phonetic Change y > s
Variant ādiya
Sanskrit ādṛśya
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Example

tumhe ca me bhikkhave āmisadāy'ādā bhaveyyātha no dhammadāy'ādā, tumhe'pi tena ādissā bhaveyyātha, āmisadāy'ādā satthusāvakā viharanti, no dhammadāy'ādā'ti

Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

Root √dis･1 ya (see)

Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)
ādiṃ katvā

idiom. beginning with; starting from; lit. having made first ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + abs
Meaning beginning with; starting from; lit. having made first

Example

so satthārā dinnanaye ṭhatvā satthāraṃ vanditvā, ajja ādiṃ katvā mama santakaṃ dasikasuttamattam'pi maṃ abhibhavitvā anekasatā'pi rājāno vā corā vā gaṇhituṃ samatthā nāma mā hontu, agginā'pi mama santakaṃ mā ḍayhatu, udakena'pi mā vuyhatū'ti patthanaṃ akāsi.

DHPa 2.26.33 jaṭilatthera vatthu
ādī

adj. eating; feeding on [√ad + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from adati
Meaning eating; feeding on
Root Family √ad
Root √ad･1 a (eat)
Construction √ad > ād + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym ada, adaka, āhāra, bhakkha
Commentary (SNa) gūth'ādī'ti gūthabhakkhā
Sanskrit ādin
Sanskrit Root √ad 2 (eat)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mīḷhakā gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa. purato c'assa mahāgūthapuñjo. sā tena aññā mīḷhakā atimaññeyya, aham'hi gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa, purato ca my'āyaṃ mahāgūthapuñjo'ti.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
ādīna 1

nt. misery; affliction; problem; trouble [ā + √dī + na] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning misery; affliction; problem; trouble
Root Family ā √dī
Root √dī×3 ya (be afflicted)
Construction ā + √dī + na
Derivative kita (na)
Synonym agha, kiccha
Sanskrit ādīnava
Sanskrit Root √dī 4 (decay)

Example

etam'ādīnaṃ ñatvā,
bhaven'amhi anatthiko,
nissaṭo sabbakāmehi,
patto me āsavakkhayo'ti.

TH 121 uttarattheragāthā
ādīna 2

adj. wretched [ā + √dī] ✗
ādīnava 1

masc. (+gen or +loc) danger (in); problem (in) [ā + √dī + na + vant + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ādīna (+gen or +loc)
Meaning danger (in); problem (in)
Root Family ā √dī
Root √dī×3 ya (be afflicted)
Construction ā + √dī + na + vant + a
ādīnavant + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Commentary (ANa) ādīnavan'ti amadhurabhāvaṃ dosaṃ.
Notes (MW) misfortune, want of luck in dice
Sanskrit ādīnava
Sanskrit Root √dī 4 (decay)

Examples

na tāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno idh'ekacce ādīnavā saṃvijjanti yāva na ñatt'ajjhāpanno hoti yasappatto. yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ñatt'ajjhāpanno hoti yasappatto, ath'assa idh'ekacce ādīnavā saṃvijjanti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ

kāmā hi citrā madhurā manoramā, virūparūpena mathenti cittaṃ.
ādīnavaṃ kāmaguṇesu disvā, tasmā ahaṃ pabbajito'mhi rāja.

TH 251 raṭṭhapālattheragāthā
ādīnava 2

masc. (+gen or +loc) disadvantage (of); drawback (of); unsatisfactoriness (of); inadequacy (of) [ā + √dī + na + vant + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ādīna (+gen or +loc)

Root √dī×3 ya (be afflicted)
Construction ā + √dī + na + vant + a
ādīnavant + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Antonym assāda, ānisaṃsa
Synonym palibodha
Commentary (ANa) ādīnavan'ti amadhurabhāvaṃ dosaṃ.
Notes (MW) misfortune, want of luck in dice
Sanskrit ādīnava
Sanskrit Root √dī 4 (decay)

Examples

yato kho, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti

SN 22.109 sotāpannasuttaṃ

etam'ādīnavaṃ ñatvā,
muni pubb'āpare idha,
ekacariyaṃ daḷhaṃ kayirā,
na nisevetha methunaṃ.

SNP 45 tissametteyyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 7
ādīnavadassa

adj. seeing the danger ✗
ādīnavadassanahetu

ind. due to seeing the disadvantage [ādīnava + dassana + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to seeing the disadvantage
Construction ādīnava + dassana + hetu
Compound abyayībhāva (ādīnavadassana + hetu)
Sanskrit ādīnava + darśana + hetu

Example

tadabhiññāya bhagavā assādam'addasa ādīnavam'addasa nissaraṇam'addasa magg'āmaggañāṇadassanam'addasa. tassa assādadassanahetu ādīnavadassanahetu nissaraṇadassanahetu magg'āmaggañāṇadassanahetu atthassa patti hadayassa santi viditā hoti.

AN 10.26 kāḷīsuttaṃ
ādīnavadassāvī

adj. (+gen or +loc) seeing the danger (in); seeing the disadvantage (of) [ādīnava + dassāvī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+gen or +loc)
Meaning seeing the danger (in); seeing the disadvantage (of)
Construction ādīnava + dassāvī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ādīnavaṃ + dassāvī)
Antonym nissaraṇapañña, anādīnavadassāvī
Sanskrit ādīnava + darśivas

Examples

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ ... aladdhā ca cīvaraṃ na ca paritassissāma, laddhā ca cīvaraṃ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhāpannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjissāma.

SN 16.1 santuṭṭhasuttaṃ

tesaṃ gihī pasann'ākāraṃ karonti. te taṃ lābhaṃ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhopannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti.

SN 20.9 nāgasuttaṃ
ādīnavanupassī

adj. seeing the danger, realizing the bad consequences ✗

fem. (+gen) search for the disadvantage (of); quest for the inadequacy (of) [ādīnava + pariyesanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp (+gen)
Meaning search for the disadvantage (of); quest for the inadequacy (of)
Construction ādīnava + pariyesanā
ādīnavamaddasa

aor. saw the disadvantage (of); perceived the drawback (of) [ādīnavaṃ + addasa] ~

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning saw the disadvantage (of); perceived the drawback (of)
Construction ādīnavaṃ + addasa
ādīnavavibhāvana

adj. revealing the disadvantages ✗
ādīnavasaññā

fem. recognition of the disadvantage; perception of unsatisfactoriness [ādīnava + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning recognition of the disadvantage; perception of unsatisfactoriness
Construction ādīnava + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ādīnavassa + saññā)
Commentary (DNa) ādīnav'ānupassanāñāṇe saññā ādīnavasaññā nāma.
Notes ten peceptions 1. aniccasaññā, 2. anattasaññā, 3. asubhasaññā, 4. ādīnavasaññā, 5. pahānasaññā, 6. virāgasaññā, 7. nirodhasaññā, 8. sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā, 9. sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā, 10. ānāpānassati.
Sanskrit ādīnava + saṃjñā

Examples

katamā c'ānanda, ādīnavasaññā? idh'ānanda, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā iti paṭisañcikkhati, bahudukkho kho ayaṃ kāyo bahuādīnavo.

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ

pañc'imā, bhikkhave, saññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mah'ānisaṃsā amat'ogadhā amatapariyosānā. katamā pañca? asubhasaññā, maraṇasaññā, ādīnavasaññā, āhāre paṭikūlasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā.

Meaning fortified by the perception of danger

aniccasaññāparicitañ'ca no cittaṃ bhavissati, anattasaññāparicitañ'ca no cittaṃ bhavissati, asubhasaññāparicitañ'ca no cittaṃ bhavissati, ādīnavasaññāparicitañ'ca no cittaṃ bhavissati

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ
ādīpita

pp. in flames, ablaze [ā + √dīp] ✗
ādīyati

pr. (+instr) is taken; is grasped; is embraced [√ādā] ✗
ādīyatī

pr. (+acc) takes; grasps; embraces [√ādā + ya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning takes; grasps; embraces
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādīya (irreg)
Construction ādīya + ti > tī
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
with metrically lengthened ī
Synonym ādiyati, ādeti
Sanskrit ādatte
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
ādu

ind. (second part of a question) or?; or rather? [udāhu] ✓

Grammar ind, interr
Meaning (second part of a question) or?; or rather?
Construction udāhu > ādu
Phonetic Change udāhu > ādu (contraction)
Sanskrit utāho

Example

yadatthikaṃ brahmacariyaṃ acarī,
kappāyano kacci'ssa taṃ amoghaṃ,
nibbāyi so ādu saupādiseso,
yathā vimutto ahu taṃ suṇoma.

Examples

katibhi parisujjhatī'ti.

yo ve kiñcikkhakamyatā, panthasmiṃ vajantaṃ janaṃ.
hantvā kiñcikkham'ādeti, taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

ādeyyavācana

adj. whose speech is persuasive; with influential speech ✗
ādeva

masc. mourning; lamenting; wailing; crying [ā + √dev + a] ✓

Example

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
ādesa 1

masc. (gram) substitution; replacement; change [ā + √dis + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ādisati
Meaning (gram) substitution; replacement; change
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ā + √dis > des + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym ādesabhūta
Sanskrit ādeśa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Examples

tesaṃ mahantasaddānaṃ mahāādeso hoti tuly'ādhikaraṇe pade.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 330

tato abbhāsato pā māna'icc'etesaṃ dhātūnaṃ vā maṃ'icc'ete ādesā honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ sapaccaye pare. pivāsati, vīmaṃsati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 467
ādesa 2

masc. pointing out [ā + √dis] ✗
ādesana 1

nt. indicating; pointing [ā + √dis + *e + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from ādeseti, caus
Meaning indicating; pointing
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 *e (point out, explain)
Base √dis + *e > dese (caus)
Construction ā + dese + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit ādeśana
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)
ādesana 2

nt. indication (of another's mental state) [ā + √dis + *e + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from ādeseti, caus
Meaning indication (of another's mental state)
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 *e (point out, explain)
Base √dis + *e > dese (caus)
Construction ā + dese + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit ādeśana
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)
ādesanavidhā

fem. form or variety of indicating; (another's thoughts or state of mind) ✗
ādesanavidhādesanā

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning teaching about indicating the form of another's mental state
Construction ādesanavidhā + desanā
ādesanā

fem. prophesy, guessing, pointing out [ā + √dis] ✗
ādesanāpāṭihāriya

nt. miracle or marvellous power of indicating (another's thoughts or state of mind) ✗

Meaning (gram) replacement; substitution
Construction ādesa + bhūta
Synonym ādesa
ādesita

pp. shown; indicated [ā + √dis] ✗
ādhātukāma

adj. wanting to kindle; wanting to prepare (a fire); lit. wanting to place here [ādhātuṃ + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wanting to kindle; wanting to prepare (a fire); lit. wanting to place here
Construction ādhātuṃ + kāma

Example

evaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, tathāgatā pucchitabbā, ahañ'hi, bhante, aggiṃ ādhātu'kāmo, yūpaṃ ussāpetu'kāmo. ovadatu maṃ, bhante, bhagavā.

AN 7.47 dutiyaaggisuttaṃ
ādhātuṃ

inf. to place on; to fix, to settle; to establish; to accept, receive [ā + √dhā] ✗
ādhāna 1

Meaning receptacle; container; bucket; lit. placing here

Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
ādhāna 2

nt. placing; putting; keeping; (comm) strongly; lit. placing here [ā + √dhā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act
Meaning placing; putting; keeping; (comm) strongly; lit. placing here
Root Family ā √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction ā + √dhā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym dhāna
Commentary (MNa) ādhānan'ti daḷhaṃ vuccati
Sanskrit ādhāna
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

att'ukkaṃsakaparavambhakā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, sandiṭṭhiparāmāsā ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggino, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, kuhakā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, pāpicchā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, pāpamittā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi asaddhammehi samannāgatā nigaṇṭhā'ti.

AN 10.78 nigaṇṭhasuttaṃ

tassa mukha-adhāne kāraṇaṃ kāriyamānassa honti y'eva visūkāyitāni visevitāni vipphanditāni kānici kānici, yathā taṃ akāritapubbaṃ kāraṇaṃ kāriyamānassa.

ādhāna 3

nt. hedge [ā + √dhā] ✗

ādhānagāhī

masc. obstinate person ✗

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (of views) holding on tightly; clutching; lit. grasping what is placed

Commentary (MNa) ādhānaṃ gaṇhantī'ti ādhānaggāhī, ādhānan'ti daḷhaṃ vuccati, daḷhaggāhī'ti attho.
Notes (PED) (?) reading uncertain and interchanging with ādāna

att'ukkaṃsakaparavambhakā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, sandiṭṭhiparāmāsā ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggino, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, kuhakā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, pāpicchā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, pāpamittā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi asaddhammehi samannāgatā nigaṇṭhā'ti.

AN 10.78 nigaṇṭhasuttaṃ

pare sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī bhavissanti, mayam'ettha asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
ādhāya

Meaning support; stand; lit. holding up

Sanskrit ādhāra
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakamaṇiko ritto tuccho ādhāre ṭhapito. atha puriso āgaccheyya udakabhāraṃ ādāya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso labhetha udakassa nikkhepanan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

Example

ādhipacca

nt. rulership; lordship; leadership; presidency; sovereign power [adhi + √pat + i + *ya] ✓

Meaning rulership; lordship; leadership; presidency; sovereign power

Root √pat×3 ya (command, control)

adhipati + *ya

Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
a > ā
Sanskrit ādhipatya
Sanskrit Root √pat 4 (rule)

Example

pathabyā ekarajjena,
saggassa gamanena vā,
sabbalok'ādhipaccena,
sot'āpattiphalaṃ varaṃ.

DHP 178 lokavaggo

Example

susaṇṭhānā surūpatā,
ādhipaccaparivāro,
sabbam'etena labbhati.

āna

Meaning inhaling; inhalation; breathing in

Examples

SN 54.11 icchānaṅgalasuttaṃ

ayam'pi kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi bhāvito bahulīkato santo c'eva paṇīto ca asecanako ca sukho ca vihāro uppann'uppanne ca pāpake akusale dhamme ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ
ānaka

Meaning kettle drum; timpani

Example

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ
ānaṇyasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.62 (AN4.62) ✗
ānana

nt. face, mouth [ā + √an] ✗
ānantarika 1

adj. immediate; without delay; with no interval; with immediate results [na + anta + ra + *ika] ✓

Meaning immediate; without delay; with no interval; with immediate results
Construction na > an > ān + anta + ra + *ika
anantara + *ika

Phonetic Change a > ā
Compound kammadhāraya (na + antarika)
Synonym ānantariya
Commentary (DNa) ānantariko cetosamādhī'ti aññattha magg'ānantaraṃ phalaṃ ānantariko cetosamādhi nāma. idha pana vipassan'ānantaro maggo vipassanāya vā anantarattā attano vā anantaraṃ phaladāyakattā ānantariko cetosamādhī'ti adhippeto
Sanskrit na + antarikṣa

Example

yaṃ buddhaseṭṭho parivaṇṇayī suciṃ,
samādhim'ānantarikañ'ñam'āhu,
samādhinā tena samo na vijjati,
idam'pi dhamme ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

DHP 146 jarāvaggo

tatra ce, bhikkhave, pare tathāgataṃ sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tatra, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa na hoti ānando na somanassaṃ na cetaso uppilāvitattaṃ.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
ānanda 2

masc. name of the Buddha's attendant; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in great learning, remembrance, conduct, resoluteness and service; lit. happiness [ā + √nand + a] ✓

Construction ā + √nand + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (AN 1.219) etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahussutānaṃ ... satimantānaṃ ... gatimantānaṃ ... dhitimantānaṃ ... upaṭṭhākānaṃ yadidaṃ ānando
Sanskrit ānanda
Sanskrit Root √nand 1 (rejoice)

Examples

yāyaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi na c'ābhinato na c'āpanato na ca sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato, vimuttattā ṭhito, ṭhitattā santusito, santusitattā no paritassati. ayaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi kiṃphalo vutto bhagavatā'ti?

AN 9.37 ānandasuttaṃ

evañ'ca vadehi, sādhu kira, bhante, ayyo ānando yena bhikkhun'upassayo yena sā bhikkhunī ten'upasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā'ti.
