ānapānasati

fem. intentness of mind on one's breathing in and out ✗
ānapānassati

fem. intentness of mind on one's breathing in and out ✗
ānaya

ptp. persuadable; seduce-able; lit. to be fetched [ā + √nī + *ya] ~

Grammar ptp of āneti
Meaning persuadable; seduce-able; lit. to be fetched
Root Family ā √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction ā + √nī > nay + *ya
Derivative kicca (*ya)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)
ānayati

pr. (+acc) brings; brings back; pulls [ā + √nī + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning brings; brings back; pulls
Root Family ā √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Base √nī + a > naya
Construction ā + naya + ti
Phonetic Change ī > ay (Kacc 514, 491)
Synonym āharati
Variant āneti
Sanskrit ānayati
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

tathā tu kassāmi yathā'pi issaro,
yaṃ labbhati tena'pi hotu me alaṃ,
vīriyena taṃ mayha vas'ānayissaṃ,
gajaṃ'va mattaṃ kusal'aṅkusaggaho.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
ānayāpetvā

abs. having caused to bring [ā + √nī] ✗
ānayi

aor. brought near; led near [ā + √nī] ✗
ānāpayati

pr. causes to be brought; has fetched [ā + √nī] ✗
ānāpāna 1

nt. inhaling and exhaling; breathing in and out; in breath and out breath [āna + apāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning inhaling and exhaling; breathing in and out; in breath and out breath
Construction āna + apāna
Compound dvanda (āna ca apāna ca)
Sanskrit prāṇāpāna

Examples

yañ'hi taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya, ariyavihāro iti'pi, brahmavihāro iti'pi, tathāgatavihāro iti'pi, ānāpānassatisamādhiṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, ariyavihāro iti'pi, brahmavihāro iti'pi, tathāgatavihāro iti'pī'ti.

SN 54.11 icchānaṅgalasuttaṃ

ānāpānassati bhikkhave bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
ānāpāna 2

nt. meditation on the in and out breath; lit. in-breath and out-breath [āna + apāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning meditation on the in and out breath; lit. in-breath and out-breath
Construction āna + apāna
Compound dvanda (āna ca apāna ca)
Sanskrit prāṇāpāna

Example

bodhisatto ito cito ca olokento kañci adisvā vegena uṭṭhāya pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ānāpāne pariggahetvā paṭhamajjhānaṃ nibbattesi.

MNa 36 mahāsaccakasutavaṇṇanā
ānāpāna 3

masc. breathing in and out (in reference to MN 118 Ānāpānassatisuttaṃ) [āna + apāna] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning breathing in and out (in reference to MN 118 Ānāpānassatisuttaṃ)
Construction āna + apāna
ānāpānapabba

nt. section on the in and out breath [ānāpāna + pabba] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning section on the in and out breath
Construction ānāpāna + pabba
ānāpānavagga

masc. Chapter 7 of the Bojjhaṅgasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 5 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
ānāpānasaṃyutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 54 (SN54) ✗
ānāpānasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.66 (SN46.66) ✗
ānāpānassati

fem. mindfulness while breathing in and out; mindfulness during inhalation and exhalation [ānāpāna + sati] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning mindfulness while breathing in and out; mindfulness during inhalation and exhalation
Construction ānāpāna + sati
Compound kammadhāraya (ānāpāna + sati)
Variant ānāpānasati
Notes ten peceptions 1. aniccasaññā, 2. anattasaññā, 3. asubhasaññā, 4. ādīnavasaññā, 5. pahānasaññā, 6. virāgasaññā, 7. nirodhasaññā, 8. sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā, 9. sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā, 10. ānāpānassati.
Sanskrit prāṇāpāna + smṛti

Examples

yañ'hi taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya, ariyavihāro iti'pi, brahmavihāro iti'pi, tathāgatavihāro iti'pi, ānāpānassatisamādhiṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, ariyavihāro iti'pi, brahmavihāro iti'pi, tathāgatavihāro iti'pī'ti.

SN 54.11 icchānaṅgalasuttaṃ

disvāna āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, ānāpānassatiṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. ānāpānassati, rāhula, bhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā'ti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
ānāpānassatibhāvanānuyogamanuyutta

adj. devoted to the development of mindfulness while breathing in and out; engaged in the cultivation of mindfulness during inhalation and exhalation [ānāpāna + sati + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to the development of mindfulness while breathing in and out; engaged in the cultivation of mindfulness during inhalation and exhalation
Construction ānāpāna + sati + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (ānāpānassatibhāvanānuyogaṃ + anuyutta)
Sanskrit prāṇāpāna + smṛti + bhāvanā + anuyoga + anuyukta

Example

santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe ānāpānassatibhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharanti. ānāpānassati, bhikkhave, bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
ānāpānassatisamādhi

masc. stability of mind from mindfulness while breathing in and out; stillness of mind from being aware during inhalation and exhalation [ānāpāna + sati + samādhi] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning stability of mind from mindfulness while breathing in and out; stillness of mind from being aware during inhalation and exhalation
Construction ānāpāna + sati + samādhi
Compound kammadhāraya (ānāpānassati + samādhi)
Commentary (SNa) ānāpānassatisamādhī'ti ānāpānapariggāhikāya satiyā saddhiṃ sampayutto samādhi, ānāpānassatiyaṃ vā samādhi, ānāpānassatisamādhi.
Sanskrit prāṇāpāna + smṛti + samādhi

Example

ayam'pi kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi bhāvito bahulīkato santo c'eva paṇīto ca asecanako ca sukho ca vihāro uppann'uppanne ca pāpake akusale dhamme ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ

Meaning development of mental composure based on mindfulness while breathing in and out
Construction ānāpānassati + samādhibhāvanā

adj. together with mindfulness while breathing in and out [ānāpānassati + sahagata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning together with mindfulness while breathing in and out
Construction ānāpānassati + sahagata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ānāpānassatiyā + sahagata)
ānāpānassatisutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 118 (MN118) ✗
ānāpiya

ger. commanding [ā + √ñā] ✗
ānāpeti

pr. causes to be brought; has fetched [ā + √nī] ✗
ānisada

nt. buttocks; bottom; rear end [ā + ni + √sad + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning buttocks; bottom; rear end
Root Family ā ni √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ā + ni + √sad + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit āniṣada (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ānisaṃsa 1

masc. (+loc) profit (in); benefit (in); advantage (of); good result (of) [ā + ni + √saṃs + a] ✓

Grammar masc (+loc)
Meaning profit (in); benefit (in); advantage (of); good result (of)
Root Family ā ni √saṃs
Root √saṃs･1 a (proclaim, praise)
Construction ā + ni + √saṃs + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym ādīnava
Synonym attha, lābha
Sanskrit anuśaṃsa (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √śaṃs √śaṅs 1 (praise)

Examples

pakappitā saṅkhatā yassa dhammā,
purakkhatā santi avīvadātā,
yadattani passati ānisaṃsaṃ,
taṃ nissito kuppapaṭicca santiṃ.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.

AN 5.202 dhammassavanasuttaṃ
ānisaṃsa 2

adj. (+loc) for the benefit (of); for the advantage (of); for the good (of) [ā + ni + √saṃs + a] ✓

Meaning for the benefit (of); for the advantage (of); for the good (of)

Root √saṃs･1 a (proclaim, praise)
Construction ā + ni + √saṃs + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym ānisaṃsaka
Sanskrit anuśaṃsa (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √śaṃs √śaṅs 1 (praise)

Example

passaddhi sukh'atthā sukh'ānisaṃsā, pīti passaddh'atthā passaddh'ānisaṃsā, pāmojjaṃ pīt'atthaṃ pīt'ānisaṃsaṃ, avippaṭisāro pāmojj'attho pāmojj'ānisaṃso, kusalāni sīlāni avippaṭisār'atthāni avippaṭisār'ānisaṃsāni

AN 10.2 cetanākaraṇīyasuttaṃ
ānisaṃsa 3

Meaning expecting; anticipating

Root √saṃs･1 a (proclaim, praise)

Example

pasaṃs'āvahanaṃ sukhaṃ,
phal'ānisaṃso bhāveti,
vahanto porisaṃ dhuraṃ.

ānīta

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vadhukā yaññad'eva rattiṃ vā divaṃ vā ānītā hoti, tāva'd'ev'assā tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sassuyā'pi sasure'pi sāmike'pi antamaso dāsakammakaraporisesu.

AN 4.73 sappurisasuttaṃ
ānītapañha

nt. leading question ✗
ānīya

ger. causing to bring [ā + √nī] ✗
ānīyati 1

pr. (+instr) is fetched; is brought [ā + √nī] ✗
ānīyati 2

Grammar pr, pass of āneti, intrans
Meaning (of a woman) is brought home; is brought into the house as a wife

Base √nī + ya > nīya (pass)
Construction ā + nīya + ti
Sanskrit ānīyate
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)
ānīyamāna

prp. (+instr) being led (by); being brought (by) [ā + √nī + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of ānīyati, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being led (by); being brought (by)
Root Family ā √nī
Root √nī･1 ya (lead, carry)

Construction ā + nīya + māna

Example

yam'pi so pāṇo galappaveṭhakena ānīyamāno dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, iminā dutiyena ṭhānena bahuṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ
ānugghāṭesi

aor. opened, unfastened [anu + √ghaṭ] ✗
ānutappa

ptp. regrettable; lamentable; lit. to be regretted [anu + √tapp + *ya] ~

Grammar ptp of anutappati
Meaning regrettable; lamentable; lit. to be regretted
Root Family anu √tapp
Root √tapp･1 a (regret)
Construction anu > ānu + √tapp + *ya
Derivative kicca (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant anutappa
Commentary (ANa) anutappā hotī'ti anutāpakarā hoti. tattha cakkavattirañño kālakiriyā ekacakkavāḷe devamanussānaṃ anutāpakarā hoti. buddhānaṃ kālakiriyā dasasahassacakkavāḷesu devamanussānaṃ anutāpakarā hoti. tena vuttaṃ, bahuno janassa anutappā hotī'ti.
Sanskrit anutapya
Sanskrit Root √trap 1 (be abashed)
ānuttariya 1

nt. ultimate end; unsurpassable limit; highest thing [na + uttara + *iya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na uttara, neg
Meaning ultimate end; unsurpassable limit; highest thing
Construction na > an > ān + uttara + *iya
anuttara + *iya
Derivative taddhita (*iya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
d > t
Antonym uttariya
Sanskrit anuttara +

Example

etadānuttariyaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇānaṃ yadidaṃ tattha tattha yathābhūtañāṇaṃ. etasmā c'āhaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇā aññaṃ ñāṇaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā n'atthī'ti vadāmi

AN 10.22 adhivuttipadasuttaṃ
ānuttariya 2

adj. unsurpassable, incomparable [ud] ✗
ānuttāsī

adj. not fearful; not afraid ✗
ānutrāsī

adj. not fearful; not afraid ✗
ānupubba

nt. order, regular order, succession [pubba] ✗
ānupubbikathā

fem. talk that develops progressively; graduated instruction; systematic talk [ānupubbī + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning talk that develops progressively; graduated instruction; systematic talk
Construction ānupubbī + kathā
Compound kammadhāraya (ānupubbī + kathā)
Variant ānupubbīkathā, anupubbikathā, anupubbiṃ kathaṃ
Commentary (ANa) dānānantaraṃ sīlaṃ, sīlānantaraṃ saggan'ti evaṃ desan'ānupubbiṃ kathaṃ vā, yaṃ yaṃ suttapadaṃ vā gāthāpadaṃ vā nikkhittaṃ hoti, tassa tassa anurūpakathaṃ kathessāmī'ti cittaṃ upaṭṭhapetvā paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo.
Sanskrit anupūrvam + kathā

Example

ānupubbikathaṃ kathessāmī'ti paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo.

AN 5.159 udāyīsuttaṃ
ānupubbī

Example

AN 5.159 udāyīsuttaṃ
ānupubbīkathā

fem. talk that develops progressively; graduated instruction; systematic talk [ānupubbī + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning talk that develops progressively; graduated instruction; systematic talk
Construction ānupubbī + kathā
Compound kammadhāraya (ānupubbī + kathā)
Variant ānupubbikathā, anupubbikathā, anupubbiṃ kathaṃ
Commentary (ANa) dānānantaraṃ sīlaṃ, sīlānantaraṃ saggan'ti evaṃ desan'ānupubbiṃ kathaṃ vā, yaṃ yaṃ suttapadaṃ vā gāthāpadaṃ vā nikkhittaṃ hoti, tassa tassa anurūpakathaṃ kathessāmī'ti cittaṃ upaṭṭhapetvā paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo.
Sanskrit anupūrvam + kathā

Example

atha kho bhagavā upālissa gahapatissa ānupubbīkathaṃ kathesi, seyyath'idaṃ, dānakathaṃ sīlakathaṃ saggakathaṃ, kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṃkilesaṃ, nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
ānubhāva 1

masc. splendour; majesty; magnificence; pomp [anu + √bhū + *a + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, from anubhāva
Meaning splendour; majesty; magnificence; pomp
Root Family anu √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction anu > ānu + √bhū > bhāv + *a + *a
anubhāva + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
ū > āv
Sanskrit ānubhāva
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

rājā kira pasenadi kosalo ekasmiṃ chaṇadivase alaṅ'katapaṭiyattaṃ sabbasetaṃ ekaṃ puṇḍarīkaṃ nāma hatthiṃ abhiruyha mahantena rāja-ānubhāvena nagaraṃ padakkhiṇaṃ karoti

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu

bhavatu sabbamaṅgalaṃ, rakkhantu sabbadevatā,
sabbadhamm'ānubhāvena, sadā sotthi bhavantu te

Trad

ānubhāva 2

masc. power; ability [anu + √bhū + *a + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from anubhāva
Meaning power; ability
Root Family anu √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction anu > ānu + √bhū > bhāv + *a + *a
anubhāva + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
ū > āv
Sanskrit ānubhāva
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

so gantvā taṃ bhattaṃ pañcahi paccekabuddhasatehi saddhiṃ saṃvibhaji. taṃ tassa-ānubhāvena sabbesam'pi pahoti. te olokentā'y'eva aṭṭhaṃsu.

DHPa 2.18.10 meṇḍakaseṭṭhi vatthu

datvā ca bhutvā ca yatha-anubhāvaṃ,
anindito saggam'upeti ṭhānan'ti.

SN 1.41 ādittasuttaṃ
ānubhāva 3

masc. supernatural power; psychic ability [anu + √bhū + *a + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from anubhāva
Meaning supernatural power; psychic ability
Root Family anu √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction anu > ānu + √bhū > bhāv + *a + *a
anubhāva + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
ū > āv
Synonym iddhānubhāva
Sanskrit ānubhāva
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

atha kho cittassa gahapatino etadahosi, yo kho imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe sabbanavako bhikkhu tass'āyaṃ evarūpo iddhi-ānubhāvo'ti.

adj. in regular order; conformable to, suitable [loma] ✗

nt. immovability; imperturbability ✗
ānejjakārana

āneñja 1

nt. immovableness; imperturbable state; unshakability; lit. not moving state [na + √iñj + a + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na iñja, neg
Meaning immovableness; imperturbable state; unshakability; lit. not moving state

Root √iñj･1 a (move, shake)
Construction na + √iñj > eñj + a + *a
aniñja + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym ejā
Sanskrit āniñjya
Sanskrit Root √iṅg 1 (stir)

Examples

tassa evaṃpaṭipannassa tabbahulavihārino āyatane cittaṃ pasīdati. sampasāde sati etarahi vā āneñjaṃ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ

so evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigat'ūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivās'ānussatiñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
āneñja 2

adj. imperturbable; motionless; perfectly still; lit. no movement [na + √iñj + a + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from na iñja, neg
Meaning imperturbable; motionless; perfectly still; lit. no movement
Root Family √iñj
Root √iñj･1 a (move, shake)
Construction na > an > ān + √iñj > eñj + a + *a
aniñja + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change an > ān
i > e
Antonym ejā
Commentary (VINa) āneñjaṃ samādhin'ti anejaṃ acalaṃ kāyavācāvipphandavirahitaṃ catutthajjhānasamādhiṃ.
Sanskrit āniñjya
Sanskrit Root √iṅg 1 (stir)

Example

tena kho pana samayena bhagavā āneñjena samādhinā nisinno hoti. atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, katamena nu kho bhagavā vihārena eta'r'ahi viharatī'ti?

UD 23 yasojasuttaṃ
āneñjakāraṇa

nt. feat of immovability (or a trained elephant) ✗

adj. connected with the imperturbable states; concerned with unshakeable meditation attainments [āneñja + paṭisaṃyutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected with the imperturbable states; concerned with unshakeable meditation attainments
Construction āneñja + paṭisaṃyutta

Commentary (MNa) āneñjapaṭisaṃyuttāyā'ti āneñjasamāpattipaṭisaṃyuttāya.
āneñjapatta

adj. who or which has reached immovability or imperturbability ✗
āneñjappatta

adj. reached the imperturbable state; unflappable; unshakeable [āneñja + patta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning reached the imperturbable state; unflappable; unshakeable

Sanskrit āniñjya + prāpta

Examples

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

so evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigat'ūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivās'ānussatiñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmesiṃ.

VIN 1.0 verañjakaṇḍaṃ
āneñjabhisaṅkhāra

masc. accumulation of motive force, impetus, for formless states ✗
āneñjasaññā

fem. imperturbable perception; perception of the imperturbable states [āneñja + saññā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning imperturbable perception; perception of the imperturbable states
Construction āneñja + saññā
āneñjasappāya

adj. conducive to the imperturbable state; beneficial for imperturbability [āneñja + sappāya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning conducive to the imperturbable state; beneficial for imperturbability
Construction āneñja + sappāya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (āneñjassa + sappāya)
Commentary (MNa) āneñjasappāyā'ti āneñjassa catutthajjhānassa sappāyā.
Sanskrit āniñjya + sāṃpreya

Example

sampasāde sati etarahi vā āneñjaṃ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā. ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati yaṃ taṃsaṃvattanikaṃ viññāṇaṃ assa āneñj'ūpagaṃ. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamā āneñjasappāyā paṭipadā akkhāyati.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ
āneñjasappāyasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 106 (MN106) ✗
āneñjasamādhi

masc. imperturbable stability of mind; perfectlty stable mental stillness [āneñja + samādhi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning imperturbable stability of mind; perfectlty stable mental stillness
Construction āneñja + samādhi
Compound kammadhāraya (āneñja + samādhi)
Commentary (UDa) āneñjasamādhinā'ti catutthajjhānapādakena aggaphalasamādhinā, arūpajjhānapādakenā'ti'pi vadanti. āneñjena samādhinā'tipi pāṭho.
Sanskrit āniñjya + samādhi

Example

atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, āneñjena kho bhagavā vihārena eta'r'ahi viharatī'ti. sabb'eva āneñjasamādhinā nisīdiṃsu.

UD 23 yasojasuttaṃ
āneñjasaṃyojana

nt. connection with the imperturbable states; concern with unshakeable meditation attainments [āneñja + saṃyojana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning connection with the imperturbable states; concern with unshakeable meditation attainments
Construction āneñja + saṃyojana
āneñjasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.117 (AN3.117) ✗
āneñjādhimutta

adj. intent on the imperturbable state; fixed on the imperturbable [āneñja + adhimutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning intent on the imperturbable state; fixed on the imperturbable
Construction āneñja + adhimutta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (āneñjaṃ + adhimutta)
Commentary (MNa) āneñj'ādhimuttassā'ti kilesasiñcanavirahitāsu heṭṭhimāsu chasu samāpattīsu adhimuttassa tanninnassa taggaruno tappabbhārassa.
Sanskrit āniñjya + adhimukta

Example

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, paṇḍupalāso bandhanā pavutto abhabbo haritattāya. evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, āneñj'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye lok'āmisasaṃyojane se pavutte.

Meaning unshakeable intention

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ
ānetabba 1

ptp. (gram) should be repositioned; lit. to be carried [ā + √nī + a + tabba] ~

Meaning (gram) should be repositioned; lit. to be carried
Root Family ā √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Base √nī + a > ne
Construction ā + ne + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change ī > e
Sanskrit ānayitavya
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)
ānetabba 2

ptp. should be brought, should be fetched [ā + √nī] ✗
āneti

pr. (+acc) brings; brings home; fetches; leads; conveys [ā + √nī + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning brings; brings home; fetches; leads; conveys
Root Family ā √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Base √nī + a > ne
Construction ā + ne + ti
Phonetic Change ī > e
Synonym āharati, pāpeti
Sanskrit ānayati
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Examples

sace, mārisā, dev'āsurasaṅgāme samupabyūḷhe asurā jineyyuṃ devā parājineyyuṃ, yena naṃ sakkaṃ devānam'indaṃ kaṇṭhapañcamehi bandhanehi bandhitvā mama santike āneyyātha asurapuran'ti.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ

atītayobbano poso,
āneti timbarutthaniṃ,
tassā issā na supati,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6
ānetuṃ

inf. to lead back; to bring back [ā + √nī] ✗
ānetvā 1

abs. (+acc) having brought home; having fetched [ā + √nī + a + tvā] ✓

Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)

Construction ā + ne + tvā
Phonetic Change ī > e

Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Examples

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ

sīghaṃ dāruādīni āharathā'ti gahapatike vatvā gāmamajjhe vuttapakāraṃ gehaṃ kārāpetvā gāmasatato paṇṇākāraṃ āharāpetvā janapadaseṭṭhino santikā dhītaraṃ ānetvā maṅgalaṃ katvā seṭṭhissa sāsanaṃ pahiṇi, idañ'c'idañ'ca mayā katan'ti.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ
āpa

nt. water; liquid [√āp + a] ✓

Grammar nt, in comps
Meaning water; liquid
Root Family √āp

Construction √āp + a

Examples

āpā ce sabbadā siyuṃ,

kissa pariyesanaṃ care'ti.

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ

ahesuṃ kho ye, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ pathavīgarahakā pathavījigucchakā, āpagarahakā āpajigucchakā, tejagarahakā tejajigucchakā, vāyagarahakā vāyajigucchakā

āpagaharaka

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
āpajja

ger. (+acc) experiencing; undergoing; suffering [ā + √pad + ya] ~

Meaning experiencing; undergoing; suffering
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction ā + √pad + ya
Synonym anvāya
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)
āpajjati 1

pr. (+acc) comes to; experiences; gets (pleasure); suffers (pain); meets (with) [ā + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning comes to; experiences; gets (pleasure); suffers (pain); meets (with)
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ā + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Antonym nāpajjati
Synonym anubhavati, abhijānāti, upeti, nigacchati, paṭisevati, pappoti, vindati
Sanskrit āpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

tāvataken'eva tuṭṭhiṃ āpajjeyyātha

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

evaṃ puṭṭhā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā na c'eva sampāyissanti, uttariñ'ca vighātaṃ āpajjissanti. taṃ kissa hetu? yathā taṃ, bhikkhave, avisayasmiṃ.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
āpajjati 2

pr. (+acc) arouses; exhibits; produces; brings into being [ā + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning arouses; exhibits; produces; brings into being
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ā + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Antonym nāpajjati
Sanskrit āpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

so tathā sato viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmaṃsam'āpajjati.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ

tassa saṃvarāya paṭipajjatha, rakkhatha cakkhu'ndriyaṃ, cakkhu'ndriye saṃvaraṃ āpajjatha.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

pr. (+acc) engages in [ā + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Phonetic Change dy > jj

Sanskrit āpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

VIN PAT PC 79 kammappaṭibāhanasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu nimantito sabhatto samāno santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyya aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 46 cārittasikkhāpadaṃ
āpajjati 4

pr. (+acc) (of an offence) commits; falls into [ā + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of an offence) commits; falls into
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ā + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Antonym vuṭṭhāti, paṭikaroti
Sanskrit āpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

maraṇañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, ariyassa vinaye yo sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati, maraṇamattañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, dukkhaṃ yaṃ aññataraṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

maraṇamattañ'h'etaṃ, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ yadidaṃ aññataraṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati. yathārūpāya āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyati.

SN 20.10 biḷārasuttaṃ
āpajjati 5

pr. (+acc) causes; effects [ā + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning causes; effects
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ā + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Antonym nāpajjati
Synonym āpādeti
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.8) cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyyā'ti āyataṃ vā hotu vitthataṃ vā appitaṃ vā saṇhaṃ vā.
Sanskrit āpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

tatra ce so bhikkhu pubbe appavārito upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya, sādhu vata maṃ āyasmā iminā cīvaracetāpannena evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādehī'ti

VIN PAT NP 8 paṭhamaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ

vaca'icc'etassa dhātussa akāro ottam'āpajjate ajjatanimhi vibhattimhi. avoca. avocuṃ. ajjatanimhī'ti kim'atthaṃ? avaca, avacū.

āpatati

pr. falls or rushes on to [ā + √pat] ✗
āpatana

nt. falling down [ā + √pat] ✗
āpati

aor. fell or rushed on to [ā + √pat] ✗
āpatita

āpato

masc. as water; from liquid; apart from water [√āp + as + to] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group, abl sg of āpas
Meaning as water; from liquid; apart from water
Root Family √āp
Root √āp×4 uṇā (be wet)
Construction √āp + as + to
āpas + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Notes mano-group nouns, while neuter in Sanskrit, are considered to be masculine by classical Pāḷi grammars such as Saddanīti
Sanskrit āpāt
Sanskrit Root ap - (water)

Example

āpaṃ āpato sañjānāti, āpaṃ āpato saññatvā āpaṃ maññati, āpasmiṃ maññati, āpato maññati, āpaṃ me'ti maññati, āpaṃ abhinandati. taṃ kissa hetu? apariññātaṃ tassā'ti vadāmi.

āpas + tta

Sanskrit Root ap - (water)

Construction āpatti + lesa
Compound kammadhāraya (āpatti + lesa)
Commentary (VINa) āpattileso nāma lahukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjanto diṭṭho hoti. tañ'ce pārājikena codeti, āpatti vācāya, vācāya saṅghādisesassa.
Sanskrit āpatti + leśa

Example

kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāyā'ti leso nāma dasa lesā, jātileso, nāmaleso, gottaleso, liṅgaleso, āpattileso, pattaleso, cīvaraleso, upajjhāyaleso, ācariyaleso, sen'āsanaleso.

VIN 1.2.9 dutiyaduṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ
āpattivuṭṭhāna

nt. removal of an offence; rehabilitation ✗
āpattivuṭṭhānakusalatā

fem. skill in rehabilitation from offences [āpattivuṭṭhāna + kusalatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning skill in rehabilitation from offences
Construction āpattivuṭṭhāna + kusalatā
āpattivuṭṭhānatā

fem. state allowing rehabilitation from offences ✗
āpattisaññī

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as an offence [āpatti + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as an offence
Construction āpatti + saññī
Compound kammadhāraya (āpatti + saññī)
Commentary (ANa) anāpattiyā āpattisaññī'ti āpucchitvā bhaṇḍakaṃ dhovantassa, pattaṃ pacantassa, kese chindantassa, gāmaṃ pavisantassā'tiādīsu anāpatti, tattha āpatti ayan'ti evaṃsaññī.
Sanskrit āpatti + saṃjñin

Example

dve'me, bhikkhave, bālā. katame dve? yo ca anāpattiyā āpattisaññī, yo ca āpattiyā anāpattisaññī. ime kho, bhikkhave, dve bālā'ti.

AN 2.103 bālavaggo
āpattisāmantaṃ

ind. bordering on an offence; close to transgression [āpatti + sāmanta + aṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of āpattisāmanta
Meaning bordering on an offence; close to transgression
Construction āpatti + sāmanta + aṃ
āpattisāmanta + aṃ
Synonym āpattisāmantā
Commentary (VINa) āpattisāmantā bhaṇamāno'ti padasodhammaduṭṭhull'ādivasena āpattiyā āsannavācaṃ bhaṇamāno.
āpattisāmantā

ind. bordering on an offence; close to transgression [āpatti + sāmanta + ā] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of āpattisāmanta
Meaning bordering on an offence; close to transgression
Construction āpatti + sāmanta + ā
āpattisāmanta + ā
Synonym āpattisāmantaṃ
Commentary (VINa) āpattisāmantā bhaṇamāno'ti padasodhammaduṭṭhull'ādivasena āpattiyā āsannavācaṃ bhaṇamāno.
āpattiṃ āpanna

idiom. who has committed an offence; who has fallen into wrongdoing ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + pp
Meaning who has committed an offence; who has fallen into wrongdoing
Sanskrit āpattim + āpanna

Examples

na ca tassa bhikkhuno aññāṇakena mutti atthi, yañ'ca tattha āpattiṃ āpanno, tañ'ca yathādhammo kāretabbo, uttari c'assa moho āropetabbo

VIN PAT PC 73 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno codakass'eva paccāropeti, tvaṃ kho'si itthan'nāmaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno, tvaṃ tāva paṭhamaṃ paṭikarohī'ti.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ
āpadatthā

ind. (for use) in case of misfortune or accident ✗
āpadatthāya

ind. for use in case of emergency; lit. for the sake of misfortune [āpada + attha + āya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for use in case of emergency; lit. for the sake of misfortune
Construction āpada + attha + āya
āpadattha + āya
Commentary (VINa) āpad'atthāya nikkhittānī'ti aggidāhena vā purāṇabhāvena vā paṭirāj'ūparundhan'ādinā vā gopur'aṭṭālakarāj'antepurahatthisāl'ādīnaṃ vipatti āpadāti vuccati. tadatthaṃ nikkhittānī'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit āpadā + arthāya

Example

atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto anattamano ahosi, kathañ'hi nāma devo devagahadārūni nagarapaṭisaṅkhārikāni āpad'atthāya nikkhittāni dhaniyassa kumbhakāraputtassa dassatī'ti!

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
āpadā

fem. adversity; misfortune; distress; calamity [ā + √pad + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from āpajjati
Meaning adversity; misfortune; distress; calamity
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction ā + √pad + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Synonym īti, vipatti
Commentary (VINa) āpadāsū'ti vāḷamigā vā corā vā anubandhanti, evarūpāsu āpadāsu anāpatti.
Sanskrit āpadā
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

āpadāsu kho, mahārāja, thāmo veditabbo. so ca kho dīghena addhunā na ittaraṃ, manasikarotā no amanasikarotā, paññavatā no duppaññena

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ

anāpatti asañcicca, assatiyā, ajānantassa, gilānassa, āpadāsu, ummattakassa, ādikammikassā'ti.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo
āpadī

fem. misfortune; distress; calamity ✗
āpanna 1

pp. (+acc) fallen into; entered into; met with [ā + √pad + na] ✓

Grammar pp of āpajjati (+acc)
Meaning fallen into; entered into; met with
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction ā + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Sanskrit āpanna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ loko āpanno, jāyati ca jīyati ca mīyati ca cavati ca upapajjati ca, atha ca panimassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṃ nappajānāti jarāmaraṇassa.

DN 14.11 mahāpadānasuttaṃ

kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ satto āpanno, app'eva nāma imamhā dukkhā mucceyyā'ti karuṇā pavattetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

Sanskrit āpanna

kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ loko āpanno, jāyati ca jīyati ca mīyati ca cavati ca upapajjati ca, atha ca pan'imassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṃ nappajānāti jarāmaraṇassa

Meaning committed before; fallen into before

āpannasattā

fem. pregnant woman ✗
āpannomhi

Grammar sandhi, pp + pr
Meaning I committed (an offence); I did it
Construction āpanno + amhi
Sanskrit āpanna + asmi

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno, n'ev'āhaṃ āpanno'mhi, na pan'āhaṃ āpanno'mhī'ti so tuṇhībhāvena saṅghaṃ viheṭheti.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

Meaning who praises water; who approves of water
Construction āpas + pasaṃsaka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (āpaṃ + pasaṃsaka)
Sanskrit āpas + praśaṃsaka

Example

ye pana, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ pathavīpasaṃsakā pathav'ābhinandino, āpapasaṃsakā āp'ābhinandino, tejapasaṃsakā tej'ābhinandino, vāyapasaṃsakā vāy'ābhinandino ... te kāyassa bhedā pāṇupacchedā paṇīte kāye patiṭṭhitā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
āpabhinandī

adj. finding pleasure in (the element of) water ✗
āpayamāna

prp. (+acc) causing to reach; making be [√ap + *aya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of āpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning causing to reach; making be
Root Family √ap
Root √ap･4 *aya (reach, attain)
Base √ap + *aya > āpaya (caus)
Construction āpaya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Sanskrit āpayamāna
Sanskrit Root √āp 5 (obtain)

Example

tap'ode gattāni parisiñcitvā paccuttaritvā ekacīvaro aṭṭhāsi gattāni pubb'āpayamāno.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ
āpas

masc. water; liquid [√āp + as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group
Meaning water; liquid
Root Family √āp
Root √āp×4 uṇā (be wet)
Construction √āp + as
Derivative kita (as)
Synonym āpa
Notes mano-group nouns, while neuter in Sanskrit, are considered to be masculine by classical Pāḷi grammars such as Saddanīti
Sanskrit āpas
Sanskrit Root ap - (water)

Examples

kattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
kattha dīghañ'ca rassañ'ca,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
kattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhatī'ti?

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ … yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā āpodhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
āpāṇa

masc. life; lit. breathing [ā + pa + √an + *a] ~

Meaning life; lit. breathing
Root Family ā pa √an
Root √an･1 a (breath, blow)
Construction ā + pa + √an > āṇ + *a

Synonym pāṇa

āpāṇakoṭika

adj. until the end of life; until death ✗
āpāṇakoṭikaṃ

ind. until the end of one's life, all one's life ✗
āpāta

masc. falling in; flying in [ā + √pat + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āpatati
Meaning falling in; flying in
Root Family ā √pat
Root √pat･1 a (fall)
Construction ā + √pat > pāt + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant āpātha
Commentary (UDa) āpātaparipātan'ti āpātaṃ paripātaṃ, āpatitvā āpatitvā paripatitvā paripatitvā, abhimukhapātañ'c'eva paribbhamitvā pātañ'ca katvā'ti attho. āpāthe paripātan'ti keci paṭhan'ti, āpāthe padīpassa attano āpāthagamane sati paripatitvā paripatitvā'ti attho.
Sanskrit āpāta
Sanskrit Root √pat 1 (fly, fall)

Example

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā adhipātakā tesu telappadīpesu āpātaparipātaṃ anayaṃ āpajjanti, byasanaṃ āpajjanti, anayabyasanaṃ āpajjanti.

UD 59 upātidhāvantisuttaṃ
āpātaparipātaṃ

ind. falling in from all sides [āpāta + paripāta + aṃ] ✓

Meaning falling in from all sides

Commentary (UDa) āpātaparipātan'ti āpātaṃ paripātaṃ, āpatitvā āpatitvā paripatitvā paripatitvā, abhimukhapātañ'c'eva paribbhamitvā pātañ'ca katvā'ti attho. āpāthe paripātan'ti keci paṭhan'ti, āpāthe padīpassa attano āpāthagamane sati paripatitvā paripatitvā'ti attho.

Example

UD 59 upātidhāvantisuttaṃ
āpātha

masc. (+gen) (of a sense organ) range (of); sphere (of); scope (of); horizon (of) [ā + √path + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from patha (+gen)
Meaning (of a sense organ) range (of); sphere (of); scope (of); horizon (of)

Root √path･1 a (go, move)
Construction ā + √path > pāth + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant āpāta
Notes ? or from √pā (guard) ? or sk ā√pā "to drink in with the eyes"
Sanskrit ābhāsa (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √path √panth 1 (go)

Examples

evaṃ sammā vimuttacittassa, bhante, bhikkhuno bhusā ce'pi cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā cakkhussa āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, n'ev'assa cittaṃ pariyādiyanti.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso āpāthagatānaṃ rūpānaṃ adassanakāmo assa, so nimīleyya vā aññena vā apalokeyya.

Examples

ajjhattikañc'eva, āvuso, cakkhuṃ aparibhinnaṃ hoti, bāhirā ca rūpā na āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, no ca tajjo samannāhāro hoti, n'eva tāva tajjassa viññāṇabhāgassa pātubhāvo hoti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

evaṃ sammā vimuttacittassa, bhante, bhikkhuno bhusā ce'pi cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā cakkhussa āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, n'ev'assa cittaṃ pariyādiyanti.

AN 4.63 brahmasuttaṃ
āpādana

nt. production [ā + √pad] ✗

pr. causes to enter upon or reach (a state); brings to; brings up, nurtures [ā + √pad] ✗

kiṃsu tassa vidhāvati,

kiṃsu tassa mahabbhayan'ti.

āpādetar 1

masc. who brings up (a child) [ā + √pad] ✗
āpādetar 2

masc. nurse [ā + √pad] ✗
āpādeti 1

pr. (+acc) (of something bad) causes; effects; produces [ā + √pad + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of āpajjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of something bad) causes; effects; produces
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 *e (go, step)
Base √pad + *e > pāde (caus)

Sanskrit āpadayati
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

so abhikkamanto paṭikkamanto bahū khuddake pāṇe saṅghātaṃ āpādeti. imassa pana, gahapati, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto kaṃ vipākaṃ paññapetī'ti?

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ

paṭhamena vayasā anikīḷitāvino kāmesu yāvajīvaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ caranti, addhānañ'ca āpādentī'ti?

SN 35.127 bhāradvājasuttaṃ
āpādeti 2

pr. (+acc) nurses [ā + √pad] ✗

Grammar inf of āpādeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to cause; to effect; to produce
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 *e (go, step)
Base √pad + *e > pāde (caus)
Construction ā + pāde + tuṃ
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym uppādetuṃ
Sanskrit āpadayitum
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)
āpādetvā

abs. having made happen; having caused; having generated [ā + √pad] ✗
āpādenta

prp. (+acc) (of something bad) causing; effecting; producing [ā + √pad + *e + nta] ~

Grammar prp of āpādeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of something bad) causing; effecting; producing
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 *e (go, step)
Base √pad + *e > pāde (caus)
Construction ā + pāde + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym uppādayanta, uppādenta
Sanskrit āpadayat
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)
āpādesi 1

aor. (+acc) (of harm of suffering) made happen; caused; generated [ā + √pad + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of āpādeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of harm of suffering) made happen; caused; generated
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 *e (go, step)
Base √pad + *e > pāde (caus)
Construction ā + pāde + si
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym ajanesi, uppādesi, pāpesi
Commentary (ANa) saṅghātaṃ āpādesin'ti ghātaṃ vadhaṃ pāpesiṃ.
Sanskrit āpad
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

tikkhattuṃ sīhanādaṃ naditvā gocarāya pakkamati. taṃ kissa hetu? m'āhaṃ khuddake pāṇe visamagate saṅghātaṃ āpādesin'ti!

AN 10.21 sīhanādasuttaṃ
āpādesi 2

aor. nursed [ā + √pad] ✗
āpāna

nt. drinking place; drinking party; lit. drinking [ā + √pā + ana] ~

Grammar nt, from āpivati
Meaning drinking place; drinking party; lit. drinking
Root Family ā √pā
Root √pā･1 a (drink)
Construction ā + √pā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (APt) āpivanti saṃbhūya pivantyasmiṃ āpānaṃ, yu.
Sanskrit āpāna
Sanskrit Root √pā 1 (drink)
āpānabhūmi

fem. banqueting hall ✗

Example

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā
āpānīya

adj. suitable for drinking; fit for drinking with; lit. to be drunk [ā + √pā + anīya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of āpivati
Meaning suitable for drinking; fit for drinking with; lit. to be drunk
Root Family ā √pā
Root √pā･1 a (drink)
Construction ā + √pā + anīya
Derivative kicca (anīya)
Sanskrit ā + pānīya
Sanskrit Root √pā 1 (drink)

Example

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, āpānīyakaṃso vaṇṇasampanno gandhasampanno rasasampanno, so ca kho visena saṃsaṭṭho.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

Example

ye pana, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ pathavīpasaṃsakā pathav'ābhinandino, āpapasaṃsakā āp'ābhinandino, tejapasaṃsakā tej'ābhinandino, vāyapasaṃsakā vāy'ābhinandino ... te kāyassa bhedā pāṇupacchedā paṇīte kāye patiṭṭhitā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
āpāyika 1

adj. suffering; wretched; miserable; lit. gone away [apa + √i + *a + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from apāya
Meaning suffering; wretched; miserable; lit. gone away
Root Family apa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction apa + √i > ay + *a + *ika
apāya + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Synonym kapaṇa, duggata, varāka
Commentary (MNa) āpāyikānaṃ ṭhānānan'ti apāye nibbattāpakānaṃ kāraṇānaṃ
Sanskrit āpāyika
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

imesaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, samaṇamalānaṃ samaṇadosānaṃ samaṇakasaṭānaṃ āpāyikānaṃ ṭhānānaṃ duggativedaniyānaṃ appahānā, na samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadaṃ paṭipanno'ti vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ tvaṃ evaṃ vadeyyāsi, atha kiñ'carahi te, bhante, devadatto byākato, āpāyiko devadatto, nerayiko devadatto, kappaṭṭho devadatto, atekiccho devadatto'ti?

āpucchati

pr. (+acc and +acc) asks (about); asks permission [ā + √pucch + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, ditrans (+acc and +acc)
Meaning asks (about); asks permission
Root Family ā √pucch
Root √pucch･1 a (ask, question)
Base √pucch + a > puccha
Construction ā + puccha + ti
Sanskrit āpṛcchate
Sanskrit Root √prach 6 (ask)

Examples

na ca me hiṃsati kiñci,
na ca'haṃ isidāsiyā saha vacchaṃ,
dessāva me alaṃ me,
āpucch'āhaṃ gamissāmi.

THI 72 isidāsītherīgāthā

dukkhassa ve maṃ pabhavaṃ apucchasi,
taṃ te pavakkhāmi yathā pajānaṃ,
upadhinidānā pabhavanti dukkhā,
ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
āpucchā

abs. (+acc and +acc) having asked permission; having taken leave; having informed [ā + √pucch + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of āpucchati, irreg, ditrans (+acc and +acc)
Meaning having asked permission; having taken leave; having informed
Root Family ā √pucch
Root √pucch･1 a (ask, question)
Construction ā + √pucch + tvā > pucchā
Phonetic Change tvā > ā (contraction)
Antonym anāpucchā
Notes see SDM 17 laddhā'ti labhitvā. laddhānā'ti labhitvāna. diṭṭhā'ti disvā
Sanskrit āpṛcchya, āpṛṣṭvā
Sanskrit Root √prach 6 (ask)

Examples

santaṃ nāma bhikkhuṃ sakkā hoti āpucchā pavisituṃ. asantaṃ nāma bhikkhuṃ na sakkā hoti āpucchā pavisituṃ.

VIN 2.5.5.6 cārittasikkhāpadaṃ

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā saṅkhā'pi so puggalo āpucchā pakkamitabbaṃ, n'ānubandhitabbo.

JAa 542 umaṅgajātakavaṇṇanā

bhante, idaṃ udakaṃ dārakassa sīse āsiñcāmā'ti āpucchitvā, tena hi āsiñcathā'ti vutte tathā akāsi. sā devatā tāva'd'eva taṃ muñcitvā gantvā leṇadvāre aṭṭhāsi.

DHPa 2.26.21 pabbhāravāsī tissatthera vatthu
āpucchiya

AN 10.26 kāḷīsuttaṃ

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ yathāṭhitaṃ yathāpaṇihitaṃ dhātuso paccavekkhati atthi imasmiṃ kāye pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū'ti

DN 22.6 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ … yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā āpodhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

fem. liquid; moisture; lit. water state [āpo + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning liquid; moisture; lit. water state
Construction āpo + dhātu
Compound kammadhāraya (āpo + dhātu)
Commentary (SNa) āpo'ti uparisnehanaāpo.
Sanskrit āpas + dhātu

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pathavīdhātu, evaṃ catasso viññāṇaṭṭhitiyo daṭṭhabbā. seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, āpodhātu, evaṃ nandirāgo daṭṭhabbo. seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pañca bījajātāni, evaṃ viññāṇaṃ s'āhāraṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.

SN 22.54 bījasuttaṃ
āpodhātu 3

fem. (abhidhamma) element of cohesion; lit. water state [āpo + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning (abhidhamma) element of cohesion; lit. water state
Construction āpo + dhātu
Compound kammadhāraya (āpo + dhātu)

Sanskrit dhātu

Example

katamaṃ taṃ rūpaṃ āpodhātu? yaṃ āpo āpogataṃ sineho sinehagataṃ bandhanattaṃ rūpassa, idaṃ taṃ rūpaṃ āpodhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhante, āpasmiṃ sucim'pi ... dhovanti, na ca tena āpo aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā. evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, āposamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ
āphusati

so aparena samayena tamhā ābādhā mucceyya

DN 2.19 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ

saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.

SN 22.59 anattalakkhaṇasuttaṃ
ābādhaṭṭhena

ind. in the sense of a disease [ābādha + aṭṭhena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning in the sense of a disease
Construction ābādha + aṭṭhena
Compound abyayībhāva (ābādha + aṭṭhena)
ābādhati

pr. (+acc) afflicts; troubles; oppresses [ā + √bādh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning afflicts; troubles; oppresses
Root Family ā √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Base √bādh + a > bādha
Construction ā + bādha + ti
Synonym bādhayati, bādheti
Sanskrit ābādhate
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Example

evaṃ vutte, māgaṇḍiyo paribbājako sakān'eva sudaṃ gattāni pāṇinā anomajjati, idan'taṃ, bho gotama, ārogyaṃ, idan'taṃ nibbānaṃ. ahañ'hi, bho gotama, etarahi arogo sukhī, na maṃ kiñci ābādhatī'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
ābādhato

ind. as disease; as sickness; as illness; as affliction; as oppressive [ā + √bādh + a + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of ābādha
Meaning as disease; as sickness; as illness; as affliction; as oppressive
Root Family ā √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Construction ā + √bādh + a + to
ābādha + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Synonym rogato
Commentary (MNa) rog'aṭṭhena ābādhato (ANa) ābādhan'aṭṭhena ābādhato
Sanskrit ābādhāt
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Example

so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ, te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.

AN 9.36 jhānasuttaṃ
ābādhana

nt. afflicting; troubling; oppressing [ā + √bādh + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from ābādhati
Meaning afflicting; troubling; oppressing
Root Family ā √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Construction ā + √bādh + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym pīḷana, sampīḷana
Sanskrit ābādha
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)
ābādhanaṭṭhena

ind. in the sense of afflicting [ābādhana + aṭṭhena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning in the sense of afflicting
Construction ābādhana + aṭṭhena
Compound abyayībhāva (ābādhana + aṭṭhena)
ābādhapaccayā

ind. due to sickness; because of illness [ābādha + paccayā] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to sickness; because of illness
Construction ābādha + paccayā
Commentary (VINa) ābādhapaccayā'ti kaṇḍukacchuādiābādhapaccayā saṃharāpentiyā anāpatti.
ābādhappaccayā

ind. due to illness; because of sickness [ābādha + paccayā] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to illness; because of sickness
Construction ābādha + paccayā
Commentary (VINa) ābādhappaccayā'ti yassa ābādhassa lasuṇaṃ bhesajjaṃ, tappaccayā'ti attho.
ābādhabhūta

adj. like a disease; like an affliction; lit. become oppression [ābādha + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a disease; like an affliction; lit. become oppression
Construction ābādha + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (ābādha + bhūta)
Commentary (MNa) rogo'va bhūto'ti rogabhūto. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit ābādha + bhūta

Example

ayaṃ kho pana, māgaṇḍiya, kāyo rogabhūto gaṇḍabhūto sallabhūto aghabhūto ābādhabhūto, so tvaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ rogabhūtaṃ gaṇḍabhūtaṃ sallabhūtaṃ aghabhūtaṃ ābādhabhūtaṃ, idan'taṃ, bho gotama, ārogyaṃ, idan'taṃ nibbānan'ti vadesi.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
ābādhayati

pr. (+acc) oppresses; afflicts [√bādh] ✗
ābādhayi

aor. (+acc) harmed; troubled; afflicted; lit. oppressed [√bādh + *aya + i] ~

Grammar aor of ābādhayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning harmed; troubled; afflicted; lit. oppressed
Root Family √bādh
Root √bādh･1 *aya (press, oppress)
Base √bādh + aya > bādhaya (caus)
Construction ā + bādhaya + i
Synonym randhayi
Sanskrit ābādh
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)
ābādhika

adj. sick; ill; lit. oppressed [ā + √bādh + a + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from ābādha
Meaning sick; ill; lit. oppressed
Root Family ā √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Construction ā + √bādh + a + ika
ābādha + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Synonym akallaka, ātura, gilāna, byādhika
Commentary (DNa) ābādhikan'ti iriyāpathabhañjanakena visabhāgabādhena ābādhikaṃ. (MNa) visabhāgavedan'uppattiyā kakacen'eva catuiriyāpathaṃ chindanto ābādhatī'ti ābādho, sv'āssa atthī'ti ābādhiko.
Sanskrit ābādha + ika
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Examples

ahaṃ kho pubbe ābādhiko ahosiṃ dukkhito bāḷhagilāno, bhattañ'ca me nacchādesi, na ca me āsi kāye balamattā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?

AN 3.36 devadūtasuttaṃ
ābādhikinī

fem. sick woman; ill woman; lit. oppressed [ā + √bādh + a + ika + inī] ✓

Grammar fem, from ābādhika
Meaning sick woman; ill woman; lit. oppressed
Root Family ā √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Construction ā + √bādh + a + ika + inī
ābādhika + inī
Derivative taddhita (inī)
Sanskrit ābādha + ika
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Example

ehi tvaṃ, ambho purisa, yen'ayyo ānando ten'upasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena ayyassa ānandassa pāde sirasā vanda, itthan'nāmā, bhante, bhikkhunī ābādhikinī dukkhitā bāḷhagilānā.

AN 4.159 bhikkhunīsuttaṃ
ābādhita

pp. afflicted, oppressed [ā + √bādh] ✗
ābādheti

pr. oppresses, harasses [ā + √bādh] ✗
ābha

adj. radiant; lustrous; luminous; epithet of a class of devas; lit. having light [ā + √bhā + ā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from ābhā
Meaning radiant; lustrous; luminous; epithet of a class of devas; lit. having light
Root Family ā √bhā
Root √bhā･1 a (shine, speak)
Construction ā + √bhā + ā + a
ābhā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Synonym ābhassara, jutimant, pabha, sappabhāsa
Commentary (MNa) ābhānaṃ devānan'ti ābhā nāma visuṃ n'atthi, paritt'ābhāppamāṇābhā-abhassarānam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit ābha
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

Example

ākaṅkheyya ce, gahapatayo, dhammacārī samacārī, aho vat'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ābhānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan'ti, ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ vijjati, yaṃ so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ābhānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
ābhañjati

pr. leans upon [ā + √bhañj] ✗
ābhaṭa

adj. brought, carried; handed down, transmitted ✗
ābhata

pp. (+abl) brought (from); carried here (from) [ā + √bhar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ābharati (+abl)
Meaning brought (from); carried here (from)
Root Family ā √bhar
Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)
Construction ā + √bhar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Commentary (VINa) ābhatan'ti ānītaṃ.
Sanskrit ābhṛta
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṃsapāti ābhatā āpaṇā vā kammārakulā vā rajena ca malena ca pariyonaddhā. tam'enaṃ sāmikā na c'eva paribhuñjeyyuṃ na ca pariyodapeyyuṃ, rajāpathe ca naṃ nikkhipeyyuṃ.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ

so ce dūto taṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, idaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmantaṃ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṃ ābhataṃ, paṭiggaṇhātu āyasmā cīvaracetāpannan'ti.

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ
ābhatātha

sandhi. brought and then ✗

JA 545 tittha jātakaṃ

kāsikasukhumāni dhāraya,
abhiropehi ca mālavaṇṇakaṃ,
kañcanamaṇimuttakaṃ bahuṃ,
vividhaṃ ābharaṇaṃ karomi te.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
ābharati 1

pr. brings, carries [ā + √bhar] ✗
ābharati 2

pr. wears jewellery [ā + √bhar] ✗
ābhassara

adj. radiant; shining; belonging to the radiant heaven; epithet of a class of devas [ā + √bhās + ara] ✓

Grammar adj, from ābhāsati
Meaning radiant; shining; belonging to the radiant heaven; epithet of a class of devas
Root Family ā √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (shine)
Construction ā + √bhās > bhass + ara
Derivative kita (ara)
Phonetic Change ās > ass
Synonym ābha, pabha, pabhassara, sobha, sobhaṇa, sobhana, sobhī
Commentary (DNa) ābhassarā'ti daṇḍaukkāya acci viya etesaṃ sarīrato ābhā chijjitvā chijjitvā patantī viya sarati vissaratī'ti ābhassarā.
Sanskrit ābhāsvara
Sanskrit Root √bhās 1 (shine)

Examples

susukhaṃ vata jīvāma,
yesaṃ no n'atthi kiñcanaṃ,
pītibhakkhā bhavissāma,
devā ābhassarā yathā.

DHP 200 sukhavaggo

ākaṅkheyya ce, gahapatayo, dhammacārī samacārī, aho vat'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ābhassarānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan'ti, ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ vijjati, yaṃ so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ābhassarānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
ābhassarakāya

masc. host of radiant gods [ābhassara + kāya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning host of radiant gods
Construction ābhassara + kāya

nt. radiance; effulgence; fact of being a radiant deity [ā + √bhās + ara + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from ābhassarā
Meaning radiance; effulgence; fact of being a radiant deity

Root √bhās･1 a (shine)

Phonetic Change ās > ass
Sanskrit ābhāsvara +
Sanskrit Root √bhās 1 (shine)

Example

viññāṇaṃ anidassanaṃ anantaṃ sabbato pabhaṃ, taṃ ... ābhassarānaṃ ābhassarattena ananubhūtaṃ, subhakiṇhānaṃ subhakiṇhattena ananubhūtaṃ, vehapphalānaṃ vehapphalatte ananubhūtaṃ, abhibhussa abhibhuttena ananubhūtaṃ, sabbassa sabbattena ananubhūtaṃ.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

Commentary (DNa) yebhuyyenā'ti ye uparibrahmalokesu vā arūpesu vā nibbattanti, tadavasese sandhāya vuttaṃ.
ābhassarā

masc. radiant gods; effulgent deities [ā + √bhās + ara + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, from ābhāsati
Meaning radiant gods; effulgent deities
Root Family ā √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (shine)
Construction ā + √bhās > bhass + ara + ā
ābhassara + ā
Phonetic Change ās > ass
Commentary (DNa) paṇītaṃ bhāvetvā upapannā ābhassarā nāma honti, tesaṃ aṭṭha kappā āyuppamāṇaṃ.
Sanskrit ābhāsvara
Sanskrit Root √bhās 1 (shine)

Examples

ābhassare ābhassarato sañjānāti, ābhassare ābhassarato saññatvā ābhassare maññati, ābhassaresu maññati, ābhassarato maññati, ābhassare me'ti maññati, ābhassare abhinandati. taṃ kissa hetu? apariññātaṃ tassā'ti vadāmi.

MN 1 mūlapariyāyasuttaṃ

atthi kho, brahme, añño kāyo, taṃ tvaṃ na jānāsi na passasi, tam'ahaṃ jānāmi passāmi. atthi kho, brahme, ābhassarā nāma kāyo yato tvaṃ cuto idh'ūpapanno.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
ābhassarūpaga

adj. living in the radiant; experiencing the shining [ābhassara + upaga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living in the radiant; experiencing the shining
Construction ābhassara + upaga
Compound kammadhāraya (ābhassara + upaga)
Commentary (ITIa) ābhassar'ūpago'ti tattha paṭisandhiggahaṇavasena ābhassarabrahmalokaṃ upagacchāmī'ti ābhassar'ūpago homi.
Sanskrit ābhāsvara + upaga

Example

satta vassāni mettaṃ cittaṃ bhāvesiṃ. satta vassāni mettaṃ cittaṃ bhāvetvā satta saṃvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe na'y'imaṃ lokaṃ punāgamāsiṃ. saṃvaṭṭamāne sud'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, loke ābhassar'ūpago homi, vivaṭṭamāne loke suññaṃ brahmavimānaṃ upapajjāmi.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ
ābhā

fem. radiance; lustre; luminosity [ā + √bhā + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from ābhāti
Meaning radiance; lustre; luminosity
Root Family ā √bhā
Root √bhā･1 a (shine, speak)
Construction ā + √bhā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Synonym nibhā
Commentary (MNa) ābhā ... āloko nāma
Sanskrit ābhā
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, telappadīpassa jhāyato acciṃ paṭicca ābhā paññāyati, ābhaṃ paṭicca acci paññāyati, evam'eva kho, āvuso, āyu usmaṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhati, usmā āyuṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhatī'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, lok'antarikā aghā asaṃvutā andhakārā andhakāratimisā, yattham'imesaṃ candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃmah'iddhikānaṃ evaṃ mah'ānubhāvānaṃ ābhāya n'ānubhontī'ti.

SN 56.46 andhakārasuttaṃ
ābhāti

pr. shines; radiates; glows [ā + √bhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning shines; radiates; glows
Root Family ā √bhā
Root √bhā･1 a (shine, speak)
Base √bhā + a > bhā
Construction ā + bhā + ti
Synonym tapati, dibbati, pakāseti, bhāsati, sobhati
Sanskrit ābhāti
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

Examples

divā tapati ādicco,
rattim'ābhāti candimā,
sannaddho khattiyo tapati,
jhāyī tapati brāhmaṇo,
atha sabbam'ahorattiṃ,
buddho tapati tejasā.

DHP 387 brāhmaṇavaggo

cattāro loke pajjotā,
pañcam'ettha na vijjati,
divā tapati ādicco,
rattim'ābhāti candimā.

SN 1.26 pajjotasuttaṃ

ābhāvagga

masc. Chapter 15 of Catukkanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.141-150 ✗
ābhāsa 1.1

masc. light, lustre, radiance [ā + √bhās] ✗

Meaning speaking; talking; propounding

ābhāsati

pr. shines; radiates [ā + √bhās] ✗
ābhāsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.141 (AN4.141) ✗
ābhicetasika

masc. higher state of consciousness; higher state of mind [abhi + √cit + *as + *ika] ✓

Grammar masc, from abhicetas
Meaning higher state of consciousness; higher state of mind
Root Family abhi √cit
Root √cit･8 *aya (think, intend)
Construction abhi > ābhi + √cit > cet + *as + *ika
abhicetas + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
i > e
Variant abhicetasika
Commentary (MNa) ābhicetasikānan'ti abhiceto'ti abhikkantaṃ visuddhacittaṃ vuccati, adhicittaṃ vā, abhicetasi jātāni ābhicetasikāni, abhiceto sannissitānī'ti vā ābhicetasikāni.
Sanskrit adhicittaśikṣā
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

imesañ'ca catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī bhavissasi akicchalābhī akasiralābhī

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu … catunnañ'ca jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī ... evaṃ so ten'aṅgena paripūro hoti.

Construction abhi > ābhi + saṃ + ā + √car > cār + *a + *ika
abhisamācāra + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (VINt) ābhisamācārikasīlan'ti ettha abhisamācāro'ti uttamasamācāro, abhisamācāro'va ābhisamācārikaṃ, abhisamācāraṃ vā ārabbha paññattaṃ ābhisamācārikaṃ, tadeva sīlan'ti ābhisamācārikasīlaṃ. khandhakavattapariyāpannassa sīlass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit abhi + samācāra +
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)
ābhisamācārikadhammapūraṇa

nt. fulfilling of matters related to excellent conduct [ābhisamācārika + dhamma + pūraṇa] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning fulfilling of matters related to excellent conduct
Construction ābhisamācārika + dhamma + pūraṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (ābhisamācārika + dhammapūraṇa)
Commentary (DNt) kāmaṃ ādibrahmacariyakadhammassavanena'pi mettākāyakammāni labbhanti, nippariyāyato pana cārittadhammassavanena ayam'attho icchito'ti dassento ābhisamācārikadhammapūraṇan'ti āha.
ābhisallekhika

adj. very stern; sobering; extremely austere [abhi + saṃ + √likh + *a + *ika] ~

Grammar adj, from sallekha
Meaning very stern; sobering; extremely austere
Root Family abhi saṃ √likh
Root √likh･1 a (scratch, write)
Construction abhi > ābhi + saṃ + √likh > lekh + *a + *ika
abhisallekha + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant abhisallekhika
Commentary (ANa) ābhisallekhikā'ti ativiya kilesasallekhikā.
Sanskrit abhi + saṃlekha +
Sanskrit Root √likh 6 (scratch)
ābhisallehika

adj. concerned with austerity, with strict abstinence [abhi + saṃ + √likh] ✗
ābhiseka

adj. worthy of inauguration as king ✗
ābhisekika

adj. belonging to the consecration [abhi + √sic] ✗
ābhujati

pr. bends, coils, contracts [ā + √bhuj] ✗
ābhujana

nt. crouching, bending, soiling [ā + √bhuj] ✗
ābhuji

aor. (+acc) bent; folded [ā + √bhuj + i] ✓

Grammar aor of ābhujati, trans (+acc)
Meaning bent; folded
Root Family ā √bhuj
Root √bhuj･1 a (bend)
Construction ā + √bhuj + i
Sanskrit ābhuj
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6 (bend)

Example

dassanaṃ me atikkante,
sasaṅghe lokanāyake,
sayanā vuṭṭhahitvāna,
pallaṅkaṃ ābhujiṃ tadā.

BV 2.77 sumedha patthanā kathā
ābhujitvā

abs. (+acc) having bent; having folded [ā + √bhuj + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ābhujati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having bent; having folded
Root Family ā √bhuj
Root √bhuj･1 a (bend)
Construction ā + √bhuj + itvā
Commentary (ANa) ābhujitvā'ti bandhitvā.
Sanskrit ābhujya
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6 (bend)

Examples

UD 50 cūḷapanthakasuttaṃ

ayya sumedhatāpasa, porāṇakabodhisattānaṃ pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, pāramiyo vicinissāmā'ti nisinnakāle yāni pubbanimittāni nāma paññāyanti, tāni sabbāni'pi ajja pātubhūtāni

āma 1.1

ind. yes; certainly ✓

Grammar ind, excl
Meaning yes; certainly
Sanskrit āma

Examples

VIN 4.4.125 āpattipaṭikamma vidhi

iti puṭṭho, no'ti vadeyya. tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yaṃ tvaṃ na jānāsi na passasi, tassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosī'ti? iti puṭṭho, āmā'ti vadeyya.

Meaning raw; uncooked; undigested

MN 27 cūḷa hatthipadopamasuttaṃ

adj. unripe; green [āma + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from āma
Meaning unripe; green
Construction āma + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym sārada
Commentary (MNa) āmakacchinno'ti atitaruṇakāle chinno, so hi vāt'ātapena saṃphusati c'eva milāyati ca.
Sanskrit āmaka

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma tittak'ālābu āmakacchinno vāt'ātapena saṃphuṭito hoti sammilāto, evam'ev'assu me sīsacchavi saṃphuṭitā hoti sammilātā tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

Sanskrit āmaka

Example

na vo ahaṃ, ānanda, tathā parakkamissāmi yathā kumbhakāro āmake āmakamatte. niggayha niggayh'āhaṃ, ānanda, vakkhāmi.

Sanskrit āmaka + dhānya + pratigrahaṇa

Example

āmantayati 1

pr. (+acc) addresses; speaks (to); tells; informs; advises [ā + √mant + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning addresses; speaks (to); tells; informs; advises
Root Family ā √mant
Root √mant･8 *aya (counsel, invite)
Base √mant + aya > mantaya
Construction ā + mantaya + ti
Synonym akkhāti, ācikkhati, ārocayati, āroceti, ālapati, kathayati, katheti, pabrūti, pāvadati, pilapati, bravīti, brūti, bhaṇati, lapayati, vadati, samudācarati
Sanskrit āmantrayate
Sanskrit Root √mantr 10 (speak)

Examples

rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati

ind. (expression of assent) "agreed" ✗
āmantāpeti

Grammar pr, caus of āmanteti, trans (+acc)

MIL 4.2.3 maccubhāyanābhāyanapañho
āmantāpetvā

abs. (+acc) having sent (for); having had summoned [ā + √mant + *āpe + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of āmantāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having sent (for); having had summoned
Root Family ā √mant
Root √mant･8 *āpe (counsel, invite)
Base √mant + āpe > mantāpe (caus)
Construction ā + mantāpe + tvā
Sanskrit āmantr
Sanskrit Root √mantr 10 (speak)

Example

atha kho pāyāsi rājañño uttaraṃ māṇavaṃ āmantāpetvā etadavoca, saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, tāta uttara, dānaṃ datvā evaṃ anuddisasi, imin'āhaṃ dānena pāyāsiṃ rājaññam'eva imasmiṃ loke samāgacchiṃ, mā parasmin'ti

DN 23.20 pāyāsisuttaṃ
āmantāpesi

aor. (+acc) sent (for); summoned; lit. caused to summon [ā + √mant + *āpe + si] ✓

Grammar aor of āmantāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning sent (for); summoned; lit. caused to summon
Root Family ā √mant
Root √mant･8 *āpe (counsel, invite)
Base √mant + āpe > mantāpe (caus)
Construction ā + mantāpe + si
Sanskrit āmantr
Sanskrit Root √mantr 10 (speak)

Example

sārathiṃ āmantāpetvā'ti rājā kira nemittakehi kathitakālato paṭṭhāya ohitasoto vicarati, so, kumāro uyyānaṃ gacchanto antarāmagge nivatto'ti sutvā sārathiṃ āmantāpesi.

DNa 14.5 mahāpadānasuttavaṇṇanā
āmantita

pp. called, addressed, invited [ā + √mant] ✗
āmanteti

pr. (+acc) invites; calls; summons [ā + √mant + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning invites; calls; summons
Root Family ā √mant
Root √mant･8 *e (counsel, invite)
Base √mant + e > mante
Construction ā + mante + ti
Synonym abhineti, avhāyati, āmantayati, nimanteti
Sanskrit āmantrayate
Sanskrit Root √mantr 10 (speak)

Example

atha kho bhagavā aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantesi, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena theraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantehi, satthā taṃ, āvuso thera, āmantetī'ti.

SN 21.10 theranāmakasuttaṃ
āmantetvā

abs. (+acc) having invited; having called; having summoned [ā + √mant + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of āmanteti, trans (+acc)
Meaning having invited; having called; having summoned
Root Family ā √mant
Root √mant･8 *e (counsel, invite)
Base √mant + e > mante
Construction ā + mante + tvā
Antonym anāmantetvā
Synonym pakkositvā
Sanskrit āmantr
Sanskrit Root √mantr 10 (speak)

Examples

sac'assa hoti avisayhaṃ, hatthavikārena dutiyaṃ āmantetvā hatthavilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpema, na tv'eva mayaṃ, bhante, tappaccayā vācaṃ bhindāma.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

ath'ekadivasaṃ bodhisatto uyyānabhūmiṃ gantukāmo sārathiṃ āmantetvā, rathaṃ yojehī'ti āha.

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā

aor. (+acc) addressed; said (to); advised [ā + √mant + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of āmanteti, trans (+acc)
Meaning addressed; said (to); advised
Root Family ā √mant
Root √mant･8 *e (counsel, invite)

Construction ā + mante + si
Synonym āmantayi
Sanskrit āmantr

Examples

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca

Construction āmalaka + matta

āmasati 1

pr. (+acc) touches; rubs; strokes; pats [ā + √mas + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning touches; rubs; strokes; pats
Root Family ā √mas
Root √mas･1 a (touch, rub)
Base √mas + a > masa
Construction ā + masa + ti
Synonym anumajjati, parāmasati, parimajjati, parimasati
Sanskrit āmṛśati
Sanskrit Root √mṛś 6 (touch, feel)

Examples

ehi tvaṃ, ambho purisa, kālass'eva uṭṭhahanto'va sayanamhā pathaviṃ āmaseyyāsi

aṅgulipatodako nāma aṅguliyā'pi tudanti upasampanno upasampannaṃ has'ādhippāyo kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti pācittiyassa.

āmisa 1

Meaning material; physical; worldly; lit. fleshly
Construction āma + isa
Derivative taddhita (isa)

Examples

tattha katamāni cha gehasitāni somanassāni? cakkhuviññeyyānaṃ rūpānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ manoramānaṃ loka-āmisapaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ paṭilābhaṃ vā paṭilābhato samanupassato

Meaning worldly thing; physical item; material stuff
Construction āma + isa

Examples

dve'me, bhikkhave, saṃvibhāgā āmisasaṃvibhāgo ca dhammasaṃvibhāgo ca. etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ saṃvibhāgānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammasaṃvibhāgo.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
āmisa 4

nt. meat; bait [āma + isa] ✓

Grammar nt, from āma
Meaning meat; bait
Construction āma + isa
Derivative taddhita (isa)
Antonym nirāmisa
Commentary (SNa) āmisaṃ'va macchānaṃ vadhāya khittā'ti yathā macchānaṃ vadhatthāya baḷisalaggaṃ āmisaṃ khipati, evaṃ tayā pasaṃsamānena ete rūpā sattānaṃ vadhāya khittā'ti vadati.
Sanskrit āmiṣa

Examples

ye keci rūpā idha vā huraṃ vā,
ye c'antalikkhasmiṃ pabhāsavaṇṇā,
sabb'eva te te namucippasatthā,
āmisaṃ'va macchānaṃ vadhāya khittā'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

vipariṇāmadhammato asārakato aghamūlato vadhakato vibhavato sāsavato saṅkhatato māra-amisato

āmisakiñcikkha

nt. some material gain ✗
āmisakiñcikkhahetu

ind. for the sake of some small worldly benefit [āmisa + kiñcikkha + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of some small worldly benefit
Construction āmisa + kiñcikkha + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āmisakiñcikkhassa + hetu)
Commentary (ANa) āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā'ti ettha āmisan'ti lañjo adhippeto. kiñcikkhan'ti yaṃ vā taṃ vā appamattakaṃ antamaso tittiriya-vaṭṭaka-sappi-piṇḍa-navanīta-piṇḍ'ādi-mattakassa lañjassa hetū'ti attho.
Sanskrit āmiṣa + kiṃcid + ka + hetu

Example

iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo gūthabhāṇī.

āmisakhāra

āmisagata

adj. baited; lit. gone into meat [āmisa + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning baited; lit. gone into meat
Construction āmisa + gata
Commentary (SNa) āmisagatan'ti āmisamakkhitaṃ.
Sanskrit āmiṣa + gata

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, bāḷisiko āmisagataṃ baḷisaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya. tam'enaṃ aññataro āmisacakkhu maccho gileyya.

nt. one of the material things [āmisa + aññatara] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one of the material things
Construction āmisa + aññatara
Compound kammadhāraya (āmisa + aññatara)
Commentary (MNa) āmis'aññataran'ti catunnaṃ paccay'āmisānaṃ aññataraṃ, ekan'ti attho.
Sanskrit āmiṣa + anyatara

Example

āmis'aññataraṃ kho pan'etaṃ, yadidaṃ piṇḍapāto. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ abhuñjitvā iminā'va jighacchādubbalyena evaṃ imaṃ rattin'divaṃ vītināmeyyan'ti.

Meaning material gift; worldly charity; (comm) four requisites
Construction āmisa + dāna

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning material searching
Construction āmisa + esanā
Antonym dhammesanā
Commentary (ANa) āmisassa esanā āmis'esanā, dhammassa esanā dhamm'esanā.
āmukka

pp. dressed in; put on [ā + √muc + ta] ~

Grammar pp of āmuñcati
Meaning dressed in; put on
Root Family ā √muc
Root √muc･2 ṃa (release, free)
Construction ā + √muc + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ct > kk
Sanskrit āmukta
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

āya 1.1

masc. coming in; income [ā + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, in comps

Root √i･1 a (come, go)

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

masc. income; revenue; profit; lit. coming in [ā + √i + *a] ✓

Meaning income; revenue; profit; lit. coming in

Synonym udaya, uddaya
Sanskrit āya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

SN 2.23 serīsuttaṃ

Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym apāya
Commentary (ANa) na āyasampannan'ti na udak'āgamanasampannaṃ.
Sanskrit āya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, khettaṃ unnāmaninnāmi ca hoti, pāsāṇasakkharikañ'ca hoti, ūsarañ'ca hoti, na ca gambhīrasitaṃ hoti, na āyasampannaṃ hoti, na apāyasampannaṃ hoti, na mātikāsampannaṃ hoti, na mariyādasampannaṃ hoti.

masc. improvement [ā + √i] ✗

Examples

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 435

nāmato katt'ūpamānā ācār'atthe āyapaccayo hoti. saṅgho pabbatam'iva attānam'ācarati, pabbatāyati, taḷākaṃ samuddam'iva attānam'ācarati, samuddāyati, saddo cicciṭam'iva attānam'ācarati, cicciṭāyati. evam'aññe'pi yojetabbā.

āyatati

pr. ranges over [ā + √yat] ✗

Meaning sense base; internal sense organ; lit. stretching out
Root Family ā √yat
Root √yat･1 a (stretch, strive)
Construction ā + √yat + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (SNa) se āyatane veditabbe, taṃ kāraṇaṃ jānitabban'ti attho.
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit āyatana
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)

Examples

evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, cha kho, āvuso, ajjhattikāni āyatanāni eko anto, cha bāhirāni āyatanāni dutiyo anto, viññāṇaṃ majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
āyatana 4

nt. support; basis; grounds; lit. stretching out [ā + √yat + ana] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning support; basis; grounds; lit. stretching out
Root Family ā √yat
Root √yat･1 a (stretch, strive)
Construction ā + √yat + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym adhikaraṇa, ṭhāna, vatthu
Commentary (SNa) khettaṃ taṃ na hotī'tiādīsu'pi viruhan'aṭṭhena taṃ khettaṃ na hoti, patiṭṭhān'aṭṭhena vatthu na hoti, paccay'aṭṭhena āyatanaṃ na hoti, kāraṇ'aṭṭhena adhikaraṇaṃ na hoti.
Sanskrit āyatana
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)

Examples

yassa kassaci ca abhiññāsacchikaraṇīyassa dhammassa cittaṃ abhininnāmeti abhiññāsacchikiriyāya tatra tatr'eva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

vatthu taṃ na hoti yaṃpaccay'āssa taṃ uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ. āyatanaṃ taṃ na hoti yaṃpaccay'āssa taṃ uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ.

SN 12.25 bhūmijasuttaṃ

Meaning meditation object; meditation subject; lit. stretching out

kismiṃ ṭhito paralokaṃ na bhāye'ti.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
āyati 1

Meaning future; what’s coming

Example

evaṃ pamatto rasagārave ratto,
bālo yadī āyati n'āvabujjhati,

parivattiya attānam'eva khādati.

JA 537 mahāsutasoma jātakaṃ
āyati 2

adj. future; upcoming [ā + √yat + i] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning future; upcoming

Root √yat･1 a (stretch, strive)
