AN 3.113 dutiyanidānasuttaṃ
āyatika 1

adj. upcoming; future [ā + √yat + i + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from āyati
Meaning upcoming; future
Root Family ā √yat
Root √yat･1 a (stretch, strive)
Construction ā + √yat + i + ka
āyati + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym āyati
Sanskrit āyati +
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)

Examples

khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ nava n'atthi sambhavaṃ,
virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ,
te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā,
nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1

tena hi tvaṃ anuruddha āyatikam'pi vass'āvāsaṃ idh'eva cetīsu pācīnavaṃsadāye vihareyyāsī'ti

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
āyatika 2

adj. stretching; extending; expanding [ā + √yat + a + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from āyata
Meaning stretching; extending; expanding
Root Family ā √yat
Root √yat･1 a (stretch, strive)
Construction ā + √yat + a + ika
āyata + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Sanskrit āyatika
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)

Example

yathā vā pana, mahārāja, brāhmaṇamāṇavakānaṃ ... bhūmikampaṃ disādāhaṃ bhumm'antalikkhaṃ jotisaṃ lok'āyatikaṃ sācakkaṃ migacakkaṃ antaracakkaṃ missak'uppādaṃ sakuṇarutaravitaṃ sikkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
āyatika 3

adj. based on [ā + √yat] ✗
āyatikā

fem. tube, water-pipe [ā + √yat] ✗
āyatijātijarāmaraṇiya

adj. leading to birth, old age and death in the future ✗
āyatiṃ

ind. in future [ā + √yat + i + iṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of āyati
Meaning in future
Root Family ā √yat
Root √yat･1 a (stretch, strive)
Construction ā + √yat + i + iṃ
āyati + iṃ
Commentary (MNa) āyatin'ti anāgate
Sanskrit āyati
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)

Examples

tena vattabbo, passasī'ti. āma passāmī'ti. āyatiṃ saṃvareyyāsī'ti

VIN 4.4.125 āpattipaṭikamma vidhi

iti kho, ānanda, kammaṃ khettaṃ, viññāṇaṃ bījaṃ, taṇhā sneho. avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ hīnāya dhātuyā viññāṇaṃ patiṭṭhitaṃ evaṃ āyatiṃ punabbhav'ābhinibbatti hoti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
āyatiṃ saṃvarāya

idiom. for the sake of future restraint; for future prevention ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + masc
Meaning for the sake of future restraint; for future prevention
Sanskrit āyati + saṃvara

Example

accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā, yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, y'āhaṃ evam'akāsiṃ. tassā me, bhante, ayyo ānando accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā'ti.

AN 4.159 bhikkhunīsuttaṃ
āyatta 1

pp. dependent on; reliant on [ā + √yat + ta] ~

Grammar pp of ā √yat
Meaning dependent on; reliant on
Root Family ā √yat
Root √yat･1 a (stretch, strive)
Construction ā + √yat + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Sanskrit āyatta
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)
āyatta 2

pp. possessed [ā + √yat] ✗
āyatta 3

nt. possession [ā + √yat] ✗
āyana

nt. way, act of going [ā + √i] ✗
āyanta

prp. (+acc) approaching; coming; arriving [ā + √yā + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of āyāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning approaching; coming; arriving
Root Family ā √yā
Root √yā･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √yā + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym abhikkamanta, āgacchanta, pāpuṇanta
Sanskrit āyāt
Sanskrit Root √yā 2 (go)

Examples

kiṃsu harantaṃ vārenti,
haranto pana ko piyo,
kiṃsu punappun'āyantaṃ,
abhinandanti paṇḍitā'ti.

SN 1.77 issariyasuttaṃ

coraṃ harantaṃ vārenti,
haranto samaṇo piyo,
samaṇaṃ punappun'āyantaṃ,
abhinandanti paṇḍitā'ti.

SN 1.77 issariyasuttaṃ
āyapaccaya

masc. (gram) āya suffix; used to form denominative verbs [āya + paccaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (gram) āya suffix; used to form denominative verbs
Construction āya + paccaya
Compound kammadhāraya (āya + paccaya)
Sanskrit āya + pratyaya

Example

nāmato katt'ūpamānā ācār'atthe āyapaccayo hoti. saṅgho pabbatam'iva attānam'ācarati, pabbatāyati, taḷākaṃ samuddam'iva attānam'ācarati, samuddāyati, saddo cicciṭam'iva attānam'ācarati, cicciṭāyati. evam'aññe'pi yojetabbā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 435
āyamati 1

pr. (+acc) stretches; stretches out [ā + √yam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning stretches; stretches out
Root Family ā √yam
Root √yam･1 a (support, stretch)
Base √yam + a > yama
Construction ā + yama + ti
Sanskrit āyacchati
Sanskrit Root √yam 1, 2 (reach)

Example

paṭibhātu taṃ, ānanda, kāpilavatthavānaṃ sakyānaṃ sekho pāṭipado. piṭṭhi me āgilāyati, tam'ahaṃ āyamissāmī'ti.

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ
āyamati 2

pr. expands [ā + √yam] ✗
āyamukha

nt. inflow; income; entrance [āya + mukha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning inflow; income; entrance
Construction āya + mukha
Compound kammadhāraya (āya + mukha)
Commentary (DNa) āyamukhan'ti āgamanamaggo.
Sanskrit āya + mukha

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakarahado ubbhid'odako. tassa n'ev'assa puratthimāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ, na pacchimāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ, na uttarāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ, na dakkhiṇāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
āyava 1

nt. strength ✗
āyava 2

nt. energy, power ✗
āyas

masc. life; health; power [ā + √i + *as] ✓

Grammar masc, in comps, mano group
Meaning life; health; power
Root Family ā √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction ā + √i > ay + *as
Derivative kita (*as)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Notes mano-group nouns, while neuter in Sanskrit, are considered to be masculine by classical Pāḷi grammars such as Saddanīti
Sanskrit āyus
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

no ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti parisuddhena kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā kāyikaṃ sikkhassū'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ

ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ
āyasa

adj. made of iron; metal [ayas + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from ayas
Meaning made of iron; metal
Construction ayas > āyas + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit āyasa

Examples

na taṃ daḷhaṃ bandhanam'āhu dhīrā,
yadāyasaṃ dārujapabbajañ'ca,
sārattarattā maṇikuṇḍalesu,
puttesu dāresu ca yā apekkhā.

DHP 345 taṇhāvaggo

tena kho pana samayena vajirapāṇi yakkho āyasaṃ vajiraṃ ādāya ādittaṃ sampajjalitaṃ sajotibhūtaṃ saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa uparivehāsaṃ ṭhito hoti, sac'āyaṃ saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavatā yāvatatiyaṃ sahadhammikaṃ pañhaṃ puṭṭho na byākarissati etth'ev'assa sattadhā muddhaṃ phālessāmī'ti.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
āyasakka

nt. disgrace, ill-repute, dishonour ✗
āyasakya

nt. disgrace; dishonour; ill-repute; infamy [na + yasas + ka + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na yasas, neg
Meaning disgrace; dishonour; ill-repute; infamy
Construction na > a > ā + yasas + ka + *ya
ayasaka + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym yasas
Sanskrit ayaśas

Example

kodhasammadasammatto,
āyasakyaṃ nigacchati,
ñātimittā suhajjā ca,
parivajjanti kodhanaṃ.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
āyasampanna

adj. with a (water) inlet; lit. income succeeded [āya + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a (water) inlet; lit. income succeeded
Construction āya + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (āyena + sampanna)
Antonym apāyasampanna
Commentary (ANa) na āyasampannan'ti na udak'āgamanasampannaṃ.
Sanskrit āya + sampanna

Example

idha, bhikkhave, khettaṃ unnāmaninnāmi ca hoti, pāsāṇasakkharikañ'ca hoti, ūsarañ'ca hoti, na ca gambhīrasitaṃ hoti, na āyasampannaṃ hoti, na apāyasampannaṃ hoti, na mātikāsampannaṃ hoti, na mariyādasampannaṃ hoti.

AN 8.34 khettasuttaṃ
āyasmant 1

masc. venerable; reverend; lit. having age quality [ā + √i + *as + mant] ✓

Grammar masc, from āyas
Meaning venerable; reverend; lit. having age quality
Root Family ā √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction ā + √i > ay + *as + mant
āyas + mant
Derivative taddhita (mant)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Synonym bhadanta, bhadante
Sanskrit āyuṣmat
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu gāmagato vā araññagato vā labhati vattāraṃ, ayañ'ca kho āyasmā evaṃkārī evaṃsamācāro asucigāmakaṇṭako'ti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ
āyasmant 2

adj. long-lived, venerable [ā + √i] ✗
āyasmā

masc. venerable; lit. having age quality [ā + √i + *as + mant + ā] ✓

Grammar masc, nom sg of āyasmant
Meaning venerable; lit. having age quality
Root Family ā √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction ā + √i > ay + *as + mant + ā
āyas + mā
Phonetic Change i > ay
Sanskrit āyuṣmān
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

no ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti parisuddhena kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā kāyikaṃ sikkhassū'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ

imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo'ti? evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.

SN 12.31 bhūtasuttaṃ
āyasmāpi

sandhi. and then venerable; venerable also [āyasmā + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + ind
Meaning and then venerable; venerable also
Construction āyasmā + api
Sanskrit āyuṣmān + api

Examples

nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane. āyasmā'pi kho soṇo bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi. ekam'antaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ soṇaṃ bhagavā etadavoca.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā puṇṇo mantāṇiputto andhavanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṃ nisīdi. āyasmā'pi kho sāriputto andhavanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṃ nisīdi.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
āyāga

masc. gift; sacrifice; religious offering [ā + √yaj + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning gift; sacrifice; religious offering
Root Family ā √yaj
Root √yaj･1 a (honour, sacrifice)
Construction ā + √yaj > yag > yāg + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Synonym bali
Sanskrit āyāga
Sanskrit Root √yaj 1, 2 (offer)

Example

kāye visaṃ na kamati,
satthāni na ca hanti me
udake'haṃ na miyyāmi,
āyāgassa idaṃ phalaṃ.

APA 40 āyāgadāyaka therāpadānaṃ
āyāgaseṭṭha

masc. greatest of offerings ✗
āyācaka

adj. petitioner, applicant [ā + √yāc] ✗
āyācati

pr. (+acc and +acc) begs; prays; implores; entreats; calls on in supplication [ā + √yāc + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, ditrans (+acc and +acc)
Meaning begs; prays; implores; entreats; calls on in supplication
Root Family ā √yāc
Root √yāc･1 a (beg)
Base √yāc + a > yāca
Construction ā + yāca + ti
Synonym abhiyācati
Sanskrit āyācati
Sanskrit Root √yāc 1 (ask)

Example

tam'enaṃ mahā janakāyo saṅgamma samāgamma āyāceyya thomeyya pañjaliko anuparisakkeyya, ayaṃ puriso kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjatū'ti.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ
āyācana

nt. begging; praying; imploring; entreating; supplication [ā + √yāc + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from āyācati
Meaning begging; praying; imploring; entreating; supplication
Root Family ā √yāc
Root √yāc･1 a (beg)
Construction ā + √yāc + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit āyācana
Sanskrit Root √yāc 1 (ask)

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gāmaṇi, api nu so puriso mahato janakāyassa āyācanahetu vā thomanahetu vā pañjalikā anuparisakkanahetu vā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ
āyācanavagga 1

masc. Chapter 3 of the Rādhasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 3 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
āyācanavagga 2

masc. Chapter 12 of Dukanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 2.131-141 ✗
āyācanasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.176 (AN4.176) ✗
āyācanahetu

ind. due to begging; because of imploring ✗
āyācanā

fem. request, application [ā + √yāc] ✗
āyācanta

prp. (+acc and +acc) praying for the wellbeing (of); blessing; wishing well [ā + √yāc + a + nta] ~

Grammar prp of āyācati, ditrans (+acc and +acc)
Meaning praying for the wellbeing (of); blessing; wishing well
Root Family ā √yāc
Root √yāc･1 a (beg)
Base √yāc + a > yāca
Construction ā + yāca + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Antonym oyācati
Sanskrit āyācat
Sanskrit Root √yāc 1 (ask)
āyācamāna

prp. imploring [ā + √yāc] ✗
āyāci

aor. requested, implored [ā + √yāc] ✗
āyācita

pp. requested, implored [ā + √yāc] ✗
āyācitabhattajātaka

nt. Jātaka 19 (JA 19) ✗
āyācituṃ

inf. (+acc and +acc) to beg; to pray; to implore; to entreat; to call on in supplication [ā + √yāc + a + ituṃ] ~

Grammar inf of āyācituṃ, ditrans (+acc and +acc)
Meaning to beg; to pray; to implore; to entreat; to call on in supplication
Root Family ā √yāc
Root √yāc･1 a (beg)
Base √yāc + a > yāca
Construction ā + yāca + ituṃ
Sanskrit āyācitum
Sanskrit Root √yāc 1 (ask)
āyācitvā

abs. (+acc) having begged; having prayed; having implored [ā + √yāc + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of āyācati, ditrans (+acc)
Meaning having begged; having prayed; having implored
Root Family ā √yāc
Root √yāc･1 a (beg)
Construction ā + √yāc + itvā
Sanskrit āyācitvā
Sanskrit Root √yāc 1 (ask)
āyāta

pp. come, approached [ā + √yā] ✗
āyāti

pr. (+acc) approaches; goes (to) [ā + √yā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning approaches; goes (to)
Root Family ā √yā
Root √yā･1 a (go)
Base √yā + a > yā
Construction ā + yā + ti
Synonym upayāti, upasaṅkamati
Sanskrit āyāti
Sanskrit Root √yā 2 (go)

Examples

āyāmi-āvuso, yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamissāma. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocessāma. yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā'ti.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate. atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, āyāma, bhikkhave, yena paṭibhānakūṭo ten'upasaṅkamissāma divāvihārāyā'ti.

SN 56.42 papātasuttaṃ
āyāma 1.1

imp. (+acc) let us go! we should go! [ā + √yā + āma] ✓

Grammar imp 1st pl of āyātu, trans (+acc)
Meaning let us go! we should go!
Root Family ā √yā
Root √yā･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √yā + āma
Sanskrit āyāma
Sanskrit Root √yā 2 (go)

Examples

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate. atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, āyāma, bhikkhave, yena paṭibhānakūṭo ten'upasaṅkamissāma divāvihārāyā'ti.

SN 56.42 papātasuttaṃ

upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahācundaṃ etad'avoca, āyām'āvuso cunda, yen'āyasmā channo ten'upasaṅkamissāma gilānapucchakā'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
āyāma 2.1

masc. effort; striving; exertion; endeavour; lit. stretching [ā + √yam + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āyamati
Meaning effort; striving; exertion; endeavour; lit. stretching
Root Family ā √yam
Root √yam･1 a (control, strive, end)
Construction ā + √yam > yām + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym appaṭivānī, upakkama, ussāha, nikkama, paggaha, paggāha, yoga
Variant vāyāma
Commentary (SNa) atthi āyāman'ti atthi vīriyaṃ.
Sanskrit āyāma (stretching)
Sanskrit Root √yam 1 (reach)

Example

chando ca vūpasanto hoti, vitakko ca vūpasanto hoti, saññā ca vūpasantā hoti, tappaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ, appattassa pattiyā atthi āyāmaṃ, tasmim'pi ṭhāne anuppatte tappaccayā'pi vedayitan'ti.

SN 45.11 paṭhamavihārasuttaṃ
āyāma 3.1

masc. stretch; flex; extension [ā + √yam + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from āyamati
Meaning stretch; flex; extension
Root Family ā √yam
Root √yam･1 a (support, stretch)
Construction ā + √yam > yām + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit Root √yam 1, 2 (reach)
āyāma 3.2

adj. having the length of [ā + √yam] ✗
āyāma 3.3

masc. length [ā + √yam] ✗
āyāmato

ind. in length; lengthwise [ā + √yam + *a + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of āyāma
Meaning in length; lengthwise
Root Family ā √yam
Root √yam･1 a (support, stretch)
Construction ā + √yam > yām + *a + to
āyāma + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym vitthārato
Synonym dīghato, dīghaso
Sanskrit āyāmatas
Sanskrit Root √yam 1, 2 (reach)

Example

ñattidutiyena kammena kuṭivatthuṃ na desāpetvā, āyāmato vā vitthārato vā antamaso kes'aggamattam'pi atikkāmetvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge payoge dukkaṭaṃ.

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ
āyāmānanda

sandhi. come Ānanda!; let's go Ānanda! [āyāma + ānanda] ✓

Grammar sandhi, imp + masc
Meaning come Ānanda!; let's go Ānanda!
Construction āyāma + ānanda
Sanskrit āyāma + ānanda

Example

sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi, āyām'ānanda, yena pubb'ārāmo migāramātupāsādo ten'upasaṅkamissāma divāvihārāyā'ti.

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ
āyāmāvuso

sandhi. let us go friend [āyāma + āvuso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, imp + masc
Meaning let us go friend
Construction āyāma + āvuso
Sanskrit āyāmaḥ + āyusmanto

Examples

atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāy'anhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yen'āyasmā mahācundo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahācundaṃ etadavoca, āyām'āvuso cunda, yen'āyasmā channo ten'upasaṅkamissāma gilānapucchakā'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno sāy'anhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yen'āyasmā mahākassapo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahākassapaṃ etadavoca, āyām'āvuso, kassapa, yen'āyasmā sāriputto ten'upasaṅkamissāma dhammassavanāyā'ti.

āyāsa

masc. trouble; trial; tribulation; affliction; adversity [ā + √yas + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning trouble; trial; tribulation; affliction; adversity
Root Family ā √yas
Root √yas×3 ya (strive, struggle)
Construction ā + √yas > yās + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anāyāsa
Synonym upāyāsa, vighāta
Sanskrit āyāsa
Sanskrit Root √yas 1, 3, 4 (be heated)

Example

katamo ca, bhikkhave, upāyāso? yo kho, bhikkhave, aññatar'aññatarena byasanena samannāgatassa aññatar'aññatarena dukkhadhammena phuṭṭhassa āyāso upāyāso āyāsitattaṃ upāyāsitattaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, upāyāso

Meaning life

āyusā ekaputtam'anurakkhe,
evam'pi sabbabhūtesu,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

yadā kho, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ tayo dhammā jahanti, āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, ath'āyaṃ kāyo ujjhito avakkhitto seti, yathā kaṭṭhaṃ acetanan'ti.

āyuṃ arogiyaṃ vaṇṇaṃ,
saggaṃ uccākulīnataṃ,
ratiyo patthayantena,

Meaning age

pārāyanavaggo 0

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
āyuta

Grammar pp of ā √yu (+instr)
Meaning mixed (with); combined (with); attached (to); lit. fastened

Root √yu×1 a (unite, fasten)
Construction ā + √yu + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym missita, vokiṇṇa, saṃyutta, saṃsaṭṭha

Commentary (SNPa) nārīvaragaṇ'āyutan'ti varanārīgaṇasaṃyuttaṃ.

Example

nārīvaragaṇ'āyutaṃ,
uḷāraṃ mānusaṃ bhogaṃ,
abhijjhāyiṃsu brāhmaṇā.

SNP 19 brāhmaṇadhammikasuttaṃ
āyutta

pp. (+loc) engaged (in); devoted (to); pursuing; lit. yoked [ā + √yuj + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of āyuñjati (+loc)
Meaning engaged (in); devoted (to); pursuing; lit. yoked

Root √yuj･2 ṃa (yoke, join)
Construction ā + √yuj + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change j > t
Synonym payutta, pasuta, yuta
Commentary (SNa) āyuttā'ti tapojigucchane yuttapayuttā.
Sanskrit āyukta
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

Example

tapojigucchāya āyuttā,
pālayaṃ pavivekiyaṃ,
rūpe ca ye niviṭṭhāse,
devalok'ābhinandino,
te ve samm'ānusāsanti,
paralokāya mātiyā'ti.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
āyussa

adj. giving long life ✗
āyuhati

pr. thrusts forward, pushes forward (intransitive); struggles, strains, exerts oneself (especially in water); pursues, works at [ā + √yūh] ✗

masc. thrusting; striving; exertion ✗
āyūhaka

adj. active, who strives or collects [ā + √yūh] ✗

Examples

SN 1.1 oghataraṇasuttaṃ

n'atthi kiccaṃ brāhmaṇassa,
katakicco hi brāhmaṇo,
yāva na gādhaṃ labhati nadīsu,
āyūhati sabbagattebhi jantu,
gādhañ'ca laddhāna thale ṭhito yo,
n'āyūhatī pāragato hi so'va.

aor. strived [ā + √yūh] ✗
āyūhi 2

aor. accumulated [ā + √yūh] ✗
āyūhi 3

aor. swam [ā + √yūh] ✗

āyūhita 2

pp. accumulated [ā + √yūh] ✗
āyūhita 3

pp. swum [ā + √yūh] ✗
āyūhitakamma

nt. action that requires effort; intended action [āyūhita + kamma] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning action that requires effort; intended action
Construction āyūhita + kamma
Compound kammadhāraya (āyūhita + kamma)
Sanskrit āyūhita (bsk) + karman
āyoga 1

masc. (+loc) devotion (to); practice (of); exertion (in); pursuit (of); lit. yoking [ā + √yuj + *e + a] ✓

Grammar masc, caus (+loc)
Meaning devotion (to); practice (of); exertion (in); pursuit (of); lit. yoking
Root Family ā √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ā + yoje > yoge + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Synonym anuyoga
Sanskrit āyoga
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

Examples

anūpavādo anūpaghāto,
pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ,
pantañ'ca sayan'āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo,
etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

DHP 185 buddhavaggo

dujjānaṃ kho etaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, tayā aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatr'āyogena aññatr'ācariyakena, saññā purisassa attā'ti vā, aññā'va saññā añño attā'ti vā'ti.

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā
āyoga 2

masc. exertion [ā + √yuj] ✗
āyoga 3

masc. bandage [ā + √yuj] ✗
āra 1

suffix. (gram) āra; causative suffix added to nouns ✓

Grammar suffix
Meaning (gram) āra; causative suffix added to nouns

Example

caggahaṇena āra āla'icc'ete paccayā honti. santaṃ karoti, santārati, upakkamaṃ karoti, upakkamālati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 439
āra 2

masc. needle ✗
āraka

adj. distant, far from [ādi] ✗
ārakatta

nt. state of being far from [ā + √ar] ✗
ārakā 1

ind. (+abl) far (from); far away (from) [ā + √ar + a + ka + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, prep, abl sg of āraka (+abl)
Meaning far (from); far away (from)
Root Family ā √ar
Root √ar･1 a (move, attain)
Construction ā + √ar + a + ka + ā
āraka + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Commentary (MNa) ārakā ahaṃ, bhante'ti pathavito nabhaṃ viya samuddassa orimatīrato paratīraṃ viya ca suvidūr'avidūre ahaṃ.
Sanskrit ārāt, ārakāt
Sanskrit Root √ṛ 1 (go, send)

Examples

tapanīyāni kammāni,
yāni dhammehi ārakā,
tāni ārocayissāmi,
taṃ suṇātha yathā tathaṃ.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ, ārakā udakā thale nikkhittaṃ. atha puriso āgaccheyya uttar'āraṇiṃ ādāya aggiṃ abhinibbattessāmi, tejo pātukarissāmī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ārakā 2

Grammar ind, prep, abl sg of āraka (+abl)

yathā jānāmi taṃ ahaṃ,
ārakā parivajjeyya,
gūthaṭṭhānaṃ'va pāvuse.

TH 263 mahāmoggallānattheragāthā
ārakūṭa

masc. brass ✗
ārakkha 1

masc. guard; watchman; protector [ā + √rakkh + a] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from ārakkhati

Root Family ā √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Construction ā + √rakkh + a

Synonym ārakkhaka, pāla, pālaka, rakkhitar
Sanskrit ārakṣa
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ. kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca pamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otaritvā yāva'd'atthaṃ madaṃ āpajjeyya pamādaṃ āpajjeyya.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

tassa heṭṭhā kumārassa sayanaṃ paññapetvā upari suvaṇṇatārakakhacitaṃ vitānaṃ bandhāpetvā sāṇipākārena parikkhipāpetvā ārakkhaṃ ṭhapetvā rājā sabb'ālaṅkāraṃ alaṅkaritvā amaccagaṇaparivuto naṅgalakaraṇaṭṭhānaṃ agamāsi.

MNa 36 mahāsaccakasutavaṇṇanā
ārakkha 2

masc. protection; preservation; safe-keeping; safeguarding [ā + √rakkh + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ārakkhati
Meaning protection; preservation; safe-keeping; safeguarding
Root Family ā √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Construction ā + √rakkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ārakṣa
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi, ye'me pañca kāmaguṇā cetaso samphuṭṭhapubbā atītā niruddhā vipariṇatā, tatra me attarūpena appamādo sati cetaso ārakkho karaṇīyo.

SN 35.117 kāmaguṇasuttaṃ

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yaṃ bhattā āharati dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā taṃ ārakkhena guttiyā sampādeti, tattha ca hoti adhuttī athenī asoṇḍī avināsikā.

ārakkhati

pr. (+acc) guards; watches over; protects [ā + √rakkh + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning guards; watches over; protects
Root Family ā √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Base √rakkh + a > rakkha
Construction ā + rakkha + ti
Synonym anurakkhati, gopeti, pāleti, rakkhati
Variant sārakkhati
Commentary (ANa) na ārakkhatī'ti na rakkhati.
Sanskrit ārakṣati
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)
ārakkhanirodha

masc. ending of safeguarding; cessation of safekeeping ✗
ārakkhanta

prp. (+acc) guarding; watching over; protecting [ā + √rakkh + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ārakkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning guarding; watching over; protecting
Root Family ā √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Base √rakkh + a > rakkha
Construction ā + rakkha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym anurakkhamāna, gopayanta, pālayanta, rakkhanta
Sanskrit ārakṣat
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

Example

tassa evaṃ ārakkhato gopayato te bhoge rājāno vā haranti, corā vā haranti, aggi vā dahati, udakaṃ vā vahati, appiyā vā dāy'ādā haranti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, yam'pi me ahosi tam'pi no n'atthī'ti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
ārakkhasatī

adj. with mindfulness on guard; watched over by awareness [ārakkha + satī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with mindfulness on guard; watched over by awareness
Construction ārakkha + satī
Commentary (ANa) ārakkhasatino'ti dvārarakkhikāya satiyā samannāgatā.
ārakkhasampadā

fem. (of wealth) successfully protecting; accomplishment in preservation [ārakkha + sampadā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning (of wealth) successfully protecting; accomplishment in preservation
Construction ārakkha + sampadā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ārakkhassa + sampadā)
Sanskrit ārakṣa + sampradā

Example

te ārakkhena guttiyā sampādeti, kin'ti me ime bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi ḍaheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāyādā hareyyun'ti! ayaṃ vuccati, byagghapajja, ārakkhasampadā.

AN 8.54 dīghajāṇusuttaṃ
ārakkhasampanna

adj. having a bodyguard; with protection [ārakkha + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having a bodyguard; with protection
Construction ārakkha + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ārakkhena + sampanna)
Sanskrit ārakṣa + sampanna

Example

seyyathā'pi, āvuso yamaka, gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo, so ca ārakkhasampanno. tassa koci'd'eva puriso uppajjeyya anatthakāmo ahitakāmo ayogakkhemakāmo jīvitā voropetu'kāmo.

āracayāracayā

fem. arranging again and again; pulling this way and that ✗
ārajayārajayā

fem. scoring again and again ✗
ārañjita 1

pp. (+instr) marked (by); furrowed (by); slashed (by); scratched (by); grooved (by) [ā + √rañj + ita] ✓

Meaning marked (by); furrowed (by); slashed (by); scratched (by); grooved (by)
Root Family ā √rañj
Root √rañj×1 ya (scratch)
Construction ā + √rañj + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Commentary (MNa) uccā ca dantehi ārañjitānī'ti satt'aṭṭharatan'ubbedhe vaṭarukkh'ādīnaṃ khandhappadese pharasunā pahataṭṭhānaṃ viya dāṭṭhāhi chinnaṭṭhānaṃ.
Sanskrit ā + rañjita
Sanskrit Root √rañj √raj 1, 4 (colour)

Example

so tam'anugacchati. tam'anugacchanto passati nāgavane mahantaṃ hatthipadaṃ, dīghato ca āyataṃ, tiriyañ'ca vitthataṃ, uccā ca nisevitaṃ, uccā ca dantehi ārañjitāni.

Example

idam'pi vuccati, brāhmaṇa, tathāgatapadaṃ iti'pi, tathāgatanisevitaṃ iti'pi, tathāgat'ārañjitaṃ iti'pi. na tv'eva tāva ariyasāvako niṭṭhaṃ gacchati, sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho'ti.

AN 5.114 andhakavindasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso āraññiko hoti. so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi āraññiko ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na āraññikā'ti. so tena āraññikattena attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

āraññikaṅga

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

so paṭipadaṃ'y'eva antaraṃ karitvā tena āraññikattena n'ev'attān'ukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.181 (AN5.181) ✗
ārata

KHP 5 maṅgalasuttaṃ
āratta

nt. time period; season; lit. died; tinted [ā + √raj + ta] ✓

Meaning time period; season; lit. died; tinted

Root √raj･1 a (colour)

Commentary (SDt) vassāratto'ti vassakālo
Sanskrit ārakta
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Example

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
āraddha 1.1

pp. aroused; applied; undertaken [ā + √rabh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ārabhati
Meaning aroused; applied; undertaken
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (begin)
Construction ā + √rabh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change bht > ddh
Antonym asāraddha
Sanskrit ārabdha
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Examples

yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathā vūpakaṭṭho viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ anussarati anuvitakketi, satisambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, satisambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ

āraddhaṃ kho pana me, brāhmaṇa, vīriyaṃ ahosi asallīnaṃ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṃ cittaṃ ekaggaṃ

VIN 1.0 verañjakaṇḍaṃ
āraddha 2.1

pp. won; accomplished; succeeded [ā + √rādh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ārādheti
Meaning won; accomplished; succeeded
Root Family ā √rādh
Root √rādh･3 ya (succeed, please)
Construction ā + √rādh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Antonym viraddha
Synonym sampanna
Sanskrit rāddha
Sanskrit Root √rādh 4, 5 (succeed)

Examples

catūhi kho, visākhe, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo idhalokavijayāya paṭipanno hoti, ayaṃsa loko āraddho hoti. katamehi catūhi?

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

catūhi kho, visākhe, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo paralokavijayāya paṭipanno hoti, paraloko āraddho hoti. katamehi catūhi?

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
āraddha 2.2

pp. (+instr) pleased (with); satisfied (with); contented (with) [ā + √rādh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ārādheti (+instr)
Meaning pleased (with); satisfied (with); contented (with)
Root Family ā √rādh
Root √rādh･3 ya (succeed, please)
Construction ā + √rādh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Synonym abhiraddha, tuṭṭha, patīta, santappita, santuṭṭha, santusita
Commentary (MNa) āraddho'ti tuṭṭho.
Sanskrit ārādhita
Sanskrit Root √rādh 4, 5 (succeed)

Example

atha kho bhagavā tuṇhībhūtaṃ tuṇhībhūtaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ anuviloketvā bhikkhū āmantesi, āraddho'smi, bhikkhave, imāya paṭipadāya, āraddhacitto'smi, bhikkhave, imāya paṭipadāya.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
āraddhacitta 1

adj. (+instr) satisfied (with); lit. accomplished mind [āraddha + citta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+instr)
Meaning satisfied (with); lit. accomplished mind
Construction āraddha + citta
Compound kammadhāraya (āraddha + citta)
Synonym dhāta
Commentary (MNa) āraddho'ti tuṭṭho.
Sanskrit rāddha + citta

Example

atha kho bhagavā tuṇhībhūtaṃ tuṇhībhūtaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ anuviloketvā bhikkhū āmantesi, āraddho'smi, bhikkhave, imāya paṭipadāya, āraddhacitto'smi, bhikkhave, imāya paṭipadāya.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
āraddhacitta 2

adj. (+instr) in agreement (with); decided (about); settled (about); lit. accomplished mind [āraddha + citta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+instr)
Meaning in agreement (with); decided (about); settled (about); lit. accomplished mind
Construction āraddha + citta
Compound kammadhāraya (āraddha + citta)
Commentary (MNa) āraddho'ti tuṭṭho.
Sanskrit rāddha + citta

Example

catunnaṃ māsānaṃ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājenti, upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya. api ca m'ettha puggalavemattatā viditā'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
āraddhavipassaka

adj. who has undertaken insight practice [āraddha + vipassaka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has undertaken insight practice
Construction āraddha + vipassaka
Sanskrit ārabdha + vipaśyaka (bsk)
āraddhaviriya

adj. (+dat) strenuous ✗
āraddhavīriya 1

adj. (+dat) energetic (in); with energy aroused (to); applying energy (to); making an effort (to) [āraddha + vīriya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+dat)
Meaning energetic (in); with energy aroused (to); applying energy (to); making an effort (to)
Construction āraddha + vīriya
Compound kammadhāraya (āraddha + vīriya)
Antonym kusīta, hīnavīriya
Variant āraddhaviriya
Commentary (SNa) āraddhavīriyo'ti paggahitavīriyo paripuṇṇavīriyo.
Sanskrit ārabdha + vīrya

Examples

sabbadā sīlasampanno,
paññavā susamāhito,
āraddhavīriyo pahit'atto,
oghaṃ tarati duttaraṃ.

SN 2.15 candanasuttaṃ

vīriyasambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati. āraddhavīriyassa uppajjati pīti nirāmisā.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ
āraddhavīriya 2

masc. who is energetic; who applies oneself; who makes an effort [āraddha + vīriya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning who is energetic; who applies oneself; who makes an effort
Construction āraddha + vīriya
Compound kammadhāraya > bahubbīhi (āraddha + vīriya)
Antonym kusīta, hīnavīriya
Variant āraddhaviriya
Commentary (SNa) āraddhavīriyo ca kho, bhikkhave'ti āraddhavīriyo puggalo imasmiṃ'y'eva sāsane sukhaṃ viharati. bāhirasamaye pana yo āraddhavīriyo, so dukkhaṃ viharati.
Sanskrit ārabdha + vīrya

Example

āraddhavīriyo ca kho, bhikkhave, sukhaṃ viharati pavivitto pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañ'ca sadatthaṃ paripūreti. na, bhikkhave, hīnena aggassa patti hoti.

SN 12.22 dutiyadasabalasuttaṃ
āraddhavīriyatā

fem. fact of being energetic; fact of having aroused energy; fact of making an effort [āraddha + vīriya + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from āraddhavīriya
Meaning fact of being energetic; fact of having aroused energy; fact of making an effort
Construction āraddha + vīriya + tā
āraddhavīriya + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit ārabdha + vīrya +

Example

etam'ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, āraddhavīriyataṃ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomam'āpādiṃ araññe vihārāya.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
āraddhavīriyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 37.22 (SN37.22) ✗
āraddhā

abs. having begun or started [ā + √rabh] ✗
ārapatha

masc. path of a needle ✗
ārabbha 1

ger. (+acc) bringing forth; arousing; initiating; lit. beginning with [ā + √rabh + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of ārabhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning bringing forth; arousing; initiating; lit. beginning with
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (begin)
Construction ā + √rabh + ya
Phonetic Change bhy > bbh
Sanskrit ārabhya
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Example

okkhittacakkhu na ca pādalolo,
jhān'ānuyutto bahujāgarassa,
upekkham'ārabbha samāhit'atto,
takk'āsayaṃ kukkucciy'ūpachinde.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
ārabbha 2

ind. (+acc) concerning; referring (to); regarding; at the expense (of); owing to; lit. beginning with [ā + √rabh + ya] ✓

Grammar ind, prep, ger of ārabhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning concerning; referring (to); regarding; at the expense (of); owing to; lit. beginning with
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (begin)
Construction ā + √rabh + ya
Phonetic Change bhy > bbh
Synonym adhi, adhikicca
Commentary (MNa) ārabbhā'ti sandhāya.
Sanskrit ārabhya
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Examples

atīte, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando jāyati.

AN 3.113 dutiyanidānasuttaṃ

ujugatam'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti sīlaṃ ārabbha.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ
ārabbhati

pr. (+acc) rouses oneself; starts; gets going [ā + √rabh + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning rouses oneself; starts; gets going
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (be aroused, violent)
Base √rabh + a > rabha > rabbha (irreg)
Construction ā + rabbha + ti
Synonym ārambhati
Commentary (SNa) ārambhathā'ti ārambhavīriyaṃ karotha.
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)
ārabbhadhātu

fem. fact of beginning; fact of undertaking; fact of initiation [ārabbha + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of beginning; fact of undertaking; fact of initiation
Construction ārabbha + dhātu
Compound kammadhāraya (ārabbha + dhātu)
Commentary (ANa) ārambhadhātū'ti ārabhanavasena pavattavīriyaṃ.
Sanskrit ārabhya + dhātu

Example

yaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, ārabbhadhātuyā sati ārabbhavanto sattā paññāyanti, ayaṃ sattānaṃ attakāro ayaṃ parakāro.

AN 6.38 attakārīsuttaṃ
ārabbhamāna

prp. (+acc) arousing; initiating; getting going [ā + √rabh + a + māna] ~

Grammar prp of ārabbhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning arousing; initiating; getting going
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (be aroused, violent)
Base √rabh + a > rabha > rabbha (irreg)
Construction ā + rabbha + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Commentary (SNa) ārabbhamāno'vā'ti kurumāno'y'eva.
Sanskrit ārabhamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)
ārabbhavant

adj. with initiative; able to initiate; lit. having starting quality [ā + √rabh + ya + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from ārabbha
Meaning with initiative; able to initiate; lit. having starting quality
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (begin)
Construction ā + √rabh + ya + vant
ārabbha + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change bhy > bbh
Sanskrit ārabhyatva
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, atthi ārabbhadhātū'ti? evaṃ, bho. ārabbhadhātuyā sati ārabbhavanto sattā paññāyantī'ti? evaṃ, bho. yaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, ārabbhadhātuyā sati ārabbhavanto sattā paññāyanti, ayaṃ sattānaṃ attakāro ayaṃ parakāro.

AN 6.38 attakārīsuttaṃ
ārabhati 1.1

pr. (+acc) begins; starts; undertakes; arouses oneself (to); makes an effort (to) [ā + √rabh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning begins; starts; undertakes; arouses oneself (to); makes an effort (to)

Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Examples

ārabbhatha nikkhamatha,
yuñjatha buddhasāsane,
dhunātha maccuno senaṃ,
naḷ'āgāraṃ'va kuñjaro.

SN 6.14 aruṇavatīsuttaṃ

kammaṃ kho pana me karontassa kāyo kilamissati. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti. so nipajjati, na vīriyaṃ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.

AN 8.80 kusītārambhavatthusuttaṃ
ārabhati 2.1

pr. (+acc) kills; slaughters [ā + √rabh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning kills; slaughters
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (be aroused, violent)
Base √rabh + a > rabha
Construction ā + rabha + ti
Synonym ghātayati
Variant ārambhati
Commentary (MNa) ārabhantī'ti ghātenti.
Sanskrit ārabhate
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Examples

sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ uddissa pāṇaṃ ārabhanti, taṃ samaṇo gotamo jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman'ti.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ

yam'pi so evam'āha, gacchatha imaṃ pāṇaṃ ārabhathā'ti, iminā tatiyena ṭhānena bahuṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ
ārabhatisutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.142 (AN5.142) ✗
ārabhana

nt. starting of, beginning [ā + √rabh] ✗
ārabhanta 1

prp. (+acc) beginning; starting; undertaking; arousing [ā + √rabh + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ārabhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning beginning; starting; undertaking; arousing
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (begin)
Base √rabh + a > rabha
Construction ā + rabha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit ārabhat
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Examples

yo ca vassasataṃ jīve,
kusīto hīnavīriyo,
ek'āhaṃ jīvitaṃ seyyo,
vīriyam'ārabhato daḷhaṃ.

DHP 112 sahassavaggo

tañ'ca pana ārabhantena paṭhamaṃ piyapuggal'ādīsu na ārabhitabbā. piyo hi piyaṭṭhāne'y'eva tiṭṭhati. atippiyasahāyako atippiyasahāyakaṭṭhāne'y'eva.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
ārabhanta 2

prp. (+acc) referring to [ā + √rabh] ✗

Root √rabh･1 a (begin)
Construction ā + √rabh + i
Sanskrit ārambhi
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (begin)
Construction ā + √rabh + i
Sanskrit ārambhi
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)
ārabhi 2.1

aor. (+acc) killed, tortured [ā + √rabh] ✗
ārabhitabba

Sanskrit ārabhyatva
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Examples

karuṇaṃ bhāvetu'kāmena pana nikkaruṇatāya ādīnavaṃ karuṇāya ca ānisaṃsaṃ paccavekkhitvā karuṇābhāvanā ārabhitabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

tañ'ca pana ārabhantena paṭhamaṃ piyapuggal'ādīsu na ārabhitabbā. piyo hi piyaṭṭhāne'y'eva tiṭṭhati. atippiyasahāyako atippiyasahāyakaṭṭhāne'y'eva.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
ārabhituṃ

inf. (+acc) to begin; to start; to undertake; to arouse [ā + √rabh] ✗
ārabhitvā

abs. (+acc) having begun; having started; having undertaken [ā + √rabh + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ārabhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having begun; having started; having undertaken
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (begin)
Construction ā + √rabh + itvā
Sanskrit ārabhya
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Example

so, duggataṃ durūpetan'ti pāḷiyā na sameti, tasmā vuttanayen'ev'ettha bhāvanam'ārabhitvā sīmāsambhedaṃ katvā appanā vaḍḍhetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
ārabhiyamāna

prp. being killed; being slaughtered [ā + √rabh + iya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of ārabhiyamāno, pass, intrans
Meaning being killed; being slaughtered
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 iya (be aroused, violent)
Base √rabh + iya > rabhiya (pass)
Construction ā + rabhiya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym vajjhamāna
Commentary (MNa) ārabhiyamāno'ti māriyamāno.
Sanskrit ārabhyamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Example

yam'pi so pāṇo ārabhiyamāno dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, iminā catutthena ṭhānena bahuṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ
āramaṇa 1

nt. enjoying; delighting (in) [ā + √ram] ✗
āramaṇa 2

nt. act of shunning, shrinking [ā + √ram] ✗
āramati

pr. ceases, stops; leaves off; keeps away (from) [ā + √ram] ✗
ārambha 1.1

masc. arousing energy; making an effort; initiative; lit. beginning [ā + √rabh + a + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ārabhati
Meaning arousing energy; making an effort; initiative; lit. beginning
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (begin)
Base √rabh + a > rabha > rambha (irreg)
Construction ā + rambha + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym anārambha
Synonym vīriyārambha
Notes see ārambha 3
Sanskrit ārambha
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Examples

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ n'uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ pahīyati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ārambhadhātu nikkamadhātu parakkamadhātu

AN 1.18 nīvaraṇappahānavaggo

vīriya-arambhāya saṃvattanti, no kosajjāya, subharatāya saṃvattanti, no dubbharatāyā

AN 8.53 saṃkhittasuttaṃ
ārambha 1.2

masc. mental activity; karmic action; intentional behaviour; lit. beginning [ā + √rabh + a + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ārabhati
Meaning mental activity; karmic action; intentional behaviour; lit. beginning
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (begin)
Base √rabh + a > rabha > rambha (irreg)
Construction ā + rambha + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym anārambha
Sanskrit ārambha
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Examples

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti sabbaṃ ārambhapaccayā'ti, ayam'ek'ānupassanā. ārambhānaṃ tv'eva asesavirāganirodhā n'atthi dukkhassa sambhavo'ti, ayaṃ dutiy'ānupassanā.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti,
sabbaṃ ārambhapaccayā,
ārambhānaṃ nirodhena,
n'atthi dukkhassa sambhavo.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
ārambha 1.3

masc. beginning; attempting; undertaking [ā + √rabh] ✗
ārambha 2.1

masc. act of violence; murder; slaughter [ā + √rabh + a + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ārabhati
Meaning act of violence; murder; slaughter
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (be aroused, violent)
Base √rabh + a > rabha > rambha (irreg)
Construction ā + rambha + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym anārambha
Synonym vadha, saṃghāta, sārambha
Variant ārabbha
Commentary (SNt) mah'ārambhā'ti bahupasughātakammā.
Notes see ārambha 1
Sanskrit ārambha
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Example

assamedhaṃ purisamedhaṃ,
sammāpāsaṃ vājapeyyaṃ niraggaḷhaṃ,
mahāyaññā mah'ārambhā,
na te honti mahapphalā.

SN 3.9 yaññasuttaṃ
ārambhaja

adj. generated by impulsiveness; (comm) produced by transgression [ārambha + ja] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning generated by impulsiveness; (comm) produced by transgression
Construction ārambha + ja
Commentary (ANa) ārambhajā'ti āpattivītikkamasambhavā.
ārambhati 1.1

pr. (+acc) begins; starts; initiates; undertakes; rouses oneself [ā + √rabh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning begins; starts; initiates; undertakes; rouses oneself
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (begin)
Base √rabh + a > rabha > rambha (irreg)
Construction ā + rambha + ti
Synonym samārabbhati, samārambhati
Variant ārabbhati, ārabhati
Commentary (SNa) tattha ārambhathā'ti ārambhavīriyaṃ karotha. nikkamathā'ti nikkamavīriyaṃ karotha. yuñjathā'ti payogaṃ karotha parakkamatha.
Sanskrit ārabh, ārabhate
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Example

ārambhatha nikkhamatha,
yuñjatha buddhasāsane,
dhunātha maccuno senaṃ,
naḷ'āgāraṃ'va kuñjaro.

SN 6.14 aruṇavatīsuttaṃ
ārambhati 2.1

pr. (+acc) kills; slaughters; harms [ā + √rabh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning kills; slaughters; harms
Root Family ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (be aroused, violent)
Base √rabh + a > rabha > rambha (irreg)
Construction ā + rambha + ti
Synonym vadheti, hiṃsati
Variant ārabhati
Commentary (MNa) ārabhantī'ti ghātenti.
Sanskrit ārabhate
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Example

sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ uddissa pāṇaṃ ārambhanti, taṃ samaṇo gotamo jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman'ti.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
ārambhadhātu

fem. arousing energy; initiative; (comm) first effort; lit. beginning state [ārambha + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning arousing energy; initiative; (comm) first effort; lit. beginning state
Construction ārambha + dhātu
Compound kammadhāraya (ārambha + dhātu)
Variant ārabbhadhātu
Commentary (SNa) ārambhadhātū'ti paṭham'ārambhavīriyaṃ.
Sanskrit ārambha + dhātu

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ n'uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ pahīyati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ārambhadhātu nikkamadhātu parakkamadhātu

AN 1.18 nīvaraṇappahānavaggo
ārambhadhātu nikkamadhātu parakkamadhātu

idiom. getting up; going out and making an effort ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + fem + fem
Meaning getting up; going out and making an effort
Commentary (SNa) ārambhadhātū'ti paṭham'ārambhavīriyaṃ. nikkamadhātū'ti kosajjato nikkhantattā tato balavataraṃ. parakkamadhātū'ti paraṃ paraṃ ṭhānaṃ akkamanatāya tato'pi balavataran'ti tīhi'pi padehi vīriyam'eva kathitaṃ.

Examples

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ n'uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ pahīyati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ārambhadhātu nikkamadhātu parakkamadhātu

AN 1.18 nīvaraṇappahānavaggo

atthi, bhikkhave, ārambhadhātu nikkamadhātu parakkamadhātu. tattha yonisomanasikārabahulīkāro, ayam'āhāro anuppannassa vā vīriyasambojjh'aṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā vīriyasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.

SN 46.2 kāyasuttaṃ
ārambhapaccayā

ind. dependent on activity; due to karmic action; lit. from condition of undertaking [ārambha + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of ārambhapaccaya
Meaning dependent on activity; due to karmic action; lit. from condition of undertaking
Construction ārambha + paccaya + ā
ārambhapaccaya + ā
Commentary (SNPa) ārambhapaccayā'ti kammasampayuttavīriyapaccayā
Sanskrit ārambha + pratyayāt

Examples

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti sabbaṃ ārambhapaccayā

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti,
sabbaṃ ārambhapaccayā,
ārambhānaṃ nirodhena,
n'atthi dukkhassa sambhavo.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
ārambhavatthu

nt. grounds for arousing energy; basis for making an effort [ārambha + vatthu] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning grounds for arousing energy; basis for making an effort
Construction ārambha + vatthu
Compound catutthī tappurisa (ārambhassa + vatthu)
Commentary (ANa) ārambhavatthūnī'ti vīriyakāraṇāni.
Sanskrit ārambha + vastu

Example

aṭṭh'imāni, bhikkhave, ārambhavatthūni. katamāni aṭṭha?

AN 8.80 kusītārambhavatthusuttaṃ
ārammaṇa 1

nt. base; foundation; support; sustenance; lit. supporting [ā + √lamb + a + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, from ālambati
Meaning base; foundation; support; sustenance; lit. supporting
Root Family ā √lamb
Root √lamb･1 a (hang)
Base √lamb + a > lamba > ramma (irreg)
Construction ā + ramma + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Phonetic Change l > r
Antonym anārammaṇa
Synonym yāpana
Variant ālambana
Sanskrit ālambana
Sanskrit Root √lamb 1 (hang down)

Examples

yañ'ca, bhikkhave, ceteti yañ'ca pakappeti yañ'ca anuseti, ārammaṇam'etaṃ hoti viññāṇassa ṭhitiyā.

SN 12.38 cetanāsuttaṃ

gedhaṃ brūmi mah'ogho'ti,
ājavaṃ brūmi jappanaṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ pakappanaṃ,
kāmapaṅko duraccayo.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
ārammaṇa 2

nt. chance; opportunity; lit. supporting [ā + √lamb + a + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, from ālambati
Meaning chance; opportunity; lit. supporting
Root Family ā √lamb
Root √lamb･1 a (hang)
Base √lamb + a > lamba > ramma (irreg)
Construction ā + ramma + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Phonetic Change l > r
Synonym avakāsa
Commentary (MNa) ārammaṇan'ti kiles'uppattipaccayaṃ.
Sanskrit ālambana
Sanskrit Root √lamb 1 (hang down)

Examples

kaliṅgar'ūpadhānā, bhikkhave, eta'r'ahi licchavī viharanti appamattā ātāpino upāsanasmiṃ. tesaṃ rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto na labhati otāraṃ na labhati ārammaṇaṃ.

SN 20.8 kaliṅgarasuttaṃ

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, labhati tassa māro otāraṃ, labhati tassa māro ārammaṇaṃ.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
ārammaṇa 3

nt. object; cause; reason; lit. supporting [ā + √lamb + a + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, from ālambati
Meaning object; cause; reason; lit. supporting
Root Family ā √lamb
Root √lamb･1 a (hang)
Base √lamb + a > lamba > ramma (irreg)
Construction ā + ramma + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Phonetic Change l > r
Synonym adhikaraṇa, kāraṇa, ṭhāna, nidāna, nimitta
Variant ālambana
Commentary (VINa) bhikkhuṃ ārammaṇaṃ karitvā'ti bhikkhuṃ paccayaṃ katvā
Sanskrit ālambana
Sanskrit Root √lamb 1 (hang down)

Example

VIN 1.4.1.8 upakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ
ārammaṇa 4

nt. meditation object; theme of meditation; lit. supporting [ā + √lamb + a + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, from ālambati
Meaning meditation object; theme of meditation; lit. supporting
Root Family ā √lamb
Root √lamb･1 a (hang)
Base √lamb + a > lamba > ramma (irreg)
Construction ā + ramma + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Phonetic Change l > r
Sanskrit ālambana
Sanskrit Root √lamb 1 (hang down)

Examples

nāgaṃ'va thambhamhi daḷhāya rajjuyā,
taṃ me suguttaṃ satiyā subhāvitaṃ,
anissitaṃ sabbabhavesu hehisi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

akammaṃ h'etaṃ, mahārāja, jinaputtānaṃ yadidaṃ pūjā, sammasanaṃ saṅkhārānaṃ, yoniso manasikāro, satipaṭṭhān'ānupassanā, ārammaṇasāraggāho, kilesayuddhaṃ, sadattham'anuyuñjanā, etaṃ jinaputtānaṃ karaṇīyaṃ, avasesānaṃ devamanussānaṃ pūjā karaṇīyā.

ārādhaka 1

Meaning successful; accomplished
Root Family ā √rādh
Root √rādh･3 *e (succeed, please)
Base √rādh + e > rādhe (caus)
Construction ā + rādhe + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Antonym nārādhaka, anārādhaka
Synonym ārādhika, saṃrādhaka
Sanskrit ārādhaka (worshipping)
Sanskrit Root √rādh 4, 5 (succeed)

Example

sace hi, bho gotama, imaṃ dhammaṃ bhavaṃ'y'eva gotamo ārādhako abhavissa, no ca kho bhikkhū ārādhakā abhavissaṃsu, evam'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ aparipūraṃ abhavissa ten'aṅgena.

Examples

n'āhaṃ taṃ, bhikkhave, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya yo imesaṃ pañhānaṃ veyyākaraṇena cittaṃ ārādheyya, aññatra tathāgatena vā tathāgatasāvakena vā ito vā pana sutvā.

katame satta phalā satt'ānisaṃsā? diṭṭh'eva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti. no ce diṭṭh'eva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, atha maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti.

DHPa 1.3.2 aññatarabhikkhu vatthu
ārādhetvā

abs. having invited, pleased, won favour, obtained [ā + √rādh] ✗
ārādhesi

aor. invited, pleased, won favour, obtained [ā + √rādh] ✗
ārāpatha

masc. stitch; lit. needle path [ārā + patha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning stitch; lit. needle path
Construction ārā + patha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ārāya + patha)
Commentary (VINa) ārāpathe ārāpathe'ti sūciṃ pavesetvā pavesetvā nīharaṇe.
Sanskrit ārā + patha

Example

sibbeyyā'ti sayaṃ sibbati ārāpathe ārāpathe āpatti pācittiyassa. sibbāpeyyā'ti aññaṃ āṇāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa. sakiṃ āṇatto bahukam'pi sibbati, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.3.6 cīvarasibbanasikkhāpadaṃ
ārāma 1

adj. (+loc) enjoying; taking pleasure (in); fond (of) [ā + √ram + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from āramati (+loc)
Meaning enjoying; taking pleasure (in); fond (of)
Root Family ā √ram
Root √ram･1 a (delight, please)
Construction ā + √ram > rām + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym kāma
Sanskrit ārāma
Sanskrit Root √ram 1 (be or make content)

Examples

nippapañc'ārāmassa-ayaṃ dhammo nippapañcaratino n'āyaṃ dhammo papañc'ārāmassa papañcaratino'ti

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

pavivittassāyaṃ dhammo n'āyaṃ dhammo saṅgaṇik'ārāmassa

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
ārāma 2

masc. pleasure; delight [ā + √ram] ✗
ārāma 3

masc. park; parkland; nature reserve [ā + √ram + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āramati
Meaning park; parkland; nature reserve
Root Family ā √ram
Root √ram･1 a (delight, please)
Construction ā + √ram > rām + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit ārāma
Sanskrit Root √ram 1 (be or make content)

Examples

tam'anugacchanto passeyya purāṇaṃ nagaraṃ purāṇaṃ rājadhāniṃ pubbakehi manussehi ajjhāvuṭṭhaṃ ārāmasampannaṃ vanasampannaṃ pokkharaṇīsampannaṃ uddhāpavantaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ.

SN 12.65 nagarasuttaṃ

ārāmaropā vanaropā,
ye janā setukārakā,
papañ'ca udapānañ'ca,
ye dadanti upassayaṃ.

SN 1.47 vanaropasuttaṃ
ārāma 4

masc. monastery [ā + √ram + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āramati
Meaning monastery
Root Family ā √ram
Root √ram･1 a (delight, please)
Construction ā + √ram > rām + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym āgatasamaṇa, vihāra
Sanskrit ārāma
Sanskrit Root √ram 1 (be or make content)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ārāmaṃ gantā hoti abhikkhaṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ santike dhammassavanāya

AN 3.30 avakujjasuttaṃ

atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ. yaṃnūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
ārāmakoṭṭhaka

masc. wall surrounding a monastery; gateway of a monastery [ārāma + koṭṭhaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wall surrounding a monastery; gateway of a monastery
Construction ārāma + koṭṭhaka
Compound kammadhāraya (ārāma + koṭṭhaka)
Sanskrit ārāma + koṣṭhaka

Example

tena kho pana samayena jānapadā manussā bahuṃ loṇam'pi telam'pi taṇḍulam'pi khādanīyam'pi sakaṭesu āropetvā bahi-ārāmakoṭṭhake sakaṭaparivaṭṭaṃ karitvā acchanti

VIN 4.6.179 kappiyabhūmi anujānanā
ārāmagata

adj. gone to the park; arrived at the monastery [ārāma + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning gone to the park; arrived at the monastery
Construction ārāma + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ārāmaṃ + gata)
Sanskrit ārāma + gata

Examples

so ārāmagato nisīdati paññatte āsane. nisajja pāde pakkhāleti, na ca so bhavaṃ gotamo pādamaṇḍan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, ahosi te pubbe chando, ārāmaṃ gamissāmī'ti? tassa te ārāmagatassa yo tajjo chando so paṭippassaddho'ti? evaṃ, bho.

SN 51.15 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ
ārāmacetiya

nt. garden shrine; park shrine [ārāma + cetiya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning garden shrine; park shrine
Construction ārāma + cetiya
Compound kammadhāraya (ārāma + cetiya)
Commentary (MNa) ārāmacetiyānī'ti pupph'ārāmaphal'ārām'ādayo ārāmā eva ārāmacetiyāni.
Sanskrit ārāma + caitya

Example

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ yā tā rattiyo abhiññātā abhilakkhitā, cātuddasī pañcadasī aṭṭhamī ca pakkhassa, tathārūpāsu rattīsu yāni tāni ārāmacetiyāni vanacetiyāni rukkhacetiyāni bhiṃsanakāni salomahaṃsāni tathārūpesu sen'āsanesu vihareyyaṃ app'eva nām'āhaṃ bhayabheravaṃ passeyyan'ti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
ārāmatā

Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit ārāma + tā
Sanskrit Root √ram 1 (be or make content)

Examples

AN 6.14 bhaddakasuttaṃ

na kamm'ārāmatā, na bhass'ārāmatā, na nidd'ārāmatā, na saṅgaṇik'ārāmatā, indriyesu guttadvāratā, bhojane mattaññutā, asaṃsagg'ārāmatā, nippapañc'ārāmatā.

VIN 1.4.3.9 sāsaṅkasikkhāpadaṃ

nt. formless existence; immaterial state [na + √rūp + a + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na rūpa, neg
Meaning formless existence; immaterial state
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction na > a > ā + √rūp + a + *ya
arūpa + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym ruppa
Commentary (MNa) āruppā'ti arūpabrahmaloko nāma
Sanskrit ārūpya (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Examples

ye ca rūp'ūpagā sattā,
ye ca āruppavāsino,
nirodhaṃ appajānantā,
āgantāro punabbhavaṃ.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

santi, gahapatayo, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, n'atthi sabbaso āruppā'ti. tesaṃ'y'eva kho, gahapatayo, samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā ujuvipaccanīkavādā. te evam'āhaṃsu, atthi sabbaso āruppā'ti.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
āruppa 2

adj. formless; immaterial [na + √rūp + a + *ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from na arūpa, neg
Meaning formless; immaterial
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction na > a > ā + √rūp + a + *ya
arūpa + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym arūpa
Sanskrit ārūpya (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Example

idha ekacco puggalo ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te kāyena phusitvā viharati paññāya c'assa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.

MN 70 kīṭāgirisuttaṃ
āruppaṭṭhayī

adj. being or living in a formless or immaterial existence ✗

adj. being or living in a formless or immaterial existence ✗

Meaning immediately following the immaterial states
Construction āruppa + anantaraṃ
āruyha 1

ger. (+acc) ascending; mounting; climbing up [ā + √ruh + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of āruhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning ascending; mounting; climbing up
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction ā + √ruh + ya > ruyha
Phonetic Change hy > yh (metathesis)
Variant ārūyha
Sanskrit āruhya
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Examples

gattāni parimajjitvā,
puna'p'āruyha caṅkamaṃ,
caṅkame caṅkamiṃ so'haṃ,
ajjhattaṃ susamāhito.

TH 187 bhaguttheragāthā

pamādaṃ appamādena,
yadā nudati paṇḍito,
paññāpāsādam'āruyha,
asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe,
dhīro bāle avekkhati.

DHP 28 appamādavaggo
āruyha 2

ger. (+acc) (of shoes) putting on; lit. mounting [ā + √ruh + ya] ~

Meaning (of shoes) putting on; lit. mounting
Root Family ā √ruh

Construction ā + √ruh + ya > ruyha
Phonetic Change hy > yh (metathesis)
Sanskrit āruhya
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)
āruyhati

pr. mounts, climbs, goes up; gets on to or into, steps on to; climbs on or into [ā + √ruh] ✗
āruha

masc. rider; driver; lit. mounter; ascender [ā + √ruh + a] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from āruhati
Meaning rider; driver; lit. mounter; ascender
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction ā + √ruh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Variant āroha
Sanskrit āroha
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato hatthim'pi hanati, hatth'āruham'pi hanati, assam'pi hanati, ass'āruham'pi hanati, ratham'pi hanati, rathikam'pi hanati, pattikam'pi hanati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo hantā hoti.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
āruhati

pr. ascends, mounts, climbs [ā + √ruh] ✗
āruhana

nt. ascending or climbing up [ā + √ruh] ✗
āruhanta

prp. ascending, climbing [ā + √ruh] ✗
āruhi

aor. (+acc) ascended; climbed (onto); mounted [ā + √ruh + i] ✓

Grammar aor of āruhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning ascended; climbed (onto); mounted
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction ā + √ruh + i
Synonym abhiruhi
Sanskrit āruhat
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

puriso aṅkusam'ādāya,
dehi pādan'ti yācati,
nāgo pasārayī pādaṃ,
puriso nāgam'āruhi.

THI 32 dantikātherīgāthā
āruhituṃ

inf. (+acc) to climb (up) [ā + √ruh + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of āruhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to climb (up)
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction ā + √ruh + ituṃ
Antonym orohituṃ
Variant ārohituṃ
Sanskrit ārohitum
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

tassa evam'assa, ayaṃ kho rukkho sampannaphalo ca upapannaphalo ca, n'atthi ca kānici phalāni bhūmiyaṃ patitāni. jānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ rukkhaṃ āruhituṃ.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
āruhitvā

abs. (+acc) having ascended; having climbed (onto); having mounted [ā + √ruh] ✗
āruhya

ger. ascending, mounting, climbing [ā + √ruh] ✗
āruḷha 1

pp. ascended; boarded; embarked [ā + √ruh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of āruhati
Meaning ascended; boarded; embarked
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction ā + √ruh + ta > ruḍha > ruḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change t > ḍ > ḷ
Antonym oruḷha
Synonym abhiruḷha
Variant ārūḷha
Sanskrit ārūḍha
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

nāv'ābhiruhanasamayo nāma nāvaṃ abhiruhissāmī'ti bhuñjitabbaṃ, āruḷhena bhuñjitabbaṃ, oruḷhena bhuñjitabbaṃ.

VIN 2.5.4.2 gaṇabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ
āruḷha 2

pp. wearing; put on; lit. ascended [ā + √ruh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of āruhati
Meaning wearing; put on; lit. ascended
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction ā + √ruh + ta > ruḍha > ruḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change t > ḍ > ḷ
Antonym oruḷha
Variant ārūḷha
Sanskrit ārūḍha
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

na pāduk'āruḷhassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 61 pādukasikkhāpadaṃ
āruḷha 3

pp. climbed up [ā + √ruh + ta] ~

Meaning climbed up

Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)

Antonym oruḷha
Variant ārūḷha
Sanskrit ārūḍha

pp. (+acc) came up (to) [ā + √ruh + ta] ~

Meaning came up (to)
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)

Phonetic Change t > ḍ > ḷ
Antonym oruḷha
Variant ārūḷha
Sanskrit ārūḍha
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)
ārūyha 1

ger. (+acc) ascending; mounting; climbing up [ā + √ruh + *ya] ~

Grammar ger of ārūhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning ascending; mounting; climbing up
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction ā + √ruh > rūh + *ya > rūyha
Phonetic Change hy > yh (metathesis)
Variant āruyha
Sanskrit āruhya
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)
ārūyha 2

ptp. to be ridden [ā + √ruh] ✗
ārūhati

pr. mounts, climbs, goes up; gets on to or into, steps on to; climbs on or into [ā + √ruh] ✗
ārūhana

nt. climbing, ascending, mounting [ā + √ruh] ✗
ārūḷha 1

pp. climbed up [ā + √ruh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of āruhati
Meaning climbed up
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction ā + √ruh + ta > rūḍha > rūḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change u > ū
t > ḍ > ḷ
Variant āruḷha
Sanskrit ārūḍha
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

amuko yo so puriso paṭhamaṃ rukkhaṃ ārūḷho sace so na khippam'eva oroheyya tassa so rukkho papatanto hatthaṃ vā bhañjeyya pādaṃ vā bhañjeyya aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ bhañjeyya

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
ārūḷha 2

pp. mounted [ā + √ruh] ✗
ārūḷha 3

pp. embarked [ā + √ruh] ✗
ārūḷha 4

pp. (of a text) fixed; set; added to the canon; lit. mounted [ā + √ruh + ta] ~

Grammar pp of āruhati
Meaning (of a text) fixed; set; added to the canon; lit. mounted
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction ā + √ruh + ta > rūḍha > rūḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change u > ū
t > ḍ > ḷ
Synonym adhimutta, adhimocita, niyāmita, patiṭṭhita
Variant āruḷha
Sanskrit ārūḍha
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)
ārogiya

nt. freedom from disease; health, well-being [√ruj] ✗
ārogya 1

nt. health; freedom from disease [na + √ruj + *a + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na aroga, neg
Meaning health; freedom from disease
Root Family √ruj
Root √ruj･1 a (hurt, be painful)
Construction na + √ruj > rog + *a + *ya
aroga + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Antonym rogya
Synonym arogiya
Sanskrit ārogya
Sanskrit Root √ruj 6, 10 (break)

Examples

ārogyaparamā lābhā,
santuṭṭhiparamaṃ dhanaṃ,
vissāsaparamā ñāti,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP 204 sukhavaggo

yo hi, gahapati, imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharanto muhuttam'pi ārogyaṃ paṭijāneyya, kimaññatra bālyā?

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
ārogya 2

nt. mental health; epithet of Nibbāna [na + √ruj + *a + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na aroga, neg
Meaning mental health; epithet of Nibbāna
Root Family √ruj
Root √ruj･1 a (hurt, be painful)
Construction na + √ruj > rog + *a + *ya
aroga + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Antonym rogya
Commentary (SNPa) ārogyan'ti nibbānaṃ
Sanskrit ārogya
Sanskrit Root √ruj 6, 10 (break)

Example

ārogyaṃ samma'd'aññāya,
āsavānaṃ parikkhayā,
saṅkhāya sevī dhammaṭṭho,
saṅkhyaṃ n'opeti vedagū'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning time of being healthy
Construction ārogya + kāla

ārogyattha + aṃ

Meaning for health; lit. for the sake of health
Construction ārogya + attha + āya
ārogyattha + āya

Commentary (VINt) ārogyatthāyā'ti nirupaddavatthāya.

adj. having health as the highest; with freedom from disease as the ultimate [ārogya + parama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having health as the highest; with freedom from disease as the ultimate
Construction ārogya + parama
Compound kammadhāraya (ārogya + parama)
Sanskrit ārogya + parama

Examples

ārogyaparamā lābhā,
santuṭṭhiparamaṃ dhanaṃ,
vissāsaparamā ñāti,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP 204 sukhavaggo

ārogyaparamā lābhā,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ,
aṭṭh'aṅgiko ca maggānaṃ,
khemaṃ amatagāminan'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
ārogyamada

masc. (+loc) intoxication with health (in); proud of health [ārogya + mada] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+loc)
Meaning intoxication with health (in); proud of health
Construction ārogya + mada
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ārogyena + mada)
Sanskrit ārogya + mada

Examples

atthi, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ ārogye ārogyamado, yena madena mattā kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti, vācāya duccaritaṃ caranti, manasā duccaritaṃ caranti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ

tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato yo ārogye ārogyamado so sabbaso vā pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti. idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca byādhidhammo'mhi, byādhiṃ anatīto'ti

AN 5.57 abhiṇha-paccavekkhitabba-ṭhāna-suttaṃ

ārogyasālā

fem. hospital, sanatorium ✗
ārocanā

fem. announcement [ā + √ruc] ✗
ārocayati

pr. (+acc and +dat) tells (to); informs (about); explains (to); breaks it (to); lit. causes to inform [ā + √ruc + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ā √ruc, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning tells (to); informs (about); explains (to); breaks it (to); lit. causes to inform
Root Family ā √ruc
Root √ruc･1 *aya (shine, like)
Base √ruc + *aya > rocaya (caus)
Construction ā + rocaya + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym akkhāti, ācikkhati, ādisati, āmantayati, āroceti, āvikaroti, uttānīkaroti, upadisati, kathayati, katheti, jānāpeti, jotayati, joteti, dīpeti, deseti, pakāseti, pabrūti, pāvadati, pilapati, bravīti, brūti, bhaṇati, lapayati, vadati, sandasseti
Commentary (MNa) ārocayāmī'ti kathemi.
Sanskrit ārocayati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

Example

ārocayāmi vo, bhikkhave, paṭivedayāmi vo, bhikkhave, mā vo sāmaññ'atthikānaṃ sataṃ sāmaññ'attho parihāyi, sati uttariṃ karaṇīye.

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
ārocayi

aor. (+acc and +dat) told (to); informed (about); explained (to); lit. caused to inform [ā + √ruc + *aya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of ārocayati, caus, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning told (to); informed (about); explained (to); lit. caused to inform
Root Family ā √ruc
Root √ruc･1 *aya (shine, like)
Base √ruc + *aya > rocaya (caus)
Construction ā + rocaya + i
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym ācikkhi, ārocesi, kathayi, kathesi, bhāsi
Sanskrit āruc
Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

Example

dhātiyo ayyaputto ekako'ti vegena sāṇiṃ ukkhipitvā anto pavisamānā bodhisattaṃ sayane pallaṅkena nisinnaṃ tañ'ca pāṭihāriyaṃ disvā gantvā rañño ārocayiṃsu

MNa 36 mahāsaccakasutavaṇṇanā
ārocāpana

nt. announcement or information through an agent [ā + √ruc] ✗
ārocāpetabba

ptp. will announce; will inform; will tell [ā + √ruc] ✗
ārocāpeti

pr. (+acc and +dat) causes to tell, causes to inform, causes to announce [ā + √ruc] ✗
ārocāpetvā

abs. having told; having announced; having informed [ā + √ruc] ✗
ārocāpesi 1

aor. (+acc and +dat) had (something) announced (to); had (something) told (to); lit. caused to inform [ā + √ruc + *āpe + si] ✓

Grammar aor of ārocāpeti, caus, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning had (something) announced (to); had (something) told (to); lit. caused to inform
Root Family ā √ruc
Root √ruc･1 *āpe (shine, like)
Base √ruc + *āpe > rocāpe (caus)
Construction ā + rocāpe + si
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit āruc
Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

Example

atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi, kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan'ti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
ārocāpesi 2

aor. told; announced [ā + √ruc] ✗
ārocita

pp. announced; stated; declared; lit. caused to inform [ā + √ruc + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of āroceti, caus
Meaning announced; stated; declared; lit. caused to inform
Root Family ā √ruc
Root √ruc･1 *e (shine, like)
Base √ruc + *e > roce (caus)
Construction ā + roce + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym akkhāta, paññatta, byākata
Commentary (VINa) vatthu vā ārocitan'ti codakena ca cuditakena ca attano kathā kathitā, anuvijjako sammato, ettāvatā'pi vatthum'eva ārocitaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit ārocita (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

Example

saṅghe vinicchayakathā nāma vatthu vā ārocitaṃ hoti avinicchitaṃ, ñatti vā ṭhapitā hoti, kammavācā vā vippakatā hoti.

VIN 2.5.8.10 chandaṃadatvāgamanasikkhāpadaṃ
ārocetabba

ptp. should be informed [ā + √ruc] ✗
āroceti 1

pr. (+acc and +dat) tells (to); informs (about); explains (to); lit. caused to inform [ā + √ruc + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ā √ruc, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning tells (to); informs (about); explains (to); lit. caused to inform
Root Family ā √ruc
Root √ruc･1 *e (shine, like)
Base √ruc + *e > roce (caus)
Construction ā + roce + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym nāroceti
Synonym akkhāti, ācikkhati, ādisati, āmantayati, ārocayati, āvikaroti, uttānīkaroti, upadisati, kathayati, katheti, jānāpeti, jotayati, joteti, dīpeti, deseti, pakāseti, pabrūti, pāvadati, pilapati, bravīti, brūti, bhaṇati, lapayati, vadati, sandasseti
Sanskrit ārocayati
Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

Examples

āyām'āvuso, yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamissāma. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocessāma. yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā'ti.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

tena kho pana maṃ, aggivessana, samayena pañca bhikkhū paccupaṭṭhitā honti, yaṃ kho samaṇo gotamo dhammaṃ adhigamissati, taṃ no ārocessatī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
āroceti 2

pr. (+acc and +dat) announces (to); declares (to); states (to); lit. caused to inform [ā + √ruc + *e + ti] ✓

Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

Examples

samudācareyyā'ti āroceyya itthiyā vā purisassa vā gahaṭṭhassa vā pabbajitassa vā.

VIN 1.1.4 catutthapārājikaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannassa uttarimanussadhammaṃ āroceyya, bhūtasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 8 dhammadesanāsikkhāpadaṃ
ārocetukāma

adj. (+acc and +dat) wanting to tell (to); wishing to inform (about); hoping to explain (to) [ārocetuṃ + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+acc and +dat)
Meaning wanting to tell (to); wishing to inform (about); hoping to explain (to)
Construction ārocetuṃ + kāma
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (ārocetuṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit ārocayitum + kāma

Example

evaṃ vutte, bhāradvājagotto brāhmaṇo saṃviggo lomahaṭṭhajāto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, etadeva kho pana mayaṃ bhoto gotamassa ārocetu'kāmā.

Examples

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

ekam'antaṃ nisinnā kho therā bhikkhū yāvatako ahosi sabbeh'eva saddhiṃ kathāsallāpo, taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesuṃ.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ
ārocesi 2

aor. (+acc and +dat) announced (to); declared (to); stated (to); lit. caused to inform [ā + √ruc + *e + si] ✓

Base √ruc + *e > roce (caus)
Construction ā + roce + si
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym akkhāsi, pabyāhari, byākāsi, sāvesi
Commentary (SNa) evam'ārocesī'ti dhammikaṃ samaṇā'tiādīni vadamānā sāsanassa niyyānikaṃ guṇaṃ kathesi.
Sanskrit āruc
Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

Example

atha kho sūcimukhī paribbājikā rājagahe rathiyāya rathiyaṃ, siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evam'ārocesi, dhammikaṃ samaṇā sakyaputtiyā āhāraṃ āhārenti, anavajjaṃ samaṇā sakyaputtiyā āhāraṃ āhārenti.

SN 28.10 sūcimukhīsuttaṃ
ārodanā

fem. cry, lamentation, weeping [ā + √rud] ✗
āropana

nt. putting on, raising up to, committing [ā + √ruh] ✗
āropanā

fem. impeaching; impugning; charging; making a formal legal accusation; lit. mounting [ā + √ruh + *e + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from āropeti, caus
Meaning impeaching; impugning; charging; making a formal legal accusation; lit. mounting
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 *e (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *e > rohe > rope (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + rope + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Phonetic Change u > o
h > p
Sanskrit ārohaṇa
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

saṅgho itthan'nāmassa bhikkhuno mohaṃ āropeti. yass'āyasmato khamati itthan'nāmassa bhikkhuno mohassa āropanā, so tuṇhassa. yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.

VIN 2.5.8.3 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ
āropamānaka

āropayati

Phonetic Change u > o
h > p
Sanskrit āruh
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)
āropita 1

pp. (+loc) put on top (of); placed (on); mounted (on) [ā + √ruh + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of āropeti, caus (+loc)
Meaning put on top (of); placed (on); mounted (on)
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 *e (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *e > rohe > rope (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + rope + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change u > o
h > p
Sanskrit āropita
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Examples

taṃ kiṃ maññatha bhikkhave, katamaṃ nu kho bahutaraṃ, yo v'āyaṃ mayā paritto nakhasikhāyaṃ paṃsu āropito ayaṃ vā mahāpathavī'ti?

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ

imehi sakkārehi yath'ārahaṃ āropitehi abhipūjayāma

Thai

āropita 2

pp. (+dat) (of an argument) refuted; debunked; disproved; lit. mounted [ā + √ruh + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of āropeti, caus (+dat)
Meaning (of an argument) refuted; debunked; disproved; lit. mounted
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 *e (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *e > rohe > rope (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + rope + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change u > o
h > p
Synonym niggahita
Commentary (SNa) āropito te vādo'ti tuyhaṃ doso mayā āropito.
Notes SCPN §99 dative of animosity
Sanskrit āropita
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Examples

micchāpaṭipanno tvam'asi, aham'asmi sammāpaṭipanno. sahitaṃ me, asahitaṃ te. purevacanīyaṃ pacchā avaca, pacchāvacanīyaṃ pure avaca. adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattaṃ. āropito te vādo, cara vādappamokkhāya. niggahito'si, nibbeṭhehi vā sace pahosī'ti.

SN 56.9 viggāhikakathāsuttaṃ

evaṃ te kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchissati, abhayena rājakumārena samaṇassa gotamassa evaṃ mah'iddhikassa evaṃ mah'ānubhāvassa vādo āropito'ti.

MN 58 abhayarājakumārasuttaṃ
āropita 3

pp. (+instr and +dat) impeached (by); impugned (by); charged (by); formally accused (by); lit. mounted [ā + √ruh + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of āropeti, caus (+instr and +dat)
Meaning impeached (by); impugned (by); charged (by); formally accused (by); lit. mounted
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 *e (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *e > rohe > rope (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + rope + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change u > o
h > p
Antonym anāropita
Synonym ropita
Notes SCPN §99 dative of animosity
Sanskrit āropita
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Examples

āropito saṅghena itthan'nāmassa bhikkhuno moho. khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evam'etaṃ dhārayāmī'ti.

VIN 2.5.8.3 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ

anāropite mohe moheti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. āropite mohe moheti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.3 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ
āropita 4

pp. hung; suspended [ā + √ruh + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of āropeti, caus
Meaning hung; suspended
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 *e (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *e > rohe > rope (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + rope + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change u > o
h > p
Sanskrit āropita
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

sabbasanthariṃ santhataṃ, bhante, santh'āgāraṃ, āsanāni paññattāni, udakamaṇiko upaṭṭhāpito, telappadīpo āropito. yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṃ maññatī'ti.

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ
āropita 5

pp. got ready [ā + √ruh] ✗
āropita 6

pp. strung (of a bow) [ā + √ruh] ✗
āropitaniyāmena

ind. according to the prescribed order ✗
āropetabba

ptp. should be refuted; should be impugned; should be challenged; should be impeached; lit. to cause to be mounted [ā + √ruh + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of āropeti, caus
Meaning should be refuted; should be impugned; should be challenged; should be impeached; lit. to cause to be mounted
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 *e (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *e > rohe > rope (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + rope + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change u > o
h > p
Commentary (KVa) uttari c'assa moho āropetabbo'ti yathādhammakaraṇato ca uttari, tassa te, āvuso'tiādivacanehi ninditvā tassa puggalassa ñattidutiyakammena moho āropetabbo
Sanskrit āruh
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Examples

na ca tassa bhikkhuno aññāṇakena mutti atthi, yañ'ca tattha āpattiṃ āpanno, tañ'ca yathādhammo kāretabbo, uttari c'assa moho āropetabbo

VIN PAT PC 73 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ

evañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, āropetabbo. byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo.

VIN 2.5.8.3 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ
āropeti 1

pr. (+acc) disputes; disproves; refutes; lit. mounts [ā + √ruh + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of āruhati, trans (+acc)

Root √ruh･1 *e (ascend, grow)

Construction ā + rope + ti

h > p
Notes SCPN §99 dative of animosity
Sanskrit ārūpayati
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Examples

puratthimāya ce'pi disāya āgaccheyya samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā vād'atthiko vādagavesī, vādam'assa āropessāmī'ti, taṃ vata sahadhammena saṅkampessati vā sampakampessati vā sampacālessati vā'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

SN 56.40 vādatthikasuttaṃ

te pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharonti, imaṃ mayaṃ pañhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pucchissāma. evaṃ ce no puṭṭho evaṃ byākarissati, evam'assa mayaṃ vādaṃ āropessāma.

MN 58 abhayarājakumārasuttaṃ
āropetvā 1

abs. (+acc and +loc) having put on top (of); having placed on top (of); having mounted (onto); lit. having caused to climb [ā + √ruh + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of āropeti, caus, trans (+acc and +loc)
Meaning having put on top (of); having placed on top (of); having mounted (onto); lit. having caused to climb
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 *e (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *e > rohe > rope (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + rope + tvā
Phonetic Change u > o
h > p
Sanskrit āropayati
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Examples

atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ nakhasikhāyaṃ paṃsuṃ āropetvā bhikkhū āmantesi.

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ kullaṃ sīse vā āropetvā khandhe vā uccāretvā yena kāmaṃ pakkameyyan'ti.

DN 2.2 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena jānapadā manussā bahuṃ loṇam'pi telam'pi taṇḍulam'pi khādanīyam'pi sakaṭesu āropetvā bahārāmakoṭṭhake sakaṭaparivaṭṭaṃ karitvā acchanti

Root Family ā √ruh

Examples

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

atha kho pesso ca hatth'ārohaputto kandarako ca paribbājako yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā pesso hatth'ārohaputto bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

ārohituṃ

inf. (+acc) to climb (up) [ā + √ruh + *a + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of ārohati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to climb (up)
Root Family ā √ruh
Root √ruh･1 *a (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *a > roha
Construction ā + roha + ituṃ

Antonym orohituṃ
Variant āruhituṃ
Sanskrit ārohitum
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

tassa evam'assa, ayaṃ kho rukkho sampannaphalo ca upapannaphalo ca, n'atthi ca kānici phalāni bhūmiyaṃ patitāni. jānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ rukkhaṃ ārohituṃ.

abs. (+acc) having climbed (up) [ā + √ruh + *a + itvā] ✓

Sanskrit āruhya

Example

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
āla

suffix. (gram) āla; causative suffix added to nouns ✓

Meaning (gram) āla; causative suffix added to nouns

Example

caggahaṇena āra āla'icc'ete paccayā honti. santaṃ karoti, santārati, upakkamaṃ karoti, upakkamāla'ti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 439
ālakamanda

adj. open, unenclosed; or crowded (like Āḷakamandā); (also āḷakamanda) ✗
ālaggita

ālaggesi

aor. hung on, fastened to [ā + √lagg] ✗
ālapati

pr. (+acc) addresses; talks (to); speaks (to) [ā + √lap + a + ti] ✓

Meaning addresses; talks (to); speaks (to)
Root Family ā √lap

Construction ā + lapa + ti

Example
