nt. something to hold on to or lean on, support; staff; support on a carriage [ā + √lamb] ✗
ālambati

pr. hangs on to, takes hold of [ā + √lamb] ✗
ālambana 1

nt. support; rest; stand; lit. supporting [ā + √lamb + ana] ~

Grammar nt, from ālambati
Meaning support; rest; stand; lit. supporting
Root Family ā √lamb
Root √lamb･1 a (hang)
Construction ā + √lamb + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit ālambana
Sanskrit Root √lamb 1 (hang down)
ālambana 2

nt. hanging down from [ā + √lamb] ✗
ālambana 3

nt. sense-object [ā + √lamb] ✗
ālambanabāhā

fem. rail, banister ✗
ālambara

masc. drum ✗
ālambi

aor. hung on to, took hold of [ā + √lamb] ✗
ālambita

pp. hung on to, taken hold of [ā + √lamb] ✗
ālambitvā

abs. (+acc) having leaned (on); having clung (onto); having taken support (on) [ā + √lamb + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ālambati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having leaned (on); having clung (onto); having taken support (on)
Root Family ā √lamb
Root √lamb･1 a (hang)
Construction ā + √lamb + itvā
Sanskrit ālamb
Sanskrit Root √lamb 1 (hang down)

Example

so n'ātidūre n'āccāsanne āsanassa parivattati, na ca pāṇinā ālambitvā āsane nisīdati, na ca āsanasmiṃ kāyaṃ pakkhipati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
ālaya 1

masc. roost; perch; nest; lair; home [ā + √lī + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from allīyati
Meaning roost; perch; nest; lair; home
Root Family ā √lī
Root √lī･3 ya (stick, hide)
√ In Comps llī
Construction ā + √lī > lay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Synonym āsaya
Notes see ālaya 2
Sanskrit ālaya
Sanskrit Root √lī 1, 4, 9 (cling)

Example

yadā balākā sucipaṇḍaracchadā,
kāḷassa meghassa bhayena tajjitā,
palehiti ālayam'ālay'esinī,
tadā nadī ajakaraṇī rameti maṃ.

TH 196 sappakattheragāthā
ālaya 2

masc. (+loc) attachment (to); clinging (to); (comm) craving [ā + √lī + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from allīyati (+loc)
Meaning attachment (to); clinging (to); (comm) craving
Root Family ā √lī
Root √lī･3 ya (stick, hide)
√ In Comps llī
Construction ā + √lī > lay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Antonym anālaya
Synonym pasaṅga, visata, saṅga
Commentary (DHPa) ālayā'ti taṇhā
Notes see ālaya 1
Sanskrit ālaya
Sanskrit Root √lī 1, 4, 9 (cling)

Examples

yo imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu chando ālayo anunayo ajjhosānaṃ so dukkhasamudayo. yo imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṃ, so dukkhanirodho'ti. ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno bahukataṃ hoti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

yass'ālayā na vijjanti,
aññāya akathaṃkathī,
amat'ogadham'anuppattaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 411 brāhmaṇavaggo
ālaya 3

masc. pretence [ā + √lī] ✗
ālaya 4

masc. reliance, thing relied on [ā + √lī] ✗
ālayati

pr. settles down on; is attached to; clings, has longings [ā + √lī] ✗
ālayarata

adj. delighting in attachment; taking pleasure in clinging [ālaya + rata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning delighting in attachment; taking pleasure in clinging
Construction ālaya + rata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ālayesu + rata)
Commentary (MNa) ālayarāmā'ti sattā pañcasu kāmaguṇesu allīyanti. tasmā te ālayā'ti vuccanti. aṭṭhasatataṇhāvicaritāni ālayanti, tasmā ālayā'ti vuccanti. tehi ālayehi ramantī'ti ālayarāmā. ālayesu ratā'ti ālayaratā. ālayesu suṭṭhu muditā'ti ālayasammuditā.
Sanskrit ālaya + rata

Example

ālayarāmā kho pan'āyaṃ pajā ālayaratā ālayasammuditā. ālayarāmā kho pan'āyaṃ pajā ālayaratāya ālayasammuditāya duddasaṃ idaṃ ṭhānaṃ yadidaṃ, idappaccayatā paṭiccasamuppādo.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
ālayarāma

adj. pleased by attachment; enjoying clinging [ālaya + rāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pleased by attachment; enjoying clinging
Construction ālaya + rāma
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ālayesu + rāma)
Commentary (MNa) ālayarāmā'ti sattā pañcasu kāmaguṇesu allīyanti. tasmā te ālayā'ti vuccanti. aṭṭhasatataṇhāvicaritāni ālayanti, tasmā ālayā'ti vuccanti. tehi ālayehi ramantī'ti ālayarāmā. ālayesu ratā'ti ālayaratā. ālayesu suṭṭhu muditā'ti ālayasammuditā.
Sanskrit ālaya + rāma

Example

ālayarāmā kho pan'āyaṃ pajā ālayaratā ālayasammuditā. ālayarāmā kho pan'āyaṃ pajā ālayaratāya ālayasammuditāya duddasaṃ idaṃ ṭhānaṃ yadidaṃ, idappaccayatā paṭiccasamuppādo.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
ālayasamugghāta

masc. eradication of attachment; destruction of clinging [ālaya + samugghāta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning eradication of attachment; destruction of clinging
Construction ālaya + samugghāta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ālayassa + samugghāta)
Commentary (VINa) yasmā pana taṃ āgamma pañca kāmaguṇālayā samugghātaṃ gacchanti, tasmā ālayasamugghāto'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit ālaya + samudghāta

Example

madanimmadanāya pipāsavinayāya ālayasamugghātāya vaṭṭ'upacchedāya taṇhakkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammo desito?

VIN 1.2.1 sukkavissaṭṭhi sikkhāpada

Example

TH 196 sappakattheragāthā
ālayesī

adj. seeking shelter; seeing the nest ✗
ālasānuyoga

masc. laziness [ālasa + anuyoga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning laziness
Construction ālasa + anuyoga
Variant ālasyānuyoga
ālasiya

nt. laziness; idleness [na + √las + a + *iya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na lasa, neg
Meaning laziness; idleness
Root Family √las
Root √las･1 a (shine, be active)
Construction na > a > ā + √las + a + *iya
alasa + *iya
Derivative taddhita (*iya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anālasiya
Synonym ālasiyabhāva, kosajja
Variant ālasya
Sanskrit ālasya
Sanskrit Root √las 1 (be lively)

Example

uṭṭhānakālamhi anuṭṭhahāno,
yuvā balī ālasiyaṃ upeto,
saṃsannasaṅkappamano kusīto,
paññāya maggaṃ alaso na vindati.

DHP 280 maggavaggo
ālasiyabhāva

masc. laziness; idleness; lit. lazy state [ālasiya + bhāva] ~

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning laziness; idleness; lit. lazy state
Construction ālasiya + bhāva
Synonym ālasiya, ālasya
ālasya

nt. laziness; idleness [na + √las + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na lasa, neg
Meaning laziness; idleness
Root Family √las
Root √las･1 a (shine, be active)
Construction na > a > ā + √las + *ya
alasa + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anālasya
Synonym ālasiyabhāva, kosajja
Variant ālasiya
Commentary (SNa) ālasyan'ti ālasiyaṃ, yena ṭhitaṭṭhāne ṭhito'va, nisinnaṭṭhāne nisinno'va hoti, tele'pi uttarante ṭhitiṃ na karoti. (ANa) ālasye'ti ālasiyabhāve.
Sanskrit ālasya
Sanskrit Root √las 1 (be lively)

Examples

cha kho'me, gahapatiputta, ādīnavā ālasya-anuyoge.

DN 31.11 siṅgālasuttaṃ

cha lokasmiṃ chiddāni,
yattha vittaṃ na tiṭṭhati,
ālasyañ'ca pamādo ca,
anuṭṭhānaṃ asaṃyamo,
niddā tandī ca te chidde,
sabbaso taṃ vivajjaye'ti.

SN 1.76 najīratisuttaṃ
ālasyānālasya

nt. laziness and exertion; idleness and making effort [ālasya + anālasya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning laziness and exertion; idleness and making effort
Construction ālasya + anālasya
Compound dvanda (ālasya ca anālasya ca)
Variant alasa analasa
Sanskrit ālasya + anālasya

Example

kiṃ ālasy'ānālasyañ'ca,
mātā puttaṃ'va posati,
kiṃ bhūtā upajīvanti,
ye pāṇā pathavissitā'ti.

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of medicine) applies (onto); smears (onto); rubs (onto)
Root Family ā √lip
Root √lip･2 ṃa (coat, smear)
Base √lip + ṃa > limpa
Construction ā + limpa + ti
Sanskrit ālimpati
Sanskrit Root √lip 6 (smear)

Example

kālena kālañ'ca vaṇaṃ dhoveyyāsi, kālena kālaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ ālimpeyyāsi, mā te na kālena kālaṃ vaṇaṃ dhovato na kālena kālaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ ālimpato pubbalohitaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ pariyonandhi.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
ālimpāpeti

pr. causes to anoint [ā + √lip] ✗
ālimpita 1.1

pp. set fire to [ā + √dīp] ✗
ālimpita 2.1

pp. smeared, anointed [ā + √lip] ✗
ālimpeti 1.1

pr. (+acc) sets fire to; ignites [ā + √dīp + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ādippati, trans (+acc)
Meaning sets fire to; ignites
Root Family ā √dīp
Root √dīp･3 *e (shine, explain)
Base √dīp + e > dīpe > līpe > limpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + limpe + ti
Phonetic Change d > l
Variant āḷimpeti
Commentary (ANa) ālimpeyyā'ti tattha aṅgāre pakkhipitvā aggiṃ datvā nāḷikāya dhamanto aggiṃ gāhāpeyya. (VISMa) ālimpetī'ti ādīpeti jāleti.
Sanskrit ādīpayati
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, suvaṇṇakāro vā suvaṇṇakār'antevāsī vā ukkaṃ bandheyya, ukkaṃ bandhitvā ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpeyya, ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpetvā saṇḍāsena jātarūpaṃ gahetvā ukkāmukhe pakkhipeyya

AN 3.103 nimittasuttaṃ

ālimpesi

aor. (+acc) set fire to; ignited [√dīp + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of ālimpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning set fire to; ignited
Root Family √dīp
Root √dīp･3 *e (shine, explain)
Base √dīp + e > dīpe > līpe > limpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + limpe + si
Variant āḷimpesi
Commentary (ANa) ālimpeyyā'ti tattha aṅgāre pakkhipitvā aggiṃ datvā nāḷikāya dhamanto aggiṃ gāhāpeyya. (VISMa) ālimpetī'ti ādīpeti jāleti.
Sanskrit ādīp
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)

Example

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dāyaṃ ālimpesuṃ, manussā daḍḍhā kālam'akaṃsu.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
ālu

nt. edible root or bulb, yam ✗
āluppakārakaṃ

Meaning making into lumps; breaking into lumps

Sanskrit ālopa + kāra

Example

so'pi tesaṃ gatabhāvaṃ ñatvā vaccakuṭiyā padaraṃ vivaritvā oruyha ubhohi hatthehi ālumpakāraṃ gūthaṃ khādi

DHPa 1.5.11 jambukatthera vatthu
ālumpati

pr. (+acc) tears out; pulls out [ā + √lup + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning tears out; pulls out
Root Family ā √lup
Root √lup･2 ṃa (cut off, rob)
Base √lup + ṃa > lumpa
Construction ā + lumpa + ti
Commentary (MNa) thambañ'ca ālumpatī'ti tiṇañ'ca ālumpamānā khādati.
Sanskrit ālumpati
Sanskrit Root √lup 6 (break)

Example

seyyathā'pi gāvī taruṇavacchā thambañ'ca ālumpati vacchakañ'ca apacinati. evam'eva kho dhammatā esā diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
ālumpitvā

abs. having torn off; having broken off [ā + √lup] ✗

Meaning is disturbed; is stirred up
Root Family ā √luḷ
Root √luḷ･1 īya (agitate, be greedy)

Sanskrit ālulyate
Sanskrit Root √lul 1 (be lively)
āluḷati

pr. is stirred up; is disturbed [ā + √luḷ] ✗
āluḷāpetvā

abs. having caused to stir up; having made churn [ā + √luḷ] ✗
āluḷita

pp. agitated, confounded [ā + √luḷ] ✗
āluḷeti

pr. agitates, confounds [ā + √luḷ] ✗
āluḷesi

aor. agitated, confounded [ā + √luḷ] ✗
ālepa 1

masc. medicinal oil; ointment [ā + √lip + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from ālimpati
Meaning medicinal oil; ointment
Root Family ā √lip
Root √lip･2 ṃa (coat, smear)
Construction ā + √lip > lep + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (KVt) bāhirālepan'ti tel'ādiṃ.
Sanskrit ālepa
Sanskrit Root √lip 6 (smear)
ālepa 2

masc. plaster [ā + √lip] ✗
ālepana

nt. anointing, plastering [ā + √lip] ✗
ālepita

pp. set on fire; ignited; lit. burned [ā + √dīp + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of ālimpeti, caus
Meaning set on fire; ignited; lit. burned
Root Family ā √dīp
Root √dīp･3 *e (shine, explain)
Base √dīp + e > dīpe > lepe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + lepe + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change d > l
Variant ālimpita
Sanskrit ādīpta
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kumbhakārapāko ālepito paṭhamaṃ dhūmeti saṃdhūmeti sampadhūmeti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, chaṭṭhassa sūriyassa pātubhāvā ayañ'ca mahāpathavī sineru ca pabbatarājā dhūmāyanti saṃdhūmāyanti sampadhūmāyanti.

AN 7.66 sattasūriyasuttaṃ
āloka

masc. light; brightness; clarity [ā + √lok + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āloketi
Meaning light; brightness; clarity
Root Family ā √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Construction ā + √lok + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym andhakāra, anāloka
Synonym pabhassara, pabhāsa, pasāda
Sanskrit āloka
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto accho vippasanno anāvilo āloke nikkhitto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ jāneyya passeyya.

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ

yathā kho, mārisā, nimittāni dissanti, uḷāro āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati

DN 18.4 janavasabhasuttaṃ
ālokakara

masc. illuminator; lit. light maker [āloka + kara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning illuminator; lit. light maker
Construction āloka + kara
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ālokaṃ + kara)
Commentary (NIDD2a) ālokakaro'ti anandhakārakaro.
Sanskrit āloka + kara

Example

evarūpā ca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū satthāro'ti'pi vuccanti, satthavāhā'ti'pi vuccanti, raṇañ'jahā'ti'pi vuccanti, tamonudā'ti'pi vuccanti, ālokakarā'ti'pi vuccanti, obhāsakarā'ti'pi vuccanti, pajjotakarā'ti'pi vuccanti, ukkādhārā'ti'pi vuccanti, pabhaṅ'karā'ti'pi vuccanti, ariyā'ti'pi vuccanti, cakkhumanto'ti'pi vuccantī'ti.

ITI 104 sīlasampannasuttaṃ
ālokakaraṇa

adj. light-giving, illuminating ✗
ālokajāta

adj. full of light; radiant; lit. light born [āloka + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of light; radiant; lit. light born
Construction āloka + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (āloka + jāta)
Commentary (UDa) ālokajātā viyā'ti sañjātālokā viya. itaraṃ tass'eva vevacanaṃ, candasahassasūriyasahassehi obhāsitā viyā'ti attho. yasmā te yasojappamukhā pañcasatā bhikkhū sabbaso avijjandhakāravidhamanena ālokabhūtā obhāsabhūtā hutvā viharanti, tasmā bhagavā tehi ṭhitadisāya ālokajātā viya me, ānanda, esā disā'tiādinā vaṇṇabhaṇanāpadesena te bhikkhū pasaṃsati. (VISMa) ālokajātan'ti ālokabhūtaṃ, jātālokaṃ vā.
Sanskrit āloka + jāta

Example

atha kho bhagavā vaggumudātīriyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cetasā ceto paricca manasi karitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi, ālokajātā viya me, ānanda, esā disā, obhāsajātā viya me, ānanda, esā disā, yassaṃ disāyaṃ vaggumudātīriyā bhikkhū viharanti.

UD 23 yasojasuttaṃ
ālokada

adj. giving light ✗
ālokana 1

nt. window [ā + √lok] ✗
ālokana 2

nt. looking at [ā + √lok] ✗
ālokapharaṇa

masc. pervasion or pervading with light or insight ✗

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning suffusion with light
Construction āloka + pharaṇatā

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of light; (comm) full of the light of wisdom; lit. lots of light
Construction āloka + bahula
Commentary (ANa) ālokabahulo'ti ñāṇālokabahulo.
ālokayati

pr. looks at; looks forward [ā + √lok] ✗
ālokayanta

prp. (+acc) looking at; observing; lit. looking here [ā + √lok + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ālokayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning looking at; observing; lit. looking here
Root Family ā √lok
Root √lok･8 *aya (look)
Base √lok + aya > lokaya
Construction ā + lokaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym ālokenta
Sanskrit lokayat
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Example

sace, bhikkhave, nandassa puratthimā disā āloketabbā hoti, sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā nando puratthimaṃ disaṃ āloketi, evaṃ me puratthimaṃ disaṃ ālokayato n'ābhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssavissantī'ti. itiha tattha sampajāno hoti.

AN 8.9 nandasuttaṃ
ālokasaññā

fem. recognition of light; perception of brightness [āloka + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning recognition of light; perception of brightness
Construction āloka + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ālokassa + saññā)
Commentary (ANa) ālokasaññan'ti middhavinodanaālokasaññaṃ.
Sanskrit āloka + saṃjñā

Examples

no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, ālokasaññaṃ manasi kareyyāsi divāsaññaṃ adhiṭṭhaheyyāsi yathā divā tathā rattiṃ yathā rattiṃ tathā divā

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

ālokasaññaṃ manasi kareyyāsi, divāsaññaṃ adhiṭṭhaheyyāsi, yathā divā tathā rattiṃ yathā rattiṃ tathā divā. iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sa'p'pabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveyyāsi

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
ālokasaññī

adj. perceptive of light; conscious of brightness [āloka + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning perceptive of light; conscious of brightness
Construction āloka + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ālokassa + saññī)
Sanskrit āloka + saṃjñin

Example

thinamiddhaṃ pahāya vigatathinamiddho viharati ālokasaññī sato sampajāno thinamiddhā cittaṃ parisodheti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

Example

VIN PAT PC 19 mahallakavihārasikkhāpadaṃ
ālokasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.143 (AN4.143) ✗
ālokita 1

nt. looking ahead; looking forward; lit. looked here [ā + √lok + ita] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of āloketi
Meaning looking ahead; looking forward; lit. looked here
Root Family ā √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Construction ā + √lok + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym vilokita
Commentary (MNa) ālokitaṃ nāma purato pekkhanaṃ.
Sanskrit ālokita
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Example

so abhikkante paṭikkante sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, ālokite vilokite sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, samiñjite pasārite sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇe sampajānakārī ahosiṃ

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
ālokita 2

pp. looked at or before [ā + √lok] ✗
ālokitabba

ptp. should be looked at [ā + √lok] ✗
āloketabba

ptp. should be looked ahead; should be looked forward; lit. to be looked at [ā + √lok + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of āloketi
Meaning should be looked ahead; should be looked forward; lit. to be looked at
Root Family ā √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Base √lok + e > loke
Construction ā + loke + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Antonym viloketabba
Sanskrit ālokayitavya
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Example

evaṃ te abhikkamitabbaṃ, evaṃ te paṭikkamitabbaṃ, evaṃ te āloketabbaṃ, evaṃ te viloketabbaṃ, evaṃ te samiñjitabbaṃ, evaṃ te pasāritabbaṃ, evaṃ te saṅghāṭipattacīvaraṃ dhāretabban'ti.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ
āloketi

pr. (+acc) looks (at); looks ahead; looks upon; lit. looks here [ā + √lok + *e + ti] ✓

Meaning looks (at); looks ahead; looks upon; lit. looks here

Construction ā + loke + ti
Antonym viloketi

Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Example

suṇāti na vijānāti,
āloketi na passati,
dhammasmiṃ bhaññamānasmiṃ,
atthaṃ bālo na bujjhati.

SN 9.3 kassapagottasuttaṃ
ālokesi

aor. looked at or before [ā + √lok] ✗
ālocita

pp. illuminated [ā + √loc] ✗

Meaning (of food) morsel; lump; bit; lit. breaking off

Derivative kita (*a)

Synonym kabaḷa, kabaḷī, kavaḷa, peḷa
Sanskrit ālopa
Sanskrit Root √lup 6 (break)

Examples

cattāro pañca ālope,
abhutvā udakaṃ pive,
alaṃ phāsuvihārāya,
pahit'attassa bhikkhuno.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

byañjanaṃ kho pana bhavaṃ gotamo byañjanamattāya āhāreti, na ca byañjanena ālopaṃ atināmeti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
ālopa 2

masc. stealing; robbing; plundering [ā + √lup + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ālumpati
Meaning stealing; robbing; plundering
Root Family ā √lup
Root √lup･2 ṃa (cut off, rob)
Construction ā + √lup > lop + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym accheda, mosa
Commentary (MNa) ālopo vuccati gāmanigam'ādīnaṃ vilopakaraṇaṃ.
Sanskrit ālopa
Sanskrit Root √lup 6 (break)

Example

tulākūṭa kaṃsakūṭa mānakūṭa ukkoṭana vañcana nikati sāciyoga chedana vadha bandhana viparāmosa ālopa sāhasākārā paṭivirato ahosi.

ālopati

Root Family ā √lup
Root √lup･2 ṃa (cut off, rob)
Construction ā + √lup > lop + *a + ika
ālopa + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (DNa) ek'ālopiko'ti yo eken'eva ālopena yāpeti. dv'āgārik'ādīsu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit ālopa
Sanskrit Root √lup 6 (break)

Example

te ek'āgārikā vā honti ek'ālopikā, dv'āgārikā vā honti dv'ālopikā ... satt'āgārikā vā honti satt'ālopikā. ekissā'pi dattiyā yāpenti, dvīhi'pi dattīhi yāpenti ... sattahi'pi dattīhi yāpenti.

Meaning having stirred; having mixed

āvaṭa 1

pp. closed; shut; barred; lit. obstructed [ā + √var + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of āvarati
Meaning closed; shut; barred; lit. obstructed
Root Family ā √var
Root √var･1 a (cover, dress, restrain)
Construction ā + √var + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > ṭ
Antonym anāvaṭa
Synonym āvarita, pihita
Sanskrit āvṛta
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

Example

āvaṭaṃ dvāraṃ nigaṇṭhānaṃ nigaṇṭhīnaṃ, anāvaṭaṃ dvāraṃ bhagavato bhikkhūnaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ upāsakānaṃ upāsikānaṃ.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
āvaṭa 2

pp. covered, veiled, prohibited [ā + √var] ✗
āvaṭṭa 1

masc. eddy; whirlpool; maelstrom [ā + √vaṭṭ + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āvaṭṭati
Meaning eddy; whirlpool; maelstrom
Root Family ā √vaṭṭ
Root √vaṭṭ･1 a (turn)
Construction ā + √vaṭṭ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym āvatta, gaggalaka
Sanskrit āvarta
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Examples

cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, bhayāni udak'orohantassa pāṭikaṅkhitabbāni. katamāni cattāri? ūmibhayaṃ, kumbhīlabhayaṃ, āvaṭṭabhayaṃ, susukābhayaṃ

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, sace tumhe'pi ... na āvaṭṭaggāho gahessati, na antopūtī bhavissatha, evaṃ tumhe, bhikkhave, nibbānaninnā bhavissatha nibbānapoṇā nibbānapabbhārā.

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
āvaṭṭa 2

adj. twisting; turning; rotating; curling [ā + √vaṭṭ + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from āvaṭṭati
Meaning twisting; turning; rotating; curling
Root Family ā √vaṭṭ
Root √vaṭṭ･1 a (turn)
Construction ā + √vaṭṭ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym āvaṭṭaka
Sanskrit āvarta
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Example

uddh'aggalomo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, uddh'aggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjanavaṇṇāni kuṇḍal'āvaṭṭāni dakkhiṇ'āvaṭṭakajātāni, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

Meaning converted; changed; transformed

Root √vaṭṭ･1 a (turn)
Construction ā + √vaṭṭ + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym pariṇata
Sanskrit āvarta
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Example

samaṇo hi, bhante, gotamo māyāvī āvaṭṭaniṃ m'āyaṃ jānāti yāya aññatitthiyānaṃ sāvake āvaṭṭetī'ti. āvaṭṭo kho te, bhante, upāli gahapati samaṇena gotamena āvaṭṭaniyā māyāyā'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
āvaṭṭa 4

masc. circumference [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗
āvaṭṭaka

adj. twisting; turning; rotating; curling [ā + √vaṭṭ + a + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from āvaṭṭa
Meaning twisting; turning; rotating; curling
Root Family ā √vaṭṭ
Root √vaṭṭ･1 a (turn)
Construction ā + √vaṭṭ + a + ka
āvaṭṭa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym āvaṭṭa
Sanskrit āvarta
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Example

uddh'aggalomo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, uddh'aggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjanavaṇṇāni kuṇḍal'āvaṭṭāni dakkhiṇ'āvaṭṭakajātāni, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
āvaṭṭaggāha

masc. clutch of a whirlpool; sucked in by a whirlpool [āvaṭṭa + gāha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning clutch of a whirlpool; sucked in by a whirlpool
Construction āvaṭṭa + gāha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (āvaṭṭena + gāha)
Sanskrit āvarta + grāha

Example

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, sace tumhe'pi ... na āvaṭṭaggāho gahessati, na antopūtī bhavissatha, evaṃ tumhe, bhikkhave, nibbānaninnā bhavissatha nibbānapoṇā nibbānapabbhārā.

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
āvaṭṭati 1

pr. (+dat) reverts (to); turns back (to); returns (to); goes back (to) [ā + √vaṭṭ + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+dat)
Meaning reverts (to); turns back (to); returns (to); goes back (to)
Root Family ā √vaṭṭ
Root √vaṭṭ･1 a (turn)
Base √vaṭṭ + a > vaṭṭa
Construction ā + vaṭṭa + ti
Synonym āvattati, paccaniyyāti, paccāgacchati
Commentary (MNa) āvaṭṭeyyā'ti mānusakakāmahetu āvaṭṭo bhaveyyā'ti attho.
Sanskrit āvartate
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, māgaṇḍiya, api nu so devaputto nandane vane accharāsaṅghaparivuto dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito ... amussa gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā piheyya, mānusakānaṃ vā pañcannaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ mānusakehi vā kāmehi āvaṭṭeyyā'ti?

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
āvaṭṭati 2

pr. bends forward and back; rocks back and forth [ā + √vaṭṭ + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning bends forward and back; rocks back and forth
Root Family ā √vaṭṭ
Root √vaṭṭ･1 a (turn)
Base √vaṭṭ + a > vaṭṭa
Construction ā + vaṭṭa + ti
Commentary (UDa) āvaṭṭatī'ti ekasmiṃ'y'eva ṭhāne anipajjitvā attano sarīraṃ ito c'ito ākaḍḍhanto āvaṭṭati. parivaṭṭatī'ti ekasmiṃ padese nipanno'pi aṅgapaccaṅgāni parito khipanto vaṭṭati, abhimukhaṃ vā vaṭṭanto āvaṭṭati, samantato vaṭṭanto parivaṭṭati.
Sanskrit āvartate
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Example

atha kho so paribbājako rañño pasenadissa kosalassa koṭṭhāgāraṃ gantvā telassa yāva'd'atthaṃ pivitvā gharaṃ āgantvā n'eva sakkoti uddhaṃ kātuṃ, na pana adho. so dukkhāhi tibbāhi kharāhi kaṭukāhi vedanāhi phuṭṭho āvaṭṭati parivaṭṭati.

UD 16 gabbhinīsuttaṃ
āvaṭṭana 1

nt. revolving [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗
āvaṭṭana 2

nt. temptation [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗
āvaṭṭana 3

nt. possession by some spirit [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗
āvaṭṭanimāyā

fem. conversion magic [āvaṭṭanī + māyā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning conversion magic
Construction āvaṭṭanī + māyā
Compound kammadhāraya (āvaṭṭanī + māyā)

Commentary (MNa) āvaṭṭanimāyan'ti āvaṭṭetvā gahaṇamāyaṃ.
Sanskrit āvartanī + māyā
āvaṭṭanī

adj. converting; transforming; mind-changing; lit. turning around [ā + √vaṭṭ + ana + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from āvaṭṭana
Meaning converting; transforming; mind-changing; lit. turning around
Root Family ā √vaṭṭ
Root √vaṭṭ･1 a (turn)
Construction ā + √vaṭṭ + ana + ī
āvaṭṭana + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Variant āvaṭṭanīmāya, āvaṭṭanimāya
Commentary (MNa) āvaṭṭanimāyan'ti āvaṭṭetvā gahaṇamāyaṃ.
Sanskrit āvartanī
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Example

sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, māyāvī samaṇo gotamo āvaṭṭaniṃ māyaṃ jānāti yāya aññatitthiyānaṃ sāvake āvaṭṭetī'ti.

AN 4.193 bhaddiyasuttaṃ
āvaṭṭanīmāyā

fem. conversion magic [āvaṭṭanī + māyā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning conversion magic
Construction āvaṭṭanī + māyā

āvaṭṭabhaya

nt. danger of whirlpools [āvaṭṭa + bhaya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning danger of whirlpools
Construction āvaṭṭa + bhaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āvaṭṭānaṃ + bhaya)

Examples

cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, bhayāni udak'orohantassa pāṭikaṅkhitabbāni. katamāni cattāri? ūmibhayaṃ, kumbhīlabhayaṃ, āvaṭṭabhayaṃ, susukābhayaṃ

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āvaṭṭabhayassa bhīto sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvatto. āvaṭṭabhayan'ti kho, bhikkhave, pañcann'etaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ
āvaṭṭamāna

prp. bending forward and back; rocking back and forth [ā + √vaṭṭ + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of āvaṭṭati, intrans
Meaning bending forward and back; rocking back and forth
Root Family ā √vaṭṭ
Root √vaṭṭ･1 a (turn)
Base √vaṭṭ + a > vaṭṭa
Construction ā + vaṭṭa + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit āvartamāna
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Example

atha kho bhagavā pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya sāvatthiṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi. addasā kho bhagavā taṃ paribbājakaṃ dukkhāhi tibbāhi kharāhi kaṭukāhi vedanāhi phuṭṭhaṃ āvaṭṭamānaṃ parivaṭṭamānaṃ.

UD 16 gabbhinīsuttaṃ
āvaṭṭi

aor. turned forward and backward, rotated [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗
āvaṭṭita

pp. gone back, turned around, twisted [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗
āvaṭṭitvā

abs. (+dat) having turned back; having rotated [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗
āvaṭṭeti 1

pr. (+acc) converts; transforms; changes the mind; lit. turns around [ā + √vaṭṭ + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of āvaṭṭati, trans (+acc)
Meaning converts; transforms; changes the mind; lit. turns around
Root Family ā √vaṭṭ
Root √vaṭṭ･1 *e (turn)
Base √vaṭṭ + e > vaṭṭe (caus)
Construction ā + vaṭṭe + ti
Commentary (MNa) āvaṭṭetī'ti āvaṭṭetvā parikkhipitvā gaṇhāti.
Sanskrit āvartayati
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Examples

sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, māyāvī samaṇo gotamo āvaṭṭaniṃ māyaṃ jānāti yāya aññatitthiyānaṃ sāvake āvaṭṭetī'ti.

AN 4.193 bhaddiyasuttaṃ

bhaddikā, bhante, āvaṭṭanī māyā, kalyāṇī, bhante, āvaṭṭanī māyā, piyā me, bhante, ñātisālohitā imāya āvaṭṭaniyā āvaṭṭeyyuṃ, piyānam'pi me assa ñātisālohitānaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
āvaṭṭeti 2

pr. (+acc) turns round [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗
āvaṭṭetvā

abs. (+acc) having transformed; having converted; having changed the mind; lit. having turned around [ā + √vaṭṭ + *e + tvā] ~

Grammar abs of āvaṭṭeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having transformed; having converted; having changed the mind; lit. having turned around
Root Family ā √vaṭṭ

Construction ā + vaṭṭe + tvā
Sanskrit āvṛtayitvā
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)
āvatta 1

pp. (+dat) reverted (to); returned (to); gone back (to) [ā + √vatt + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of āvattati (+dat)
Meaning reverted (to); returned (to); gone back (to)
Root Family ā √vatt
Root √vatt･1 a (be, proceed)
Construction ā + √vatt + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Commentary (MNa) āvatto bāhullāyā'ti rasagiddho hutvā paṇītapiṇḍapāt'ādīnaṃ atthāya āvatto.
Sanskrit āvṛtta
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Examples

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ūmibhayassa bhīto sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvatto. ūmibhayan'ti kho, bhikkhave, kodh'ūpāyāsass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ūmibhayaṃ.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

yato kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṃ āhāraṃ āhāresiṃ odanakummāsaṃ, atha me te pañca bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamiṃsu, bāhulliko samaṇo gotamo, padhānavibbhanto, āvatto bāhullāyā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
āvatta 2

nt. winding, turn, bent [ā + √vatt] ✗
āvatta 3

masc. whirlpool; vortex; maelstrom; lit. turning [ā + √vatt + a] ~

āvattaka 1

adj. coming back, who returns [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗
āvattaka 2

adj. twisting; turning; rotating; curling [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗
āvattati

pr. (+dat) reverts (to); returns (to); retreats (to); goes back (to) [√vatt + a + ti] ✓

maraṇañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, ariyassa vinaye yo sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati, maraṇamattañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, dukkhaṃ yaṃ aññataraṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

so kupito anattamano sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ūmibhayassa bhīto sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvatto.

āvattana

nt. turning, return [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗

pp. gone back, turned round [ā + √vatt] ✗

Example

sakkā bhoge ca bhuñjituṃ puññāni ca kātuṃ. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjeyyaṃ puññāni ca kareyyan'ti.

āvamati

pr. swallows back; swallows what one has vomited or ejected [ā + √vam] ✗
āvamituṃ

inf. (+acc) to re-swallow what was vomited; i.e. to return to worldly life [ā + √vam + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of āvamati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to re-swallow what was vomited; i.e. to return to worldly life
Root Family ā √vam
Root √vam･1 a (eject, vomit)
Construction ā + √vam + ituṃ
Variant āgamituṃ
Commentary (THa) vante ahaṃ āvamituṃ na ussahe'ti evaṃ te chaḍḍite puna paccāvamituṃ ahaṃ na sakkomi, pariccattā eva hontī'ti vadati.
English Cognate vomit
Sanskrit āvamitum
Sanskrit Root √vam 1, 2 (vomit)

Example

taṇhā avijjā ca piy'āpiyañ'ca,
subhāni rūpāni sukhā ca vedanā,
manāpiyā kāmaguṇā ca vantā,
vante ahaṃ āvamituṃ na ussahe.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
āvaraṇa 1

adj. obstructing; blocking; impeding [ā + √var + aṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from āvareti
Meaning obstructing; blocking; impeding
Root Family ā √var
Root √var･1 a (cover, dress, restrain)
Construction ā + √var + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Synonym antarāyika
Sanskrit āvaraṇa
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

Examples

ajjhattañ'ca na jānāti,
bahiddhā ca na passati,
samant'āvaraṇo bālo,
sa ve ghosena vuyhati.

AN 4.65 rūpasuttaṃ

uddhaccakukkuccaṃ, bhikkhave, āvaraṇaṃ nīvaraṇaṃ cetaso ajjhāruhaṃ paññāya dubbalīkaraṇaṃ.

AN 5.51 āvaraṇasuttaṃ
āvaraṇa 2

nt. obstruction; obstacle; blockage; impediment; lit. obstructing [ā + √var + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, from āvareti
Meaning obstruction; obstacle; blockage; impediment; lit. obstructing
Root Family ā √var
Root √var･1 a (cover, dress, restrain)
Construction ā + √var + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Antonym anāvaraṇa
Synonym nīvaraṇa
Sanskrit āvaraṇa
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

Example

yam'pi no saddhā gahapatikā divā vikāle paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā denti, tatra'p'ime mukh'āvaraṇaṃ maññe karontī'ti.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ
āvaraṇanīvaraṇasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.38 (SN46.38) ✗
āvaraṇasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.51 (AN5.51) ✗
āvaraṇasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.86 (AN6.86) ✗
āvaraṇaṃ karoti

idiom. obstructs; prohibits ✗
āvaraṇīya

adj. obstructive; impeding; hindering; lit. to be blocked [ā + √var + aṇīya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of āvareti
Meaning obstructive; impeding; hindering; lit. to be blocked
Root Family ā √var
Root √var･1 a (cover, dress, restrain)
Construction ā + √var + aṇīya
Derivative kicca (aṇīya)
Synonym antarāyika
Sanskrit āvṛ
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

Example

divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhessāma

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
āvarati

pr. (+acc and +dat) (of a door) closes (for); shuts (for) [ā + √var + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning (of a door) closes (for); shuts (for)
Root Family ā √var
Root √var･1 a (cover, dress, restrain)
Base √var + a > vara
Construction ā + vara + ti
Synonym nimīleti, pidahati
Commentary (MNa) āvarāmī'ti thakemi pidahāmi.
Sanskrit āvṛṇoti
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

Example

dovārikaṃ āmantesi, ajja't'agge, samma dovārika, āvarāmi dvāraṃ nigaṇṭhānaṃ nigaṇṭhīnaṃ, anāvaṭaṃ dvāraṃ bhagavato bhikkhūnaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ upāsakānaṃ upāsikānaṃ.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
āvarayati

pr. (+acc) blocks; closes; shuts off [ā + √var + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of āvarati, trans (+acc)
Meaning blocks; closes; shuts off
Root Family ā √var
Root √var･1 *aya (cover, dress, restrain)
Base √var + *aya > vāraya > varaya (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + varaya + ti
Synonym thaketi
Sanskrit āvārayati
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

Example

cakkhūhi n'eva lol'assa,
gāmakathāya āvaraye sotaṃ,
rase ca n'ānugijjheyya,
na ca mamāyetha kiñci lokasmiṃ.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
āvari

āvasati 1

pr. (+acc) lives (in); resides (in); spends time (in) [ā + √vas + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning lives (in); resides (in); spends time (in)
Root Family ā √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)

Construction ā + vasa + ti
Synonym paṭivasati, vasati
Sanskrit āvasati

Examples

na hi santi niccā pariggahā,
vinābhāva'santam'ev'idaṃ,
iti disvā n'āgāram'āvase.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6

uposathaṃ upavasissaṃ,
sadā sīlesu saṃvutā,
saññamā saṃvibhāgā ca,
vimānaṃ āvasām'ahaṃ.

VV 15 uttarā vimānavatthu
āvasati 2

pr. stays; remains [ā + √vas + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning stays; remains
Root Family ā √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)
Base √vas + a > vasa
Construction ā + vasa + ti
Synonym viharati, hoti
Sanskrit āvasati
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)

Example

tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate ath'āparaṃ suvaṇṇasikat'āvasissanti.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
āvasatha 1

masc. dwelling; house; lodging [ā + √vas + a + tha] ✓

Grammar masc, from āvasa
Meaning dwelling; house; lodging
Root Family ā √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)
Construction ā + √vas + a + tha
āvasa + tha
Derivative taddhita (tha)
Commentary (ANa) āvasatho'ti āvasath'āgāraṃ.
Sanskrit āvasatha
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)

Examples

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjak'āvasathe. atha kho āyasmā saddho yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ

so ca hoti dubbaṇṇo duddasiko okoṭimako bavhābādho kāṇo vā kuṇī vā khañjo vā pakkhahato vā, na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyā-āvasatha-padīpeyyassa

VIN PAT PC 31 āvasathapiṇḍasikkhāpadaṃ

agilāno nāma sakkoti tamhā āvasathā pakkamituṃ.

VIN 2.5.4.1 āvasathapiṇḍasikkhāpadaṃ
āvasathagāra

nt. dwelling; rest-house ✗

Commentary (VINa) āvasathadvāre'ti ovarakadvāre.

masc. meal in a rest house; food in a traveller’s lodge [āvasatha + piṇḍa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning meal in a rest house; food in a traveller’s lodge
Construction āvasatha + piṇḍa

Commentary (VIN 2.5.4.1) āvasathapiṇḍo ... sālāya vā maṇḍape vā rukkhamūle vā ajjhokāse vā anodissa yāvadattho paññatto hoti. (VINa) āvasathapiṇḍo'ti āvasathe piṇḍo.

Example

āvaha

adj. bringing; conferring; causing [ā + √vah + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from āvahati
Meaning bringing; conferring; causing
Root Family ā √vah
Root √vah･1 a (carry, bring)

Sanskrit āvaha

Examples

taṇhālataṃ bahuvidh'ānuvattaniṃ,
paññāmayaṃ tikhiṇam'asiṃ gahetvā,
chetvā vase tam'pi kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

dunniggahassa lahuno,
yatthakāmanipātino,
cittassa damatho sādhu,
cittaṃ dantaṃ sukh'āvahaṃ.

DHP 35 cittavaggo
āvahata

pp. brought; brought about; caused [ā + √vah] ✗

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ

dhammo have rakkhati dhammacāriṃ,
dhammo suciṇṇo sukham'āvahati.
es'ānisaṃso dhamme suciṇṇe,
na duggatiṃ gacchati dhammacārī.

TH 195 dhammikattheragāthā

kam'ettha bālo'ti paraṃ daheyya,
sayam'eva so medhagam'āvaheyya,
paraṃ vadaṃ bālam'asuddhidhammaṃ.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12

saddh'īdha vittaṃ purisassa seṭṭhaṃ,
dhammo suciṇṇo sukham'āvahati,
saccaṃ have sādutaraṃ rasānaṃ,
paññājīviṃ jīvitam'āhu seṭṭhan'ti.

SN 1.73 vittasuttaṃ
āvahana

nt. (+acc) bring; conferring; causing; conducive (to) [ā + √vah + ana] ✓

Root √vah･1 a (carry, bring)
Construction ā + √vah + ana

Commentary (SNPa) pasaṃsaṃ āvahatī'ti pasaṃs'āvahanaṃ.
Sanskrit āvahana
Sanskrit Root √vah 1 (carry)

Example

pāmujjakaraṇaṃ ṭhānaṃ,
pasaṃs'āvahanaṃ sukhaṃ,
phal'ānisaṃso bhāveti,
vahanto porisaṃ dhuraṃ.

SNP 15 hirisuttaṃ
āvahanaka

adj. bringing, bearing, conducive ✗
āvahāti

pr. (+acc) brings; confers; is conducive (to); procures [ā + √vah + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning brings; confers; is conducive (to); procures
Root Family ā √vah
Root √vah･1 a (carry, bring)
Base √vah + a > vaha
Construction ā + vaha + ti
Phonetic Change with metrically lengthened ā
Synonym āharati
Sanskrit āvahati
Sanskrit Root √vah 1 (carry)

Example

kiṃ sū'dha vittaṃ purisassa seṭṭhaṃ,
kiṃ su suciṇṇaṃ sukham'āvahāti,
kiṃ su have sādutaraṃ rasānaṃ,
kathaṃ jīviṃ jīvitam'āhu seṭṭhaṃ.

pr. brings through; leads through [ā + √vah] ✗

rājā te sabbe gāhāpetvā rāj'aṅgaṇe nābhippamāṇe āvāṭe khaṇāpetvā te tattha nisīdāpetvā paṃsūhi pūretvā upari palāle vikirāpetvā aggiṃ dāpesi.

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo mahataṃ bhūtānaṃ āvāso

Example

āvi

SN 10.5 sānusuttaṃ

cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā. katame cha? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca, ayam'pi dhammo sāraṇīyo.

AN 6.11 paṭhamasāraṇīyasuttaṃ
āvi ceva raho ca

idiom. openly and even in private ✗
āvikata

pp. disclosed; divulged; openly revealed; lit. made open [āvi + kata] ✓

Grammar pp of āvikaroti, comp vb
Meaning disclosed; divulged; openly revealed; lit. made open
Construction āvi + kata
Compound comp verb (āvi + kata)
Variant āvikatvā
Sanskrit āviṣkṛta

Example

sampajānamusāvādo kho pan'āyasmanto antarāyiko dhammo vutto bhagavatā, tasmā saramānena bhikkhunā āpannena visuddh'āpekkhena santī āpatti āvikātabbā, āvikatā hi'ssa phāsu hoti.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso
āvikattar

masc. (+acc and +loc) who reveals (to); who divulges (to); lit. who makes open [āvi + kattar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp, from āvikaroti (+acc and +loc)
Meaning who reveals (to); who divulges (to); lit. who makes open
Construction āvi + kattar
Phonetic Change r > t
Commentary (MNa) yathābhūtaṃ attānaṃ āvikattā'ti yathābhūtaṃ attano aguṇaṃ pakāsetā.
Sanskrit āviṣkartṛ

Examples

yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ sārathissa āvikattā hoti. tesam'assa sārathi abhinimmadanāya vāyamati.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
āvikatvā

abs. (+acc) having openly revealed; lit. makes made open [āvi + katvā] ~

Grammar abs of āvikaroti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning having openly revealed; lit. makes made open
Construction āvi + katvā
Sanskrit āviṣkṛtvā
āvikamma

nt. disclosure; exposure; revealing; lit. open action [āvi + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp, from āvikaroti
Meaning disclosure; exposure; revealing; lit. open action
Construction āvi + kamma
Phonetic Change r > m
Sanskrit āviṣkaraṇa

Example

sikkhaṃ apaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā'ti, atthi, bhikkhave, dubbaly'āvikammañ'c'eva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā, atthi, bhikkhave, dubbaly'āvikammañ'c'eva hoti sikkhā ca paccakkhātā.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
āvikaraṇa

nt. explaining; clarifying; openly revealing; lit. making open [āvi + karaṇa] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp, from āvikaroti
Meaning explaining; clarifying; openly revealing; lit. making open
Construction āvi + karaṇa
Sanskrit āviṣkaraṇa
āvikaroti 1

pr. (+acc) explains; clarifies; lit. makes open [āvi + karoti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning explains; clarifies; lit. makes open
Construction āvi + karoti
Synonym akkhāti, ādisati, ārocayati, āroceti, uttānīkaroti, upadisati, jānāpeti, jotayati, joteti, dīpeti, deseti, pakāseti, pilapati, sandasseti
Variant āvīkaroti
Sanskrit āviṣkaroti

Example

caturo samaṇā na pañcam'atthi,
te te āvikaromi sakkhipuṭṭho,
maggajino maggadesako ca,
magge jīvati yo ca maggadūsī.

SNP 5 cundasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 5
āvikaroti 2

pr. (+acc) (vinaya) discloses; divulges; openly reveals; confesses; lit. makes open [āvi + karoti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning (vinaya) discloses; divulges; openly reveals; confesses; lit. makes open
Construction āvi + karoti
Compound comp verb (āvi + karoti)
Antonym nāvikaroti
Variant āvīkaroti
Sanskrit āviṣkaroti

Examples

yassa siyā āpatti, so āvikareyya, asantiyā āpattiyā tuṇhī bhavitabbaṃ, tuṇhībhāvena kho pan'āyasmante parisuddhā'ti vedissāmi.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso

caturo samaṇā na pañcam'atthi,
te te āvikaromi sakkhipuṭṭho,
maggajino maggadesako ca,
magge jīvati yo ca maggadūsī.

SNP 5 cundasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 5
āvikaronta 1

prp. (+acc) explaining; clarifying; lit. making open [āvi + karonta] ~

Grammar prp of āvikaroti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning explaining; clarifying; lit. making open
Construction āvi + karonta
Sanskrit āvis + kurvat
āvikaronta 2

prp. (+acc) disclosing; divulging openly revealing; lit. making open [āvi + karonta] ~

Grammar prp of āvikaroti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning disclosing; divulging openly revealing; lit. making open
Construction āvi + karonta
Sanskrit āvis + kurvat
āvikātabba

ptp. (vinaya) should be disclosed; should be divulged; should be openly revealed; lit. to be made open [āvi + kātabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of āvikaroti, comp vb
Meaning (vinaya) should be disclosed; should be divulged; should be openly revealed; lit. to be made open
Construction āvi + kātabba
Compound comp verb (āvi + kātabba)
Variant āvīkātabba
Sanskrit āviṣkartavya

Example

sampajānamusāvādo kho pan'āyasmanto antarāyiko dhammo vutto bhagavatā, tasmā saramānena bhikkhunā āpannena visuddh'āpekkhena santī āpatti āvikātabbā, āvikatā hi'ssa phāsu hoti.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso
āvijjhati 1

pr. encircles, goes round, whirls round [ā + √vidh] ✗
āvijjhati 2

pr. pierces through [ā + √vidh] ✗
āvijjhana

nt. going to whirling round [ā + √vidh] ✗
āvijjhi 1

aor. encircled, went round, whirled round [ā + √vidh] ✗
āvijjhi 2

aor. pierced through [ā + √vidh] ✗
āvijjhitvā 1

abs. having surrounded [ā + √vidh] ✗
āvijjhitvā 2

abs. having pierced through [ā + √vidh] ✗
āviñchati

pr. (+acc or +loc) pulls (towards); tugs (to) [ā + vi + √añch + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc or +loc)
Meaning pulls (towards); tugs (to)
Root Family ā vi √añch
Root √añch･1 a (extend, draw along)
Base √añch + a > añcha
Construction ā + vi + añcha + ti
Antonym nāviñchati
Synonym kaḍḍhati
Variant āviñjati
Notes possibly corruption of āvañchati "wanders towards"
Sanskrit āvañcati
Sanskrit Root √āñch 1 (tear)

Examples

daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā majjhe gaṇṭhiṃ karitvā ossajjeyya. atha kho, te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

mano āviñchati manāpiyesu dhammesu, amanāpiyā dhammā paṭikūlā honti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, asaṃvaro hoti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
āviñchana

nt. picking up, dealing with, directing towards [ā + vi + √añch] ✗
āviñchi

aor. (+acc) pulled; tugged [ā + vi + √añch + i] ~

Grammar aor of āviñchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning pulled; tugged
Root Family ā vi √añch
Root √añch･1 a (extend, draw along)
Construction ā + vi + √añch + i
Sanskrit Root √āñch 1 (tear)
āviñjati 1

pr. (+acc) pulls; pulls on [ā + vi + √iñj + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning pulls; pulls on
Root Family ā vi √iñj
Root √iñj･1 a (move, shake)
Base √iñj + a > iñja
Construction ā + vi + iñja + ti
Variant āviñchati
Sanskrit āvarjati
Sanskrit Root √iṅg 1 (stir)

Examples

no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, ubho kaṇṇasotāni āviñjeyyāsi pāṇinā gattāni anumajjeyyāsi

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā majjhe gaṇṭhiṃ karitvā ossajjeyya. atha kho, te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñjeyyuṃ

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
āviñjati 2

pr. churns, agitates [ā + vi + √iñj] ✗

adj. swinging round [ā + vi + √iñj] ✗
āviñjanaka 2

adj. hanging loose [ā + vi + √iñj] ✗

fem. rope to raise a latch ✗

āviñjanarajju

āviṭṭha

pp. entered, approached, possessed by a spirit [ā + √vis] ✗
āviddha 1

pp. encircled, went round, whirled round [ā + √vidh] ✗
āviddha 2

pp. pierced through [ā + √vidh] ✗
āvibhavati

pr. becomes clear; becomes evident ✗
āvibhāva

masc. appearance; manifestation; becoming visible [āvi + bhāva] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp, from āvibhavati
Meaning appearance; manifestation; becoming visible
Construction āvi + bhāva
Synonym pātubhāva
Sanskrit āvirbhāva

Example

so sace ākaṅkhati, anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhaveyyaṃ, eko'pi hutvā bahudhā assaṃ, bahudhā'pi hutvā eko assaṃ, āvibhāvaṃ tirobhāvaṃ

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ
āvibhāvatta

nt. fact of appearance; fact of manifestation; fact of becoming visible [āvi + bhāva + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp, from āvibhāva
Meaning fact of appearance; fact of manifestation; fact of becoming visible

āvibhāva + tta

Sanskrit āvirbhāva +
āvibhūta

pp. become clear; become manifest; become visible [āvi + bhūta] ~

Grammar pp of āvibhavati, comp vb
Meaning become clear; become manifest; become visible
Construction āvi + bhūta
Sanskrit āvirbhūta
āvila 1

adj. cloudy; murky; unclear; lit. broken [ā + √bil + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from āvilati
Meaning cloudy; murky; unclear; lit. broken
Root Family ā √bil
Root √bil･1 a (break, chop)
Construction ā + √bil > vil + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change v > b
Antonym accha
Commentary (ANa) āvilo'ti appasanno.
Sanskrit āvila
Sanskrit Root √bil 6, 10 (split)

Example

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto āvilo luḷito kalalībhūto andhakāre nikkhitto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya.

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ
āvila 2

adj. stirred up; agitated; disturbed; lit. broken [ā + √bil + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from āvilati
Meaning stirred up; agitated; disturbed; lit. broken
Root Family ā √bil
Root √bil･1 a (break, chop)
Construction ā + √bil > vil + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change v > b
Antonym anāvila
Synonym ākula
Commentary (THIa) āvilacitto'ti cittassa āvilabhāvakarānaṃ kāmavitakk'ādīnaṃ vasena āvilacitto
Sanskrit āvila
Sanskrit Root √bil 6, 10 (split)

Example

āvilacitto anāvilaṃ,
sarajo vītarajaṃ anaṅgaṇaṃ,
sabbattha vimuttamānasaṃ,
kiṃ maṃ ovariyāna tiṭṭhasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
āvilacitta

adj. mentally disturbed; mentally unsettled; stirred up by passion [āvila + citta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning mentally disturbed; mentally unsettled; stirred up by passion
Construction āvila + citta
Compound kammadhāraya (āvila + citta)
Commentary (THIa) āvilacitto'ti cittassa āvilabhāvakarānaṃ kāmavitakk'ādīnaṃ vasena āvilacitto
Sanskrit āvila + citta

Example

āvilacitto anāvilaṃ,
sarajo vītarajaṃ anaṅgaṇaṃ,
sabbattha vimuttamānasaṃ,
kiṃ maṃ ovariyāna tiṭṭhasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
āvilatta 1

nt. (of mind) fact of agitation; confusion; disturbance; lit. broken state [ā + √bil + a + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from āvila
Meaning (of mind) fact of agitation; confusion; disturbance; lit. broken state
Root Family ā √bil
Root √bil･1 a (break, chop)
Construction ā + √bil > vil + a + tta
āvila + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change v > b
Antonym anāvilatta
Sanskrit āvila +
Sanskrit Root √bil 6, 10 (split)

Example

theyyaṃ na kāre na musā bhaṇeyya,
mettāya phasse tasathāvarāni,
yadāvilattaṃ manaso vijaññā,
kaṇhassa pakkho'ti vinodayeyya.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16

āvisati 1

pr. (+acc) enters; approaches; takes possession of [ā + √vis] ✗
āvisati 2

pr. is possessed by a spirit [ā + √vis] ✗
āvisi 1

aor. (+acc) possessed; took control; lit. entered [ā + √vis + i] ✓

Grammar aor of āvisati, trans (+acc)
Meaning possessed; took control; lit. entered
Root Family ā √vis
Root √vis･1 a (enter)
Construction ā + √vis + i
Sanskrit āvikṣat
Sanskrit Root √viś 6 (enter)

Example

phandamānaṃ pajaṃ disvā,
macche app'odake yathā,
aññam'aññehi byāruddhe,
disvā maṃ bhayam'āvisi.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
āvisi 2

aor. entered, approached [ā + √vis] ✗
āviṃ

ind. before the eyes; openly, manifestly; in public ✗

ind. before the eyes; openly, manifestly; in public ✗

masc. who openly reveals themself; who displays themself openly [āvi + kattar] ~

r > t

āvuṭa 1

pp. (+instr) covered (by); concealed (by); hidden (by); enclosed (by); surrounded (by) [ā + √var + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of āvarati (+instr)
Meaning covered (by); concealed (by); hidden (by); enclosed (by); surrounded (by)
Root Family ā √var
Root √var･1 a (cover, dress, restrain)
Construction ā + √var > vur + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change a > u
rt > ṭ
Synonym guḷha, channa, chādita, nilīna, paṭicchanna, parikiṇṇa, paricchanna, parivārita, saṃvuta
Variant āvuta
Commentary (MNa) tamokhandhena āvuṭā'ti avijjārāsinā ajjhotthatā.
Sanskrit āvṛta
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

Example

paṭisotagāmiṃ nipuṇaṃ,
gambhīraṃ duddasaṃ aṇuṃ,
rāgarattā na dakkhanti,
tamokhandhena āvuṭā'ti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
āvuṭa 2

pp. (+instr) shrouded (by); cloaked (by) [ā + √var] ✗
āvuṭṭha

Grammar pp of āvasati (+instr)
Meaning inhabited (by); lived in (by); dwelt in (by)
Root Family ā √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)
Construction ā + √vas > vus + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change a > u (sk ṛ)
st > ṭṭh
Synonym ajjhāvuṭṭha, abhinivuṭṭha, nisevita
Variant āvuttha
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)
āvuṇati

pr. strings; threads; inserts; impales [ā + √vu] ✗

āvuṇāti 1

pr. (+acc) conceals; hides; covers [ā + √vu + ṇā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning conceals; hides; covers
Root Family ā √vu
Root √vu･4 ṇā (weave, cover)

Construction ā + vuṇā + ti

Sanskrit āvṛṇoti
Sanskrit Root √ve 1 (weave)

Example

su'icc'evam'ādito dhātugaṇato ṇu ṇā uṇā'icc'ete paccayā honti kattari. abhisuṇoti, abhisuṇāti, saṃvuṇoti, saṃvuṇāti, āvuṇoti, āvuṇāti, pāpuṇoti, pāpuṇāti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 448

āvuṇoti

pr. covers; shuts; obstructs [ā + √vu] ✗

pp. (+instr) covered (by); concealed (by); hidden (by); enclosed (by); surrounded (by) [ā + √var + ta] ✓

Meaning covered (by); concealed (by); hidden (by); enclosed (by); surrounded (by)

Root √var･1 a (cover, dress, restrain)
Construction ā + √var > vur + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change a > u
rt > t

Variant āvuṭa

Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

Example

ayaṃ loko kena āvuto nivuto ovuto, pihito paṭicchanno paṭikujjito'ti, kena'ssu nivuto loko?

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa
āvuta 1.2

pp. (+instr) inhabited (by); lived in (by); dwelt in (by) [ā + √vas + ta] ✓

isisaṅghanisevitaṃ,

pītisañjananaṃ mama.

SN 1.48 jetavanasuttaṃ
āvudha

nt. weapon; arms; (comm) bows and crossbows [ā + √yudh + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from āyujjhati
Meaning weapon; arms; (comm) bows and crossbows
Root Family ā √yudh
Root √yudh･3 ya (fight)
Construction ā + √yudh > vudh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change y > v
Commentary (VIN 2.7.6) āvudhaṃ nāma cāpo kodaṇḍo.
Sanskrit āyudha
Sanskrit Root √yudh 1, 4 (fight)

Examples

sutvāna corā isino subhāsitaṃ,
nikkhippa satthāni ca āvudhāni ca,
tamhā ca kammā viramiṃsu eke,
eke ca pabbajjam'arocayiṃsu.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

kumbh'ūpamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā,
nagar'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā.
yodhetha māraṃ paññā-āvudhena,
jitañ'ca rakkhe anivesano siyā.

DHP 40 cittavaggo
āvudhajāta

nt. kind of weapon [āvudha + jāta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning kind of weapon
Construction āvudha + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (āvudha + jāta)
Synonym mataja
Sanskrit āyudha + jāta

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, matajaṃ nāma āvudhajātaṃ ubhatodhāraṃ pītanisitaṃ. tadassa saṅghāṭiyā sampārutaṃ sampaliveṭhitaṃ. tath'ūpam'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imassa bhikkhuno pabbajjaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
āvudhapāṇisikkhāpada

nt. Sekhiya 60; lit. rule about (teaching the Dhamma to someone with) a weapon in hand [āvudhapāṇī + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Sekhiya 60; lit. rule about (teaching the Dhamma to someone with) a weapon in hand
Construction āvudhapāṇī + sikkhāpada
āvudhapāṇī

adj. with weapon in hand; carrying arms [āvudha + pāṇī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with weapon in hand; carrying arms
Construction āvudha + pāṇī
Compound kammadhāraya (āvudha + pāṇī)
Commentary (VINa) āvudhapāṇissā'ti ettha kiñ'cā'pi vuttaṃ, āvudhaṃ nāma cāpo kodaṇḍo'ti, atha kho sabbā'pi dhanuvikati saddhiṃ saravikatiyā āvudhan'ti veditabbaṃ.
Sanskrit āyudha + pāṇi

Example

na āvudhapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 60 āvudhapāṇisikkhāpadaṃ
āvudhabala

adj. having weapons as one's power; lit. weapon strength [āvudha + bala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having weapons as one's power; lit. weapon strength
Construction āvudha + bala
Compound kammadhāraya (āvudha eva bala)
Commentary (JAa) āvudhabalavantānan'ti āvudhabalena yuttānaṃ samannāgatānaṃ.
Sanskrit āyudha + bala

Example

ruṇṇabalā, bhikkhave, dārakā, kodhabalā mātugāmā, āvudhabalā corā, issariyabalā rājāno, ujjhattibalā bālā, nijjhattibalā paṇḍitā, paṭisaṅkhānabalā bahussutā, khantibalā samaṇabrāhmaṇā, imāni kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭha balānī'ti.

AN 8.27 paṭhamabalasuttaṃ
āvudhalakkhaṇa

nt. auspicious marks of weapons ✗
āvunati

pr. strings; threads; inserts; impales [ā + √vu] ✗
āvunituṃ

inf. (+acc) to string; to thread [ā + √vu + ṇā + ituṃ] ~

Grammar inf of āvunati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to string; to thread
Root Family ā √vu
Root √vu･4 ṇā (weave, cover)
Base √vu + ṇā > vuṇā > vunā (irreg)
Construction ā + vunā + ituṃ
Sanskrit āvayitum
Sanskrit Root √ve 1 (weave)
āvusavāda

masc. addressing as friend, title brother ✗
āvuso

ind. brother; brothers; friend; friends [ā + √i + *as + mant + o] ✓

Grammar ind, voc sg and pl
Meaning brother; brothers; friend; friends
Root Family ā √i
Root √i･1 (come, go)
Construction ā + √i > ay + *as + mant + o
āyasmanto > āyas(mant)o > āvuso
Synonym samma
Notes a familiar form of address among monks
Sanskrit āyusmanto
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

cittasmiṃ vasībhūt'āmhi,
iddhipādā subhāvitā,
sabbabandhanamutt'āmhi,
na taṃ bhāyāmi āvuso'ti.

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ

na kho pan'āhaṃ, āvuso, appatvā lokassa antaṃ dukkhassa antakiriyaṃ vadāmi

SN 2.26 rohitassasuttaṃ
āvusovāda

masc. word friend; familiar form of address [āvuso + vāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning word friend; familiar form of address
Construction āvuso + vāda
Compound kammadhāraya (āvuso + vāda)
Sanskrit āyusmanto + vāda

Examples

accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo'haṃ bhagavantaṃ āvusovādena samudācaritabbaṃ amaññissaṃ.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

app'ekacce maṃ paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesuṃ, app'ekacce āsanaṃ paññapesuṃ, app'ekacce pād'odakaṃ upaṭṭhapesuṃ. api ca kho maṃ nāmena ca āvusovādena ca samudācaranti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
āveṭhana

nt. winding round, ravelling [ā + √veṭh] ✗
āveṭhita

pp. twisted or wrapped over [ā + √veṭh] ✗
āveṭheti

pr. twists or wraps over [ā + √veṭh] ✗
āveṭhesi

aor. twisted or wrapped over [ā + √veṭh] ✗
āveṇi

ind. autonomously; individualy; separately; lit. not woven [a + √ve + i] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from na veṇi
Meaning autonomously; individualy; separately; lit. not woven
Root Family √ve
Root √ve･1 a (weave)
Construction a > ā + √ve + [ṇ] + i
Derivative kita (i)
Phonetic Change +ṇ
Variant āveni, āveniṃ, āveṇikaṃ
Commentary (PYt) visun'ti iminā āveṇisaddo visun'tiatthavācako anipphannapāṭipadiko'ti dasseti.
Sanskrit aveṇi, āveṇika
Sanskrit Root √ve 1 (weave)

Example

te imehi dasahi vatthūhi avakassanti apakassanti āveṇi kammāni karonti āveṇi pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti. ettāvatā kho, upāli, saṅgho bhinno hotī'ti.

AN 10.37 saṅghabhedasuttaṃ
āveṇika

adj. specific; unique to; different; particular; lit. not braided [na + √ve + ī + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from na veṇi, neg
Meaning specific; unique to; different; particular; lit. not braided

Root √ve･1 (weave)

aveṇi + ika

Phonetic Change +ṇ
Sanskrit āveṇika
Sanskrit Root √ve 1 (weave)

Example

pañc'imāni, bhikkhave, mātugāmassa āveṇikāni dukkhāni

SN 37.3 āveṇikadukkhasuttaṃ
āveṇikadukkhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 37.3 (SN37.3) ✗
āveṇibhāva

masc. separateness, distinction; schism ✗
āveṇiya

adj. not united, not mingled together (as is a plait of hair or the confluence of rivers); separate; specific, particular ✗
āveṇiṃ

ind. separately, apart; or not united, separate ✗
āvedhita

pp. trembled, quaked [ā + √vedh] ✗
āveni

ind. autonomously; individualy; separately; lit. not woven [a + √ve + i] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from na veṇi
Meaning autonomously; individualy; separately; lit. not woven
Root Family √ve
Root √ve･1 a (weave)
Construction a > ā + √ve + [n] + i
Derivative kita (i)
Phonetic Change +n
Variant āveṇi, āveniṃ, āveṇikaṃ
Commentary (VINa) āvenin'ti visuṃ.
Sanskrit aveṇi, āveṇika
Sanskrit Root √ve 1 (weave)

Example

te imehi dasahi vatthūhi avakassanti apakassanti āveni kammāni karonti āveni pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti. ettāvatā kho, upāli, saṅgho bhinno hotī'ti.

AN 10.37 saṅghabhedasuttaṃ
āvenika

adj. not united, not mingled together (as is a plait of hair or the confluence of rivers); separate; specific, particular ✗
āveniya

adj. not united, not mingled together (as is a plait of hair or the confluence of rivers); separate; specific, particular ✗
āveniṃ

ind. separately, apart; or not united, separate ✗
āvelā

fem. garland for the head, chaplet ✗
āvellita

pp. curved, crooked, curled [ā + √vell] ✗
āvesana 1

nt. workshop; lit. entering here [ā + √vis + *ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from āvisati
Meaning workshop; lit. entering here
Root Family ā √vis
Root √vis･1 a (enter)
Construction ā + √vis > ves + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant nivesana
Sanskrit āveśana
Sanskrit Root √viś 6 (enter)

Examples

sace te, bhaggava, agaru viharemu āvesane ekarattan'ti. na kho me, bhante, garu. atthi c'ettha pabbajito paṭhamaṃ vās'ūpagato. sace so anujānāti, viharatha, bhante, yathāsukhan'ti.

bhikkhū ghaṭikārassa kumbhakārassa āvesanaṃ uttiṇam'akaṃsu.

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
āsa 2.1

Meaning shooting; throwing; hurling

Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit āsa (bow)
Sanskrit Root √as 4 (throw)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, issāso vā issās'antevāsī vā tiṇapurisarūpake vā mattikāpuñje vā yoggaṃ karitvā, so aparena samayena dūrepātī ca hoti akkhaṇavedhī ca mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

unnaḷassa pamattassa,
bāhir'āsassa bhikkhuno,

pāripūriṃ na gacchati.

āsaṅkati 1

adj. (+acc) suspecting; fearing; apprehensive (about); imagining (something bad) [ā + √saṅk + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from āsaṅkati (+acc)
Meaning suspecting; fearing; apprehensive (about); imagining (something bad)

Root √saṅk･1 a (doubt, suspect)
Construction ā + √saṅk + ī

Commentary (SNPa) na so mitto yo sadā appamatto, bhedāsaṅkī randham'ev'ānupassī'ti yo bhedam'eva āsaṅkamāno katamadhurena upacārena sadā appamatto viharati, yaṃkiñci assatiyā amanasikārena kataṃ, aññāṇakena vā akataṃ, yadā maṃ garahissati, tadā naṃ etena paṭicodessāmī'ti evaṃ randham'eva anupassati, na so mitto sevitabbo'ti.
Sanskrit āśaṅkin
Sanskrit Root √śaṅk 1 (doubt)

Example

na so mitto yo sadā appamatto,
bhedāsaṅkī randham'ev'ānupassī,
yasmiñ'ca seti urasī'va putto,
sa ve mitto yo parehi abhejjo.

āsajja 1

Examples

ye viruddhā sallapanti,

anariyaguṇam'āsajja,
añño'ññavivar'esino.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ

mayam'eva, bho gotama, dhaṃsī, mayaṃ pagabbā, ye mayaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ vādena vādaṃ āsādetabbaṃ amaññimha. siyā hi, bho gotama, hatthiṃ pabhinnaṃ āsajja purisassa sotthibhāvo, na tv'eva bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ āsajja siyā purisassa sotthibhāvo.

Examples

yo vejayantapāsādaṃ,
pād'aṅguṭṭhena kampayi,
t'ādisaṃ bhikkhum'āsajja,
kaṇha dukkhaṃ nigacchasi.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

khat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. upahat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā pitaraṃ dhammikaṃ dhammarājānaṃ jīvitā na voropessatha, imasmiññ'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ uppajjissathā'ti.

ubbhaṭṭhako'pi homi āsanapaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi homi ukkuṭikappadhānamanuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi homi kaṇṭakāpassaye seyyaṃ kappemi, sāyatatiyakam'pi udakorohanānuyogamanuyutto viharāmi

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā nigaṇṭhā isigilipasse kāḷasilāyaṃ ubbhaṭṭhakā honti āsanapaṭikkhittā, opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayanti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
āsanapariyanta

masc. last seat ✗
āsanappaṭikkhitta

adj. who has rejected seats; who does not sit down [āsana + paṭikkhitta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has rejected seats; who does not sit down
Construction āsana + paṭikkhitta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (āsanāni + paṭikkhitta)
Sanskrit āsana + pratikṣipta

Example

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

mahāvaggo 11

āsanna 1

pp. near; close by; proximate; in the neighbourhood (of); lit. seated near [ā + √sad + na] ✓

Grammar pp of āsīdati
Meaning near; close by; proximate; in the neighbourhood (of); lit. seated near
Root Family ā √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ā + √sad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Antonym dūra
Sanskrit āsanna
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

mahantasmiṃ kho pana lokasannivāse santi samaṇabrāhmaṇā iddhimanto dibbacakkhukā paracittaviduno. te dūrato'pi passanti, āsannā'pi na dissanti, cetasā'pi cittaṃ pajānanti.

āsabba

adj. bull-like; i.e. of strong and eminent qualities ✗
āsabha 1

adj. of a stud bull [usabha + *a] ~

Grammar adj, from usabha
Meaning of a stud bull

Phonetic Change u > ā (sk ṛ)
Sanskrit ārṣabha
āsabha 2

adj. foremost; primary; of the leader; lit. of the head bull [usabha + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from usabha
Meaning foremost; primary; of the leader; lit. of the head bull
Construction usabha > āsabha + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > ā (sk ṛ)
Synonym seṭṭha
Commentary (ANa) āsabhaṃ ṭhānan'ti seṭṭhaṭṭhānaṃ uttamaṭṭhānaṃ. āsabhā vā pubbabuddhā, tesaṃ ṭhānan'ti attho.
Sanskrit ārṣabha

Example

dasabalasamannāgato, bhikkhave, tathāgato catūhi ca vesārajjehi samannāgato āsabhaṃ ṭhānaṃ paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṃ nadati, brahmacakkaṃ pavatteti

SN 47.12 nālandasuttaṃ
āsamāna

prp. desiring; wishing for [ā + √siṃs] ✗
āsaya 1

masc. tendency; inclination; disposition; bias; lit. resting place [ā + √sī + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning tendency; inclination; disposition; bias; lit. resting place
Root Family ā √sī
Root √sī･1 a (lie, sleep)
Construction ā + √sī > say + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Antonym nirāsaya
Synonym ajjhāsaya, ākāra
Sanskrit āśraya
Sanskrit Root √śī 1, 2 (lie)

Example

jhān'ānuyutto bahujāgarassa,
upekkham'ārabbha samāhit'atto,
takk'āsayaṃ kukkucciy'ūpachinde.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16

yaṃnūna mayaṃ amuṃ nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ nevāpikassa upanissāya āsayaṃ kappeyyāma.

āsarati

pr. approaches [ā + √sar] ✗

masc. discharge from a sore; suppuration from a wound [ā + √su + *a] ✓

Meaning discharge from a sore; suppuration from a wound
Root Family ā √su
Root √su･1 a (flow)
√ In Comps ssu

Derivative kita (*a)

Antonym anāsava
Sanskrit āsrava
Sanskrit Root √sru 1 (flow)

Example

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
āsava 1.2

masc. discharge; suppuration; outflow; effluent [ā + √su + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āsavati
Meaning discharge; suppuration; outflow; effluent
Root Family ā √su
Root √su･1 a (flow)
√ In Comps ssu
Construction ā + √su > sav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > av
Antonym anāsava
Synonym assava
Commentary (ANa) āsavā'ti kilesā.
Notes 3 āsavā: 1. kāmāsava, 2. bhavāsava, 3. avijjāsava. 4. āsavā 1. kāmāsava, 2. bhavāsava, 3. diṭṭhāsava, 4 avijjāsava. The list of four appears for the first time in Khuddakanikāya, then becomes the standard.
Sanskrit āsrava
Sanskrit Root √sru 1 (flow)

Examples

sadā jāgaramānānaṃ,
ahoratt'ānusikkhinaṃ,
nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ,
atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

DHP 226 kodhavaggo

katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā paññāya sacchikaraṇīyā? āsavānaṃ khayo, bhikkhave, paññāya sacchikaraṇīyo.

AN 4.189 sacchikaraṇīyasuttaṃ
āsava 1.3

nt. discharge; suppuration; outflow; effluent [ā + √su + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from āsavati
Meaning discharge; suppuration; outflow; effluent
Root Family ā √su
Root √su･1 a (flow)
√ In Comps ssu
Construction ā + √su > sav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > av
Antonym anāsava
Sanskrit āsrava
Sanskrit Root √sru 1 (flow)

Example

chetvā āsavāni ālayāni,
vidvā so na upeti gabbhaseyyaṃ,
saññaṃ tividhaṃ panujja paṅkaṃ,
kappaṃ n'eti tam'āhu ariyo'ti.

VIN 2.5.6.1 surāpānasikkhāpadaṃ

Examples

āsavā tassa vaḍḍhanti,
ārā so āsavakkhayā.

etam'ādīnaṃ ñatvā,
bhaven'amhi anatthiko,
nissaṭo sabbakāmehi,
patto me āsavakkhayo'ti.

Meaning depletion of the defilements; exhaustion of the effluents
Construction āsava + pariyādāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āsavānaṃ + pariyādāna)
Sanskrit āsrava + paryādāna

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco puggalo sabbasaṅkhāresu anicc'ānupassī viharati, aniccasaññī, aniccapaṭisaṃvedī satataṃ samitaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ cetasā adhimuccamāno paññāya pariyogāhamāno. tassa apubbaṃ acarimaṃ āsavapariyādānañ'ca hoti jīvitapariyādānañ'ca.

AN 7.16 aniccānupassīsuttaṃ
āsavapahānasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.56 (SN35.56) ✗
āsavasamugghātasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.57 (SN35.57) ✗
āsavasamudaya

masc. source of the effluents; arising of the defilements [āsava + samudaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning source of the effluents; arising of the defilements
Construction āsava + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āsavānaṃ + samudaya)
Sanskrit āsrava + samudaya

Examples

ayaṃ āsavasamudayo'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako āsavañ'ca pajānāti, āsavasamudayañ'ca pajānāti, āsavanirodhañ'ca pajānāti, āsavanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadañ'ca pajānāti, ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
āsavasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.163 (SN45.163) ✗
āsavasutta 2

āsavasutta 4

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.183 (AN10.183) ✗

Meaning name of a group of deities
Root Family ā √su
Root √su･1 a (flow)

Sanskrit āsrava

āsavānaṃ khayañāṇa

idiom. knowledge of the extinction of the effluents; understanding how the impurities are slowly worn away [āsavānaṃ + khaya + ñāṇa] ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + nt
Meaning knowledge of the extinction of the effluents; understanding how the impurities are slowly worn away
Construction āsavānaṃ + khaya + ñāṇa
Sanskrit āsrava + kṣaya + jñāna

Example

so evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigat'ūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṃ khayañāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
āsavāvijjā

fem. effluents and ignorance; defilement and illusion [āsava + avijjā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning effluents and ignorance; defilement and illusion
Construction āsava + avijjā
āsavi

aor. flowed [ā + √su] ✗
āsasāna

prp. praying for; wishing to get; desiring; expecting [ā + √sas + a + āna] ✓

Grammar prp of āsasati, intrans
Meaning praying for; wishing to get; desiring; expecting
Root Family ā √sas
Root √sas･1 a (breath)
√ In Comps ssas
Base √sas + a > sasa
Construction ā + sasa + āna
Derivative kita (āna)
Synonym āsīsanta, āsīsamāna
Notes (PED) either grd. for *āsaṃsāna or contracted form of ppr. med. of āsaṃsati (= āsiṃsati) for *asaṃsamāna
Sanskrit āśvasat
Sanskrit Root √śvas 1, 2 (blow)

Example

nirāsaso so na ca āsasāno,
paññāṇavā so na ca paññakappī,
evam'pi todeyya muniṃ vijāna,
akiñcanaṃ kāmabhave asattan'ti.

SNP 64 todeyya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 9
āsaṃsa

adj. having wishes or expectations [ā + √saṃs] ✗
āsaṃsamāna

prp. wishing or expecting [ā + √saṃs] ✗
āsaṃsasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.13 (AN3.13) ✗
āsaṃsuka

adj. full of expectation; hoping ✗
āsā

fem. wish; desire; hope; expectation [ā + √is + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from icchati
Meaning wish; desire; hope; expectation
Root Family ā √is
Root √is･1 a (wish for)
Construction ā + √is + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Antonym nirāsā
Synonym apekkhā, icchā, kamyatā, kāmatā, paccāsā
Notes √siṃs?
Sanskrit āśā
Sanskrit Root √iṣ 1, 4, 6, 9 (seek, desire)

Examples

āsā yassa na vijjanti,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca,
nirāsāsaṃ visaṃyuttaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 410 brāhmaṇavaggo

na kappayanti na purekkharonti,
accantasuddhī'ti na te vadanti,
ādānaganthaṃ gathitaṃ visajja,
āsaṃ na kubbanti kuhiñci loke.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
āsā ca niṭṭhā ca

idiom. hopes and aspirations; wishes and expectations ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + ind + fem + ind
Meaning hopes and aspirations; wishes and expectations
Sanskrit āśā + niṣṭhā

Example

chandānidānāni piyāni loke,
ye c'āpi lobhā vicaranti loke,
āsā ca niṭṭhā ca itonidānā,
ye samparāyāya narassa honti.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11
āsāṭikā 1

fem. insect's egg; nit; (comm) bluebottle egg ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning insect's egg; nit; (comm) bluebottle egg
Commentary (ANa) na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā'ti gunnaṃ khāṇukaṇṭak'ādīhi pahaṭaṭṭhānesu vaṇo hoti. tattha nīlamakkhikā aṇḍakāni ṭhapenti, tesaṃ āsāṭikā'ti nāmaṃ.
Non IA āsāḍī (Mārāṭhi)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, gopālako na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṃ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṃ kattā hoti, na titthaṃ jānāti, na pītaṃ jānāti, na vīthiṃ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
āsāṭikā 2

fem. (comm) thought of sensuality, ill-will or harming; lit. insect's egg ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning (comm) thought of sensuality, ill-will or harming; lit. insect's egg
Commentary (ANa) na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hotī'ti uppannaṃ kāmavitakkan'ti evaṃ vutte kāmavitakk'ādayo na vinodeti.
Non IA āsāḍī (Mārāṭhi)

Example

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ adhivāseti nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
āsādana 1

nt. (+gen) approaching; encountering; meeting (of) [ā + √sad + *e + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from āsādeti, caus (+gen)
Meaning approaching; encountering; meeting (of)
Root Family ā √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ā + sāde + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit āsādana
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
āsādana 2

nt. (+gen) insulting; assaulting; attacking (of) [ā + √sad + *e + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from āsādeti, caus (+gen)
Meaning insulting; assaulting; attacking (of)
Root Family ā √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ā + sāde + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (DNa) āsādanā'ti ahaṃ buddhena saddhiṃ pāṭihāriyaṃ karissāmī'ti ghaṭṭanā. (VIN 2.5.4.6) āsādan'āpekkho'ti iminā imaṃ codessāmi sāressāmi paṭicodessāmi paṭisāressāmi maṅku karissāmī'ti
Sanskrit āsādana
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ bhuttāviṃ pavāritaṃ anatirittena khādanīyena vā bhojanīyena vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, handa bhikkhu khāda vā bhuñja vā'ti jānaṃ āsādan'āpekkho, bhuttasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 36 dutiyapavāraṇāsikkhāpadaṃ

evam'eva kho tvaṃ, āvuso pāthikaputta, sugat'āpadānesu jīvamāno sugat'ātirittāni bhuñjamāno tathāgate arahante sammāsambuddhe āsādetabbaṃ maññasi. ke ca chave pāthikaputte, kā ca tathāgatānaṃ arahantānaṃ sammāsambuddhānaṃ āsādanā'ti.

DN 24.5 pāthikasuttaṃ
āsādanapekkha

adj. looking to insult, aiming to be offensive ✗
āsādanāpekkha

adj. looking to attack; wanting to offend; wishing to insult; looking for revenge [āsādana + apekkha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning looking to attack; wanting to offend; wishing to insult; looking for revenge
Construction āsādana + apekkha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (āsādanaṃ + apekkha)
Commentary (VINa) āsādan'āpekkho'ti āsādanaṃ codanaṃ maṅkukaraṇabhāvaṃ apekkhamāno.
Sanskrit āsādana + apekṣā

Example

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ bhuttāviṃ pavāritaṃ anatirittena khādanīyena vā bhojanīyena vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, handa bhikkhu khāda vā bhuñja vā'ti jānaṃ āsādan'āpekkho, bhuttasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 36 dutiyapavāraṇāsikkhāpadaṃ
āsādayati

pr. meets, encounters, reaches; approaches with (physical or verbal) violence; strikes against, hits; offends, insults [ā + √sad] ✗

Grammar aor of āsīdati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning offended; insulted
Root Family ā √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ā + sāde + i
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant āsadi
Sanskrit āsad
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
āsādiya

ger. (+acc) insulting; assaulting; attacking [ā + √sad + *e + iya] ✓

Grammar ger of āsādeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning insulting; assaulting; attacking
Root Family ā √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ā + sāde + iya
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym āsajja
Variant āhaniya
Commentary (THIa) āsādiyā'ti ghaṭṭetvā.
Sanskrit āsādya (putting down)
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

āsādiya edisaṃ janaṃ,
aggiṃ pajjalitaṃ va liṅgiya,
gaṇhiya āsīvisaṃ viya,
api nu sotthi siyā khamehi no.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
āsāduppajahavagga

masc. Chapter 11 of Dukanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 2.119-130 ✗
āsādetabba

ptp. could be attacked; could be assailed; could be offended; could be insulted; lit. to cause to be sunk [ā + √sad + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of āsādeti, caus
Meaning could be attacked; could be assailed; could be offended; could be insulted; lit. to cause to be sunk
Root Family ā √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ā + sāde + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (SNa) āsādetabban'ti ghaṭṭayitabbaṃ.
Sanskrit āsādayitavya
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Examples

atha kho tā devatāyo pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhahitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ, accayo no, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yā mayaṃ bhagavantaṃ āsādetabbaṃ amaññimhā.

SN 1.35 ujjhānasaññisuttaṃ

evam'eva kho tvaṃ, āvuso pāthikaputta, sugat'āpadānesu jīvamāno sugat'ātirittāni bhuñjamāno tathāgate arahante sammāsambuddhe āsādetabbaṃ maññasi. ke ca chave pāthikaputte, kā ca tathāgatānaṃ arahantānaṃ sammāsambuddhānaṃ āsādanā'ti.

DN 24.5 pāthikasuttaṃ
āsādeti 1

pr. (+acc) offends; insults [ā + √sad + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of āsīdati, trans (+acc)
Meaning offends; insults
Root Family ā √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ā + sāde + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) akappiyena āsādetī'ti acchamaṃsaṃ sūkaramaṃsan'ti, dīpimaṃsaṃ vā migamaṃsan'ti khādāpetvā, tvaṃ kiṃ samaṇo nāma, akappiyamaṃsaṃ te khāditan'ti ghaṭṭeti.
Sanskrit āsādayati
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

yam'pi so tathāgataṃ vā tathāgatasāvakaṃ vā akappiyena āsādeti, iminā pañcamena ṭhānena bahuṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.

āsi 2.1

aor. sat [√ās] ✗

Root Family ā √sic

Construction ā + siñca + ti
Synonym siñcati
Sanskrit āsiñcati
Sanskrit Root √sic 6 (pour out)

Example

bhante, idaṃ udakaṃ dārakassa sīse āsiñcāmā'ti āpucchitvā, tena hi āsiñcathā'ti vutte tathā akāsi. sā devatā tāva'd'eva taṃ muñcitvā gantvā leṇadvāre aṭṭhāsi.

DHPa 2.26.21 pabbhāravāsī tissatthera vatthu
āsiñcanta

prp. sprinkling, pouring [ā + √sic] ✗
