MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
āsī 2.1

fem. blessing [ā + √is] ✗
āsītika 1

masc. liana; box bean plant; Entada scandens; lit. eighty years old [aṭṭha + dasa + *ika] ✓

Grammar masc, from asīti, comp
Meaning liana; box bean plant; Entada scandens; lit. eighty years old
Construction aṭṭha + dasa + *ika
asīti > āsīti + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā'ti yathā āsītikavalliyā vā kāḷavalliyā vā sandhiṭṭhānesu milāyitvā majjhe unnatunnatāni honti, evaṃ mayhaṃ aṅgapaccaṅgāni hontī'ti dasseti.
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entada
Sanskrit āsītakī

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
āsītika 2

adj. eighty years old [aṭṭha + dasa + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from asīti, comp
Meaning eighty years old
Construction aṭṭha + dasa + *ika
asīti > āsīti + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit aśītika

Examples

yato ca kho ayaṃ bhavaṃ puriso jiṇṇo hoti vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto, āsītiko vā nāvutiko vā vassasatiko vā jātiyā, atha tamhā paññāveyyattiyā, parihāyatī'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, tam'eva bhaginiṃ passeyya aparena samayena āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantiṃ āturaṃ gatayobbanaṃ khaṇḍadantaṃ palitakesaṃ, vilūnaṃ khalitasiraṃ valinaṃ tilak'āhatagattaṃ.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
āsītikapabba

nt. joint of a liana; knot of a box bean plant; lit. eighty years old limb [āsītika + pabba] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning joint of a liana; knot of a box bean plant; lit. eighty years old limb
Construction āsītika + pabba
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āsītikassa + pabba)
Commentary (MNa) āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā'ti yathā āsītikavalliyā vā kāḷavalliyā vā sandhiṭṭhānesu milāyitvā majjhe unnatunnatāni honti, evaṃ mayhaṃ aṅgapaccaṅgāni hontī'ti dasseti.
Sanskrit āsītakī + parvan

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
āsīdati

pr. approaches; meets with, encounters; approaches with (physical or verbal) violence; strikes against, hits; offends, insults [ā + √sad] ✗
āsīditvā

abs. (+acc) having offended, having insulted [ā + √sad + a + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of āsīdati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having offended, having insulted
Root Family ā √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + a > sada > sīda (irreg)
Construction ā + sīda + itvā
Sanskrit āsattvā
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
āsīna 1

pp. seated; sitting [√ās + na] ✓

Grammar pp of āsati, in comps
Meaning seated; sitting
Root Family √ās
Root √ās･1 a (sit)
Construction √ās + [ī] + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change +ī
Sanskrit āsīna
Sanskrit Root √ās 2 (sit)

Examples

porāṇam'etaṃ atula,
n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ,
nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti,
n'atthi loke anindito.

DHP 227 kodhavaggo

jhāyiṃ virajam'āsīnaṃ,
katakiccaṃ anāsavaṃ,
pāraguṃ sabbadhammānaṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
aññāvimokkhaṃ pabrūhi,
avijjāya pabhedanaṃ.

SNP 68 udaya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 13
āsīna 2

pp. settled; (comm) sitting still as a stone; lit. seated [√ās + na] ✓

Grammar pp of āsati, in comps
Meaning settled; (comm) sitting still as a stone; lit. seated
Root Family √ās
Root √ās･1 a (sit)
Construction √ās + [ī] + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change +ī
Commentary (NIDD2) āsīnan'ti nisinno bhagavā pāsāṇake cetiye'ti āsīno.
Sanskrit āsīna
Sanskrit Root √ās 2 (sit)

Example

jhāyiṃ virajam'āsīnaṃ,
katakiccam'anāsavaṃ,
uttam'attham'anuppattaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 386 brāhmaṇavaggo
āsīvisa

masc. poisonous snake; lit. poison fang [āsī + visa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning poisonous snake; lit. poison fang
Construction āsī + visa
Compound kammadhāraya (āsī + visa)
Sanskrit āśīviṣa

Examples

āsādiya edisaṃ janaṃ,
aggiṃ pajjalitaṃ va liṅgiya,
gaṇhiya āsīvisaṃ viya,
api nu sotthi siyā khamehi no.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, āsīviso ghoraviso. atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitukāmo amaritukāmo sukhakāmo dukkhapaṭikūlo.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
āsīvisavagga

masc. Chapter 19 of the Saḷāyatanasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 4 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
āsīvisasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.110 (AN4.110) ✗
āsīvisūpama

adj. like a poisonous snake; like a viper [āsīvisa + upama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a poisonous snake; like a viper
Construction āsīvisa + upama
Commentary (THIa) sappaṭibhay'aṭṭhena āsīvis'ūpamā.
āsīvisopamasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.238 (SN35.238) ✗
āsīsa

masc. (+acc) desire; wish; prayer; benediction [ā + √siṃs + a + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āsīsati, trans (+acc)
Meaning desire; wish; prayer; benediction
Root Family ā √siṃs
Root √siṃs･1 a (hope, wish)
Base √siṃs + a > siṃsa > sīsa (irreg)
Construction ā + sīsa + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change iṃ > ī
Synonym chanda, nikāma, vasa
Sanskrit āśis
Sanskrit Root √śaṃs 1 (praise)

Example

āṇāty'atthe ca āsīsa-atthe ca anuttakāle pañcamīvibhatti hoti. karotu kusalaṃ, sukhaṃ te hotu.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 415
āsīsati

pr. (+acc) desires; wishes to get; hopes to get; expects [ā + √siṃs + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning desires; wishes to get; hopes to get; expects
Root Family ā √siṃs
Root √siṃs･1 a (hope, wish)
Base √siṃs + a > siṃsa > sīsa (irreg)
Construction ā + sīsa + ti
Phonetic Change iṃ > ī
Antonym nāsīsatī
Synonym jigiṃsati, jigīsati
Variant āsiṃsati
Sanskrit āśaṃsati
Sanskrit Root √śaṃs 1 (praise)

Examples

tasmā have lokavidū sumedho,
lok'antagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
lokassa antaṃ samitāvi ñatvā,
na-āsīsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

āsīsanti thomayanti abhijappanti juhanti,
kām'ābhijappanti paṭicca lābhaṃ,
te yājayogā bhavarāgarattā,
n'ātariṃsu jātijaran'ti brūmi.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3
āsīsanta

prp. (+acc) desiring; wishing to get; hoping to get; expecting [ā + √siṃs + a + nta] ~

Grammar prp of āsīsati, trans (+acc)
Meaning desiring; wishing to get; hoping to get; expecting
Root Family ā √siṃs

Synonym āsasāna, āsīsamāna

Sanskrit Root √śaṃs 1 (praise)
āsīsamāna

prp. (+acc) desiring; wishing to get; hoping to get; expecting [ā + √siṃs + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of āsīsati, trans (+acc)
Meaning desiring; wishing to get; hoping to get; expecting
Root Family ā √siṃs
Root √siṃs･1 a (hope, wish)
Base √siṃs + a > siṃsa > sīsa (irreg)

Variant āsiṃsamāna
Sanskrit āśaṃsamāna
Sanskrit Root √śaṃs 1 (praise)

Example

ye kec'ime isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
āsīsamānā puṇṇaka itthabhāvaṃ,
jaraṃ sitā yaññam'akappayiṃsu.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3

Phonetic Change iṃ > ī
Sanskrit āśaṃsayati
Sanskrit Root √śaṃs 1 (praise)
āsu

ind. quick; fast ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning quick; fast
Sanskrit āśu

Example

nihacca jāṇuṃ vanditvā,
sammukhā añjaliṃ akaṃ,
ehi bhadde'ti maṃ avaca,
sā me āsu-upasampadā.

THI 46 bhaddākuṇḍalakesātherīgāthā
āsumbhati

pr. (+acc) throws down; dumps [ā + √sumbh] ✗

Grammar aor of āsumbhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning threw down; dropped; dumped
Root Family ā √sumbh
Root √sumbh･1 a (throw, strike)
Construction ā + √sumbh + i
Synonym pātesi
Commentary (VINa) ṭhitako'va āsumbhī'ti yathā manussā araññato mahantaṃ dārubhāraṃ ānetvā kilantā ṭhitakā'va pātenti, evaṃ pātesī'ti attho.
Sanskrit ā + śumbh
Sanskrit Root √śumbh 1 (kill)
āsumbhitvā

abs. (+acc) having thrown down; having dropped; having dumped [ā + √sumbh + itvā] ~

Meaning having thrown down; having dropped; having dumped

Root √sumbh･1 a (throw, strike)

āsumhati

pr. lets fall, drops; throws down [ā + √sumbh] ✗

masc. demons, Sakka and goblins [asura + sakka + rakkhasa + ā] ~

Meaning demons, Sakka and goblins
Construction asura + sakka + rakkhasa + ā
asurasakkarakkhasa + ā
āsuṃ

aor. (+nom) they were; there were [a + √as + uṃ] ✓

Grammar aor 3rd pl of āsi, intrans (+nom)
Meaning they were; there were
Root Family √as
Root √as･1 a (be)
Construction a + √as + uṃ
Synonym ahesuṃ
Sanskrit āsuḥ
Sanskrit Root √as 2 (be)

Examples

koṭisatānaṃ navutīnaṃ,
asītiyā'pi ca koṭinaṃ,
ete āsuṃ tayo ṭhānā,
vimalānaṃ samāgame.

BV 18 siddhattha buddhavaṃsa

aparimeyyito kappe,
caturo āsuṃ vināyakā,
taṇhaṅkaro medhaṅkaro,
atho'pi saraṇaṅkaro,
dīpaṅkaro ca sambuddho,
ekakappamhi te jinā.

BV 28 buddha pakiṇṇaka kaṇḍaṃ
āsevati 1

pr. (+acc) applies oneself (to); engages (with); practices; pursues [ā + √sev + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning applies oneself (to); engages (with); practices; pursues
Root Family ā √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Base √sev + a > seva
Construction ā + seva + ti
Synonym anuyuñjati, paṭisevati, yuñjati, samāpajjati, sevati
Sanskrit āśrayati
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

Examples

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu bālo abyatto akhettaññū akusalo … paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati, so taṃ nimittaṃ na āsevati na bhāveti na bahulīkaroti na svādhiṭṭhitaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.

AN 9.35 gāvīupamāsuttaṃ

so taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti. tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti anusayā byantīhonti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
āsevati 2

pr. associates, frequents [ā + √sev] ✗
āsevana

nt. succession; repetition; lit. close association [ā + √sev] ✗
āsevanā

fem. (+gen) diligent practising (of); applying oneself (to); cultivating (of); lit. close association [ā + √sev + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from āsevati (+gen)
Meaning diligent practising (of); applying oneself (to); cultivating (of); lit. close association
Root Family ā √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Construction ā + √sev + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Commentary (SNa) āsevanāyā'ti kammaṭṭhān'āsevanāya.
Sanskrit āsevana
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

Examples

yā tesaṃ'y'eva dhammānaṃ āsevanā bhāvanā bahulīkammaṃ, ayaṃ ettha samādhibhāvanā'ti.

MN 44 cūḷavedallasuttaṃ

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, attānaṃ rakkhanto paraṃ rakkhati? āsevanāya, bhāvanāya, bahulīkammena, evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, attānaṃ rakkhanto paraṃ rakkhati.

SN 47.19 sedakasuttaṃ
āsevanta

prp. (+acc) applying oneself (to); practising; pursuing [ā + √sev + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of āsevati, trans (+acc)
Meaning applying oneself (to); practising; pursuing
Root Family ā √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Base √sev + a > seva
Construction ā + seva + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym āsevamāna
Sanskrit āsevat
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

Examples

so taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti. tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti anusayā byantīhonti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ

taṃ nimittaṃ āsevantena bhāventena bahulīkarontena mettāya vuttanayen'eva tikacatukkajjhānavasena appanā vaḍḍhetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
āsevamāna

prp. (+acc) applying oneself (to); engaging (with); practicing; pursuing [ā + √sev + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of āsevati, trans (+acc)
Meaning applying oneself (to); engaging (with); practicing; pursuing
Root Family ā √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Base √sev + a > seva
Construction ā + seva + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym āsevanta, sevamāna
Commentary (SNPa) tattha āsevamāno'ti tisso tikacatukkajjhānavasena, upekkhaṃ catutthajjhānavasena bhāvayamāno.
Sanskrit āsev, āsevamāna
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

Example

mettaṃ upekkhaṃ karuṇaṃ vimuttiṃ,
āsevamāno muditañ'ca kāle,
sabbena lokena avirujjhamāno,
eko care khaggavisāṇakappo.

SNP 3 khaggavisāṇasuttaṃ
āsevi

aor. (+acc) applied oneself (to); practiced; pursued [ā + √sev + i] ✓

Grammar aor of āsevati, trans (+acc)
Meaning applied oneself (to); practiced; pursued
Root Family ā √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Construction ā + √sev + i
Sanskrit āsev
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

Example

so kho ahaṃ, ānanda, aparena samayena kāmesu ādīnavaṃ disvā taṃ bahulamakāsiṃ, nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ adhigamma tam'āseviṃ. tassa mayhaṃ, ānanda, nekkhamme cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati etaṃ santan'ti passato.

AN 9.41 tapussasuttaṃ
āsevita

pp. practised persistently; lit. associated with often [ā + √sev + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of āsevati
Meaning practised persistently; lit. associated with often
Root Family ā √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Construction ā + √sev + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym anāsevita
Sanskrit āsevita
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

Examples

mettāya, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādasānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.

AN 11.15 mettāsuttaṃ

amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, anāsevitaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati anāsevitā. amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, āsevitaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati āsevitā'ti.

AN 1.606 amatavaggo
āsevitabba

ptp. should be practised; should be pursued; should be indulged in; lit. to be associated [ā + √sev + itabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of āsevati
Meaning should be practised; should be pursued; should be indulged in; lit. to be associated
Root Family ā √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Construction ā + √sev + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Sanskrit āśrayitavya
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

Examples

na āsevitabbaṃ, na bhāvetabbaṃ, na bahulīkātabbaṃ, bhāyitabbaṃ etassa sukhassā'ti, vadāmi.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

katamo ca, bhikkhave, āsevitabbo dhammo? sammādiṭṭhi, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, āsevitabbo dhammo'ti.

AN 10.194 āsevitabbadhammasuttaṃ
āsevitabbadhammasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.194 (AN10.194) ✗
āsevitabbasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.150 (AN10.150) ✗
āha

perf. (+acc) said [a + √ah + a + a] ✓

Grammar perf of √ah, trans (+acc)
Meaning said
Root Family √ah
Root √ah･1 a (speak)
Base √ah + a > aha
Construction a + aha + a
Notes Kacc 475, 565. brū bhūnam'āha bhūvā parokkhāyaṃ.
Sanskrit āha
Sanskrit Root √ah - (say)

Examples

eh'ambho purisa, yaṃ jānāsi taṃ vadehī'ti. so ajānaṃ vā āha, jānāmī'ti, jānaṃ vā āha, na jānāmī'ti, apassaṃ vā āha, passāmī'ti, passaṃ vā āha, na passāmī'ti.

AN 3.28 gūthabhāṇīsuttaṃ

na brāhmaṇo aññato suddhim'āha,
diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
puññe ca pāpe ca anūpalitto,
attañjaho na'y'idha pakubbamāno.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
āhacca 1.1

ger. (+acc) pressing against; forcing against [ā + √han + tya] ✓

Grammar ger of āhanati, trans (+acc)
Meaning pressing against; forcing against
Root Family ā √han
Root √han･1 a (strike, kill)
Construction ā + √han + tya
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Notes (CPD) In some cases the etymology is clear, in others not. Probably two homonyms have grown together into one word.
Sanskrit āhatya
Sanskrit Root √han 1, 2 (smite)

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ dantebhi dantam'ādhāya, jivhāya tāluṃ āhacca, cetasā cittaṃ abhiniggaṇheyyaṃ abhinippīḷeyyaṃ abhisantāpeyyan'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
khuradhār'ūpamo bhave,
jivhāya tālum'āhacca,
udare saññato siyā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
āhacca 2.1

adj. removable; detachable; lit. to be carried away [ā + √har + tya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of āharati
Meaning removable; detachable; lit. to be carried away
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction ā + √har + tya
Derivative kicca (tya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Sanskrit āhṛtya (having fetched)
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 18 vehāsakuṭisikkhāpadaṃ
āhacca tiṭṭhati

idiom. reaches; touches, strikes ✗
āhaccapādaka

adj. with removable legs; with detachable feet [āhacca + pāda + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with removable legs; with detachable feet
Construction āhacca + pāda + ka
āhaccapāda + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Compound kammadhāraya (āhacca + pādaka)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.2.8) āhaccapādako nāma mañco ... pīṭhaṃ aṅge vijjhitvā ṭhitaṃ hoti. (VINa) āhaccapādako'ti ayaṃ pana āhaccapādako nāma mañco aṅge vijjhitvā kato hotī'ti evaṃ parato pāḷiyaṃ'y'eva vutto, tasmā aṭaniyo vijjhitvā tattha pādasikhaṃ pavesetvā upari āṇiṃ datvā katamañco, āhaccapādako'ti veditabbo.
Sanskrit āhṛtya (having fetched) + pādaka

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 18 vehāsakuṭisikkhāpadaṃ

mañco nāma cattāro mañcā, masārako, bundik'ābaddho, kuḷīrapādako, āhaccapādako.

VIN 2.5.2.4 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ

Meaning stamp of approval
Construction āhacca + vacana

Grammar fut of āhanati, trans (+acc)

Root √han･1 a (strike, kill)
Base √han + a + ssa > hañcha (fut, irreg)
Construction ā + hañcha + ti

Sanskrit āhaniṣyati
Sanskrit Root √han 1, 2 (smite)

Example

gacchāmi kāsinaṃ puraṃ,
andhībhūtasmiṃ lokasmiṃ,

VIN 2.6.4 catutthapāṭidesanīyasikkhāpadaṃ

Meaning is brought; is fetched

Root √har･1 īya (carry)

Variant āhariyati, āharīyati

Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

yāguyā paṭisaṃvidite, tassā parivāro āhariyyati, etaṃ paṭisaṃviditaṃ nāma. bhattena paṭisaṃvidite, tassa parivāro āhariyyati, etaṃ paṭisaṃviditaṃ nāma.

āhareti 1

pr. brings, fetches, conveys; takes, collects; uses [ā + √har] ✗
āhareti 2

pr. takes the knife, kills oneself [ā + √har] ✗
āharesi

aor. (+acc) took (the knife); committed (suicide) [ā + √har + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of āharati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning took (the knife); committed (suicide)
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 *e (carry)
Base √har + *e > hāre > hare (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + hare + si
Commentary (MNa) satthaṃ āharesī'ti jīvitahārakaṃ satthaṃ āhari, kaṇṭhanāḷiṃ chindi.
Notes mā satthaṃ āharesi lit. "don't take the knife", i.e. "don’t commit suicide"
Sanskrit āhṛ
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

sace āyasmato channassa n'atthi patirūpā upaṭṭhākā, ahaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ upaṭṭhahissāmi. mā āyasmā channo satthaṃ āharesi. yāpet'āyasmā channo, yāpentaṃ mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ icchāmā'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
āhaṃsu

perf. (+acc) they said; they told; they spoke [a + √ah + a + aṃsu] ✓

Grammar perf 3rd pl of āha, trans (+acc)
Meaning they said; they told; they spoke
Root Family √ah
Root √ah･1 a (speak)
Base √ah + a > aha
Construction a + aha + aṃsu
Variant āhu
Notes √ah is substituted for √brū
Sanskrit āhuḥ
Sanskrit Root √ah - (say)

Examples

saccaṃ kir'evam'āhaṃsu,
narā ekacciyā idha,
kaṭṭhaṃ niplavitaṃ seyyo,
na tv'ev'ekacciyo naro'ti.

JA 73 saccaṃkira jātakaṃ

bhante, sace ayyā imaṃ temāsaṃ idha vaseyyuṃ, mayaṃ saraṇesu patiṭṭhāya sīlāni gaṇheyyāmā'ti āhaṃsu

DHPa 1.1.1 cakkhupālattheravatthu
āhāra 1

masc. (+dat) food (for); fuel (for); sustenance (for); nutriment (for); (comm) condition [ā + √har + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āharati (+dat)
Meaning food (for); fuel (for); sustenance (for); nutriment (for); (comm) condition
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 a (take, seize)
Construction ā + √har > hār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anāhāra
Commentary (VIN 2.5.4.10) āhāro nāma udakadantaponaṃ ṭhapetvā yaṃkiñci ajjhoharaṇīyaṃ, eso āhāro nāma.
Sanskrit āhāra
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Examples

yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako āhārañ'ca pajānāti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ

kāyagutto vacīgutto,
āhāre udare yato,
saccaṃ karomi niddānaṃ,
soraccaṃ me pamocanaṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
āhāra 2

adj. (+acc) eating; taking; feeding on [ā + √har + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from āharati (+acc)
Meaning eating; taking; feeding on
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 a (take, seize)
Construction ā + √har > hār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym ada, adaka, ādī, bhakkha
Sanskrit āhāra
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

so sākabhakkho'pi hoti sāmākabhakkho'pi hoti nīvārabhakkho'pi hoti daddulabhakkho'pi hoti haṭabhakkho'pi hoti kaṇabhakkho'pi hoti ācāmabhakkho'pi hoti piññākabhakkho'pi hoti tiṇabhakkho'pi hoti gomayabhakkho'pi hoti, vanamūlaphal'āhāro'pi yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
āhāra 3

masc. quotation [ā + √har] ✗
āhārakicca

nt. eating; taking food; lit. food duty [āhāra + kicca] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning eating; taking food; lit. food duty
Construction āhāra + kicca
Synonym bhojana
āhārakkhaya

masc. depletion of food; running out of sustenance; exhaustion of nutrition [āhāra + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning depletion of food; running out of sustenance; exhaustion of nutrition
Construction āhāra + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āhārassa + khaya)
Sanskrit āhāra + kṣaya

Example

devalokato hi devaputtā āyukkhayena puññakkhayena āhārakkhayena kopenā'ti catūhi kāraṇehi cavanti.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
āhāraṭṭhika

adj. subsisting on food ✗
āhāraṭṭhitika

adj. subsisting on food; dependent on fuel; lit. standing by food [āhāra + ṭhitika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning subsisting on food; dependent on fuel; lit. standing by food
Construction āhāra + ṭhitika
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (āhārena + ṭhitika)
Commentary (SNa) āhāraṭṭhitiko'ti paccayaṭṭhitiko. (ANa) āhāraṭṭhitikā'ti āhārato ṭhiti etesan'ti āhāraṭṭhitikā
Sanskrit āhāra + sthitika

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ayaṃ kāyo āhāraṭṭhitiko, āhāraṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhati, anāhāro no tiṭṭhati, evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇā āhāraṭṭhitikā, āhāraṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhanti, anāhārā no tiṭṭhanti.

SN 46.2 kāyasuttaṃ

katamo eko dhammo abhiññeyyo? sabbe sattā āhāraṭṭhitikā. ayaṃ eko dhammo abhiññeyyo.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ
āhāraṇa

nt. bringing; conveying [ā + √har + *aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from āharati
Meaning bringing; conveying
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction ā + √har > hār + *aṇa
Derivative kita (*aṇa)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym āharaṇa
Sanskrit āhāraṇā
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

chandaparisuddhi: chand'ārahānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ chandaparisuddhi-āhāraṇaṃ kataṃ kiṃ? chandaparisuddhi-āhāraṇaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
āhāratthāya

ind. for food; lit. for the sake of food [āhāra + attha + āya] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for food; lit. for the sake of food
Construction āhāra + attha + āya
āhārattha + āya
āhāranirodha

masc. ending of sustenance; cessation of fuel [āhāra + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of sustenance; cessation of fuel
Construction āhāra + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āhārassa + nirodha)
Antonym āhārasamudaya, āhārasambhava
Commentary (SNa) tadāhāranirodhā'ti tesaṃ āhārānaṃ nirodhena.
Sanskrit āhāra + nirodha

Examples

āhārasamudayā rūpasamudayo, āhāranirodhā rūpanirodho.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passati.

SN 12.31 bhūtasuttaṃ
āhāranirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the cessation of sustenance [āhāra + nirodha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the cessation of sustenance
Construction āhāra + nirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (āhāranirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit āhāra + nirodha + gāmin

Example

siyā, āvuso. yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako āhārañ'ca pajānāti, āhārasamudayañ'ca pajānāti, āhāranirodhañ'ca pajānāti, āhāranirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadañ'ca pajānāti, ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
āhāranettippabhava

adj. with source of nourishment and guide (of craving) ✗
āhārapaccaya

masc. condition for the four nutriments ✗
āhārapaccayā

ind. dependent on food; due to fuel; lit. from condition of fuel [āhāra + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of āhārapaccaya
Meaning dependent on food; due to fuel; lit. from condition of fuel
Construction āhāra + paccaya + ā
āhārapaccaya + ā
Sanskrit āhāra + pratyayāt

Examples

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti sabbaṃ āhārapaccayā

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti,
sabbaṃ āhārapaccayā,
āhārānaṃ nirodhena,
n'atthi dukkhassa sambhavo.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
āhārayati

pr. eats [ā + √har] ✗
āhārayanta

prp. (+acc) eating; taking food; consuming [ā + √har + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of āhārayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning eating; taking food; consuming
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 *aya (take, seize)
Base √har + *aya > hāraya (caus)
Construction ā + hāraya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym paribhuñjanta, bhuñjanta, bhuñjamāna
Variant āhārenta, āharayamāna
Sanskrit āharayat
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, thokaṃ thokaṃ āhāraṃ āhārayato, pasataṃ pasataṃ, yadi vā muggayūsaṃ, yadi vā kulatthayūsaṃ, yadi vā kaḷāyayūsaṃ, yadi vā hareṇukayūsaṃ, adhimattakasimānaṃ patto kāyo hoti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, sāriputta, ekaṃ'y'eva kolaṃ āhāraṃ āhārayato adhimattakasimānaṃ patto kāyo hoti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

Meaning having the characteristic of food; having the quality of nutriment
Construction āhāra + lakkhaṇa
āhāravagga

masc. Chapter 2 of the Nidānasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 2 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗

Meaning generating nutriment
Construction āhāra + samuṭṭhāpaka
āhārasamudaya

masc. source of food; arising from sustenance [āhāra + samudaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning source of food; arising from sustenance
Construction āhāra + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āhārassa + samudaya)
Antonym āhāranirodha
Commentary (SNa) āhārasamudayā kāyassa samudayo'ti āhārasamudayena kāyasamudayo.

ko ca, bhikkhave, kāyassa samudayo? āhārasamudayā kāyassa samudayo, āhāranirodhā kāyassa atthaṅgamo.

SN 47.42 samudayasuttaṃ
āhārasambhava

adj. (what is) produced by food; generated by sustenance; come into being because of fuel [āhāra + sambhava] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (what is) produced by food; generated by sustenance; come into being because of fuel
Construction āhāra + sambhava
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (āhārena + sambhava)
Antonym āhāranirodha
Sanskrit āhāra + sambhava

Example

tadāhārasambhavan'ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passati. tadāhārasambhavan'ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā āhārasambhavassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.

SN 12.31 bhūtasuttaṃ
āhārasambhūta

adj. produced by food; proceeding from food [āhāra + sambhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning produced by food; proceeding from food
Construction āhāra + sambhūta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (āhārena + sambhūta)
Commentary (ANa) āhārasambhūto'ti āhārena sambhūto āhāraṃ nissāya vaḍḍhito.
Sanskrit āhāra + sambhūta

Example

āhārasambhūto ayaṃ, bhagini, kāyo āhāraṃ nissāya āhāro pahātabbo. taṇhāsambhūto ayaṃ, bhagini, kāyo taṇhaṃ nissāya taṇhā pahātabbā.

AN 4.159 bhikkhunīsuttaṃ
āhārasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 12.11 (SN12.11) ✗
āhārasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.51 (SN46.51) ✗
āhārahetu

ind. for the sake of food [āhāra + hetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of food
Construction āhāra + hetu
āhāraṃ āharati

idiom. eats food; takes food ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr
Meaning eats food; takes food
Variant āhāraṃ āhāreti
Sanskrit āhāraṃ + āharati

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āhareyya aññatra udakadantaponā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 40 dantaponasikkhāpadaṃ

bhojane mattaññuno bhavissāma paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āharissāma n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
āhāraṃ āhāreti

idiom. eats food; consumes fuel ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr
Meaning eats food; consumes fuel
Sanskrit āhāraṃ + āhārayati

Examples

aṭṭh'aṅgasamannāgataṃ kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo āhāraṃ āhāreti, n'eva davāya, na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya, yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, āyasmā moḷiyaphagguno bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, ko nu kho, bhante, viññāṇ'āhāraṃ āhāretī'ti? no kallo pañho'ti bhagavā avoca, āhāretī'ti ahaṃ na vadāmi.

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ
āhāritar

masc. (+acc) eater; who consumes [ā + √har + *itar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from āharati (+acc)
Meaning eater; who consumes
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 a (take, seize)
Construction ā + √har > hār + *itar
Derivative kita (*itar)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit āhartṛ
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, ekaṃ'y'eva kolaṃ āhāraṃ āhāritā. siyā kho pana te, sāriputta, evam'assa, mahā nūna tena samayena kolo ahosī'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, sāriputta, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. tadā'pi etaparamo'y'eva kolo ahosi seyyathā'pi etarahi.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
āhārupaccheda

masc. cutting off food; stopping eating; starvation [āhāra + upaccheda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning cutting off food; stopping eating; starvation
Construction āhāra + upaccheda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āhārassa + upaccheda)
Sanskrit āhāra + uccheda, upaccheda (bsk)

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ sabbaso āhār'upacchedāya paṭipajjeyyan'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
āhārupahāra

adj. taking and giving; dealings ✗
āhārūpahāra

masc. transaction; deal; lit. taking and giving [āhāra + upahāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning transaction; deal; lit. taking and giving
Construction āhāra + upahāra
Commentary (VINa) āhār'ūpahāro'ti āhāro ca upahāro ca gahaṇañ'ca dānañ'ca, na amhehi kiñci āhaṭaṃ na upāhaṭaṃ tayā saddhiṃ kayavikkayo vohāro amhākaṃ n'atthī'ti dīpenti.
āhāre paṭikūlasaññā

idiom. recognition of the unpleasantness of food; perception of the repulsiveness of food [āhāre + paṭikūla + saññā] ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + fem
Meaning recognition of the unpleasantness of food; perception of the repulsiveness of food
Construction āhāre + paṭikūla + saññā
Commentary (SNa) gamana-pāṭikulyataṃ paccavekkhanto'pi kabaḷīkār'āhāraṃ pariggaṇhāti, pariyesana-pāṭikulyataṃ paccavekkhanto'pi, paribhoga-nidhānā-asaya-paripakk'āparipakka-sammakkhaṇa-nissanda-pāṭikulyataṃ paccavekkhanto'pi
Sanskrit āhāre + pratikūla + saṃjñā

Examples

pañc'imā, bhikkhave, saññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mah'ānisaṃsā amat'ogadhā amatapariyosānā. katamā pañca? asubhasaññā, maraṇasaññā, ādīnavasaññā, āhāre paṭikūlasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā.

AN 5.61 paṭhamasaññāsuttaṃ

āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

AN 7.49 dutiyasaññāsuttaṃ
āhāre paṭikūlasaññī

idiom. recognizing the unpleasantness of food; perceiving the repulsiveness of food [āhāre + paṭikūla + saññī] ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + adj
Meaning recognizing the unpleasantness of food; perceiving the repulsiveness of food
Construction āhāre + paṭikūla + saññī
Commentary (MNa) āhāre paṭikūlasaññī'ti navannaṃ pāṭikulyānaṃ vasena kabaḷīkār'āhāre paṭikūlasaññī.
Sanskrit āhāre + pratikūla + saṃjñin

Example

etha, tumhe, bhikkhave, asubh'ānupassino kāye viharatha, āhāre paṭikūlasaññino, sabbaloke anabhiratisaññino, sabbasaṅkhāresu anicc'ānupassino'ti.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
āhāreti

pr. (+acc) eats; takes food; consumes [ā + √har + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of āharati, trans (+acc)
Meaning eats; takes food; consumes
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 *e (take, seize)
Base √har + *e > hāre (caus)
Construction ā + hāre + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym paribhuñjati, bhuñjati
Sanskrit āhārayati
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Examples

byañjanaṃ kho pana bhavaṃ gotamo byañjanamattāya āhāreti, na ca byañjanena ālopaṃ atināmeti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, āyasmā moḷiyaphagguno bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, ko nu kho, bhante, viññāṇ'āhāraṃ āhāretī'ti? no kallo pañho'ti bhagavā avoca, āhāretī'ti ahaṃ na vadāmi.

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ
āhāretvā

abs. (+acc) having eaten; having taken food [ā + √har + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of āhāreti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having eaten; having taken food
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 *e (take, seize)
Base √har + *e > hāre (caus)
Construction ā + hāre + tvā
Sanskrit āhrayitvā
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṃ āhāraṃ āhāretvā, balaṃ gahetvā, vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja vihāsiṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
āhārepaṭikūlasaññā

fem. recognition of the unpleasantness of food; perception of the repulsiveness of food [āhāre + paṭikūla + saññā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning recognition of the unpleasantness of food; perception of the repulsiveness of food
Construction āhāre + paṭikūla + saññā
āhārepaṭikūlasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.69 (SN46.69) ✗
āhāresi

aor. (+acc) ate; took food; consumed [ā + √har + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of āhāreti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning ate; took food; consumed
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 *e (take, seize)
Base √har + *e > hāre (caus)
Construction ā + hāre + si
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit āhṛ
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Examples

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, thokaṃ thokaṃ āhāraṃ āhāresiṃ, pasataṃ pasataṃ, yadi vā muggayūsaṃ, yadi vā kulatthayūsaṃ, yadi vā kaḷāyayūsaṃ, yadi vā hareṇukayūsaṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

yato kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṃ āhāraṃ āhāresiṃ odanakummāsaṃ, atha me te pañca bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamiṃsu, bāhulliko samaṇo gotamo, padhānavibbhanto, āvatto bāhullāyā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
āhāsi

aor. spoken; declared, related; quoted [ā + √har] ✗
āhiṇḍati

pr. (+loc) wanders around (in); walks about [ā + √hiṇḍ + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning wanders around (in); walks about
Root Family ā √hiṇḍ
Root √hiṇḍ･1 a (roam, wander)
Base √hiṇḍ + a > hiṇḍa
Construction ā + hiṇḍa + ti
Variant anvāhiṇḍati
Sanskrit āhiṇḍati
Sanskrit Root √hiṇḍ 1 (go, move)

Example

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno āyasmā ca ānando avāpuraṇaṃ ādāya vihāre āhiṇḍanti, abhikkamath'āyasmanto, abhikkamath'āyasmanto! idān'āyasmā sāriputto bhagavato sammukhā sīhanādaṃ nadissatī'ti.

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ
āhiṇḍanta

prp. (+loc) wandering around; walking about (in) [ā + √hiṇḍ + a + nta] ~

Grammar prp of āhiṇḍati, intrans (+loc)
Meaning wandering around; walking about (in)
Root Family ā √hiṇḍ
Root √hiṇḍ･1 a (roam, wander)
Base √hiṇḍ + a > hiṇḍa
Construction ā + hiṇḍa + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym anuvicaranta, anuvicaramāna, caramāna
Sanskrit āhiṇḍat
Sanskrit Root √hiṇḍ 1 (go, move)
āhiṇḍamāna

prp. wandering around; walking about [ā + √hiṇḍ] ✗
āhiṇḍāpesi

aor. caused to wander [ā + √hiṇḍ] ✗
āhiṇḍi

aor. wandered about, roamed [ā + √hiṇḍ] ✗
āhiṇḍitvā

abs. having wandered about, having roamed [ā + √hiṇḍ] ✗
āhita 1

pp. stocked up; heaped up; provided with fuel; lit. placed here [ā + √dhā + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of ādahati
Meaning stocked up; heaped up; provided with fuel; lit. placed here
Root Family ā √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction ā + √dhā > (da)h + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change dhā > h
Sanskrit āhita
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Example

pakk'odano duddhakhīro'ham'asmi,
anutīre mahiyā samānavāso,
channā kuṭi āhito gini,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP 2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 2
āhita 2

pp. put in, put up [ā + √dhā] ✗
āhu

perf. (+acc) they say; lit. they said [a + √ah + a + u] ✓

Grammar perf 3rd pl of āha, trans (+acc)
Meaning they say; lit. they said
Root Family √ah
Root √ah･1 a (speak)
Base √ah + a > aha
Construction a + aha + u
Variant ahaṃsu
Commentary (SNa) āhū'ti kathenti.
Notes √ah is substituted for √brū
Sanskrit āhuḥ
Sanskrit Root √ah - (say)

Examples

tiṭṭhaṃ caraṃ nisinno vā,
sayāno yāvatāssa vigatamiddho,
etaṃ satiṃ adhiṭṭheyya,
brahmam'etaṃ vihāram'idha'm'āhu.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

idh'eva suddhi iti vādayanti,
n'āññesu dhammesu visuddhim'āhu,
yaṃ nissitā tattha subhaṃ vadānā,
paccekasaccesu puthū niviṭṭhā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
āhuṇa

nt. adoration, oblation [ā + √hu] ✗
āhuṇeyya

adj. worthy of adoration or offerings [ā + √hu] ✗
āhuta

adj. produced, coming from ✗
āhuti

fem. oblation; offering [ā + √hu + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr
Meaning oblation; offering
Root Family ā √hu
Root √hu･1 a (pour, offer as oblation)
Construction ā + √hu + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Synonym habya, huñña
Sanskrit āhuti
Sanskrit Root √hu 2, 3 (sacrifice)

Example

tena kho pana samayena aggikabhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa nivesane aggi pajjalito hoti āhuti paggahitā.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
āhutigandha

masc. smell of an oblation; whiff of a sacrifice [āhuti + gandha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning smell of an oblation; whiff of a sacrifice
Construction āhuti + gandha
āhuna

nt. offering; honouring ✗
āhuneyya

adj. worthy of offerings; lit. to be offered to [ā + √hu + ana + eyya] ✓

Grammar adj, from āhuna
Meaning worthy of offerings; lit. to be offered to
Root Family ā √hu
Root √hu･1 a (pour, offer as oblation)
Construction ā + √hu + ana + eyya
āhuna + eyya
Derivative taddhita (eyya)
Commentary (MNa) āhuneyyassā'ti āhutiṃ paṭiggahetuṃ yuttassa.
Notes see MW āhavanīya
Sanskrit āhavanīya
Sanskrit Root √hu 2, 3 (sacrifice)

Examples

āhuneyyā'ti, bhikkhave, mātāpitūnaṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. taṃ kissa hetu? bahukārā, bhikkhave, mātāpitaro, puttānaṃ āpādakā posakā imassa lokassa dassetāro'ti.

AN 4.63 brahmasuttaṃ

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu āhuneyyo hoti pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
āhuneyyaggi

masc. fire (of hell for those harming) someone worthy of offerings; lit. fire for offerings [āhuneyya + aggi] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fire (of hell for those harming) someone worthy of offerings; lit. fire for offerings
Construction āhuneyya + aggi
Commentary (DNa) āhuneyy'aggī'tiādīsu āhunaṃ vuccati sakkāro, āhunaṃ arahantī'ti āhuneyyā. mātāpitaro hi puttānaṃ bahūpakāratāya āhunaṃ arahanti. tesu vippaṭipajjamānā puttā niray'ādīsu nibbattanti. tasmā kiñ'cā'pi mātāpitaro n'ānudahanti, anudahanassa pana paccayā honti. iti anudahan'aṭṭhena āhuneyy'aggī'ti vuccanti.
Sanskrit āhavanīya + agni
āhuneyyavagga 1

masc. Chapter 1 of Chakkanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.1-10 ✗
āhuneyyavagga 2

masc. Chapter 1 of Chakkanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.1-10 ✗
āhuneyyavagga 3

masc. Chapter 10 of Sattakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 7.95-622 ✗
āhuneyyasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.10 (AN9.10) ✗
āhuneyyasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.16 (AN10.16) ✗
āhuneyyasutta 3

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.97 (AN10.97) ✗
āhundarika

adj. crowded, blocked up ✗
āḷakamanda

adj. open, unenclosed; or crowded (like Āḷakamandā); (also ālakamanda) ✗
āḷakamandā

fem. name of a heavenly capital city ~

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a heavenly capital city
āḷambara

masc. drum ✗
āḷavaka

adj. belonging to Āḷavī; lit. connected with forest [aṭavī + *aka] ✓

Grammar adj, from āḷavī
Meaning belonging to Āḷavī; lit. connected with forest
Construction aṭavī > āḷavī + *aka
Derivative taddhita (*aka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
ṭ > ḷ
Sanskrit āṭavika

Example

atha kho hatthako āḷavako jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno addasa bhagavantaṃ gomagge siṃsapāvane paṇṇasanthare nisinnaṃ.

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ
āḷavakasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 10.12 (SN10.12) ✗
āḷavakasutta 2

nt. Sutta Nipāta 1.10 (SNP 10) ✗
āḷavikā

fem. name of a nun; lit. from Āḷavi [aṭavī + ikā] ~

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a nun; lit. from Āḷavi
Construction aṭavī > āḷavī + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Phonetic Change ṭ > ḷ
Commentary (SNa) āḷavikā'ti āḷaviyaṃ jātā āḷavinagarato'y'eva ca nikkhamma pabbajitā.
āḷavikāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 5.1 (SN5.1) ✗
āḷavī 1

fem. name of a country ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a country
Commentary (ANa) āḷaviyan'ti āḷaviraṭṭhe.
Sanskrit aṭavī (bsk)

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā āḷaviyaṃ viharati gomagge siṃsapāvane paṇṇasanthare.

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ
āḷavī 2

fem. name of a town [aṭavī] ✗
āḷahana

nt. place of cremation; funeral pyre [ā + √ḍah] ✗
āḷāna

nt. stake, post (to which an elephant is tied) ✗
āḷāra

masc. name of the Buddha's first teacher; Āḷāra Kālāma; lit. curved ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of the Buddha's first teacher; Āḷāra Kālāma; lit. curved
Commentary (MNa) yena āḷāro kālāmo'ti ettha āḷāro'ti tassa nāmaṃ, dīghapiṅgalo kir'eso. ten'assa āḷāro'ti nāmaṃ ahosi.
Sanskrit ārāḍa

Examples

so evaṃ pabbajito samāno kiṃkusalagavesī anuttaraṃ santivarapadaṃ pariyesamāno yena āḷāro kālāmo ten'upasaṅkamiṃ, upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṃ kālāmaṃ etadavocaṃ, icchām'ahaṃ, āvuso kālāma, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye brahmacariyaṃ caritun'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

ayaṃ kho āḷāro kālāmo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī dīgharattaṃ apparaj'akkhajātiko. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ āḷārassa kālāmassa paṭhamaṃ dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
āḷārika

masc. cook ✗
āḷāhana

nt. ground for cremation [ā + √ḍah] ✗
āḷāhanakicca

nt. cremation ✗
āḷāhanaṭṭhāna

nt. place of cremation ✗
āḷi

fem. dam wall; embankment ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning dam wall; embankment
Variant āli
Commentary (MNa) āḷibandhā'ti mariyādabaddhā.
Sanskrit āli

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, same bhūmibhāge caturassā pokkharaṇī assa āḷibandhā pūrā udakassa samatittikā kākapeyyā. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āḷiṃ muñceyya āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
āḷinda

masc. verandah; porch; terrace ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning verandah; porch; terrace
Synonym pamukha
Variant ālinda
Sanskrit alinda

Example

atha kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo yena so vihāro saṃvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṃ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi. vivari bhagavā dvāraṃ.

DN 3.3 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ
āḷippabheda

masc. breaking the banks; bursting through the damn wall [āḷi + pabheda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning breaking the banks; bursting through the damn wall
Construction āḷi + pabheda
Commentary (ANa) na āḷippabhedo pāṭikaṅkho'ti na pāḷippabhedo pāṭikaṅkhitabbo. na hi tato udakaṃ uṭṭhāya pāḷiṃ bhinditvā kacavaraṃ gahetvā mahāsamuddaṃ pāpuṇāti.
āḷibandha

adj. contained within dam walls; held by embankments [āḷi + bandha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning contained within dam walls; held by embankments
Construction āḷi + bandha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (āḷiyā + bandha)
Variant ālibaddha
Commentary (MNa) āḷibandhā'ti mariyādabaddhā.
Sanskrit āli + baddha

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, same bhūmibhāge caturassā pokkharaṇī assa āḷibandhā pūrā udakassa samatittikā kākapeyyā. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āḷiṃ muñceyya āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
āḷimpeti

pr. (+acc) sets fire to; ignites [ā + √dīp + *e + ti] ~

Grammar pr, caus of ādippati, trans (+acc)
Meaning sets fire to; ignites
Root Family ā √dīp
Root √dīp･3 *e (shine, explain)
Base √dīp + e > dīpe > ḷīpe > ḷimpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + ḷimpe + ti
Phonetic Change d > ḷ
Variant ālimpeti
Commentary (ANa) ālimpeyyā'ti tattha aṅgāre pakkhipitvā aggiṃ datvā nāḷikāya dhamanto aggiṃ gāhāpeyya. (VISMa) ālimpetī'ti ādīpeti jāleti.
Sanskrit ādīpayati
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)
āḷimpetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to set fire to; to ignite [ā + √dīp + *e + tuṃ] ~

Grammar inf of ālimpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to set fire to; to ignite
Root Family ā √dīp
Root √dīp･3 *e (shine, explain)
Base √dīp + e > dīpe > līpe > limpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + limpe + tuṃ
Phonetic Change d > l
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)
āḷimpesi

aor. (+acc) set fire to; ignited [√dīp + *e + si] ~

Grammar aor of āḷimpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning set fire to; ignited
Root Family √dīp
Root √dīp･3 *e (shine, explain)
Base √dīp + e > dīpe > ḷīpe > ḷimpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + ḷimpe + si
Variant ālimpesi
Commentary (DNa) āḷimpessāmā'ti aggiṃ gāhāpessāma.
Sanskrit ādīp
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)
āḷhaka 1

masc. measure of volume ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning measure of volume
Synonym pattha
Notes 1 āḷhaka = 4 kosala pattha 1 āḷhaka = 1 tumba
Sanskrit āḍhaka

Example

ukkaṭṭho nāma patto aḍḍh'āḷhak'odanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.1 pattasikkhāpadaṃ
āḷhaka 2

nt. measure of volume ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning measure of volume
Synonym pattha
Notes 1 āḷhaka = 4 kosala pattha 1 āḷhaka = 1 tumba
Sanskrit āḍhaka

Example

ukkaṭṭho nāma patto aḍḍh'āḷhak'odanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.
